original: snang ba rnam par dag pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: snang ba rnam par dag pa zhes pa ni /
translated: The pure appearance is

original: snang ba la sogs pa gsum spong bas so //
analyzed: snang ba la sogs pa gsum spong bas so //
translated: because of the abandonment of the three, appearance and so forth.

original: de ni sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa'i sgo nas bstod pa'o //
analyzed: de ni sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa'i sgo nas bstod pa'o //
translated: That is the praise by way of the stage of the pure mind.

original: 'ja' tshon ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'od gsal ba las spros pa'i ye shes kyi sku'i bdag nyid gzung bar bstan to //
analyzed: 'ja' tshon ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'od gsal ba las spros pa'i ye shes kyi sku'i bdag nyid gzung bar bstan to //
translated: The one who is like a rainbow and so forth teaches the grasping of the exalted body of exalted wisdom that is emanated from clear light.

original: des ni bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa'i sgo nas bcom ldan 'das la bstod pa'o //
analyzed: des ni bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa'i sgo nas bcom ldan 'das la bstod pa'o //
translated: That is the praise of the Bhagavat by way of the stage of the self consecration.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yon tan gyi zhes pa ni stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yon tan gyi zhes pa ni stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The qualities of all the Buddhas are the powers, the fearlessnesses, and so forth.

original: thugs nyid yin pas na zhes pa ni de rnams kyis bsags pas na thugs te rnam pa thams cad mchog dang ldan pa'i rdo rje'i sku'i rang bzhin khyod yin no //
analyzed: thugs nyid yin pas na zhes pa ni de rnams kyis bsags pas na thugs te rnam pa thams cad mchog dang ldan pa'i rdo rje'i sku'i rang bzhin khyod yin no //
translated: Because of being the mind, you are the mind because of the accumulation of those, you are the exalted body of the vajra that has the supreme of all aspects.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi thog mar gyur pas zhes pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i ngo bo yin pas so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi thog mar gyur pas zhes pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i ngo bo yin pas so //
translated: Because of being the first of the Tathagatas, you are the essence of Great Vajradhara.

original: gtso bo ni mi slob pas so //
analyzed: gtso bo ni mi slob pas so //
translated: The principal one is the one who is not a learner.

original: de 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi 'on kyang 'das pa la sogs pa'i dus la gnas pa'i dngos po rnams zhes pa ni sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten gyi rang bzhin gnyis ka'i dngos po rnams so //
analyzed: de 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi 'on kyang 'das pa la sogs pa'i dus la gnas pa'i dngos po rnams zhes pa ni sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten gyi rang bzhin gnyis ka'i dngos po rnams so //
translated: Not only that, but also, the things that exist in the past, etc., times are the things of both the nature of the world of sentient beings and the world of the container.

original: nyid yin zhes pas dngos po thams cad khyab par byed pa bcom ldan 'das bstan to //
analyzed: nyid yin zhes pas dngos po thams cad khyab par byed pa bcom ldan 'das bstan to //
translated: The one who is the nature of all things is the Blessed One, who pervades all things.

original: dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid du gyur pas so zhes pa ni chos thams cad kyi nang du chud pa'i chos nyid kyi ngo bo yin @234a * //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid du gyur pas so zhes pa ni chos thams cad kyi nang du chud pa'i chos nyid kyi ngo bo yin @234a * //
translated: The one who is the nature of the reality that is included within all things is the one who is the nature of all things.

original: pas so // 'od gsal ba zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba'i 'bras bur gyur pa'i rdo rje'i sku khyod yin no //
analyzed: pas so // 'od gsal ba zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba'i 'bras bur gyur pa'i rdo rje'i sku khyod yin no //
translated: The one who is the vajra body that is the result of clear light is the one who is clear light.

original: khyed nyid khams gsum pa yang yin te zhes pa ni khams gsum gyi bdag nyid yin pas so //
analyzed: khyed nyid khams gsum pa yang yin te zhes pa ni khams gsum gyi bdag nyid yin pas so //
translated: The one who is the nature of the three realms is the one who is the nature of the three realms.

original: sgyu 'phrul gyi dbang brnyes pas zhes pa ni sku la sogs pa'i dbang phyug brgyad thob pas so //
analyzed: sgyu 'phrul gyi dbang brnyes pas zhes pa ni sku la sogs pa'i dbang phyug brgyad thob pas so //
translated: The one who has attained mastery of the magical emanations is the one who has attained the eight masteries of body, etc.

original: bden pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid can yin pas zhes pa ni zung du 'jug pa'i de kho na nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid can yin pas zhes pa ni zung du 'jug pa'i de kho na nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase because it has the nature of the two truths means that it is the nature of the reality of the stage of union.

original: des ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa'i sgo nas bcom ldan 'das la bstod pa'o //
analyzed: des ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa'i sgo nas bcom ldan 'das la bstod pa'o //
translated: Thus, he praises the Lord from the perspective of the stage of union.

original: me long lta bu'i ye shes zhes pa ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i sprin gyis ma bsgribs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me long lta bu'i ye shes zhes pa ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i sprin gyis ma bsgribs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase mirror-like wisdom means that it is not obscured by the clouds of the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience.

original: de las yang dag par byung ba ni rnam par snang mdzad de zhes pa ni ma 'brel pa rnam par gcod pas lha sbyin ni gzhu 'dzin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de las yang dag par byung ba ni rnam par snang mdzad de zhes pa ni ma 'brel pa rnam par gcod pas lha sbyin ni gzhu 'dzin pa bzhin no //
translated: The phrase Vairochana arises from that means that he is not related to it, like Devadatta is not related to the bow.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni gtan tshigs kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni gtan tshigs kyang de bzhin no //
translated: The phrase because he has the nature of that means that the reason is also like that.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan rnams kyi ni me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan rnams kyi ni me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid med pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that the other Tathagatas do not have the nature of mirror-like wisdom.

original: nam mkha' ni re zhig 'od gsal ba ste de'i lam ni de thob par byed pa'i ye shes te mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni re zhig 'od gsal ba ste de'i lam ni de thob par byed pa'i ye shes te mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes so //
translated: Space is clear light for the time being, and its path is the gnosis that causes its attainment, the gnosis of equality.

original: de las byung bas gnas par mdzad cing zhes pa ni skad kyi byings don du ma yin pa'i phyir gnas pa 'byung ba la 'jug go //
analyzed: de las byung bas gnas par mdzad cing zhes pa ni skad kyi byings don du ma yin pa'i phyir gnas pa 'byung ba la 'jug go //
translated: Since it arises from that, it is said to be “made to abide,” because the verbal root “sthā” has many meanings, and here it means “to arise.”

original: nam mkha' zhes bya ba la sogs pas chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi thugs gang la yod pa de ni mi bskyod pa ste ye shes dang rjes su mthun par bstan to //
analyzed: nam mkha' zhes bya ba la sogs pas chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi thugs gang la yod pa de ni mi bskyod pa ste ye shes dang rjes su mthun par bstan to //
translated: The one who has a mind that is the nature of the gnosis of the dharma-dhātu is Akṣhobhya, taught in accordance with gnosis.

original: padma'i rigs so zhes pa ni yan lag bcu gnyis pa'i gsung rab la 'jug pa la de nyid kyis dbang byed pas so //
analyzed: padma'i rigs so zhes pa ni yan lag bcu gnyis pa'i gsung rab la 'jug pa la de nyid kyis dbang byed pas so //
translated: The lotus family is the one that engages the scriptures with twelve branches, since it is controlled by that.

original: de rnams kyi mchog ces pa ni de rnams sprul pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: de rnams kyi mchog ces pa ni de rnams sprul pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The best of those is the nature of their emanations.

original: 'gro ba ma lus pa'i don ni zhes pa la bstan pa dang smin pa dang grol ba la sogs pa stobs kyi rnal 'byor gyi mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin rlung gi khams kyi ngo bo ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba ma lus pa'i don ni zhes pa la bstan pa dang smin pa dang grol ba la sogs pa stobs kyi rnal 'byor gyi mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin rlung gi khams kyi ngo bo ste /
translated: The meaning of all migrating beings is the nature of the characteristic of the yoga of power, such as teaching, ripening, liberating, and so on, the essence of the air element.

original: de rnams bya ba nan tan grub pa'i ye shes kyis rdzogs par 'gyur bas de'i bdag nyid don yod grub pa 'dir bstan to //
analyzed: de rnams bya ba nan tan grub pa'i ye shes kyis rdzogs par 'gyur bas de'i bdag nyid don yod grub pa 'dir bstan to //
translated: Since those are perfected by the wisdom of successful action, the nature of Amoghasiddhi is taught here.

original: rigs lnga'i bdag nyid kyi zhes pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po ste bdag nyid du gyur pas zhes bya ba'i tshig go //
analyzed: rigs lnga'i bdag nyid kyi zhes pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po ste bdag nyid du gyur pas zhes bya ba'i tshig go //
translated: The nature of the five families is Great Vajradhara, the one who has become the nature.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: rigs ni rnam pa brgyar bstan pa /
analyzed: rigs ni rnam pa brgyar bstan pa /
translated: The families are taught to be one hundred,

original: mdor bsdus pas ni rnam pa lnga //
analyzed: mdor bsdus pas ni rnam pa lnga //
translated: but in brief, there are five.

original: sku gsung thugs kyi dbye ba yis //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi dbye ba yis //
translated: By the division of body, speech, and mind,

original: phyi nas rnam pa gsum du @234b 'gyur //
analyzed: phyi nas rnam pa gsum du @234b 'gyur //
translated: they later become three.

original: de ni rang byung bcom ldan 'das //
analyzed: de ni rang byung bcom ldan 'das //
translated: That is the self-originated Bhagavat,

original: gcig pu nyid de lhag pa'i lha //🔽zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gcig pu nyid de lhag pa'i lha // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: the one and only supreme deity.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi don sgrub pa //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi don sgrub pa //
translated: The accomplishment of one’s own and others’ goals

original: zhes bya ba'i spyod pa ni zhes pa la sngar bshad pa'i rnam pa gsum gyi spyod pa'i rigs pas rang dang gzhan gyi don 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i spyod pa ni zhes pa la sngar bshad pa'i rnam pa gsum gyi spyod pa'i rigs pas rang dang gzhan gyi don 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: The conduct of the three kinds of persons is the means for accomplishing one’s own and others’ goals.

original: de nyid khyad par du gyur pas na zhes pa ni theg pa dman pa la sogs pa la ltos pa dang / bya ba'i rgyud la sogs pa la ltos pas zhes tshig lhag ma'o //
analyzed: de nyid khyad par du gyur pas na zhes pa ni theg pa dman pa la sogs pa la ltos pa dang / bya ba'i rgyud la sogs pa la ltos pas zhes tshig lhag ma'o //
translated: The phrase “because it is especially exalted” is an ellipsis.

original: gang gi phyir bde ba'i ngo bo dang yun ring pa ma yin pas bsgrub par bya ba'i spyod pa ni lam gzhan dang rgyud gzhan las ma bstan te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bde ba'i ngo bo dang yun ring pa ma yin pas bsgrub par bya ba'i spyod pa ni lam gzhan dang rgyud gzhan las ma bstan te /
translated: The conduct that is to be accomplished is not taught in other paths or in other tantras because it is of the nature of bliss and is not of long duration.

original: brtul zhugs dang sbyangs pa'i yon tan la sogs pas lus ngal bar byed pa'i phyir dang lan gsum bkrus pa la sogs pas lus gzir bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtul zhugs dang sbyangs pa'i yon tan la sogs pas lus ngal bar byed pa'i phyir dang lan gsum bkrus pa la sogs pas lus gzir bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not of the nature of bliss because it causes the body to be fatigued by austerities and the qualities of asceticism, and it is not of long duration because it causes the body to be emaciated by such things as the three ablutions.

original: de'i don ston pa'i zhes pa ni spyod pa gsum rjod par byed pa'i gzhung gi tshogs la le'u zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i don ston pa'i zhes pa ni spyod pa gsum rjod par byed pa'i gzhung gi tshogs la le'u zhes bya'o //
translated: The meaning of the phrase “the chapter that teaches that meaning” is that the collection of texts that describes the three kinds of conduct is called a “chapter.”

original: dgongs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni yongs su gsal ba'i de kho na nyid bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgongs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni yongs su gsal ba'i de kho na nyid bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The statement not intended is for the sake of teaching the fully evident reality.

original: sgron ma gsal bar byed pa'i 'grel pa'i t'i k'a las le'u lnga pa'i rgya cher bshad pa'o /
analyzed: sgron ma gsal bar byed pa'i 'grel pa'i t'i k'a las le'u lnga pa'i rgya cher bshad pa'o /
translated: This completes the extensive explanation of the fifth chapter of the commentary that illuminates the Lamp.

original: // / bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i nga rgyal zhes bya ba la sogs pas le'u drug pa'i bshad pa rtsom par byed do //
analyzed: // / bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i nga rgyal zhes bya ba la sogs pas le'u drug pa'i bshad pa rtsom par byed do //
translated: The sixth chapter is begun with the words the pride of self-consecration, and so on.

original: bdag ni lha'i sku la'o //
analyzed: bdag ni lha'i sku la'o //
translated: Self refers to the divine body.

original: byin gyis brlab pa ni sku la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa'o //
analyzed: byin gyis brlab pa ni sku la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa'o //
translated: Consecration refers to the consecration of the body, and so on.

original: sngon du 'gro ba'i spyod pa bya ba ni rnal 'byor chen po'i mtha'i bar du dang por sbyor ba bsgoms nas lha'i rnam pa thob pas spyod pa bya'o //
analyzed: sngon du 'gro ba'i spyod pa bya ba ni rnal 'byor chen po'i mtha'i bar du dang por sbyor ba bsgoms nas lha'i rnam pa thob pas spyod pa bya'o //
translated: Conduct refers to the conduct of the yogin who has attained the divine form by first cultivating the yoga up to the great yoga.

original: gzhan du na khyi dang spyang ki la sogs pa dang // so so'i skye bo'i bzhin du spyad pa thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na khyi dang spyang ki la sogs pa dang // so so'i skye bo'i bzhin du spyad pa thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would follow that the conduct would be like that of dogs, wolves, and so on, or like that of ordinary people.

original: sku la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa zhes pa ni rnal 'byor dang rjes su rnal 'byor dang // shin tu rnal 'byor rdzogs nas rnal 'byor chen po'i mtshan nyid can gyi dang po'i sbyor ba'i yan lag tu gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sku la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa zhes pa ni rnal 'byor dang rjes su rnal 'byor dang // shin tu rnal 'byor rdzogs nas rnal 'byor chen po'i mtshan nyid can gyi dang po'i sbyor ba'i yan lag tu gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the phrase “the process of consecrating the body, etc.” is that, having completed the yoga, the subsequent yoga, and the supreme yoga, it is the limb of the first union, which has the character of the great yoga.

original: rab tu ston to zhes pa ni rab tu phye nas bshad par bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rab tu ston to zhes pa ni rab tu phye nas bshad par bya ba'i don to //
translated: “One should teach” means that one should explain after having analyzed.

original: mi bskyod pa zhes bya ba ni sku la sogs pa de'i rang bzhin yin pas so //🔽de byin gyis rlob pa'i gsang sngags te zhes pa ni gang brjod pas thugs rdo rjes sgrub pa po byin gyis brlab par 'gyur ro //🔽gang la ming de skad ces bya ba'i thugs rtse gcig tu mdzad de zhes pa ni thugs byin gyis rlob par byed pa'i sngags rjes @235a * //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa zhes bya ba ni sku la sogs pa de'i rang bzhin yin pas so // de byin gyis rlob pa'i gsang sngags te zhes pa ni gang brjod pas thugs rdo rjes sgrub pa po byin gyis brlab par 'gyur ro // gang la ming de skad ces bya ba'i thugs rtse gcig tu mdzad de zhes pa ni thugs byin gyis rlob par byed pa'i sngags rjes @235a * //
translated: “Akshobhya” means that it is the nature of the body, etc.🔽“The mantra of his consecration” means that by reciting it, the mind-vajra of the practitioner will be consecrated.🔽“In which he is one-pointedly focused” means that it is the mind that has the character of remembering the mantra that consecrates the mind.

original: su dran pa'i mtshan nyid kyi blo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: su dran pa'i mtshan nyid kyi blo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “The mind” means the mind that has the nature of the mantra.

original: thugs byin gyis brlab pa gang yin pa zhes pa ni rtog pa dang bcas pa'i tha mal pa'i ngo bo bral nas ston ka'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor rdzogs pa dang 'dra ba gang gis byed pa de la de skad ces bshad do //
analyzed: thugs byin gyis brlab pa gang yin pa zhes pa ni rtog pa dang bcas pa'i tha mal pa'i ngo bo bral nas ston ka'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor rdzogs pa dang 'dra ba gang gis byed pa de la de skad ces bshad do //
translated: That which is the consecration of the mind is explained as that which is done by one who, having separated from the ordinary nature which has discursive thought, is like the full orb of the autumn moon.

original: yid skyob pas na zhes pa la de la gcig tu gzhol bas rnam par rtog pa gzhan las skyob pas so //
analyzed: yid skyob pas na zhes pa la de la gcig tu gzhol bas rnam par rtog pa gzhan las skyob pas so //
translated: Because it protects the mind, it is said that the mind is protected from other discursive thoughts by being directed to it alone.

original: dbang po dang ni yul dag la //
analyzed: dbang po dang ni yul dag la //
translated: In dependence on the sense faculties and the objects,

original: brten nas gang zhig yid byung ba //
analyzed: brten nas gang zhig yid byung ba //
translated: whatever arises is the mind.

original: yid de man zhes bshad pa ste //
analyzed: yid de man zhes bshad pa ste //
translated: That mind is said to be citta,

original: tra ni skyob pa'i don yin no //🔽zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: tra ni skyob pa'i don yin no // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: and tra means the meaning of protection.

original: bka' stsal par gyur to zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis te tshig lhag ma'o //
analyzed: bka' stsal par gyur to zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis te tshig lhag ma'o //
translated: It is said that the Bhagavat spoke, with the remainder of the sentence.

original: aom zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni thugs la byin gyis brlab pa'i sngags so //
analyzed: aom zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni thugs la byin gyis brlab pa'i sngags so //
translated: Om and so forth is the mantra of the consecration of the mind.

original: de brjod pa tsam gyis thugs byin gyis brlab par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de brjod pa tsam gyis thugs byin gyis brlab par 'gyur ro //
translated: By merely reciting it, the consecration of the mind is done.

original: me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid can zhes pa la nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i rdul rnams med pa dang mi phyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid can zhes pa la nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i rdul rnams med pa dang mi phyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase having the nature of mirror-like primordial wisdom means that it is free from and indivisible from the stains of the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience.

original: de byin gyis rlob pa'i sngags te /
analyzed: de byin gyis rlob pa'i sngags te /
translated: It is the mantra of consecration.

original: zhes pa ni skad kyi byings don du ma yin pas gnas kyi sgra ni byin gyis brlab pa'i rnam grangs so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni skad kyi byings don du ma yin pas gnas kyi sgra ni byin gyis brlab pa'i rnam grangs so //
translated: Since the verbal root sthā has many meanings, the word place is a synonym for consecration.🔽The mantra of the consecration of the body is stated.

original: sku byin gyis brlab pa'i sngags gsungs pa ni zhes pa la gang gi lus kyi tha mal pa'i ngo bo spangs nas mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus rnam par spras pa //
analyzed: sku byin gyis brlab pa'i sngags gsungs pa ni zhes pa la gang gi lus kyi tha mal pa'i ngo bo spangs nas mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus rnam par spras pa //
translated: Having abandoned the ordinary nature of the body, it is adorned with the thirty-two marks and the eighty minor marks,

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan par bya ba de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan par bya ba de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: and it is endowed with the supreme of all aspects. That is what is meant by that.

original: aom zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lus byin gyis brlab pa'i sngags so //
analyzed: aom zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lus byin gyis brlab pa'i sngags so //
translated: The mantra of the consecration of the body is oṃ... and so forth.

original: de brjod pas lus byin gyis brlab par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de brjod pas lus byin gyis brlab par 'gyur ro //
translated: By reciting that, the body will be consecrated.

original: tshad med gang las brnyes pa zhes pa ni byang chub kyi sems la spyod pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams yun ring du 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshad med gang las brnyes pa zhes pa ni byang chub kyi sems la spyod pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams yun ring du 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The phrase “from which you receive the immeasurable” means that the yogins who practice the thought of awakening will live for a long time.

original: de phyir 'bad pa thams cad kyis //🔽'pho ba'i chags pa bral bar bya //
analyzed: de phyir 'bad pa thams cad kyis // 'pho ba'i chags pa bral bar bya //
translated: Therefore, with all your effort,

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: you should be free from attachment to transmigration.

original: ragta gyen du 'dren pa'i bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas rnams ni bskal pa'i bar du thub par 'gyur te byang chub kyi sems mi 'pho bas so//
analyzed: ragta gyen du 'dren pa'i bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas rnams ni bskal pa'i bar du thub par 'gyur te byang chub kyi sems mi 'pho bas so//
translated: The Blessed Buddhas, who are the leaders, can live for eons, because the thought of awakening does not transmigrate.

original: de dus brtsams nas de ni rtog pa med //
analyzed: de dus brtsams nas de ni rtog pa med //
translated: Beginning from that time, it is without thought.

original: de yi dbyibs dang kha dog ji ltar mtshan //
analyzed: de yi dbyibs dang kha dog ji ltar mtshan //
translated: What is its shape, color, and mark?

original: bsam gyis mi khyab rnam par smin pa'i sku //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab rnam par smin pa'i sku //
translated: The body that is the inconceivable evolutionary action,

original: sdom pa de la bya ba byas pas thob //
analyzed: sdom pa de la bya ba byas pas thob //
translated: is obtained by the performance of the vow.

original: ces rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi sgrub thabs las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ces rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi sgrub thabs las 'byung ngo //
translated: This is stated in the Vajra Humkara Sadhana.

original: de'i ngo bo ni tshe dpag tu med par bstan to //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ni tshe dpag tu med par bstan to //
translated: Its nature is taught as limitless life.

original: so sor rtog pa'i ye @235b shes kyi bdag nyid can zhes pa ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dang tha mi dad pa so sor rtog pa'i ye shes yin te chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin rnam par dpyad par byas na mnyam pa nyid kyis khyab pa'i
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i ye @235b shes kyi bdag nyid can zhes pa ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dang tha mi dad pa so sor rtog pa'i ye shes yin te chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin rnam par dpyad par byas na mnyam pa nyid kyis khyab pa'i
translated: The nature of discerning intuition is not different from the intuition of equality, and is discerning intuition, because when the nature of all things is analyzed, it is pervaded by equality.

original: phyir ro // de med pas dngos po thams cad so sor rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyir ro // de med pas dngos po thams cad so sor rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Without that, one would not discern all things.

original: de'i rang bzhin 'od dpag tu med pa ste chos rnams so sor rtog par mdzad pas so //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin 'od dpag tu med pa ste chos rnams so sor rtog par mdzad pas so //
translated: Its nature is Amitabha, because he discerns all things.

original: de byin gyis rlob par byed pa zhes pa ni de mngon du 'gyur ba dang brtan pa nyid sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de byin gyis rlob par byed pa zhes pa ni de mngon du 'gyur ba dang brtan pa nyid sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Its consecration is for the sake of realizing and stabilizing that.

original: mi phyed pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi sngags te zhes pa ni gsung gi dbang phyug la sogs pa'i dngos grub dang dug dang dbral ba la sogs pa la nus pa ma nyams pa'o //
analyzed: mi phyed pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi sngags te zhes pa ni gsung gi dbang phyug la sogs pa'i dngos grub dang dug dang dbral ba la sogs pa la nus pa ma nyams pa'o //
translated: The mantra of indivisible nature is the undiminished power of the accomplishments of Mahamudra and so forth, and of the separation from poison and so forth.

original: tha mal pa'i dag spangs nas yan lag drug cu dang ldan pa g-yas su 'khyil ba'i dung dang 'dra ba'i mgrin pa la gnas pa'i gdong gi dkyil 'khor khyab par byed pa'i ljags dang bcas pa gang gis byed pa de ni gsung byin gyis brlab pa'i sngags gsungs
analyzed: tha mal pa'i dag spangs nas yan lag drug cu dang ldan pa g-yas su 'khyil ba'i dung dang 'dra ba'i mgrin pa la gnas pa'i gdong gi dkyil 'khor khyab par byed pa'i ljags dang bcas pa gang gis byed pa de ni gsung byin gyis brlab pa'i sngags gsungs
translated: The one who, having abandoned the ordinary tongue, creates the face mandala pervaded by the tongue endowed with sixty branches, which is situated in the throat, which is like a conch spiraling to the right, is consecrated with the mantra of speech.

original: pa ste snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: pa ste snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The mantra is stated as before.

original: aom zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngags te de brjod pas gsung byin gyis brlab par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: aom zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngags te de brjod pas gsung byin gyis brlab par 'gyur ro //
translated: The mantra is “Oṃ” and so forth, and by reciting it, the consecration of speech is performed.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngags rnams la mdor bstan pa dang rgyas par bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngags rnams la mdor bstan pa dang rgyas par bshad pa yin te /
translated: The mantras are taught in brief and in detail by “thus” and so forth.

original: rim pa gang gis sku la sogs pa byin gyis brlab par bya zhes bstan to ;
analyzed: rim pa gang gis sku la sogs pa byin gyis brlab par bya zhes bstan to ;
translated: The consecration of body and so forth is taught by the procedure.

original: / mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid ni shin tu rnal 'byor gyi rim pas shes par bya'o //
analyzed: / mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid ni shin tu rnal 'byor gyi rim pas shes par bya'o //
translated: The nature of Akṣhobhya and so forth is to be known by the stage of the very unelaborate yoga.

original: nyan thos la sogs pas yongs su mi shes pas na zhes pa ni nyan thos nas brtsams te rnal 'byor gyi rgyud kyi rnal 'byor pa'i bar du zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pas yongs su mi shes pas na zhes pa ni nyan thos nas brtsams te rnal 'byor gyi rgyud kyi rnal 'byor pa'i bar du zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since it is not known by the śrāvakas and so forth, means beginning from the śrāvakas up to the yogis of the Yoga Tantra.

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje gang yin pa zhes pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pas sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid yin pas so //
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje gang yin pa zhes pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pas sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid yin pas so //
translated: That which is the vajra body, speech, and mind, means that it is the nature of the three beings by way of the creation stage.

original: de la dam tshig sems dpa' ni sku'i rang bzhin te phyi'i gzugs su snang bas so //
analyzed: de la dam tshig sems dpa' ni sku'i rang bzhin te phyi'i gzugs su snang bas so //
translated: There, the commitment being is the nature of the body, because it appears as the external form.

original: ye shes sems dpa' ni gsung gi ngo bo ste bar na gnas pas so //
analyzed: ye shes sems dpa' ni gsung gi ngo bo ste bar na gnas pas so //
translated: The wisdom being is the essence of speech, because it abides in the middle.

original: ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' ni thugs kyi rang bzhin te phra ba'i ngo bo yin pas so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' ni thugs kyi rang bzhin te phra ba'i ngo bo yin pas so //
translated: The concentration being is the nature of the mind, because it is the subtle essence.

original: yang na lha'i sku dam tshig sems dpa' zhes bya ba sku la sogs pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang na lha'i sku dam tshig sems dpa' zhes bya ba sku la sogs pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Or else, the deity body is called the commitment being, which is the nature of the body and so forth.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir lus zhes smos te /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir lus zhes smos te /
translated: In order to teach just that, “body” is mentioned.

original: rnal 'byor gsum gyis rdzogs pa'i rdo rje 'chang chen po la sogs pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor gsum gyis rdzogs pa'i rdo rje 'chang chen po la sogs pa'i sku'o //
translated: The body of Great Vajradhara, who is perfected by the three yogas.

original: lha rnams @236a * //
analyzed: lha rnams @236a * //
translated: The wheel of the deities

original: kyi 'khor lo'i gzhir gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni rjes su rnal 'byor dang // shin du rnal 'byor gyi rim pas de bzhin gshegs pa dang lha mo dang byang chub sems dpa' dang khro bo thams cad kyi ngo bo yin pas so //
analyzed: kyi 'khor lo'i gzhir gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni rjes su rnal 'byor dang // shin du rnal 'byor gyi rim pas de bzhin gshegs pa dang lha mo dang byang chub sems dpa' dang khro bo thams cad kyi ngo bo yin pas so //
translated: is the basis of the wheel of the deities, because of the sequence of subsequent yoga and of supreme yoga, since it is the nature of all the Tathagatas, goddesses, Bodhisattvas, and wrathful deities.🔽The three-fold array of Locana, etc.,

original: spyan la sogs pa bkod pa gsum pa zhes pa ni 'khor dang bcas pa'i spyan ma la sogs pa'i lha mo gsum zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: spyan la sogs pa bkod pa gsum pa zhes pa ni 'khor dang bcas pa'i spyan ma la sogs pa'i lha mo gsum zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: means the three goddesses Locana, etc., together with their retinues.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni spyan ma la sogs pa gsum po spros nas zhi ba la sogs pa'i phrin las grub pas na gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa dang / des 'gugs pa'i rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pas rang gi sku la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa'i phyir rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa yang 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni spyan ma la sogs pa gsum po spros nas zhi ba la sogs pa'i phrin las grub pas na gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa dang / des 'gugs pa'i rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pas rang gi sku la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa'i phyir rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa yang 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: The perfection of one's own goal is also accomplished, because Vairochana, etc., who are summoned by that, consecrate one's body, etc.

original: sku rdo rje la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa'i phyir zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pas rang gi lus la sogs pa de'i rang bzhin du bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sku rdo rje la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa'i phyir zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pas rang gi lus la sogs pa de'i rang bzhin du bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to consecrate the vajra body, etc. means in order for Vairochana, etc., to make one's body, etc. have that nature.

original: spros pa ni yi ge aom la sogs pa las 'od zer gyi sgo nas phyung pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: spros pa ni yi ge aom la sogs pa las 'od zer gyi sgo nas phyung pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Emanation means the emission of light rays from the letters Om, etc.

original: mi bskyod pa la sogs pa ste zhes pa la yid kyi rnam par rtog pa'i 'jig pa las skyob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa la sogs pa ste zhes pa la yid kyi rnam par rtog pa'i 'jig pa las skyob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Akṣobhya and so forth means that they are the four tathāgatas.

original: de rnams kyis mtshon pa gang yin pa zhes pa ni brjod par bya ba dang / rjod par byed pa mi phyed pa'i phyir dang ; / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dbye bas 'chad par 'dod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyis mtshon pa gang yin pa zhes pa ni brjod par bya ba dang / rjod par byed pa mi phyed pa'i phyir dang ; / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dbye bas 'chad par 'dod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: What is indicated by them means that which is to be expressed and the means of expression are not divided, and because they are not explained by a division of cause and effect.

original: des ni yi ge gsum gyis so //
analyzed: des ni yi ge gsum gyis so //
translated: By those three syllables.

original: mgo dang lkog ma dang snying ga'i phyogs su zhes bya ba ni zla ba dang padma dang rdo rje rnams kyis mtshon pa'o //
analyzed: mgo dang lkog ma dang snying ga'i phyogs su zhes bya ba ni zla ba dang padma dang rdo rje rnams kyis mtshon pa'o //
translated: In the places of the head, throat, and heart means that they are indicated by the moon, lotus, and vajra.

original: rnam par bkod pa zhes pa ni de rnams bkod nas so //
analyzed: rnam par bkod pa zhes pa ni de rnams bkod nas so //
translated: Arranged means that they are arranged there.

original: des shin du mtshan pa zhes pa ni lha'i sku gang yin pa de nyid sngar bshad ma thag pa zhes pa la /
analyzed: des shin du mtshan pa zhes pa ni lha'i sku gang yin pa de nyid sngar bshad ma thag pa zhes pa la /
translated: By that means that the deity’s body is indicated by the three syllables.🔽What was just explained means that the three syllables are the nature of the three vajras.

original: sku la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa'i sngags sngar bshad pa gsum gyis dam par gyur pa zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa mngon du byed pa rnams kyis byin gyis brlab po zhes bstan pa bskyed par bya'o ;
analyzed: sku la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa'i sngags sngar bshad pa gsum gyis dam par gyur pa zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa mngon du byed pa rnams kyis byin gyis brlab po zhes bstan pa bskyed par bya'o ;
translated: The three previously explained mantras of the consecration of body, etc., are the “supreme consecration,” which is to say, the consecration by those who have actualized the Tathāgatas.

original: /'dir bsdus pa'i don ni rnal 'byor dang rjes su rnal 'byor dang shin du rnal 'byor byas la //🔽rang gi mgo bo dang klog ma dang snying gar zla ba dang padma dang / nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor bkod la de rnams su dkar po dang dmar po dang nag po yi ge gsum bkod nas //
analyzed: /'dir bsdus pa'i don ni rnal 'byor dang rjes su rnal 'byor dang shin du rnal 'byor byas la // rang gi mgo bo dang klog ma dang snying gar zla ba dang padma dang / nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor bkod la de rnams su dkar po dang dmar po dang nag po yi ge gsum bkod nas //
translated: Here, the condensed meaning is as follows: Having performed the yoga, the subsequent yoga, and the true yoga,🔽one should arrange the moon, lotus, and sun maṇḍalas on one’s head, throat, and heart, and having arranged the three syllables oṃ āḥ hūṃ in those places,

original: aom la @236b sogs pa'i yi ge gsum po'i thig le'i nang nas spyan ma dang gos dkar mo dang / m'a ma k'i rang dang 'dra ba'i mtha' yas pa'i sbyin ma la sogs pa'i 'khor gyis bskor bar spros te /
analyzed: aom la @236b sogs pa'i yi ge gsum po'i thig le'i nang nas spyan ma dang gos dkar mo dang / m'a ma k'i rang dang 'dra ba'i mtha' yas pa'i sbyin ma la sogs pa'i 'khor gyis bskor bar spros te /
translated: one should emanate from the bindu of the three syllables oṃ āḥ hūṃ Pāṇḍaravāsinī and Māmakī, surrounded by infinite retinues similar to oneself, such as Dānapāramitā.

original: des nam mkha'i khams gang bar byas nas 'og min dang bde ba can dang mngon par dga' ba'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing la bzhugs pa'i rnam par snang mdzad dang / 'od dpag med dang mi bskyod pa gsum spyan ma la sogs pa'i tshogs des tshig snyan pa dang /
analyzed: des nam mkha'i khams gang bar byas nas 'og min dang bde ba can dang mngon par dga' ba'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing la bzhugs pa'i rnam par snang mdzad dang / 'od dpag med dang mi bskyod pa gsum spyan ma la sogs pa'i tshogs des tshig snyan pa dang /
translated: Having filled the realm of space, they reside in the buddhafields of Akaniṣṭha, Sukhāvatī, and Abhirati, where one sees Vairocana, Amitābha, and Akṣobhya, respectively, together with the hosts of Locanā, and so on.🔽They are pleased by the sweet words and flirtatious behavior of the goddesses.

original: sgeg pas mgu ba byas la dpung pa'i zhags pas 'khyud cing bkug la shar phyogs kyi sgo ru padma dang / zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng na bzhugs par mthong nas /🔽dpal ldan sku yi rdo rje 'chang //
analyzed: sgeg pas mgu ba byas la dpung pa'i zhags pas 'khyud cing bkug la shar phyogs kyi sgo ru padma dang / zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng na bzhugs par mthong nas / dpal ldan sku yi rdo rje 'chang //
translated: They are drawn in by the lasso of their arms and are seen to reside on moon maṇḍalas in the eastern door.🔽One should supplicate with the three verses beginning “Glorious Vajra Body Holder,” and so on, and offer the five offerings.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsum gyis gsol ba btab nas mchod pa rnam pa lngas mchod la spyan ma la sogs pa'i tshogs de nyid dang bcas pa yi ge gsum de dag la 'jug cing /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsum gyis gsol ba btab nas mchod pa rnam pa lngas mchod la spyan ma la sogs pa'i tshogs de nyid dang bcas pa yi ge gsum de dag la 'jug cing /
translated: The hosts of Locanā and so on enter into those three syllables.

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi sku gang yin //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi sku gang yin //
translated: The body of all buddhas

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis nga rgyal byas la sku gsung thugs ni rnam par thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa la sogs pas mtshan pa mthong ste /🔽aom sarba ta th'a ga ta k'a ya badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis nga rgyal byas la sku gsung thugs ni rnam par thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa la sogs pas mtshan pa mthong ste / aom sarba ta th'a ga ta k'a ya badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham //
translated: One should see the body, speech, and mind marked with the best of all aspects, and so forth.🔽With the three mantras beginning with “Oṃ, I am the essence of the vajra body of all tathāgatas,” one should consecrate.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sngags gsum gyis byin gyis brlab par bya'o zhes pa 'di ni sku la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa'i bdag nyid can gyi rnal 'byor chen po bstan pa ste dang po sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sngags gsum gyis byin gyis brlab par bya'o zhes pa 'di ni sku la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa'i bdag nyid can gyi rnal 'byor chen po bstan pa ste dang po sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: This is the teaching of the great yoga that has the nature of the consecration of body, and so forth. It is the first concentration, the first union.

original: drang ba'i don to zhes pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i yan lag tu gyur pa'i dang po sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi phyogs gcig pa rnal 'byor chen po so sor bstan pas so //
analyzed: drang ba'i don to zhes pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i yan lag tu gyur pa'i dang po sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi phyogs gcig pa rnal 'byor chen po so sor bstan pas so //
translated: The meaning of the words is that it is the first concentration, the first union, which is a branch of the creation stage, and it is the great yoga that is taught separately.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis zhes pa ni /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis zhes pa ni /
translated: For the yogis of the completion stage,

original: rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa'i rim pa lnga po bsgom pas so //
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa'i rim pa lnga po bsgom pas so //
translated: By cultivating the five stages, beginning with the vajra recitation.

original: bshad pa'i rgyud las zhes pa ni rdo rje phreng ba'i rgyud ces bya ba las so //
analyzed: bshad pa'i rgyud las zhes pa ni rdo rje phreng ba'i rgyud ces bya ba las so //
translated: The explanatory tantra is the tantra called the vajra garland.

original: de nas dpal chen zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi don sngar bshad zin to ;
analyzed: de nas dpal chen zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi don sngar bshad zin to ;
translated: The meaning of the samadhi beginning with Then, the great glorious one has been explained above.

original: / aom zhes bya ba dang po zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: / aom zhes bya ba dang po zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: The first is Vairochana.

original: sarba ni rin chen 'byung ldan te nam mkha'i khams ni thams cad kyi bdag nyid yin no //
analyzed: sarba ni rin chen 'byung ldan te nam mkha'i khams ni thams cad kyi bdag nyid yin no //
translated: The all is Ratnasambhava, because he is the nature of the entire realm of space.

original: ta th'a ga ta ni 'od dpag tu med pa ste byang chub kyi sems de bzhin gshegs pa'i bdag nyid yin pas so //
analyzed: ta th'a ga ta ni 'od dpag tu med pa ste byang chub kyi sems de bzhin gshegs pa'i bdag nyid yin pas so //
translated: The tathagata is Amitabha, because the bodhicitta is the nature of the tathagatas.

original: yon tan yin pas zhes @237a * //
analyzed: yon tan yin pas zhes @237a * //
translated: The qualities

original: pa ni snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa ste yon tan gsum mo //
analyzed: pa ni snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa ste yon tan gsum mo //
translated: are sattva, rajas, and tamas, the three gunas.

original: des na rnam par mdzad dang rin chen 'byung ldan dang 'od dpag tu med pa ste de bzhin gshegs pa gsum zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na rnam par mdzad dang rin chen 'byung ldan dang 'od dpag tu med pa ste de bzhin gshegs pa gsum zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the three tathagatas are Vairochana, Ratnasambhava, and Amitabha. This is the meaning of three tathagatas.

original: tsi tta badzra zhes bya ba ni tshig gnyis te ldan pa ni gcig tu gyur nas tshig gcig go //
analyzed: tsi tta badzra zhes bya ba ni tshig gnyis te ldan pa ni gcig tu gyur nas tshig gcig go //
translated: Citta-vajra is two words, but united they become one word.

original: des na mi bskyod pa yin te thugs rdo rje'i rang bzhin yin pas so //
analyzed: des na mi bskyod pa yin te thugs rdo rje'i rang bzhin yin pas so //
translated: Therefore, it is Akṣobhya, because of being the nature of mind-vajra.

original: sva bh'a wa a'atma ko zhes pa ni rlung gi khams kyi rang bzhin don yod grub pa ste lnga pa'o //
analyzed: sva bh'a wa a'atma ko zhes pa ni rlung gi khams kyi rang bzhin don yod grub pa ste lnga pa'o //
translated: Svabhāva-ātmako means Amoghasiddhi, the nature of the wind element, the fifth.

original: aa ham zhes pa ni sna tshogs kyi nga rgyal gyi rang bzhin du gnas pa bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang ste de nyid du drug pa'o //
analyzed: aa ham zhes pa ni sna tshogs kyi nga rgyal gyi rang bzhin du gnas pa bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang ste de nyid du drug pa'o //
translated: Ahaṃ means abiding in the nature of the pride of variety, Bhagavān Vajradhara, the sixth.

original: sku drug ces bya ba la sogs pas de dag dang de bzhin gshegs pa drug sku gsum gyi ngo bo yin te /
analyzed: sku drug ces bya ba la sogs pas de dag dang de bzhin gshegs pa drug sku gsum gyi ngo bo yin te /
translated: The six bodies and so on indicate that those and the six tathāgatas are the nature of the three bodies.

original: de'i rang bzhin nang yin no zhes lhag par mos pa nyid du thugs byin gyis brlab pa bstan to //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin nang yin no zhes lhag par mos pa nyid du thugs byin gyis brlab pa bstan to //
translated: The nature of those is within, which teaches the consecration of mind as the imagination of that.

original: de bzhin du 'og ma la yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'og ma la yang sbyar ro //
translated: The same is applied below.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sngar bshad zin to //
translated: Then and so on has been explained previously.

original: aom tshangs par bshad ces pa ni dang po yin pa dang / gcig yin pas tshangs pa ni rnam par snang mdzad de dang po'o //
analyzed: aom tshangs par bshad ces pa ni dang po yin pa dang / gcig yin pas tshangs pa ni rnam par snang mdzad de dang po'o //
translated: Om is the first, and since it is one, Brahma is Vairochana, the first.

original: sarba ta th'a ga ta zhes pa ni rin chen 'byung ldan te de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi nang na chos kyi rgyal srid la mnga' mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sarba ta th'a ga ta zhes pa ni rin chen 'byung ldan te de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi nang na chos kyi rgyal srid la mnga' mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Sarvatathagatakaya is Ratnasambhava, because he is the lord of the Dharma kingdom among all tathagatas.

original: chags gtogs dbang phyug ces pa ni 'dod chags rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin te 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: chags gtogs dbang phyug ces pa ni 'dod chags rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin te 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: Kama-ishvara is Amitabha, the nature of the purification of desire.

original: k'a ya zhes pa ni k'a ni sgra ste des na gsung gi rang bzhin gsum pa'o //
analyzed: k'a ya zhes pa ni k'a ni sgra ste des na gsung gi rang bzhin gsum pa'o //
translated: Kaya means sound, so the third is the nature of speech.

original: badzra ni thugs rdo rje ste bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: badzra ni thugs rdo rje ste bzhi pa'o //
translated: Vajra is the mind vajra, the fourth.

original: snyan ngang gi rig byed dang mchod sbyin gyi rig byed dang srid srung ba'i rig byed dang mang du brjod pa'i rig byed de bzhi pa'o ;
analyzed: snyan ngang gi rig byed dang mchod sbyin gyi rig byed dang srid srung ba'i rig byed dang mang du brjod pa'i rig byed de bzhi pa'o ;
translated: The four are the Rig Veda, the Yajur Veda, the Sama Veda, and the Atharva Veda.

original: / sva bh'a wa a'atma ko zhes pa ni snga ma bzhin du don yod grub pa'o //
analyzed: / sva bh'a wa a'atma ko zhes pa ni snga ma bzhin du don yod grub pa'o //
translated: Svabhava-atmako is Amoghasiddhi, as before.

original: 'dod lha ni gzugs la sogs pa 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga ste des na lnga'o //
analyzed: 'dod lha ni gzugs la sogs pa 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga ste des na lnga'o //
translated: The desire gods are the five sense objects of form and so on.

original: aa ham ni snga ma bzhin du rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: aa ham ni snga ma bzhin du rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: Aham is as before, Vajrasattva.

original: smin drug ni smin drug gi bu kar ti ka ste gdong drug pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smin drug ni smin drug gi bu kar ti ka ste gdong drug pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Jyestha is Jyestha-putra Kartikeya, because he has six faces.🔽Therefore, the consecration of the body is the imagination that my body is the nature of the six Tathagatas.🔽One should imagine that by the power of the mantra, the body is consecrated as the nature of the six Tathagatas.🔽By the power of the mantra means by the power of the mantra of the consecration of the body.

original: des na de bzhin gshegs pa drug gi rang bzhin ni nga'i sku yin no zhes lhag par mos pa gang yin pa de ni sku byin gyis brlab pa zhes bya'o //🔽dgongs pa yis ni yang dag brtags //
analyzed: des na de bzhin gshegs pa drug gi rang bzhin ni nga'i sku yin no zhes lhag par mos pa gang yin pa de ni sku byin gyis brlab pa zhes bya'o // dgongs pa yis ni yang dag brtags //
translated: One should imagine means one should imagine that by the power of the mantra, the body is consecrated as the nature of the six Tathagatas.

original: zhes pa ni tshig gi tshogs de dag dgongs pas bshad pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽shes rab dbye bas bya //🔽zhes pa ni rdo rje @237b slob dpon bsten pa las thob pa'i shes rab kyi khyad par gyis nges par rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni tshig gi tshogs de dag dgongs pas bshad pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to // shes rab dbye bas bya // zhes pa ni rdo rje @237b slob dpon bsten pa las thob pa'i shes rab kyi khyad par gyis nges par rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of one should imagine is that one should imagine that by the power of the mantra, the body is consecrated as the nature of the six Tathagatas.🔽The meaning of one should imagine is that one should imagine that by the power of the mantra, the body is consecrated as the nature of the six Tathagatas.🔽The meaning of one should imagine is that one should imagine that by the power of the mantra, the body is consecrated as the nature of the six Tathagatas.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don bshad zin to //🔽aom ni dang po ste rnam par snang mdzad snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don bshad zin to //🔽aom ni dang po ste rnam par snang mdzad snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of one should imagine is that one should imagine that by the power of the mantra, the body is consecrated as the nature of the six Tathagatas.🔽The meaning of one should imagine is that one should imagine that by the power of the mantra, the body is consecrated as the nature of the six Tathagatas.🔽The meaning of one should imagine is that one should imagine that by the power of the mantra, the body is consecrated as the nature of the six Tathagatas.🔽The meaning of one should imagine is that one should imagine that by the power of the mantra, the body is consecrated as the nature of the six Tathagatas.🔽The meaning of one should imagine is that one should imagine that by the power of the mantra, the body is consecrated as the nature of the six Tathagatas.🔽The meaning of one should imagine is that one should imagine that by the power of the mantra, the body is consecrated as the nature of the six Tathagatas.

original: sarba ta th'a ga ta zhes pa ni rin chen 'byung ldan te gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: sarba ta th'a ga ta zhes pa ni rin chen 'byung ldan te gnyis pa'o //
translated: Sarva-tathagata is Ratnasambhava, the second.

original: w'a ka ni ngag gi rang bzhin te 'od dpag tu med pa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: w'a ka ni ngag gi rang bzhin te 'od dpag tu med pa gsum pa'o //
translated: Vaka is the nature of speech, Amitabha, the third.

original: badzra ni thugs kyi rdo rje'o //
analyzed: badzra ni thugs kyi rdo rje'o //
translated: Vajra is the mind-vajra.

original: rdzogs ldan dang / sum ldan dang / nyis ldan dang / rtsod pa ste dus bzhi'o //
analyzed: rdzogs ldan dang / sum ldan dang / nyis ldan dang / rtsod pa ste dus bzhi'o //
translated: The four ages are the perfect age, the age of three quarters, the age of two quarters, and the age of conflict.

original: de bas na bzhi pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bas na bzhi pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, it means the fourth.

original: sva bh'a wa a'atma ko zhes pa ni don yod grub pa'o //
analyzed: sva bh'a wa a'atma ko zhes pa ni don yod grub pa'o //
translated: Svaha is Amoghasiddhi.

original: 'dod lha ni 'dod pa'i lha'i smyo byed dang / nyams byed dang / rmongs byed dang / gdung byed dang / skem byed de mda' lnga'o //
analyzed: 'dod lha ni 'dod pa'i lha'i smyo byed dang / nyams byed dang / rmongs byed dang / gdung byed dang / skem byed de mda' lnga'o //
translated: The five arrows are the desire god's intoxicant, paralyzer, stupefier, tormentor, and emaciator.

original: des na lnga pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na lnga pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, it means the fifth.

original: aa ham zhes pa ni rdo rje 'chang ngo //
analyzed: aa ham zhes pa ni rdo rje 'chang ngo //
translated: Aham is Vajradhara.

original: dus ni dgun stod dang / dgun smad dang / dpyid ka dang sos ka dang / dbyar ka dang ston te drug go //
analyzed: dus ni dgun stod dang / dgun smad dang / dpyid ka dang sos ka dang / dbyar ka dang ston te drug go //
translated: The six times are the first winter month, the second winter month, spring, summer, autumn, and the last winter month.

original: des na drug pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: des na drug pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Therefore, it means the sixth.

original: des na don 'di yin te de bzhin gshegs pa drug gi rang bzhin ni nga'i ngag yin no zhes lhag par mos pa gang yin pa de ni gsung byin gyis brlab pa'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des na don 'di yin te de bzhin gshegs pa drug gi rang bzhin ni nga'i ngag yin no zhes lhag par mos pa gang yin pa de ni gsung byin gyis brlab pa'o zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, this is the meaning: the nature of the six transcendent lords is my speech. Whatever is the special resolve, that is the consecration of speech.

original: nye bar bsdus pa bstan pa'i phyir de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: nye bar bsdus pa bstan pa'i phyir de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to teach the summary, he says, thus, etc.

original: gsum ni sku la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa gsum mo //
analyzed: gsum ni sku la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa gsum mo //
translated: The three are the three consecrations of body, etc.

original: ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What are they like?

original: re re ni sku byin gyis brlab pa dang / gsung byin gyis brlab pa dang / thugs byin gyis brlab pa la'o //
analyzed: re re ni sku byin gyis brlab pa dang / gsung byin gyis brlab pa dang / thugs byin gyis brlab pa la'o //
translated: Each one is in the consecration of body, the consecration of speech, and the consecration of mind.

original: drug gsum du bshad pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: drug gsum du bshad pa zhes pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the six as three is

original: de bzhin gshegs pa drug sku gsum gyi rang bzhin du bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa drug sku gsum gyi rang bzhin du bshad pa'o //
translated: the explanation of the six transcendent lords as the nature of the three bodies.

original: thugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni thugs gsung sku zhes brjod par bya bar rigs na thugs sku gsung zhes ci'i phyir go rims log ce na /
analyzed: thugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni thugs gsung sku zhes brjod par bya bar rigs na thugs sku gsung zhes ci'i phyir go rims log ce na /
translated: If one were to say, “It is proper to say mind, speech, and body, but why is the order reversed, saying mind, body, and speech?”

original: smras pa / de ltar bshad mod kyi /
analyzed: smras pa / de ltar bshad mod kyi /
translated: We reply: It is explained in that way,🔽but

original: 'on kyang go bzlog ba bstan te /
analyzed: 'on kyang go bzlog ba bstan te /
translated: But the opposite is taught,

original: rang gi glegs bam mthong ba rnams kyis 'khrul pa skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi glegs bam mthong ba rnams kyis 'khrul pa skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the error of those who see their own books.

original: gzhan du na slob dpon dang slob ma'i 'brel pa dang / bsnyen bkur bya ba dang / bsnyen bkur byed pa'i 'brel pa yang chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na slob dpon dang slob ma'i 'brel pa dang / bsnyen bkur bya ba dang / bsnyen bkur byed pa'i 'brel pa yang chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the relationship of master and disciple and the relationship of the one who is to be honored and the one who honors would be broken.

original: des na dngos grub kyang thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na dngos grub kyang thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And thus, one would not attain power.

original: rdo rje gsum zhes pa ni sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ni lus la sogs pa yin no zhes 'du shes dang yid la byed pa gang la yod pa de ni rdo rje gsum zhes bya ba ste rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i @238a * //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum zhes pa ni sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ni lus la sogs pa yin no zhes 'du shes dang yid la byed pa gang la yod pa de ni rdo rje gsum zhes bya ba ste rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i @238a * //
translated: The one who has the notion and mental activity that the body, etc., are of the nature of the Vajra Body, etc., is called the one of the three vajras.

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams so //
translated: They are the yogis of the stage of completion.

original: bdag po'i chos can gcig tu byung //
analyzed: bdag po'i chos can gcig tu byung //
translated: The one who is the nature of the Lord is the one who has come forth as one.

original: zhes pa ni khams gsum pa 'dul bar bya ba'i dbang byed pa byin gyis brlabs pas 'byung ngo zhes sku la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa dang ldan pas rnal 'byor pa rnams la phan yon bstan to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni khams gsum pa 'dul bar bya ba'i dbang byed pa byin gyis brlabs pas 'byung ngo zhes sku la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa dang ldan pas rnal 'byor pa rnams la phan yon bstan to //
translated: Thus, the benefits for the yogis are taught by the consecration of the body, etc.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum bsgom pa'i don du ye shes gsum zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum bsgom pa'i don du ye shes gsum zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The three wisdoms are mentioned for the sake of cultivating the three samadhis of the completion stage.

original: snang ba la sogs pa'i ye shes gsum ste tha mal pa rnams kyis mi phyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snang ba la sogs pa'i ye shes gsum ste tha mal pa rnams kyis mi phyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The three wisdoms are the wisdoms of appearance, etc., because they are not divided by ordinary people.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams las byung ba zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa 'brel pa drug gi sgron nas byung ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams las byung ba zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa 'brel pa drug gi sgron nas byung ba'o //
translated: Arisen from the Tathagatas means arisen from the lamp of the sixfold union with the Tathagatas, etc.

original: yang na de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: yang na de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: Or, the Tathagata is clear light.

original: de las byung ba ni spros pa'o //🔽ji ltar chu bo dang ba las //
analyzed: de las byung ba ni spros pa'o // ji ltar chu bo dang ba las //
translated: Arisen from that is the emanation.🔽As it is said:🔽Just as fish quickly leap

original: nya dag myur du ldang bar 'gyur //
analyzed: nya dag myur du ldang bar 'gyur //
translated: from clear water,

original: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: so do the Tathagatas.

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes pa la gang gi phyir bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams ni ye shes gsum rnams 'byed pa las snod ma yin te /
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes pa la gang gi phyir bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams ni ye shes gsum rnams 'byed pa las snod ma yin te /
translated: For, the yogis of the stage of generation are not vessels for the differentiation of the three intuitions,

original: de ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i yan lag yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i yan lag yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is a limb of the stage of completion.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa ste zhes pa ni sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pas thob par bya ba'i 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa ste zhes pa ni sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pas thob par bya ba'i 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: Ultimate truth is the clearlight which is to be attained by the process of the purification of the mind.

original: rnam par shes pa gsum gyi gnas su gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni de nyid las de bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gsum gyi gnas su gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni de nyid las de bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the basis of the three consciousnesses, because it generates those.

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa ste zhes pa ni snang ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi tshogs kyi mtshan nyid ni rtog pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa ste zhes pa ni snang ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi tshogs kyi mtshan nyid ni rtog pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Conventional truth is the collection of appearances and so forth, which has the characteristic of conceptualization.

original: bskyed par gyur pa zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba nyid las kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad 'byung bas so //
analyzed: bskyed par gyur pa zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba nyid las kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad 'byung bas so //
translated: “Arisen” means that all phenomena of affliction and purification arise from just luminosity.

original: gal te de ltar yin na gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin ni ji ltar tha dad par 'gyur pa dang / de yod na tha mi dad pa ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar yin na gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin ni ji ltar tha dad par 'gyur pa dang / de yod na tha mi dad pa ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: If that is so, how could the nature of non-duality be different, and if it exists, how could it be non-different?

original: smras pa / re zhig 'od gsal ba ni tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / re zhig 'od gsal ba ni tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin yin te /
translated: It is said: First, luminosity has a nature of non-difference.

original: brten par gyur pa snying po med pa'i chos kyi dbye bas de'i dbye ba so sor snang ste nam mkha' dang char bzhin no //
analyzed: brten par gyur pa snying po med pa'i chos kyi dbye bas de'i dbye ba so sor snang ste nam mkha' dang char bzhin no //
translated: It appears as a difference due to the divisions of the phenomena of the insubstantial dependent.

original: gang gi phyir nam mkha' ni ngo bo gcig yin na yang dngos po'i dbye bas dbye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir nam mkha' ni ngo bo gcig yin na yang dngos po'i dbye bas dbye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Even though space is a single entity, it becomes different due to the divisions of things.

original: bum pa'i nam mkha' dang snam bu'i nam mkha'i tha snyad bzhin no //
analyzed: bum pa'i nam mkha' dang snam bu'i nam mkha'i tha snyad bzhin no //
translated: It is like the conventions of the space of a vase and the space of a cloth.

original: char ngo bo gcig yin na yang bu ram gyi shing la @238b sogs pa'i 'brel bas mngar ba la sogs pa'i ro dang ldan pa nyid du tha snyad du bya'o //
analyzed: char ngo bo gcig yin na yang bu ram gyi shing la @238b sogs pa'i 'brel bas mngar ba la sogs pa'i ro dang ldan pa nyid du tha snyad du bya'o //
translated: Although the rain is of one nature, it is conventionally said to have the taste of sweetness, etc. because of its connection with sugarcane, etc.

original: de bzhin du 'od gsal ba yang dngos po'i tshogs de dang de bskyed pa dang 'jig pa'i 'brel bas dbye bas tha snyad du bya ba yin gyi 'od gsal ba la ni dbye ba gang yang med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'od gsal ba yang dngos po'i tshogs de dang de bskyed pa dang 'jig pa'i 'brel bas dbye bas tha snyad du bya ba yin gyi 'od gsal ba la ni dbye ba gang yang med do //
translated: In the same way, luminosity is conventionally differentiated by the connection of the production and destruction of this and that group of entities, but there is no differentiation at all in luminosity.

original: chos kyi dbyings la dbyer med phyir ;
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la dbyer med phyir ;
translated: Because the dharma-dhātu is undifferentiated,

original: / rigs kyi dbye ba rigs ma yin //🔽brten pa'i chos kyi dbye ba yis //🔽de yi dbye ba rab tu brjod //
analyzed: / rigs kyi dbye ba rigs ma yin // brten pa'i chos kyi dbye ba yis // de yi dbye ba rab tu brjod //
translated: the differentiation of gotra is not a gotra.🔽But its differentiation is declared

original: ces 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ces 'byung ngo //
translated: by the differentiation of the supported dharmas.

original: skye bo byis pas don dam pa'i bden pa ngo bo gcig yin na yang tha dad par snang ste rtog pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye bo byis pas don dam pa'i bden pa ngo bo gcig yin na yang tha dad par snang ste rtog pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Fools, because of their conceptualization, see the ultimate truth, which is of one nature, as having different appearances.

original: dngos po'i ngo bo mthong ba'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo mthong ba'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis ma yin te /
translated: But yogins who see the nature of entities do not,

original: rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are free of conceptualization.

original: rtsangs pa yis ni bdag nyid lus //
analyzed: rtsangs pa yis ni bdag nyid lus //
translated: The lizard is the body itself,

original: sngo dang ser por snang ba bzhin //
analyzed: sngo dang ser por snang ba bzhin //
translated: Just as it appears as blue or yellow.🔽To the childish it appears as one thing,

original: byis pa rnams la gzhan ston dang // mkhas pa rnams la gzhan ston to //
analyzed: byis pa rnams la gzhan ston dang // mkhas pa rnams la gzhan ston to //
translated: To the wise it appears as another.

original: de yi ngo bo dang ba ni //
analyzed: de yi ngo bo dang ba ni //
translated: Its nature is clarity,

original: rnam med gos pa med par 'dod //
analyzed: rnam med gos pa med par 'dod //
translated: Without form, without stain.

original: nam yang sangs rgyas ma yin pas //
analyzed: nam yang sangs rgyas ma yin pas //
translated: It is never not buddha,

original: de ni shes par bya mi nus //
analyzed: de ni shes par bya mi nus //
translated: But it cannot be known.

original: ji ltar skye bo gzhan dag gis //
analyzed: ji ltar skye bo gzhan dag gis //
translated: Just as other beings🔽Do not know the nature of the Buddha,

original: de bzhin sangs rgyas kyis mi rig / de yi rang bzhin gang yin pa //
analyzed: de bzhin sangs rgyas kyis mi rig / de yi rang bzhin gang yin pa //
translated: So the Buddha does not know🔽The nature of those beings.🔽The nature of the Buddha

original: de nyid kyis ni mkhyen pa yin //🔽dam chos lung sogs la mthong nas //
analyzed: de nyid kyis ni mkhyen pa yin // dam chos lung sogs la mthong nas //
translated: Is the nature of those beings.🔽We speak only of the Dharma

original: kho bo cag ni 'ba' zhig smra //
analyzed: kho bo cag ni 'ba' zhig smra //
translated: As the object of the eye of wisdom.

original: mig dang bcas pa'i spyod yul ni //
analyzed: mig dang bcas pa'i spyod yul ni //
translated: The object of the eye of wisdom

original: dmus long rnams kyi gzugs bzhin no //🔽zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dmus long rnams kyi gzugs bzhin no // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Is like the form of the blind.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa de nyid kyi khyad par ro zhes pa ni sngar bshad pa'i mtshan nyid dang 'brel pas so //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa de nyid kyi khyad par ro zhes pa ni sngar bshad pa'i mtshan nyid dang 'brel pas so //
translated: The ultimate truth is the particular characteristic of that.

original: stong pa nyid bzhi zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba dang bcas pa'i ye shes gsum mo //
analyzed: stong pa nyid bzhi zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba dang bcas pa'i ye shes gsum mo //
translated: The four emptinesses are the three intuitions together with the clearlight transparency.🔽The Tathagatas are the five light rays.🔽The five light rays are the five Tathagatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so zhes pa ni //🔽sngags kyi sku yin pas so //🔽'od zer lnga ste zhes pa ni de rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin mtshon bar 'gyur gyi gzhan du ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so zhes pa ni // sngags kyi sku yin pas so // 'od zer lnga ste zhes pa ni de rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin mtshon bar 'gyur gyi gzhan du ma yin no //
translated: The five light rays are the five Tathagatas.🔽The five light rays are the five Tathagatas.🔽The five light rays are the five Tathagatas.🔽The five light rays are the five Tathagatas.

original: yul du gyur pa'i zhes pa ni 'od zer lngas mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: yul du gyur pa'i zhes pa ni 'od zer lngas mdzad pa'o //
translated: The five light rays are the five Tathagatas.🔽The five light rays are the five Tathagatas.🔽The five light rays are the five Tathagatas.🔽The five light rays are the five Tathagatas.🔽The five light rays are the five Tathagatas.🔽The five light rays are the five Tathagatas.🔽The five light rays are the five Tathagatas.🔽The five light rays are the five Tathagatas.🔽The five light rays are the five Tathagatas.🔽The five light rays are the five Tathagatas.🔽The five light rays are the five Tathagatas.🔽The five light rays are the five Tathagatas.🔽The five light rays are the five Tathagatas.🔽The five light rays are the five Tathagatas.🔽The five light rays are the five Tathagatas.🔽The five light rays are the five Tathagatas.🔽The five light rays are the five Tathagatas.🔽The five light rays are the five Tathagatas.🔽The five light rays are the five Tathagatas.🔽The five light rays are the five Tathagatas.🔽The five light rays are the five Tathagatas.🔽The five light rays are the five Tathagatas.🔽The five light rays are the five Tathagatas.🔽The five light rays are the five Tathagatas.🔽The five light rays are the five Tathagatas.🔽The five light rays are the five Tathagatas.🔽The five light rays are the five Tathagatas.🔽The five light rays are the five Tathagatas.🔽The five light rays are the five Tathagatas.🔽The five light rays are the five Tathagatas.🔽The five light rays are the five Tathagatas.

original: rdo rje sku zhes pa ni bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pas 'byung ba ye shes kyi sku zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽bskyed par bya'o zhes pa ni spro bar bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sku zhes pa ni bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pas 'byung ba ye shes kyi sku zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // bskyed par bya'o zhes pa ni spro bar bya'o //
translated: The five light rays are the five Tathagatas.

original: nges pa'i don to zhes pa ni sems rnam par dag pa dang / bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa gnyis 'chad par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa'i don to zhes pa ni sems rnam par dag pa dang / bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa gnyis 'chad par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The five

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas dang por sbyor ba'i 'og tu dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog la 'jug pa'i phyir @239a * //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas dang por sbyor ba'i 'og tu dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog la 'jug pa'i phyir @239a * //
translated: Having first performed the yoga, in order to enter the mandala of the supreme victors,

original: ro ; / phyag rgya sbyang ba'i cho ga bstan par bya ste //
analyzed: ro ; / phyag rgya sbyang ba'i cho ga bstan par bya ste //
translated: the ritual for purifying the consort should be taught.

original: sku byin gyis brlab pa la sogs pa byas nas //
analyzed: sku byin gyis brlab pa la sogs pa byas nas //
translated: Having performed the consecration of the body, etc.,

original: zhes pa ni rnal 'byor chen po'i mtha'i bar du zhes tshig lhag ma'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rnal 'byor chen po'i mtha'i bar du zhes tshig lhag ma'o //
translated: the remainder of the sentence is up to the end of the great yoga.

original: rang gi rigs kyi yum la zhes pa ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i rigs dang mthun pa sme sha can la sogs pa'i bu mo la'o ;
analyzed: rang gi rigs kyi yum la zhes pa ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i rigs dang mthun pa sme sha can la sogs pa'i bu mo la'o ;
translated: The daughter of one's own clan means a girl of the candāla caste, etc. who is suitable for the clan of Akṣobhya, etc.

original: / rigs lnga dgod par byas la zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i yig 'bru rnams kyi yan lag byin gyis brlab pa byas nas so //
analyzed: / rigs lnga dgod par byas la zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i yig 'bru rnams kyi yan lag byin gyis brlab pa byas nas so //
translated: Having arranged the five clans means having consecrated the limbs with the seed syllables of the tathāgatas, etc.

original: gnyis ka'i 'khor lo rjes su mnyes pa'i gsang sngags bstan pa'i phyir zhes pa ni thabs dang shes rab dag gi brdar byas pa /
analyzed: gnyis ka'i 'khor lo rjes su mnyes pa'i gsang sngags bstan pa'i phyir zhes pa ni thabs dang shes rab dag gi brdar byas pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate the mantra for pleasing the wheel of both, means the symbolic gesture of method and wisdom.

original: skyes pa dang bud med gnyis kyi yan lag la gnas pa dkyil 'khor pa rnams mnyes pa la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes pa dang bud med gnyis kyi yan lag la gnas pa dkyil 'khor pa rnams mnyes pa la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the limbs of both the man and the woman are the mandala-beings who are engaged in pleasing.

original: bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni le'u dang po nas so //
analyzed: bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni le'u dang po nas so //
translated: It has been explained means in the first chapter.

original: aom zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sngags so //
analyzed: aom zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sngags so //
translated: The mantra Oṃ and so forth.

original: 'dis 'khyud par bya'o zhes pa ni sor mo gzhug pa la sogs pa byas nas rdo rje dang padma dag snyoms par 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dis 'khyud par bya'o zhes pa ni sor mo gzhug pa la sogs pa byas nas rdo rje dang padma dag snyoms par 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: By this, one should embrace means that having inserted the fingers and so forth, one should unite the vajra and lotus, which is to say, the male and female organs.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir snyoms par zhugs pa'i 'og tu zhes pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir snyoms par zhugs pa'i 'og tu zhes pa smos te /
translated: In order to teach just that, it says, after entering into union.

original: 'khor lo gnyis la zhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi'o //🔽mchod pa'i sngags bstan pa'i phyir zhes pa ni snang ba la sogs pa'i ye shes las 'byung ba rang rig pa'i bde ba myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor lo gnyis la zhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi'o // mchod pa'i sngags bstan pa'i phyir zhes pa ni snang ba la sogs pa'i ye shes las 'byung ba rang rig pa'i bde ba myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is of all the tathāgatas who have entered into the two wheels of the male and female organs.🔽In order to teach the mantra of offering, the mantra of offering is the mantra of offering. The mantra of offering is the mantra of offering.

original: aom zhes pa ni mchod pa'i sngags so //
analyzed: aom zhes pa ni mchod pa'i sngags so //
translated: The mantra Oṃ and so forth.

original: 'dis bdag nyid kyi snang ba la sogs pa'i ye shes las 'byung ba'i bde ba myong nas de nyid byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis bdag nyid kyi snang ba la sogs pa'i ye shes las 'byung ba'i bde ba myong nas de nyid byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: Having experienced the bliss that arises from the intuition of one's own appearance, etc., one should consecrate that very [bliss].

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir bshad ma thag pa'i cho ga zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to ;
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir bshad ma thag pa'i cho ga zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to ;
translated: In order to demonstrate that very [consecration], [the Bhagavān] declares, the rite that was just explained, and so forth.

original: / de nyid la bstan par bya ba bskyed pa'i phyir zhes pa ni rdo rje dang padma snyoms par zhugs pa la'o //
analyzed: / de nyid la bstan par bya ba bskyed pa'i phyir zhes pa ni rdo rje dang padma snyoms par zhugs pa la'o //
translated: In order to generate that very [consecration] means in the case of the union of the vajra and lotus.

original: des ni dkyil 'khor rgyal mchog bsgom par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: des ni dkyil 'khor rgyal mchog bsgom par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: For the sake of cultivating the supreme royal mandala,

original: dang po phyag rgya sbyong ba'i mtshan nyid kyi don bstan te /
analyzed: dang po phyag rgya sbyong ba'i mtshan nyid kyi don bstan te /
translated: the meaning of the purification of the consort is taught.

original: de yang sgrub pa'i thabs las sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: de yang sgrub pa'i thabs las sngar bshad zin to //
translated: And that was explained previously in the method of performance.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi yang zhes pa ni rin po che lta bu'i spyod yul gyi mchod pa bstan to //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi yang zhes pa ni rin po che lta bu'i spyod yul gyi mchod pa bstan to //
translated: Also for those abiding in the stage of completion refers to the offering of the field of jewels.

original: nye bar 'phrog cing zhes pa ni nye bar bsgyur ba dang bcas pa'i 'phrog pa'i skad kyi byings ni zhu ba'i don la 'jug ste nye bar gyur pa'i dbang gis ni /
analyzed: nye bar 'phrog cing zhes pa ni nye bar bsgyur ba dang bcas pa'i 'phrog pa'i skad kyi byings ni zhu ba'i don la 'jug ste nye bar gyur pa'i dbang gis ni /
translated: The word appropriating is a verbal root with a prefix, which means to melt; by the power of the prefix,

original: skad kyi byings las don gzhan 'gyur //
analyzed: skad kyi byings las don gzhan 'gyur //
translated: the meaning of the verbal root changes.

original: gang g'a'i @239b chu ni mngar mod kyang //
analyzed: gang g'a'i @239b chu ni mngar mod kyang //
translated: The water of the Ganges is sweet,

original: rgya mtsho'i chu yis ji bzhin no //🔽zhes bshad pas so //
analyzed: rgya mtsho'i chu yis ji bzhin no // zhes bshad pas so //
translated: but it is like the water of the ocean.

original: lnga ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lnga ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'o //
translated: The five are Vairochana and so forth.

original: drug pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhes pa ni ye shes lnga'i 'od gsal ba la thim pas so //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas me long lta bu la sogs pa ye shes lnga ni rgyu'o //
