analyzed: drug pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhes pa ni ye shes lnga'i 'od gsal ba la thim pas so // de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas me long lta bu la sogs pa ye shes lnga ni rgyu'o //
translated: The sixth is the Tathagata, because it dissolves into the clear light of the five pristine consciousnesses.

original: 'od gsal ba khong du chud pa ni 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba khong du chud pa ni 'bras bu'o //
translated: The five pristine consciousnesses such as the mirror-like pristine consciousness and so on are the cause, and the clear light is the result.

original: de yang rim pa lnga dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de yang rim pa lnga dang sbyar ro //
translated: That is also applied to the five stages.

original: gang gi phyir rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa la sku la sogs pa'i bzlas pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin gyis ma ning gi bzlas pa'i dus su 'od gsal ba rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa la sku la sogs pa'i bzlas pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin gyis ma ning gi bzlas pa'i dus su 'od gsal ba rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because, in the stage of vajra repetition, the repetitions of body, etc., which have the nature of the five pristine awarenesses of Vairochana, etc., are realized as the clear light at the time of the neutral repetition.

original: sems la dmigs pa'i rim pa la yang phyag rgya'i rim pas byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le me long lta bu la sogs pa ni ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin nyams su myong bas 'bras bur gyur pa'i 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid mngon du gyur to
analyzed: sems la dmigs pa'i rim pa la yang phyag rgya'i rim pas byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le me long lta bu la sogs pa ni ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin nyams su myong bas 'bras bur gyur pa'i 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid mngon du gyur to
translated: Also, in the stage of observing the mind, the pristine awarenesses of mirror-like, etc., which are the drops of awakening mind experienced by the stage of the seal, are the clear light reality that is actualized as the result.

original: // bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa la yang de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i sku blangs nas sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis 'od gsal ba nyid myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: // bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa la yang de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i sku blangs nas sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis 'od gsal ba nyid myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Also, in the stage of self-consecration, having taken on the bodies of the five transcendent ones, one experiences the clear light by means of the illusion-like concentration.

original: mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa yang ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin gyi rtags lngas 'od gsal ba nyid rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa yang ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin gyi rtags lngas 'od gsal ba nyid rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The stage of manifest enlightenment is also realized as clear light by means of the five signs which have the nature of the five pristine wisdoms.

original: zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa la yang rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pas sngar bshad pa'i rim pas ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin gyi rgyus mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings kyi ngo bo 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid rtogs par 'gyur ro //🔽yan lag drug pa'i rim pas kyang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa la yang rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pas sngar bshad pa'i rim pas ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin gyi rgyus mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings kyi ngo bo 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid rtogs par 'gyur ro // yan lag drug pa'i rim pas kyang 'di lta ste /
translated: Also, in the stage of union, by means of the causal process which has the nature of the five pristine wisdoms, such as the repetition of the indestructible speech and so forth, as previously explained, one realizes the reality of clear light which is the nature of the realm of non-abiding nirvana.🔽Also, by means of the stage of the six limbs, one realizes the reality of clear light which is the nature of great bliss.

original: yul dang dbang po gcig tu gyur pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i ngo bo ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin gyis so sor sdud pas bde pa chen po'i ngo bo 'od gsal ba rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul dang dbang po gcig tu gyur pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i ngo bo ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin gyis so sor sdud pas bde pa chen po'i ngo bo 'od gsal ba rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is because of the withdrawal which has the nature of the five pristine wisdoms, the nature of the five Tathagatas, the characteristic of the unification of the object and the subject.

original: de rnam par dag par byed pa ye shes lnga'i ngo bo dbye ba lngas phye ba'i bsam gtan gyi yan lag gi rgyus sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid can 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid rtogs so //
analyzed: de rnam par dag par byed pa ye shes lnga'i ngo bo dbye ba lngas phye ba'i bsam gtan gyi yan lag gi rgyus sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid can 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid rtogs so //
translated: By the cause of the fivefold division of the five pristine consciousnesses that purify that, one realizes the reality of luminosity, which has the characteristic of a one-pointed mind.

original: steng dang 'og tu 'dren pa de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i ngo bo ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin gyi srog gi rlung gi rgyus 'od gsal ba de kho na nyid rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: steng dang 'og tu 'dren pa de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i ngo bo ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin gyi srog gi rlung gi rgyus 'od gsal ba de kho na nyid rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: By the cause of the life vāyu, which has the nature of the five pristine consciousnesses, one realizes the reality of luminosity.

original: ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin gyi thig le sna gsum gyi rtse mor 'dzin @240a * //
analyzed: ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin gyi thig le sna gsum gyi rtse mor 'dzin @240a * //
translated: By holding the three nāḍīs, which have the nature of the five pristine consciousnesses,

original: pas 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid rtogs so //
analyzed: pas 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid rtogs so //
translated: one realizes the reality of luminosity.

original: ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin gyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo spros pas 'bras bur gyur pa'i 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin gyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo spros pas 'bras bur gyur pa'i 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: By emanating the maṇḍala of the tathāgatas, which has the nature of the five pristine consciousnesses, one realizes the reality of luminosity, which is the result.

original: de dag nye bar sdud par byed pa bden pa gnyis dbyer med pa' bdag nyid can gyi ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyus mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings kyi mtshan nyid can 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag nye bar sdud par byed pa bden pa gnyis dbyer med pa' bdag nyid can gyi ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyus mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings kyi mtshan nyid can 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: By the cause of samādhi, which is the nature of the inseparability of the two truths, one realizes the reality of luminosity, which is characterized by the dhātu of nonabiding nirvāṇa.

original: rtsa'i rim pas kyang 'di lta ste 'dod pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i rtsa lnga po la kun du spyod pa ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid kyi byang chub kyi sems kyi don dam pa byang chub kyi sems kyi ngo bo 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid rtogs par
analyzed: rtsa'i rim pas kyang 'di lta ste 'dod pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i rtsa lnga po la kun du spyod pa ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid kyi byang chub kyi sems kyi don dam pa byang chub kyi sems kyi ngo bo 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid rtogs par
translated: Also, by the stages of the nāḍīs, one realizes the reality of the ultimate bodhicitta, the bodhicitta of the nature of the five gnoses, which is the meaning of the five nāḍīs of the desire realm, and so on.

original: 'gyur ro // de bzhin du rlung gi de kho na nyid dang sngas kyi de kho na nyid la sogs pa yang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ro // de bzhin du rlung gi de kho na nyid dang sngas kyi de kho na nyid la sogs pa yang shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand the reality of the vāyu, the reality of the bindu, and so on.

original: de yang 'og tu le'u bcu gnyis pa las 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang 'og tu le'u bcu gnyis pa las 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: That will be explained later in chapter 12.

original: mchod pa de rnams kyis zhes pa la rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i sgom pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mchod pa de rnams kyis zhes pa la rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i sgom pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase by those offerings means by the meditations of the perfection stage such as vajra repetition and so forth.

original: sangs rgyas nyid ces bya ba la sogs pas bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis thob par bya ba'i byang chub shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor pa las ldog pa bstan to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid ces bya ba la sogs pas bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis thob par bya ba'i byang chub shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor pa las ldog pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase buddhahood and so forth teaches the reversal of the perfection stage yoga from the enlightenment to be attained in three countless eons.

original: mchod pa rnam pa gnyis smos pas //
analyzed: mchod pa rnam pa gnyis smos pas //
translated: The phrase two kinds of offerings

original: zhes pa ni rim pa gnyis kyi dbye bas so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rim pa gnyis kyi dbye bas so //
translated: is a division into two stages.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen pos zhes pa ni bka' stsal to zhes sdud pa po'i tshig go //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen pos zhes pa ni bka' stsal to zhes sdud pa po'i tshig go //
translated: The phrase Mahāvajradhara is the compiler's words, said.

original: mchod pa'i cho ga zhes bya ba la sogs pas lung gi tshad ma nyid du bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: mchod pa'i cho ga zhes bya ba la sogs pas lung gi tshad ma nyid du bstan par bya ste /
translated: The phrase the rite of offerings and so forth teaches the validity of the scriptures.

original: gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa phyi'i skye mched du drug go ;
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa phyi'i skye mched du drug go ;
translated: The phrase forms and so forth refers to the six external sense bases such as form and so forth.

original: / de dag dngos po med byas pa //
analyzed: / de dag dngos po med byas pa //
translated: They are made non-entities.

original: zhes pa ni so sor sdud pa dang bsam gtan gyi yan lag dag gi ngo bo nyid med pa gang yin pa de ni sangs rgyas la mchod pa bla na med pa bstan to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni so sor sdud pa dang bsam gtan gyi yan lag dag gi ngo bo nyid med pa gang yin pa de ni sangs rgyas la mchod pa bla na med pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the unsurpassed worship of the Buddhas, which is the absence of the nature of the branches of withdrawal and contemplation.

original: des ni so sor sdud pa dang bsam gtan dag gis bsdus pa'i sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa bstan to //
analyzed: des ni so sor sdud pa dang bsam gtan dag gis bsdus pa'i sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the stage of the purification of the mind, which is included in the withdrawal and contemplation.

original: mig la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas tha mal pa'i mig la sogs pa dang de'i rnam par shes pa dang de dag 'od gsal ba las cig car ram snang ba nye bar thob pa la sogs pa'i rim pas so //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas tha mal pa'i mig la sogs pa dang de'i rnam par shes pa dang de dag 'od gsal ba las cig car ram snang ba nye bar thob pa la sogs pa'i rim pas so //
translated: The ordinary eye, etc., and the consciousness of those, and their illumination, are simultaneously or in the order of the attainment of light, etc.

original: ye shes las byung ba ni spros te mngon par shes pa lngas nye bar mdzes par byas la rnal 'byor bas @240b sgom pa gang yin pa de ni myur du byang chub nyid thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ye shes las byung ba ni spros te mngon par shes pa lngas nye bar mdzes par byas la rnal 'byor bas @240b sgom pa gang yin pa de ni myur du byang chub nyid thob par 'gyur te /
translated: The yoga that is produced from intuition, that is, emanated, and adorned with the five superknowledges, is the one by which the yogin quickly attains enlightenment itself.

original: sgyu ma'i dpe bcu gnyis kyi nye bar mtshon pa'i ye shes kyi sku thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'dis bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa bstan to //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i dpe bcu gnyis kyi nye bar mtshon pa'i ye shes kyi sku thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'dis bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa bstan to //
translated: One attains the body of intuition which is illustrated by the twelve examples of illusion. This teaches the stage of self-consecration.

original: dgongs pas bshad pa'o zhes pa ni 'gal ba'i tshig gi sgo nas 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid dang ye shes kyi sku bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dgongs pas bshad pa'o zhes pa ni 'gal ba'i tshig gi sgo nas 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid dang ye shes kyi sku bstan pa'o //
translated: The intentional explanation is the teaching of the reality of clearlight transparency and the body of intuition by means of contradictory statements.

original: de ltar phyi dang nang gi mchod pa bstan nas zhes pa ni brtags pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa gnyis kyi mchod pa zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ltar phyi dang nang gi mchod pa bstan nas zhes pa ni brtags pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa gnyis kyi mchod pa zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: Having thus taught the outer and inner offerings, means that the offerings of the two stages, the imagined and the perfect, are the same.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa dang bral bas zhes pa ni rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa'i rim pa lnga med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa dang bral bas zhes pa ni rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa'i rim pa lnga med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because of being devoid of the perfect stage, means that one is devoid of the five stages such as the vajra repetition, and so on.

original: gang gi phyir rim pa lnga las ma gtogs par rdzogs pa'i rim pa gzhan ni med do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rim pa lnga las ma gtogs par rdzogs pa'i rim pa gzhan ni med do //
translated: Because there is no perfect stage apart from the five stages.

original: yod na yang de'i nang du bsdus par 'gyur te de yang 'og nas bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: yod na yang de'i nang du bsdus par 'gyur te de yang 'og nas bshad par bya'o //
translated: Even if there were, it would be included in those, and that will be explained later.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs kyi sngags bstan to //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs kyi sngags bstan to //
translated: The words great Vajradhara and so forth teach the mantras of the body, speech, and mind of all the Tathagatas.

original: sngags la dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas rim pa lnga gsal por bstan to //
analyzed: sngags la dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas rim pa lnga gsal por bstan to //
translated: The words the focus on mantra and so forth clearly teach the five stages.

original: sngags zhes pa ni bsam pa dang bag la nyal dang rigs dang bag chags kyi dbye bas bcom ldan 'das kyis dbye ba bdun cu rtsa gnyis gsungs so //
analyzed: sngags zhes pa ni bsam pa dang bag la nyal dang rigs dang bag chags kyi dbye bas bcom ldan 'das kyis dbye ba bdun cu rtsa gnyis gsungs so //
translated: Mantra is said by the Bhagavat to be of seventy-two types, according to the distinctions of intention, latent tendencies, family, and habitual tendencies.

original: de dag thams cad a'a li dang k'a li'i ngo bo yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa dgu'i bdag nyid can gyi yi ge phyi mos byung ba ni bskyed pa'o //🔽nam mkha' las rlung rab tu byung //
analyzed: de dag thams cad a'a li dang k'a li'i ngo bo yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa dgu'i bdag nyid can gyi yi ge phyi mos byung ba ni bskyed pa'o // nam mkha' las rlung rab tu byung //
translated: All of them are the nature of the vowels and consonants, which are the nature of the forty-nine letters. The subsequent letters arise from the previous ones.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rim pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rim pas so //
translated: The words from space, wind arises and so forth refer to the sequence.

original: sgra la sogs pa'i ngo bo yin la zhes pa ni lte ba'i phyogs nas dang po yid kyis bskul ba mi gsal ba'i sgra'i ngo bo 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa'i ngo bo yin la zhes pa ni lte ba'i phyogs nas dang po yid kyis bskul ba mi gsal ba'i sgra'i ngo bo 'byung ngo //
translated: The words the nature of sound and so forth mean that from the navel region, the first letter, which is the nature of an indistinct sound, arises, impelled by the mind.

original: de nas gnas dang byed pa dang 'bad rtsol gyi dbang gis gnas brgyad la reg cing gsal bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni sgra'o //
analyzed: de nas gnas dang byed pa dang 'bad rtsol gyi dbang gis gnas brgyad la reg cing gsal bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni sgra'o //
translated: Then, that which is touched and made manifest by the power of place, action, and exertion in the eight places is sound.

original: de bas na yi ge dang tshig dang ngag dang dag chen po'i rim gyis chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de bas na yi ge dang tshig dang ngag dang dag chen po'i rim gyis chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus, the eighty-four thousand aggregates of Dharma arise by the sequence of letters, words, speech, and great sound.🔽Or,

original: yang na / yi ge dbyangs dang sgra dang ni //
analyzed: yang na / yi ge dbyangs dang sgra dang ni //
translated: letters, vowels, and sound,

original: mtha' sgra ku co 'brug sgra glu //
analyzed: mtha' sgra ku co 'brug sgra glu //
translated: final sound, babble, thunder, song,🔽desire to emerge from the cave, and strong desire—

original: phug nas 'byung 'dod chag drag dang // sgra yi mtshan nyid bcu yin no //
analyzed: phug nas 'byung 'dod chag drag dang // sgra yi mtshan nyid bcu yin no //
translated: these are the ten characteristics of sound.

original: zhes rdo rje sa 'og gi rgyud las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes rdo rje sa 'og gi rgyud las 'byung ngo //
translated: This is from the Vajra Underground Tantra.

original: sgra la sogs pa'i rang bzhin de dag bstan to //
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa'i rang bzhin de dag bstan to //
translated: The natures of sound and so forth have been taught.

original: de rnams ni zhes pa ni sngags rnams kyi'o //🔽bud med dang skyes pa dang ma ning nyid kyis zhes pa ni bud med kyi rang bzhin ni yi ge a'a ste shes rab @241a * //
analyzed: de rnams ni zhes pa ni sngags rnams kyi'o // bud med dang skyes pa dang ma ning nyid kyis zhes pa ni bud med kyi rang bzhin ni yi ge a'a ste shes rab @241a * //
translated: Those are the natures of the mantras.🔽By the natures of female, male, and neuter,

original: kyi rang bzhin yin pas so //
analyzed: kyi rang bzhin yin pas so //
translated: the nature of the female is the letter a, because it is the nature of wisdom.

original: skyes pa'i rang bzhin ni yi ge h'um ste thabs kyi rang bzhin yin pas so //
analyzed: skyes pa'i rang bzhin ni yi ge h'um ste thabs kyi rang bzhin yin pas so //
translated: The nature of the male is the syllable hūṃ, because it is the nature of method.

original: ma ning gi rang bzhin ni aom ste /
analyzed: ma ning gi rang bzhin ni aom ste /
translated: The nature of the neuter is oṃ,

original: gnyi ga dang snyoms par zhugs pa'i ngo bo yin pas so //
analyzed: gnyi ga dang snyoms par zhugs pa'i ngo bo yin pas so //
translated: because it is the essence of the union of both.

original: de la sde tshan brgyad ni dang po'i yi ge brgyad la bsdus nas bzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la sde tshan brgyad ni dang po'i yi ge brgyad la bsdus nas bzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: Therein, the eight classes are condensed into the eight first syllables and become four.

original: bzhi po aa ka ya zhes bya ba'i gsum la bsdu'o //
analyzed: bzhi po aa ka ya zhes bya ba'i gsum la bsdu'o //
translated: The four are condensed into the three called a ka ya.

original: de rnams kyang yi ge phyi mo ma lus pa nye bar bsdus pa'i sgo nas yongs su 'gyur zhing sbyar la /
analyzed: de rnams kyang yi ge phyi mo ma lus pa nye bar bsdus pa'i sgo nas yongs su 'gyur zhing sbyar la /
translated: Those are completely transformed and combined by the inclusion of all the remaining syllables.

original: aom a'a: h'um gsum zhes yi ge gsum du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: aom a'a: h'um gsum zhes yi ge gsum du 'gyur ro //
translated: They become the three syllables oṃ āḥ hūṃ.

original: yi ge gsum gyis gzhir gyur pas //
analyzed: yi ge gsum gyis gzhir gyur pas //
translated: The three syllables are the basis.

original: zhes pa ni yi ge gsum gyis bsdus pas sngags kyi sgras ni yi ge gsum bshad do //
analyzed: zhes pa ni yi ge gsum gyis bsdus pas sngags kyi sgras ni yi ge gsum bshad do //
translated: Since they are included in the three syllables, the term “mantra” is explained as the three syllables.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that,

original: sngags ni yi ge gsum zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sngags ni yi ge gsum zhes bya'o //
translated: mantra is called the three syllables.🔽Theirs is of those,

original: de rnams kyi zhes pa ni yi ge gsum gyi'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi zhes pa ni yi ge gsum gyi'o //
translated: that is, of the three syllables.

original: 'jug pa la sogs pa ni 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dang bar du gnas pa'i rim pas so //
analyzed: 'jug pa la sogs pa ni 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dang bar du gnas pa'i rim pas so //
translated: Entering and so forth are in the order of going, coming, and abiding in between.

original: yongs su shes pa zhes pa ni yan lag mnyams pa'i lha'i rnal 'byor gyi rim pas bzlas pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su shes pa zhes pa ni yan lag mnyams pa'i lha'i rnal 'byor gyi rim pas bzlas pa'o //
translated: The thorough understanding is the recitation in the sequence of the unbroken limb of the deity yoga.

original: de la srog la sogs pa rlung gsum dang // de bzhin gshegs pa gsum dang / khams gsum dang / ye shes gsum dang / srid pa gsum dang / sku gsum dang / sku dang gsung dang thugs dang / ting nge 'dzin gsum dang rtsa gsum dang /
analyzed: de la srog la sogs pa rlung gsum dang // de bzhin gshegs pa gsum dang / khams gsum dang / ye shes gsum dang / srid pa gsum dang / sku gsum dang / sku dang gsung dang thugs dang / ting nge 'dzin gsum dang rtsa gsum dang /
translated: Therein, the three winds of life and so forth, the three Tathagatas, the three realms, the three wisdoms, the three existences, the three bodies, the three vajras of body, speech, and mind, the three samadhis, the three channels,

original: ye shes sems dpa' gsum la dbyer med par lhag par mos nas 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rim pas yi ge gsum bzlas pa gang yin pa de ni sngags la dmigs pa ste yan lag ma nyams pa'i rim pas rdo rje bzlas pa zhes bya ba'i don to
analyzed: ye shes sems dpa' gsum la dbyer med par lhag par mos nas 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rim pas yi ge gsum bzlas pa gang yin pa de ni sngags la dmigs pa ste yan lag ma nyams pa'i rim pas rdo rje bzlas pa zhes bya ba'i don to
translated: and the three wisdom beings are imagined to be inseparable. The recitation of the three syllables in the sequence of entering and so forth is the focus on mantra. The unbroken sequence of limbs is the meaning of vajra repetition.

original: // ji skad du /
analyzed: // ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: don rtogs pa yi bzlas pa ni //
analyzed: don rtogs pa yi bzlas pa ni //
translated: The recitation of the realization of the meaning

original: ngo bo nyid med bzang po ste /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med bzang po ste /
translated: is the excellent one without intrinsic reality.

original: dus gsum sangs rgyas rnams spyod pas //
analyzed: dus gsum sangs rgyas rnams spyod pas //
translated: The conduct of the Buddhas of the three times

original: de ni rdo rje bzlas par bshad //
analyzed: de ni rdo rje bzlas par bshad //
translated: is explained as vajra repetition.🔽The body, speech, and mind

original: ces 'byung ngo //🔽de las zhes bya ba la sogs pas rdo rje bzlas pa la lus ngag yid ni lhan cig byed pa yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: ces 'byung ngo // de las zhes bya ba la sogs pas rdo rje bzlas pa la lus ngag yid ni lhan cig byed pa yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: are the cooperating conditions.

original: sprul pa'i lus dang zhes pa ni bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pas spros pa'i lus kyis so //
analyzed: sprul pa'i lus dang zhes pa ni bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pas spros pa'i lus kyis so //
translated: The emanation body is the body that is emanated by the stage of self-consecration.

original: des ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa bsgom pas ye shes kyi sku gzung ba yin gyi sngags kyi sku ni ma yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: des ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa bsgom pas ye shes kyi sku gzung ba yin gyi sngags kyi sku ni ma yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: This shows that the wisdom body is taken by the cultivation of the stage of completion, and not the mantra body.

original: rdo rje bzlas pa nye bar mtshon pas zhes pa ni de ltar gyur pa'i mtshon pa'i don du byed tshig gsum pa bstan to //
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa nye bar mtshon pas zhes pa ni de ltar gyur pa'i mtshon pa'i don du byed tshig gsum pa bstan to //
translated: The third person is taught for the purpose of indicating that vajra repetition is the example.

original: snying gar gnas pa'i rdo rje sems dpa' zhes pa @241b ni rdo rje bzlas pa'i dus su rdo rje sems dpa'i mos pas so //
analyzed: snying gar gnas pa'i rdo rje sems dpa' zhes pa @241b ni rdo rje bzlas pa'i dus su rdo rje sems dpa'i mos pas so //
translated: The “Vajrasattva who resides in the heart” is the imagination of Vajrasattva at the time of vajra repetition.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pas yul du byas pa'o zhes pa ni /
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pas yul du byas pa'o zhes pa ni /
translated: “The object is made into an object by means of thorough knowledge of the way things really are.”

original: shes pa dang shes bya dang bral ba'i 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid lhag par rtogs pa mngon du byas pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa dang shes bya dang bral ba'i 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid lhag par rtogs pa mngon du byas pa'o //
translated: The clearlight transparency which is free from the knower and the known is realized in excess, and is actualized.

original: phyag rgya chen po rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni phyag rgya dang ting nge 'dzin gyi rim pas sgyu ma'i sku la mngon par zhen pa bcom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni phyag rgya dang ting nge 'dzin gyi rim pas sgyu ma'i sku la mngon par zhen pa bcom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the purity of the Great Seal, means that the attachment to the illusory body by the stages of the Seal and the Samadhi is destroyed.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: The ultimate truth.

original: zhes pa ni mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pas thob par bya ba 'od gsal ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pas thob par bya ba 'od gsal ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Means that the clearlight transparency which is to be attained by the stage of the manifest enlightenment is the meaning of the word.🔽Existence and peace, means samsara and nirvana, eternalism and nihilism, etc.

original: srid pa dang zhi ba'i zhes pa ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dang / rtag pa dang chad pa la sogs pa lta ba gzhan rnams kyi gcig gi mtshan nyid can zhes pa ni gnyis su med pa nyid du snang ba /
analyzed: srid pa dang zhi ba'i zhes pa ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dang / rtag pa dang chad pa la sogs pa lta ba gzhan rnams kyi gcig gi mtshan nyid can zhes pa ni gnyis su med pa nyid du snang ba /
translated: The other views are the characteristic of one, means that the non-duality appears as the characteristic of one.

original: yid du 'ong ba'i zhes pa ni 'bras bur gyur pa nyid kyis mngon par 'dod pa rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings kyi ngo bo rdo rje 'chang chen po'i phyag rgya chen po'i sku bskyed par gyur pa'o zhes
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba'i zhes pa ni 'bras bur gyur pa nyid kyis mngon par 'dod pa rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings kyi ngo bo rdo rje 'chang chen po'i phyag rgya chen po'i sku bskyed par gyur pa'o zhes
translated: The pleasing is the great Vajradhara, who is the desired result, the nature of the realm of non-abiding nirvana, the great seal of great Vajradhara, the body that is generated.

original: pa 'dis zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa'i mdor bstan to //
analyzed: pa 'dis zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa'i mdor bstan to //
translated: This is the summary of the stage of union.

original: dngos grub ni bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i mtshan nyid can phyag rgya chen po'o zhes pa la 'od gsal ba las cig car du byung ba sgyu ma'i dpes nye bar mtshon pa rdo rje 'chang la sogs pa'i sku zhes bya ba'i don te //
analyzed: dngos grub ni bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i mtshan nyid can phyag rgya chen po'o zhes pa la 'od gsal ba las cig car du byung ba sgyu ma'i dpes nye bar mtshon pa rdo rje 'chang la sogs pa'i sku zhes bya ba'i don te //
translated: The power is the great seal, which has the characteristic of the consecration of oneself. The meaning is that the body of Vajradhara, etc., is the sudden arising from clear light, illustrated by the example of the illusion.

original: des ni bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa mdor bstan to //
analyzed: des ni bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa mdor bstan to //
translated: This is the summary of the stage of consecration of oneself.

original: phul du byung ba zhes pa ni rang bzhin dang snang ba'i dri ma bral bar byed pas mchog go //
analyzed: phul du byung ba zhes pa ni rang bzhin dang snang ba'i dri ma bral bar byed pas mchog go //
translated: The excellent is the supreme, because it removes the stains of the natural and the apparent.

original: sems rnam par dben pa'i mtshan nyid can zhes pa ni rnam par shes pa gsum gyi rang bzhin gyi sems sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas rnam par sbyong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems rnam par dben pa'i mtshan nyid can zhes pa ni rnam par shes pa gsum gyi rang bzhin gyi sems sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas rnam par sbyong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The mind is characterized by complete isolation means that the mind, which has the nature of the three consciousnesses, is purified by the stages of mantra and seal.

original: rdo rje bzlas pa las lcag pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni ngag dben pa las sems rnam par dben pa ni bsgom par dka' ba'o zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa las lcag pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni ngag dben pa las sems rnam par dben pa ni bsgom par dka' ba'o zhes bya bas so //
translated: Because it is the whip of vajra repetition means that the mind of complete isolation is difficult to cultivate from the isolation of speech.

original: de ni sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa mdor bstan to //
analyzed: de ni sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa mdor bstan to //
translated: That is the brief explanation of the stage of the pure mind.

original: rnal 'byor pa'i rgyud las zhes pa ni sgrub pa po'i sems la'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa'i rgyud las zhes pa ni sgrub pa po'i sems la'o //
translated: In the yogatantras means in the mind of the practitioner.

original: 'og nas bshad pa'i gnas skabs bzhi po zhes pa ni sems rnam par dag pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'og nas bshad pa'i gnas skabs bzhi po zhes pa ni sems rnam par dag pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The four states that will be explained below are the pure mind and so forth.

original: bskyed par bya ste bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' zhes tshig lhag ma'o //
analyzed: bskyed par bya ste bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' zhes tshig lhag ma'o //
translated: It should be generated, the Bhagavān Vajrasattva, the remainder of the sentence.

original: 'di skad bshad pa yin te rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa bsgoms nas de'i 'og tu sems la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i phyir @242a * //
analyzed: 'di skad bshad pa yin te rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa bsgoms nas de'i 'og tu sems la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i phyir @242a * //
translated: This is what is being said: having cultivated the stage of vajra repetition, then, in order to purify the mind and so on,

original: sems la dmigs pa la sogs pa rim pa bzhi bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems la dmigs pa la sogs pa rim pa bzhi bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: one should cultivate the four stages beginning with the observation of mind.

original: 'di dag gis ni zhes pa ni rim pa bzhi bsgom pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: 'di dag gis ni zhes pa ni rim pa bzhi bsgom pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: By these means by cultivating the four stages.

original: rdo rje bzlas pa zhes pa ni rim pa dang po'i phan yon gsungs pa ni bstod pa bstan to //
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa zhes pa ni rim pa dang po'i phan yon gsungs pa ni bstod pa bstan to //
translated: Vajra repetition is the first stage. The praise is taught as the benefit of the first stage.

original: gang gi phyir rdo rje bzlas pa slob pa'i rnal 'byor pas rim pa bzhir thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rdo rje bzlas pa slob pa'i rnal 'byor pas rim pa bzhir thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the vajra repetition is attained by the yogi who is training in the four stages,

original: de bas na rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i yan lag gtso bo de nyid yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i yan lag gtso bo de nyid yin no //
translated: therefore it is the principal limb of the stage of completion.

original: sngags dang sems dang de nas lus //
analyzed: sngags dang sems dang de nas lus //
translated: Mantras, mind, and then the body,

original: rnam par dag dang zung 'jug ste //
analyzed: rnam par dag dang zung 'jug ste //
translated: purification, and union,

original: rim pa lnga yis bsdus pa'i don //
analyzed: rim pa lnga yis bsdus pa'i don //
translated: the meaning included in the five stages,

original: shes pas mtha' drug la ni 'jug / ces 'byung ngo //
analyzed: shes pas mtha' drug la ni 'jug / ces 'byung ngo //
translated: by knowing it one enters the six limits.

original: mdor bstan pa'i tshig bzhi zhes pa ni rim pa bzhi ston par byed pa'i tshig rnams so //
analyzed: mdor bstan pa'i tshig bzhi zhes pa ni rim pa bzhi ston par byed pa'i tshig rnams so //
translated: The four words of the brief indication are the words that teach the four stages.

original: bshad par bstan pa'i phyir zhes pa ni rgyas par bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad par bstan pa'i phyir zhes pa ni rgyas par bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to explain, means in order to explain in detail.

original: rim pa gnyis pas ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa'o zhes pa ni sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas rang bzhin dang ye shes kyi tshogs spangs nas thams cad stong pa mngon du byas pa'o //
analyzed: rim pa gnyis pas ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa'o zhes pa ni sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas rang bzhin dang ye shes kyi tshogs spangs nas thams cad stong pa mngon du byas pa'o //
translated: Just as in the second stage, means just as in the stage of the seal, having abandoned the accumulations of the natural and the wisdom [bodies], one should realize the emptiness of everything.

original: de nyid sems ni bdag med pa ste sems gnas 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid sems ni bdag med pa ste sems gnas 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: That very mind is selfless, because the mind is transformed.

original: ngag dang lus dag kyang zhes pa ni rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ngag dang ye shes kyi sku'i mtshan nyid kyi lus gang yin pa de dag kyang sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pas bdag med pa nyid du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: ngag dang lus dag kyang zhes pa ni rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ngag dang ye shes kyi sku'i mtshan nyid kyi lus gang yin pa de dag kyang sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pas bdag med pa nyid du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Also the speech and the body, means that the speech which has the characteristic of the stage of vajra repetition and the body which has the characteristic of the wisdom body, those two also should be cultivated as selfless by the stage of the purification of the mind.

original: gang gi phyir lus dang ngag dag gi rgyu ni sems yin no zhes spangs pas 'bras bur gyur pa'i lus dang ngag kyang spong bar 'gyur ro zhes rgyu mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir lus dang ngag dag gi rgyu ni sems yin no zhes spangs pas 'bras bur gyur pa'i lus dang ngag kyang spong bar 'gyur ro zhes rgyu mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: Since the cause of body and speech is mind, by abandoning that, body and speech which are the results are also abandoned.

original: sems so sor rtog par bsgrub par bya'o zhes pa ni ye shes gsum gyi rang bzhin can gyi sems ni 'od gsal ba'i ngo bor bya'o //
analyzed: sems so sor rtog par bsgrub par bya'o zhes pa ni ye shes gsum gyi rang bzhin can gyi sems ni 'od gsal ba'i ngo bor bya'o //
translated: The mind should be established in discernment. The mind which has the nature of the three intuitions should be made into the essence of clear light.

original: 'dis ni zhes pa ni 'das ma thag tu bshad pa'i sgom pa'i rim pas so //
analyzed: 'dis ni zhes pa ni 'das ma thag tu bshad pa'i sgom pa'i rim pas so //
translated: By this, by the process of meditation just explained,

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi mtshan nyid ces pa ni lus la sogs pa rnam par dag par byed pa las nus pa can no //
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi mtshan nyid ces pa ni lus la sogs pa rnam par dag par byed pa las nus pa can no //
translated: the characteristic of body, speech, and mind, which is capable of purifying the body, etc.,

original: shes rab dang thabs dang nye bar thob pa gsum zhes pa ni shes rab kyi rang bzhin sum cu rtsa gsum dang / de'i rgyur gyur pa 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang thabs kyi rang bzhin bzhi bcu dang / de'i rgyur gyur pa'i nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang /
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs dang nye bar thob pa gsum zhes pa ni shes rab kyi rang bzhin sum cu rtsa gsum dang / de'i rgyur gyur pa 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang thabs kyi rang bzhin bzhi bcu dang / de'i rgyur gyur pa'i nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang /
translated: The three, wisdom, means, and proximate, are the thirty-three natures of wisdom, and the cause of that is the engaging consciousness, and the forty natures of means, and the cause of that is the afflicted consciousness.

original: ma rig pa'i rang bzhin bdun dang / de'i rgyur gyur pa kun gzhi rnam @242b par shes pa nye bar sdud par byed pa ston par gyur pa yin no zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba bstan to //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rang bzhin bdun dang / de'i rgyur gyur pa kun gzhi rnam @242b par shes pa nye bar sdud par byed pa ston par gyur pa yin no zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba bstan to //
translated: The seven natures of ignorance, and the cause of that is the foundation consciousness. Thus, the one who is the teacher of the proximate is taught to be clear light.

original: de ni sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa rgyas par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de ni sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa rgyas par bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the extensive explanation of the stage of mind purification.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas rim pa gsum pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas rim pa gsum pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, the third stage should be explained, beginning with “thereupon.”

original: don dam pa'i bden pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'od gsal ba las cig car du spro bar bstan to //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'od gsal ba las cig car du spro bar bstan to //
translated: The ultimate truth, etc., teaches the simultaneous emanation from clear light.

original: bskyed par bya'o zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba las spro bar bya'o //
analyzed: bskyed par bya'o zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba las spro bar bya'o //
translated: “One should generate” means one should emanate from clear light.

original: sbyor ba gsum po gcig tu gyur pa de ni zhes pa ni go bzlog pas snang ba nye bar thob pa dang snang ba mched pa dang snang ba rnams yongs su gyur pa las byung ba'i rdo rje 'chang la sogs pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba gsum po gcig tu gyur pa de ni zhes pa ni go bzlog pas snang ba nye bar thob pa dang snang ba mched pa dang snang ba rnams yongs su gyur pa las byung ba'i rdo rje 'chang la sogs pa'i sku'o //
translated: “That which is the unity of the three processes” means that which arises from the reversal of the three processes of appearance, increase, and attainment, and from the transformation of the appearances of the three processes.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to teach just that,

original: yid kyi rang bzhin gyi lha'i gzugs zhes bstan to //
analyzed: yid kyi rang bzhin gyi lha'i gzugs zhes bstan to //
translated: it is taught as the form of the deity that is the nature of mind.

original: des ni bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa rgyas par bshad pa bstan to //
analyzed: des ni bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa rgyas par bshad pa bstan to //
translated: That explains the extensive explanation of the stage of self-consecration.

original: lus zhes bya ba la sogs pas rim pa bzhi pa bstan par bya ste //
analyzed: lus zhes bya ba la sogs pas rim pa bzhi pa bstan par bya ste //
translated: The fourth stage is taught by “body” and so on.

original: lus dang ngag dang sems kyi dmigs pa nye bar rtogs pa zhes pa ni //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang sems kyi dmigs pa nye bar rtogs pa zhes pa ni //
translated: “The realization of the object of body, speech, and mind”

original: lus la sogs pa'i sgyu ma lta bu yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa'i sgyu ma lta bu yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: means the full knowledge of the body and so on as being like an illusion.

original: gang thob pa'i kun rdzob kyi bden pa ngo bo nyid de zhes pa ni 'ja' tshon ltar so sor snang ba rdo rje 'chang la sogs pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: gang thob pa'i kun rdzob kyi bden pa ngo bo nyid de zhes pa ni 'ja' tshon ltar so sor snang ba rdo rje 'chang la sogs pa'i sku'o //
translated: That reality of the conventional truth which is attained is the nature of Vajradhara and so on, the bodies which appear individually like a rainbow.

original: de ni dmigs su med pa ste //
analyzed: de ni dmigs su med pa ste //
translated: That is not an object of apprehension

original: zhes pa ni sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas 'od gsal ba la thim pas so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas 'od gsal ba la thim pas so //
translated: because it dissolves into clearlight by the process of mantra and seal.

original: gtan tshigs bstan par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: gtan tshigs bstan par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to demonstrate the reason,

original: thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te //
translated: he says, “all” and so on.

original: thams cad ni sgyu ma lta bu nyid kyis mtshan pa rdo rje 'chang la sogs pa'i ye shes kyi sku'o //
analyzed: thams cad ni sgyu ma lta bu nyid kyis mtshan pa rdo rje 'chang la sogs pa'i ye shes kyi sku'o //
translated: All is the gnosis body of Vajradhara and so on, which is characterized by the illusion-like nature.🔽Because of the realization of the ultimate truth,

original: don dam pa'i bden pa nyid rtogs pas so zhes pa ni yang dag pa'i mtha' la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa nyid rtogs pas so zhes pa ni yang dag pa'i mtha' la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the entry into the perfect limit.🔽This clarifies the stage of manifest enlightenment.

original: 'dis ni mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa gsal bar byed do zhes pa ni mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa rgyas par bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dis ni mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa gsal bar byed do zhes pa ni mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa rgyas par bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the stage of manifest enlightenment is taught extensively.

original: da ni brtags pa'i rnal 'byor gyis thar pa thob par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir 'dir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: da ni brtags pa'i rnal 'byor gyis thar pa thob par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir 'dir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Now, in order to teach that liberation is not attained by the yoga of examination, he says here, etc.

original: 'dir ni rim pa bzhi bsgom par byas nas yang ngo //
analyzed: 'dir ni rim pa bzhi bsgom par byas nas yang ngo //
translated: Here, having cultivated the four stages, again,

original: ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi sku la zhes pa ni bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pas thob par bya ba la'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi sku la zhes pa ni bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pas thob par bya ba la'o //
translated: in the body of the nature of pristine awareness, i.e., that which is to be attained by the stage of self-consecration,🔽one should abide in the yoga of realization,

original: rab tu gnas pa mi dmigs kyang //
analyzed: rab tu gnas pa mi dmigs kyang //
translated: but even though one does not perceive the abiding,

original: zhes pa ni dbang po dman pas gnas par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ni dbang po dman pas gnas par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: i.e., the weak faculty does not abide,

original: kyang gi sgras 'od gsal ba la yang ngo//
analyzed: kyang gi sgras 'od gsal ba la yang ngo//
translated: and also the clear light,

original: @243a * // gal te ni dam tshig nyams pa la sogs pa'i skyon gyi dbang gis so //
analyzed: @243a * // gal te ni dam tshig nyams pa la sogs pa'i skyon gyi dbang gis so //
translated: if, due to the power of faults such as the deterioration of the commitments,

original: rtogs pa'i rnal 'byor gyis zhes pa ni rdo rje bzhi po bsgoms pas so //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i rnal 'byor gyis zhes pa ni rdo rje bzhi po bsgoms pas so //
translated: the yoga of realization, i.e., the cultivation of the four vajras,

original: lha'i skur gnas pa dmigs par zhes pa ni sngags kyi sku la gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha'i skur gnas pa dmigs par zhes pa ni sngags kyi sku la gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: and the perception of abiding in the body of the deity, i.e., abiding in the body of mantra,🔽is reversed, i.e., abandoned,

original: de bzlog pa'i phyir zhes pa ni spong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzlog pa'i phyir zhes pa ni spong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: then,

original: aom la sogs pa ni sbas nas brjod pas so //
analyzed: aom la sogs pa ni sbas nas brjod pas so //
translated: The om and so forth are hidden, because they are spoken.

original: des lus su byas la zhes pa ni yongs su gyur pa las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: des lus su byas la zhes pa ni yongs su gyur pa las skyes pa'o //
translated: By that, having made the body means that it is born from the transformation.

original: rdo rje bzhi po zhes pa ni //
analyzed: rdo rje bzhi po zhes pa ni //
translated: The four vajras

original: dang po byang chub stong pa nyid //
analyzed: dang po byang chub stong pa nyid //
translated: The first is the emptiness of enlightenment.🔽The second is the gathering of the seed,🔽The third is the generation of the body,

original: gnyis pa sa bon bsdus pa dang // gsum pa sku ni bskyed pa dang // bzhi pa yi ge dgod pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa sa bon bsdus pa dang // gsum pa sku ni bskyed pa dang // bzhi pa yi ge dgod pa'o //
translated: And the fourth is the placement of the syllable.

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: It is said.

original: rdo rje ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku rnams skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku rnams skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: The vajra is that which generates the bodies of the Tathagatas.

original: bzhi po ni bsgom pa bzhi zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bzhi po ni bsgom pa bzhi zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The four are the four meditations. This is the meaning of the words.

original: des ni rdo rje bzhi pos so //
analyzed: des ni rdo rje bzhi pos so //
translated: By that, by the four vajras.

original: sangs rgyas pa nyid ces pa ni rdo rje 'chang gi phyag rgya chen po thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa nyid ces pa ni rdo rje 'chang gi phyag rgya chen po thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Buddhahood means that one will not attain the great seal of Vajradhara.

original: gang gi phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngags las 'byung ba'i sku bden pa ma yin no zhes bstan to//
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngags las 'byung ba'i sku bden pa ma yin no zhes bstan to//
translated: Why is that? and so forth explains that the body that arises from mantra is not true.

original: sngags kyi yi ge zhes pa ni sngags kyang yin la yi ge yang yin pas na sngags kyi yi ge'o //
analyzed: sngags kyi yi ge zhes pa ni sngags kyang yin la yi ge yang yin pas na sngags kyi yi ge'o //
translated: The term “mantra syllable” is a mantra and also a syllable, thus it is a mantra syllable.

original: sba bar bya bas na sngags so //
analyzed: sba bar bya bas na sngags so //
translated: It is a mantra because it is to be guarded.

original: gnas dang byed pa dang 'bad pa'i rjes su stobs kyis 'byung bas na yi ge'o //
analyzed: gnas dang byed pa dang 'bad pa'i rjes su stobs kyis 'byung bas na yi ge'o //
translated: It is a syllable because it arises by the power of the place, the agent, and the effort.

original: de srid tshogs pa las skyes pa yin te zhes pa ni 'dod pa dang gnas dang dbye ba la sogs pa'i 'brel pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de srid tshogs pa las skyes pa yin te zhes pa ni 'dod pa dang gnas dang dbye ba la sogs pa'i 'brel pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It arises from the assembly of those, that is, because it arises from the connection of the desire, the place, the division, and so on.🔽It is destroyed upon arising, that is, at the time of the utterance of oṃ, ā is not observed,

original: skyes nas 'jig par 'gyur bas zhes pa ni aom brjod pa'i dus su a'a mi dmigs par 'gyur ba dang / de dag brjod pa'i dus su yang h'um mi dmigs so //
analyzed: skyes nas 'jig par 'gyur bas zhes pa ni aom brjod pa'i dus su a'a mi dmigs par 'gyur ba dang / de dag brjod pa'i dus su yang h'um mi dmigs so //
translated: and at the time of the utterance of those, hūṃ is not observed.

original: de bzhin du aom brjod pa'i dus su 'jug pa'i dbyangs mi dmigs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du aom brjod pa'i dus su 'jug pa'i dbyangs mi dmigs so //
translated: Similarly, at the time of the utterance of oṃ, the entering vowel is not observed.

original: de bzhin du thams cad la sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad la sbyar ro //
translated: Apply that to all.

original: nam mkha' dang mnyam na zhes pa ni stong pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang mnyam na zhes pa ni stong pa'o //
translated: It is equal to space, that is, empty.

original: de bas na stong pa'i rang bzhin gyi sngags las sngags kyi sku ni lha'i sku gang las skyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na stong pa'i rang bzhin gyi sngags las sngags kyi sku ni lha'i sku gang las skyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, how could the mantra body, which is the nature of emptiness, be generated from the mantra?

original: gang gi phyir nam mkha'i me tog gi nam mkha' rgyur gyur pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir nam mkha'i me tog gi nam mkha' rgyur gyur pa ma yin te /
translated: Because the sky flower is not the cause of the sky,

original: gnyi ga yang brdzun pas so //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang brdzun pas so //
translated: since both are false.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that,

original: bsgom par bya ba'i lha'i sku med pas zhes pa ni las mi dmigs pas gzugs la sogs pa'i bsgom pa'i bya ba yang med do //
analyzed: bsgom par bya ba'i lha'i sku med pas zhes pa ni las mi dmigs pas gzugs la sogs pa'i bsgom pa'i bya ba yang med do //
translated: since the body of the deity to be cultivated does not exist, the activity of cultivating form, etc. also does not exist, due to the non-apprehension of action.

original: de bas na bsgom par bya ba dang / sgom pa dag med pas gang la dmigs te sgom pa pos byang chub kyi mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu thob par @243b 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na bsgom par bya ba dang / sgom pa dag med pas gang la dmigs te sgom pa pos byang chub kyi mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu thob par @243b 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since there is neither that which is to be cultivated nor cultivation, what is the object of cultivation? By what meditator would the result characterized by enlightenment be attained?

original: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas nye bar bsdus pa bstan te /
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas nye bar bsdus pa bstan te /
translated: Thus, beginning with “Therefore,” the summary is taught.

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa'i chos ni chos kyi sku ste /
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa'i chos ni chos kyi sku ste /
translated: The Dharma of the creation stage is the Dharma body.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa 'ba' zhig gtso bo yin pas chad pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir gzhan gyi don ji ltar nus te spang bya'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa 'ba' zhig gtso bo yin pas chad pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir gzhan gyi don ji ltar nus te spang bya'o //
translated: Since only the ultimate truth is primary, how can it be able to benefit others, since it is by nature a void?

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku yang stong pa'i rang bzhin gyi sngags las 'byung bas ma skyes pa nyid do //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku yang stong pa'i rang bzhin gyi sngags las 'byung bas ma skyes pa nyid do //
translated: The Enjoyment Body also is not born, since it arises from the mantra of the nature of void.

original: de brdzun yin na sprul pa'i sku yang med do //
analyzed: de brdzun yin na sprul pa'i sku yang med do //
translated: If that is false, then the Emanation Body also does not exist.

original: zhes bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bstan to //
translated: Thus it is taught.

original: blang bar gyur pa'i zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa'i ting nge 'dzin bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: blang bar gyur pa'i zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa'i ting nge 'dzin bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the meditative concentration of the stage of union which is to be taken up,

original: zhi ba dang skye ba mi gnas pa'i zhes smos te /
analyzed: zhi ba dang skye ba mi gnas pa'i zhes smos te /
translated: he says, “the peace which is not a dwelling, and the birth which is not a dwelling.

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag la mi gnas pa ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag la mi gnas pa ste /
translated: ” It is not a dwelling in cyclic existence and nirvana.🔽As it is said,

original: shes rab kyis ni srid mi gnas //
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni srid mi gnas //
translated: “By wisdom one does not dwell in existence,

original: snying rjes zhi ba la gnas min //
analyzed: snying rjes zhi ba la gnas min //
translated: by compassion one does not dwell in peace.

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: So it is said.🔽🔽

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang zhes pa ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i go 'phang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang zhes pa ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i go 'phang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The state of Great Vajradhara means the state of glorious Vajrasattva.

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi mtshan nyid ces pa ni sku ni bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa'i sgyu ma lta bu dang / gsung ni rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa sbyong ba dang / thugs ni rim pa gnyis pas 'od gsal ba rtogs pa dang /
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi mtshan nyid ces pa ni sku ni bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa'i sgyu ma lta bu dang / gsung ni rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa sbyong ba dang / thugs ni rim pa gnyis pas 'od gsal ba rtogs pa dang /
translated: The characteristics of body, speech, and mind are as follows: the body is the illusory body of the stage of self-consecration; speech is the purification of the stage of vajra repetition; and mind is the realization of clear light by the two stages.

original: mtshan nyid ni ye shes kyi sku yang mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pas 'od gsal bar bya ba dpyad pas so //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ni ye shes kyi sku yang mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pas 'od gsal bar bya ba dpyad pas so //
translated: The characteristic is the analysis of the clear light by the stage of manifest enlightenment of the body of pristine awareness.

original: sngags la dmigs pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de nyid kyis bshad pa'o //
analyzed: sngags la dmigs pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de nyid kyis bshad pa'o //
translated: The stage of the mantra-object, etc., is explained by that very [verse].

original: stong pa nyid gsum zhes pa ni sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pas thob par bya ba stong pa gsum gyi rgyu can 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid gsum zhes pa ni sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pas thob par bya ba stong pa gsum gyi rgyu can 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: The three voidnesses are the clear light which has the three voidnesses obtained by the stage of the mind-purification.

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa nyid kyis shes pa ni ye shes kyi sku bzung bas so //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa nyid kyis shes pa ni ye shes kyi sku bzung bas so //
translated: The knowledge of the very relative truth is the apprehension of the body of pristine awareness.

original: gcig tu byas pas zhes pa ni de dag gnyis su med par byas pa rim pa lnga pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gcig tu byas pas zhes pa ni de dag gnyis su med par byas pa rim pa lnga pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The phrase having made them one means that they are made non-dual. This is called the five stages.

original: de nyid kyi khyad par bstan par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de nyid kyi khyad par bstan par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to teach the distinction of that,

original: 'od zer lnga ni de bzhin gshegs pa sngags kyi sku las byung ngo //
analyzed: 'od zer lnga ni de bzhin gshegs pa sngags kyi sku las byung ngo //
translated: the five lights arise from the mantra body of the Tathagata.

original: de rnams bskyed par zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rang bzhin gyi 'od zer lngas rnam par spras pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de rnams bskyed par zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rang bzhin gyi 'od zer lngas rnam par spras pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase having generated them means that they are adorned with the five lights that are the nature of the five Tathagatas. This is the meaning of the phrase adorned with the five lights.

original: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin to zhes pa ni kun du 'od kyi sa la de rtogs pas so //
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin to zhes pa ni kun du 'od kyi sa la de rtogs pas so //
translated: The vajra-like samadhi is so called because it is realized on the stage of the Completely Radiant.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa zhes pa ni rim pa gnyis pa dang bzhi pa las bstan pa 'od gsal ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa zhes pa ni rim pa gnyis pa dang bzhi pa las bstan pa 'od gsal ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The phrase ultimate truth refers to what is taught in the second and fourth stages, called clear light.

original: de dang sbyar ba zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba dang 'brel pa ste de las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: de dang sbyar ba zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba dang 'brel pa ste de las skyes pa'o //
translated: The phrase in union with that means that it is connected with the clear light, and it is born from that.

original: bslab par bya ba zhes pa ni goms par bya'o //
analyzed: bslab par bya ba zhes pa ni goms par bya'o //
translated: The phrase should be trained in means that it should be cultivated.

original: 'dis ni @244a * //
analyzed: 'dis ni @244a * //
translated: This is the meaning of the phrase having trained in the vajra-like samadhi.

original: sngar bshad pa'i sgom pa'i rim pas so //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i sgom pa'i rim pas so //
translated: The phrase by the previously explained stages of meditation means by the stages of meditation that were previously explained.

original: zung du sbyor ba'i rim pa ston pa yin te zhes pa ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa rgyas par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zung du sbyor ba'i rim pa ston pa yin te zhes pa ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa rgyas par bshad pa yin no //
translated: The stage of union is taught, which is the extensive explanation of the stage of union.

original: dgongs pas bshad pa'o zhes pa ni 'gal ba'i tshig gi sbyar bas rim pa lnga'i de kho na nyid kyi don bstan pas so //
analyzed: dgongs pas bshad pa'o zhes pa ni 'gal ba'i tshig gi sbyar bas rim pa lnga'i de kho na nyid kyi don bstan pas so //
translated: The intentional explanation is by the application of contradictory words, which teaches the meaning of the reality of the five stages.

original: da ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas rim pa gnyis kyi rnal 'byor pa rnams la rnam pa gsum gyi phra mo'i rnal 'byor gyi sgom pa le'u gsum pa nas bshad pa yang bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas rim pa gnyis kyi rnal 'byor pa rnams la rnam pa gsum gyi phra mo'i rnal 'byor gyi sgom pa le'u gsum pa nas bshad pa yang bstan par bya ste /
translated: Now, beginning with now, the meditation of the three types of subtle yoga for the yogis of the two stages, which is explained in chapter three, will be taught,

original: mdor bstan pa ni rgyas par bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdor bstan pa ni rgyas par bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the brief explanation is for the sake of the extensive explanation.

original: de la 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi rigs can la rdzogs pa'i rim pa la brten nas rnam pa gsum gyis phra mo'i rnal 'byor dang / de'i phyogs gcig pa yang brtags pa'i rnal 'byor pa la gcig ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi rigs can la rdzogs pa'i rim pa la brten nas rnam pa gsum gyis phra mo'i rnal 'byor dang / de'i phyogs gcig pa yang brtags pa'i rnal 'byor pa la gcig ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: There, for those of the types of desire, hatred, and ignorance, the three types of subtle yoga based on the completion stage, and for those of the partial types, the single yoga, is the meaning of one.

original: rnam par shes pa rlung dang bcas pa zhes pa ni rlung dang rnam par shes pa dag ni rta dang rta ba'i rigs pa'i tshul du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rlung dang bcas pa zhes pa ni rlung dang rnam par shes pa dag ni rta dang rta ba'i rigs pa'i tshul du 'jug pa'o //
translated: Consciousness together with wind means that wind and consciousness enter in the manner of horse and rider.

original: de dag gis 'dres par gyur pa las 'byung ba thig le gang yin pa de ni rlung dang rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gis 'dres par gyur pa las 'byung ba thig le gang yin pa de ni rlung dang rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: From their mixture, the bindu arises, which is together with wind and consciousness.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa bstan pa'i 'og tu 'o zhes pa ni rim pa lnga'i mtshan nyid kyi rdzogs pa'i rim pa bstan pa'i 'og tu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa bstan pa'i 'og tu 'o zhes pa ni rim pa lnga'i mtshan nyid kyi rdzogs pa'i rim pa bstan pa'i 'og tu zhes bya'o //
translated: After the completion stage is taught means after the completion stage, which is the characteristic of the five stages, is taught.

original: tshogs gnyis zhes pa ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs gnyis so //
analyzed: tshogs gnyis zhes pa ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs gnyis so //
translated: The two accumulations are the two accumulations of merit and wisdom.

original: de la sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa lnga ni bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: de la sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa lnga ni bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
translated: Among them, the five perfections of generosity and so on are the accumulation of merit.🔽The perfection of wisdom of emptiness is the accumulation of wisdom.

original: stong pa nyid kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni ye shes kyi tshogs te de dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni ye shes kyi tshogs te de dang ldan pa'o //
translated: He is endowed with those.

original: rdo rje 'chang bar mdzad pa ste //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang bar mdzad pa ste //
translated: He is Vajradhara.

original: zhes pa ni rtse lnga pa'i phyag mtshan 'chang bas so ;
analyzed: zhes pa ni rtse lnga pa'i phyag mtshan 'chang bas so ;
translated: This is because he holds the hand-symbol of the five-crested.

original: / yi ge'i don to zhes pa ni phyag mtshan tsam bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / yi ge'i don to zhes pa ni phyag mtshan tsam bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The literal meaning is because he is taught as having only the hand-symbols.

original: me long lta bu la sogs pa ye shes lnga po zhes pa ni mthong ba dang sgom pa'i rim pas thob pa'i ye shes lnga 'chang bas so //
analyzed: me long lta bu la sogs pa ye shes lnga po zhes pa ni mthong ba dang sgom pa'i rim pas thob pa'i ye shes lnga 'chang bas so //
translated: The five intuitions such as the mirror intuition, etc., are because he holds the five intuitions attained by the paths of seeing and meditation.

original: spyi'i don to zhes pa ni mdo sde pa la sogs pa'i 'gyod pa sel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi'i don to zhes pa ni mdo sde pa la sogs pa'i 'gyod pa sel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The general meaning is because he removes the doubts of the Sautrantikas, etc.

original: yid kyi rang bzhin gyi sku zhes pa ni bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pas thob par bya ba'i ye shes kyi sku'o //
analyzed: yid kyi rang bzhin gyi sku zhes pa ni bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pas thob par bya ba'i ye shes kyi sku'o //
translated: The body of intuitive wisdom is the body of intuitive wisdom to be attained by the process of self-consecration.

original: sbas pa'o zhes pa ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don bstan par dbye bas so //
analyzed: sbas pa'o zhes pa ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don bstan par dbye bas so //
translated: The hidden meaning is because it is divided into the teaching of the meaning characterized by the conventional truth.

original: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes te zhes pa ni rim pa bzhi pas thob par byed pa'i 'od @244b gsal ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes te zhes pa ni rim pa bzhi pas thob par byed pa'i 'od @244b gsal ba'o //
translated: The nondual intuition is the clearlight to be attained by the fourth process.

original: mthar thug pa'o zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba la zhugs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don bstan pas so //
analyzed: mthar thug pa'o zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba la zhugs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don bstan pas so //
translated: The ultimate is the meaning of the characteristic of entering into clear light.

original: spyan la sogs pa ste zhes pa la 'dir de bzhin gshegs pa'i sgra ni ma gtogs so //🔽de rnams kyi mchod pas na zhes pa ni /
analyzed: spyan la sogs pa ste zhes pa la 'dir de bzhin gshegs pa'i sgra ni ma gtogs so // de rnams kyi mchod pas na zhes pa ni /
translated: The eyes, etc., are the Tathagatas, except for the word Tathagata.

original: bde ba chen po'i mtshan nyid can gyi mchod pas mchod pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: bde ba chen po'i mtshan nyid can gyi mchod pas mchod pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Their worship is the worship with the characteristic of great bliss.

original: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa ste zhes pa ni ye shes lnga rtogs pas so //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa ste zhes pa ni ye shes lnga rtogs pas so //
translated: Vairochana, etc., are the five intuitions.

original: mchog tu gyur pa zhes pa ni de rnams nye bar sdud par mdzad pas so //🔽thugs rdo rje zhes pa ni /
analyzed: mchog tu gyur pa zhes pa ni de rnams nye bar sdud par mdzad pas so // thugs rdo rje zhes pa ni /
translated: The supreme is the one who gathers them all together.🔽The mind-vajra is the one who knows the nature of the mind, the three worlds.

original: sems kyi rang bzhin khams gsum pa yongs su shes pas so bka' stsal cing zhes pa ni 'das pa'i dus su de ltar byung ba'i rkyen no //
analyzed: sems kyi rang bzhin khams gsum pa yongs su shes pas so bka' stsal cing zhes pa ni 'das pa'i dus su de ltar byung ba'i rkyen no //
translated: The statement is the condition of the past.

original: 'od gsal ba la gnas pa'o zhes pa ni sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pas thob par bya ba thams cad stong pa'i gnas la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba la gnas pa'o zhes pa ni sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pas thob par bya ba thams cad stong pa'i gnas la gnas pa'o //
translated: Abiding in the clear light is the abiding in the state of emptiness of all that is to be attained by means of the process of the purification of the mind.

original: snang ba'i tshogs so zhes pa ni zla ba dang nyi ma dang mtshams kyi snang ba dang 'dra ba'i 'od zer gyi 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: snang ba'i tshogs so zhes pa ni zla ba dang nyi ma dang mtshams kyi snang ba dang 'dra ba'i 'od zer gyi 'khor lo'o //
translated: The mass of light is the circle of light rays resembling the light of the moon, sun, and twilight.

original: dang por longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku bskyed pa'o zhes pa ni snang ba gsum yongs su gyur pa las snang ba nye bar thob pa la sogs pa'i rim pas ye shes kyi sku bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: dang por longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku bskyed pa'o zhes pa ni snang ba gsum yongs su gyur pa las snang ba nye bar thob pa la sogs pa'i rim pas ye shes kyi sku bsam par bya'o //
translated: First, the generation of the Body of Perfect Resource is the Body of Intuitive Wisdom which is to be imagined by means of the process of the attainment of light, etc. , from the transformation of the three lights.

original: phyi nas sems can la sogs pa rjes su zhugs pas zhes pa ni lus mchog tu dga' ba'i chags pa'i sgras khams gsum gyi nang na gnas pa rdzogs pa dang ma rdzogs pa'i sems can dang de bzhin gshegs pa rjes su zhugs pas so //
analyzed: phyi nas sems can la sogs pa rjes su zhugs pas zhes pa ni lus mchog tu dga' ba'i chags pa'i sgras khams gsum gyi nang na gnas pa rdzogs pa dang ma rdzogs pa'i sems can dang de bzhin gshegs pa rjes su zhugs pas so //
translated: Afterwards, the entry of the sentient beings, etc. , is the entry of the sentient beings of the three realms, both perfect and imperfect, and of the Tathagatas, by means of the sound of the supreme joy-attachment of the Body.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi phra rab las bsgrubs pa'i zhes pa ni ma lus pa lus pa med cing rigs lnga'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi cha shas rnams kyis rdzogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi phra rab las bsgrubs pa'i zhes pa ni ma lus pa lus pa med cing rigs lnga'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi cha shas rnams kyis rdzogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase accomplished from the subtle parts of all the Tathagatas means that it is complete with the parts of all the Tathagatas of the five families, without exception and without remainder.

original: sprul pa'i skur zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba las byung ba'i sku ni sprul pa'i sku ste /
analyzed: sprul pa'i skur zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba las byung ba'i sku ni sprul pa'i sku ste /
translated: The phrase the emanation body means that the body which arises from clear light is the emanation body.

original: de la cig car ram snang ba nye bar thob pa la sogs pa'i rim pas 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la cig car ram snang ba nye bar thob pa la sogs pa'i rim pas 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means that it arises either instantaneously or by the process of attaining the radiant light and so forth.

original: 'chad par gyur pa'i rim gyis zhes pa la 'og nas 'chad pa'i bsgom pa'i rim pas so //
analyzed: 'chad par gyur pa'i rim gyis zhes pa la 'og nas 'chad pa'i bsgom pa'i rim pas so //
translated: The phrase by the process of explanation means by the process of meditation which will be explained below.

original: phra mo'i rnal 'byor kun tu brtsam par bya'o zhes pa ni rnam pa gsum gyi sna'i rtse mor thig le'i rnal 'byor bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: phra mo'i rnal 'byor kun tu brtsam par bya'o zhes pa ni rnam pa gsum gyi sna'i rtse mor thig le'i rnal 'byor bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The phrase one should undertake the subtle yoga means that one should meditate on the yoga of the drop at the tip of the nose in three aspects.

original: rdo rje'i mdo zhes pa ni zab pa'i don dang ldan pa'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: rdo rje'i mdo zhes pa ni zab pa'i don dang ldan pa'i tshig gis so //
translated: The phrase the vajra summary means that it is endowed with words of profound meaning.

original: yi ge nyung dang the tshom med //
analyzed: yi ge nyung dang the tshom med //
translated: The phrase with few syllables and without doubt means that it is endowed with few syllables and is without doubt.

original: snying po can te don zab pa //
analyzed: snying po can te don zab pa //
translated: It is profound in meaning.

original: mdo ni @245a * //
analyzed: mdo ni @245a * //
translated: The sutra

original: mkhas pa rnams kyis bshad //
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams kyis bshad //
translated: is explained by the wise.

original: ces 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ces 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: mdo'i don bstan par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: mdo'i don bstan par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to teach the meaning of the sutra,

original: tha mal pa'i sems can rnams kyi skye ba zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi 'jig rten gyi ngo bo sems can gyi rigs rnam pa bzhi skye ba'o //
analyzed: tha mal pa'i sems can rnams kyi skye ba zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi 'jig rten gyi ngo bo sems can gyi rigs rnam pa bzhi skye ba'o //
translated: the birth of ordinary beings is the birth of the four types of sentient beings, the essence of the world of sentient beings.

original: brtags pa'i lhar dmigs pa zhes pa ni dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor gyi rim pas de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa la dmigs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: brtags pa'i lhar dmigs pa zhes pa ni dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor gyi rim pas de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa la dmigs par gyur pa'o //
translated: The observation of imagined deities is the observation of Tathagatas and so forth by the stage of the mandala of commitments.

original: rlung gi de kho na nyid dang zhes pa ni srog la sogs pa'i rlung gi tshogs sdud par byed pa'i bdag nyid can gyi de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: rlung gi de kho na nyid dang zhes pa ni srog la sogs pa'i rlung gi tshogs sdud par byed pa'i bdag nyid can gyi de kho na nyid do //
translated: The reality of the winds is the reality of the collection of life-sustaining and other winds, which has the nature of gathering.

original: sngags kyi de kho na nyid dang zhes pa ni sngags kyi dbye ba bdun cu rtsa gnyis bsdu bar byed pa'i yi ge gsum pa'i yang snying po zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sngags kyi de kho na nyid dang zhes pa ni sngags kyi dbye ba bdun cu rtsa gnyis bsdu bar byed pa'i yi ge gsum pa'i yang snying po zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reality of the mantras is the essence of the three syllables that gather the seventy-two divisions of mantras.

original: ye shes kyi de kho na nyid dang zhes pa ni snang ba la sogs pa don dam pa 'jug pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: ye shes kyi de kho na nyid dang zhes pa ni snang ba la sogs pa don dam pa 'jug pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: The reality of intuition is the nature of the engagement of the ultimate in appearances, etc.

original: lhag par mos pa'i rnal 'byor gyis so //
analyzed: lhag par mos pa'i rnal 'byor gyis so //
translated: By the yoga of resolute faith.

original: yongs su dag pa'i lha'i de kho na nyid nges pa ni 'dir bsgom par bya ba lha'i sku ni rnam pa gnyis te brtags pa dang yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa'i lha'i de kho na nyid nges pa ni 'dir bsgom par bya ba lha'i sku ni rnam pa gnyis te brtags pa dang yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: The ascertainment of the reality of the pure deity is the meditation here. The body of the deity to be meditated has two aspects: the imagined and the pure.

original: de la brtags pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pas so //
analyzed: de la brtags pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pas so //
translated: Of those, the imagined is by the creation stage.

original: yongs su dag pa ni bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pas so //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa ni bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pas so //
translated: The pure is by the stage of self-consecration.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sngags kyi sku dang ye shes kyi sku ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sngags kyi sku dang ye shes kyi sku ste /
translated: Therefore, it is the mantra body and the intuition body.

original: de'i ming gi rnam grangs so //
analyzed: de'i ming gi rnam grangs so //
translated: Those are synonyms for it.

original: ston to zhes pa ni de ltar phra mo'i rnal 'byor bsgoms na de bzhin gshegs pa drug gi rang bzhin tha mal pa'i sems can rnams skye ba la sogs pa de kho na nyid drug bsgom par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ston to zhes pa ni de ltar phra mo'i rnal 'byor bsgoms na de bzhin gshegs pa drug gi rang bzhin tha mal pa'i sems can rnams skye ba la sogs pa de kho na nyid drug bsgom par 'gyur ro //
translated: Taught means that if one meditates on the subtle yoga in that way, then the six realities of birth, etc. of ordinary beings, which have the nature of the six transcendent lords, will be meditated.

original: dang po zhes bya ba la sogs pas yan lag dang po bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: dang po zhes bya ba la sogs pas yan lag dang po bstan par bya ste /
translated: The first branch should be taught by “first” and so forth.

original: steng na gnas pa'i srog dang rtsol ba zhes bya ba ni gdong gi sna'i bu gnas rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: steng na gnas pa'i srog dang rtsol ba zhes bya ba ni gdong gi sna'i bu gnas rgyu ba'o //
translated: “The life and exertion abiding above” are the movement in the nostrils of the face.

original: dbang po gnyis po ni rdo rje dang padma dag 'brel ba las so //
analyzed: dbang po gnyis po ni rdo rje dang padma dag 'brel ba las so //
translated: “The two organs” are the vajra and lotus.

original: nang gi shes rab dang thabs snyoms par 'jug pa'i zhes pa ni shes rab dang thabs la rgyur gyur pa bud med dang skyes pa gnyis kyis nyams su myong ba snang ba'i ye shes phrad pas so //
analyzed: nang gi shes rab dang thabs snyoms par 'jug pa'i zhes pa ni shes rab dang thabs la rgyur gyur pa bud med dang skyes pa gnyis kyis nyams su myong ba snang ba'i ye shes phrad pas so //
translated: “The inner wisdom and means entering into union” is the appearance of the wisdom of appearance through the contact of the two, the female and male, who are the causes of wisdom and means.

original: dga' bas drangs pa zhes pa ni snang ba'i ye shes 'byung bas so //
analyzed: dga' bas drangs pa zhes pa ni snang ba'i ye shes 'byung bas so //
translated: “Drawn by joy” is the arising of the wisdom of appearance.
