original: yan lag ma lus pa las zhes pa ni bdun khri nyis stong gi rtsa'i khong stong las so //
analyzed: yan lag ma lus pa las zhes pa ni bdun khri nyis stong gi rtsa'i khong stong las so //
translated: “From all the branches” is from the hollow of the seventy-two thousand nāḍīs.

original: 'dod chags chen po'i mes zhes pa ni snang ba mched pa'i brda can gyi mchog tu dga' ba'i mes so //
analyzed: 'dod chags chen po'i mes zhes pa ni snang ba mched pa'i brda can gyi mchog tu dga' ba'i mes so //
translated: “The fire of great passion” is the fire of the supreme joy, which is the sign of the increase of appearance.

original: bzhus par gyur nas zhes pa ni yan lag thams cad kyi tshogs las byung zhing /
analyzed: bzhus par gyur nas zhes pa ni yan lag thams cad kyi tshogs las byung zhing /
translated: Having melted means having arisen from the collection of all the limbs.

original: rdo rje'i rtse 'am de'i dkyil du @245b phyin pas so //
analyzed: rdo rje'i rtse 'am de'i dkyil du @245b phyin pas so //
translated: Having gone to the tip of the vajra or its center means having gone to the center of the lotus.

original: byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le'i gzugs su zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le'i gzugs su zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The form of the drop of bodhicitta means the nature of clear light.

original: padma'i sna'i rtse mor lhung ba zhes pa ni snang ba nye bar thob pa'i dus su chos 'byung ba'i lte ba las phyung zhing spro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: padma'i sna'i rtse mor lhung ba zhes pa ni snang ba nye bar thob pa'i dus su chos 'byung ba'i lte ba las phyung zhing spro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Falling to the tip of the nose of the lotus means that at the time of the close-to-attainment appearance, it is emitted and emanated from the center of the source of phenomena.

original: 'dir ni zhes pa ni thig le tsam mo //
analyzed: 'dir ni zhes pa ni thig le tsam mo //
translated: Here means the mere drop.

original: srid pa skye ba'i rim pa ltar zhes pa ni khams gsum gyi nang na gnas pa'i sems can gyi tshogs bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa skye ba'i rim pa ltar zhes pa ni khams gsum gyi nang na gnas pa'i sems can gyi tshogs bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: Like the process of birth in existence means the process of generating the assembly of sentient beings abiding in the three realms.

original: bsgom pa rnams la zhes pa ni /
analyzed: bsgom pa rnams la zhes pa ni /
translated: For those who meditate means

original: de'i ngo bo bsam par byed pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo bsam par byed pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams la'o //
translated: for those yogis who contemplate its nature.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ngo bo rdo rje 'chang gis so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ngo bo rdo rje 'chang gis so //
translated: The tathāgatas means Vajradhara, the nature of all tathāgatas.

original: yungs kar gyi sgras mtshon par mdzad ces pa ni /
analyzed: yungs kar gyi sgras mtshon par mdzad ces pa ni /
translated: The word mustard seed is used as a metaphor.

original: shin du phra ba yin pas byang chub sems kyi thig le nyid la brda bstan to //
analyzed: shin du phra ba yin pas byang chub sems kyi thig le nyid la brda bstan to //
translated: Since it is very small, it is a symbol for the bindu of the bodhicitta.

original: tha ma'i bde ba'i dbang gis ni //
analyzed: tha ma'i bde ba'i dbang gis ni //
translated: By the power of the final bliss,

original: skad cig mas ni khams gsum skyes //
analyzed: skad cig mas ni khams gsum skyes //
translated: the three realms are generated in an instant.

original: me dang zla ba'i cha mnyam pas //
analyzed: me dang zla ba'i cha mnyam pas //
translated: By the equality of the parts of fire and moon,

original: 'byung ba bzhi yi bag chags 'byung //
analyzed: 'byung ba bzhi yi bag chags 'byung //
translated: the traces of the four elements arise.

original: rlung gi stong pa nyid ngo bo //
analyzed: rlung gi stong pa nyid ngo bo //
translated: The essence of the emptiness of vāyu

original: ye shes dang ni 'dres gyur pas //
analyzed: ye shes dang ni 'dres gyur pas //
translated: is mixed with gnosis.

original: dbang po'i lam nas byung nas ni //
analyzed: dbang po'i lam nas byung nas ni //
translated: Having arisen from the path of the sense organ,

original: yul rnams la ni bzung bar 'gyur //🔽gang tshe snang ba dang ldan pa //
analyzed: yul rnams la ni bzung bar 'gyur // gang tshe snang ba dang ldan pa //
translated: it is apprehended in the field.🔽When the vāyu becomes the mount

original: rlung ni bzhon pa nyid gyur na //
analyzed: rlung ni bzhon pa nyid gyur na //
translated: of the one endowed with light,

original: de tshe rang bzhin thams cad ni //
analyzed: de tshe rang bzhin thams cad ni //
translated: at that time, all natures

original: ma lus yul la 'jug par 'gyur //
analyzed: ma lus yul la 'jug par 'gyur //
translated: enter into the field without exception.

original: 'dir ni bsdus pa'i don 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni bsdus pa'i don 'di yin te /
translated: Here is the concise meaning:

original: re zhig dang po rnal 'byor pas bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pas ye shes kyi sku blangs la shes rab kyang de'i ngo bo nyid du dmigs la 'dod chags chen po'i sgras de bzhin gshegs pa 'jug pa sngon du 'gro bar legs par sbyangs pa'i rdo
analyzed: re zhig dang po rnal 'byor pas bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pas ye shes kyi sku blangs la shes rab kyang de'i ngo bo nyid du dmigs la 'dod chags chen po'i sgras de bzhin gshegs pa 'jug pa sngon du 'gro bar legs par sbyangs pa'i rdo
translated: First, the yogi/nī, having taken the gnosis body by the stage of self-consecration, and having visualized the wisdom consort as having the same nature, should unite the vajra and lotus, preceded by the entry of the Tathāgatas by the sound of great passion.🔽When the bodhicitta moves from the aperture of Brahmā, the gnosis of appearance, when it pervades all the limbs, the gnosis of the increase of appearance, and when it is emitted at the tip of the vajra, the reality of clear light is experienced, and it is not possible to abide in ultimate truth.

original: rje dang padmar sbyar la tshangs pa'i bu ga nas byang chub kyi sems 'pho ba'i dus su snang ba'i ye shes dang / yan lag thams cad la khyab pa'i dus su snang ba mched pa'i ye shes dang / rdo rje'i rtse mor byin pa'i dus su 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid nyams su myong zhing don dam pa'i bden pa la gnas pa mi rigs so zhes rnam par dpyang nas rig ma'i padma'i nang du de nyid spro bar bya'o //
analyzed: rje dang padmar sbyar la tshangs pa'i bu ga nas byang chub kyi sems 'pho ba'i dus su snang ba'i ye shes dang / yan lag thams cad la khyab pa'i dus su snang ba mched pa'i ye shes dang / rdo rje'i rtse mor byin pa'i dus su 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid nyams su myong zhing don dam pa'i bden pa la gnas pa mi rigs so zhes rnam par dpyang nas rig ma'i padma'i nang du de nyid spro bar bya'o //
translated: Having analyzed in this way, one should emit that [bodhicitta] into the lotus of the knowledge consort.

original: de nyid kyi sems can gyi khams rnam pa bzhi thams cad skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi sems can gyi khams rnam pa bzhi thams cad skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: From that, all four types of sentient beings will be born.

original: 'dus pa'i rgyud phyi ma las kyang gsungs te zhes pa ni le'u bco brgyad pa lags so //
analyzed: 'dus pa'i rgyud phyi ma las kyang gsungs te zhes pa ni le'u bco brgyad pa lags so //
translated: The Continuation of the Guhyasamaja Tantra also states:

original: ye shes lnga yi rang bzhin dbugs //🔽zhes pas ni de'i gsal @246a * //
analyzed: ye shes lnga yi rang bzhin dbugs // zhes pas ni de'i gsal @246a * //
translated: The breath is the nature of the five wisdoms.🔽This passage clarifies that the nature of the breath is the five wisdoms.

original: ba nyid gang yin pa de ni me long lta bu'i ye shes so //
analyzed: ba nyid gang yin pa de ni me long lta bu'i ye shes so //
translated: The clarity of the breath is the mirror-like wisdom.

original: khams nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i rdzas de dag gcig tu gyur pa gang yin pa de ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: khams nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i rdzas de dag gcig tu gyur pa gang yin pa de ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes so //
translated: The equality of the twenty-four substances of the elements is the wisdom of equality.

original: de'i nang du don dam pa'i mchog tu 'dzin pa gang yin pa de ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de'i nang du don dam pa'i mchog tu 'dzin pa gang yin pa de ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The supreme ultimate held within that is the wisdom of discernment.

original: de'i spro ba dang bsdu ba'i rim pas sems can gyi don bya ba gang yin pa de ni bya ba nan tan grub pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de'i spro ba dang bsdu ba'i rim pas sems can gyi don bya ba gang yin pa de ni bya ba nan tan grub pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The activity of benefiting sentient beings through the process of emanating and gathering is the wisdom of successful activity.

original: de'i don dam pa'i chos nyid gang yin pa de ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: de'i don dam pa'i chos nyid gang yin pa de ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes so //
translated: The ultimate reality of that is the wisdom of the extremely pure sphere of reality.

original: rlung bcu nye bar bsdus pas na dbugs so //
analyzed: rlung bcu nye bar bsdus pas na dbugs so //
translated: The breath is so called because it is the gathering of the ten winds.

original: 'byung ba lnga ni sa la sogs pa ste de'i ngo bo nyid ni de'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba lnga ni sa la sogs pa ste de'i ngo bo nyid ni de'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The five elements are earth and so forth. Their nature is their essence.

original: de la der sra ba gang yin pa ni 'byung ba chen po sa'o //
analyzed: de la der sra ba gang yin pa ni 'byung ba chen po sa'o //
translated: Among them, whatever is solid is the great element earth.

original: de'i gsher pa nyid gang yin pa de ni 'byung ba chen po chu'o //
analyzed: de'i gsher pa nyid gang yin pa de ni 'byung ba chen po chu'o //
translated: Whatever is its fluidity is the great element water.

original: de'i dro ba'i reg pa gang yin pa de ni 'byung ba chen po me'o //
analyzed: de'i dro ba'i reg pa gang yin pa de ni 'byung ba chen po me'o //
translated: Whatever is its warmth is the great element fire.

original: de'i 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni 'byung ba chen po rlung ngo //
analyzed: de'i 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni 'byung ba chen po rlung ngo //
translated: Whatever is its characteristic of going and coming is the great element wind.

original: de'i 'ba' zhig zhi ba spros pa med pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de ni 'byung ba chen po nam mkha' 'o //
analyzed: de'i 'ba' zhig zhi ba spros pa med pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de ni 'byung ba chen po nam mkha' 'o //
translated: Whatever is its mere peace, the essence of non-elaboration, is the great element space.

original: de ltar gyur pa'i byang chub sems kyi thig le padma'i sna rtser zhes pa ni nye bar mtshon pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa'i byang chub sems kyi thig le padma'i sna rtser zhes pa ni nye bar mtshon pa yin te /
translated: The drop of bodhicitta, which is like that, at the tip of the lotus is an illustration.

original: des na rdo rje'i sna rtser yang ngo //
analyzed: des na rdo rje'i sna rtser yang ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is also at the tip of the vajra.

original: phyung nas ni zhes pa la yan lag dang tshigs thams cad kyi sgo nas spros nas so //
analyzed: phyung nas ni zhes pa la yan lag dang tshigs thams cad kyi sgo nas spros nas so //
translated: Having emitted it means having emanated it through all the limbs and joints.

original: thig le'o gzugs su brtag par bya //
analyzed: thig le'o gzugs su brtag par bya //
translated: The drop should be examined in the form of a bindu.

original: zhes pa ni yungs kar gyi 'bru'i tshad tsam gyi gang bu rdo rje'i rin po che'i rtser 'dzin par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni yungs kar gyi 'bru'i tshad tsam gyi gang bu rdo rje'i rin po che'i rtser 'dzin par bya'o //
translated: This means that the bindu, the size of a mustard seed, should be held at the tip of the jewel of the vajra.

original: de nyid nye bar bsdu ba'i sgo nas khyad par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽rin chen kha dog sna lnga pa //
analyzed: de nyid nye bar bsdu ba'i sgo nas khyad par bstan par bya ba'i phyir / rin chen kha dog sna lnga pa //
translated: In order to teach the distinction by way of a summary of that,

original: zhes smos te /
analyzed: zhes smos te /
translated: it says, The jewel is five-colored.

original: rang dang gzhan gyi don 'grub pa la nus pas rin chen no //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi don 'grub pa la nus pas rin chen no //
translated: It is a jewel because it is capable of accomplishing one's own and others' goals.

original: yang na rnam pa sna tshogs kyi sems can gyi khams skyed par byed pas na rin chen no //
analyzed: yang na rnam pa sna tshogs kyi sems can gyi khams skyed par byed pas na rin chen no //
translated: Or else, it is a jewel because it generates the various kinds of sentient beings.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rang bzhin yin pas kha dog sna lnga pa'o //🔽srog dang rtsol ba zhes pa ni srog gi rlung ste rtag tu gyen du rgyu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rang bzhin yin pas kha dog sna lnga pa'o // srog dang rtsol ba zhes pa ni srog gi rlung ste rtag tu gyen du rgyu'o //
translated: It is five-colored because it is the nature of the five transcendent lords.🔽Prana and apana are the life-force winds, which always move upward and downward, respectively.

original: rtsol ba zhes pa ni de nyid nyer bar bsdus pas thur du sel ba ste / srog dang rtsol ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rtsol ba zhes pa ni de nyid nyer bar bsdus pas thur du sel ba ste / srog dang rtsol ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Prana and apana are called life-force and expelling, respectively.

original: des ni tha mal pa'i sems can bskyed pa'i mtshan nyid de yan lag dang po bstan to //
analyzed: des ni tha mal pa'i sems can bskyed pa'i mtshan nyid de yan lag dang po bstan to //
translated: This is the characteristic of the generation of the ordinary being, and the first branch is taught.

original: sa bon gyi thig le'i dbus su zhes pa ni byang chub sems kyi nang na'o //
analyzed: sa bon gyi thig le'i dbus su zhes pa ni byang chub sems kyi nang na'o //
translated: In the middle of the seed drop means in the middle of the bodhicitta.

original: skye bzhin par shes par bya ste zhes pa ni mos pa'i rnal 'byor gyis bskyed pa zhes @246b bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skye bzhin par shes par bya ste zhes pa ni mos pa'i rnal 'byor gyis bskyed pa zhes @246b bya ba'i don to //
translated: One should know it as being generated means that it is generated by the yoga of imagination.

original: bdud rtsi sa bon zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig ni dpal rdo rje bdud rtsi'i rnal 'byor gyi rgyud las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bdud rtsi sa bon zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig ni dpal rdo rje bdud rtsi'i rnal 'byor gyi rgyud las 'byung ngo //
translated: The words “nectar seed” and so forth occur in the Śrīvajra-amṛta-yoga-tantra.

original: rtog pa'i rnal 'byor slob pa na //
analyzed: rtog pa'i rnal 'byor slob pa na //
translated: When one is training in the yoga of imagination,

original: zhes pa ni lhag par mos pa'i rnal 'byor bsgom pas so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni lhag par mos pa'i rnal 'byor bsgom pas so //
translated: one meditates on the yoga of imagination.🔽One should imagine the Vajrasattva who has the aspect of the three realms, moving and unmoving,

original: rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba zhes pa ni brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i khams gsum pa'i rnam pa can gyi rdo rje sems dpa' bsam mo zhes pa ni lhag par mos par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba zhes pa ni brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i khams gsum pa'i rnam pa can gyi rdo rje sems dpa' bsam mo zhes pa ni lhag par mos par bya'o //
translated: means that one should imagine the Vajrasattva who has the aspect of the three realms, moving and unmoving.

original: 'di nyid kyi khyad par ni zhes pa ni de'i lhag par gyur pa'i tshig ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi khyad par ni zhes pa ni de'i lhag par gyur pa'i tshig ces bya'o //
translated: This is the special feature of this means that it is a word that is added to that.

original: me long lta bu la sogs pa'i ye shes rnams kyi gzhir gyur pas na ye shes gnas so //
analyzed: me long lta bu la sogs pa'i ye shes rnams kyi gzhir gyur pas na ye shes gnas so //
translated: Since it is the basis of the mirror-like wisdom and so forth, it is the abode of wisdom.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i sangs rgyas sprul pas na nyams dga' ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i sangs rgyas sprul pas na nyams dga' ba'o //
translated: Since it is the emanation of the various buddhas, it is delightful.

original: bya ba la sogs pa'i tshul la 'jug pa la ma bstan pas na gsal ba'o //
analyzed: bya ba la sogs pa'i tshul la 'jug pa la ma bstan pas na gsal ba'o //
translated: Since it is not taught in the manner of action and so forth, it is clear.

original: yang na da ni rdo rje'i rtse mo dang 'dra ba yin pas rdo rje'o //
analyzed: yang na da ni rdo rje'i rtse mo dang 'dra ba yin pas rdo rje'o //
translated: Or else, now it is the vajra since it is like the tip of the vajra.

original: ha ni bya'i gdong dang 'dra bas padma'o //
analyzed: ha ni bya'i gdong dang 'dra bas padma'o //
translated: Ha is the lotus since it is like the face of a goose.

original: sya ni 'dzag pa'i don ston te /
analyzed: sya ni 'dzag pa'i don ston te /
translated: Sya shows the meaning of dripping.

original: des na ra ha dang 'dra bas rdo rje dang padma las sya ni 'dzags pas na /
analyzed: des na ra ha dang 'dra bas rdo rje dang padma las sya ni 'dzags pas na /
translated: Therefore, since it drips from the vajra and lotus like a rutting elephant,

original: ra ha sya ni gsang ba ste byang chub kyi sems zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ra ha sya ni gsang ba ste byang chub kyi sems zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: rahasya is the secret, which means the bodhicitta.

original: ye shes kyis brtags pa zhes pa ni rang rig gi mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i spyod yul zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ye shes kyis brtags pa zhes pa ni rang rig gi mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i spyod yul zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of “examined by wisdom” is the domain of the valid knowledge of reflexive awareness.

original: drang ba'i don zhes pa ni rdzas kyi ngo bo nyid du bstan pas so //
analyzed: drang ba'i don zhes pa ni rdzas kyi ngo bo nyid du bstan pas so //
translated: The meaning of “provisional” is because it is taught as the nature of a substance.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa yang zhes pa ni /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa yang zhes pa ni /
translated: The “also” in the “perfection stage” means

original: yang gi sgra ni slar zhes bya ba'i don to ;
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni slar zhes bya ba'i don to ;
translated: that the word “also” has the meaning of “again.”

original: / des na rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i 'brel pa dang ldan pa'i phra mo'i rnal 'byor gzhan yang bshad par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: / des na rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i 'brel pa dang ldan pa'i phra mo'i rnal 'byor gzhan yang bshad par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the meaning is that “another subtle yoga, connected with the perfection stage, should be explained.”

original: snying ga zhes bya ba la sogs pa la lkog ma la sogs pa'i gnas bzhi po la gru gsum dang zlum po dang gzhu'i dbyibs can dang gru bzhi'o //
analyzed: snying ga zhes bya ba la sogs pa la lkog ma la sogs pa'i gnas bzhi po la gru gsum dang zlum po dang gzhu'i dbyibs can dang gru bzhi'o //
translated: The “heart” and so forth are the four places such as the throat and so forth, which are triangular, circular, bow-shaped, and square.

original: gos dkar mo dang m'a ma k'i dang sgrol ma dang spyan mas byin gyis rlob pa /
analyzed: gos dkar mo dang m'a ma k'i dang sgrol ma dang spyan mas byin gyis rlob pa /
translated: They are blessed by Pāṇḍaravāsinī, Māmakī, Tārā, and Locanā.

original: 'od dpag tu med pa dang mi bskyod pa dang / don yod grub pa dang rnam par snang mdzad kyis dbang byas pa dmar po dang ljang gu dang dkar po dang kha dog ser por ldan pa /
analyzed: 'od dpag tu med pa dang mi bskyod pa dang / don yod grub pa dang rnam par snang mdzad kyis dbang byas pa dmar po dang ljang gu dang dkar po dang kha dog ser por ldan pa /
translated: They are empowered by Amitābha, Akṣobhya, Amoghasiddhi, and Vairocana, and are endowed with the colors red, green, white, and yellow.

original: de dang 'dra ba'i 'od spro ba dbang dang zhi ba dang 'gugs pa dang rgyas pa'i las can g-yas g-yon dang gnyig dang dal bus dman par rgyu ba /
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba'i 'od spro ba dbang dang zhi ba dang 'gugs pa dang rgyas pa'i las can g-yas g-yon dang gnyig dang dal bus dman par rgyu ba /
translated: The light rays of the same color as those emanate, and one should perform the activities of power, pacification, attraction, and increase, moving to the right, to the left, to both, and slowly, respectively.

original: me dang chu dang rlung dang sa'i khams kyi ngo bo dkyil 'khor bzhi bsams la /
analyzed: me dang chu dang rlung dang sa'i khams kyi ngo bo dkyil 'khor bzhi bsams la /
translated: One should visualize the four maṇḍalas of the nature of the fire, water, wind, and earth elements.

original: de rnams la thun dang po nas brtsams te nyin mo dang mtshan mo'i rim pas kha dog dmar po la sogs pa'i 'od zer gyi tshogs spros la @247a * //
analyzed: de rnams la thun dang po nas brtsams te nyin mo dang mtshan mo'i rim pas kha dog dmar po la sogs pa'i 'od zer gyi tshogs spros la @247a * //
translated: Beginning with the first session, one should emanate a collection of light rays, red in color, and so on, in sequence during the day and night.🔽One should hold the breath at the tip of the nose for half a session, and one should remain there as long as there is one-pointed mind.

original: gdong gi sna rtser thun phyed phyed kyi dus su 'dzin nas ji srid sems rtse gcig par gyur pa de srid gnas par byas pas 'bad rtsol med par zhi ba la sogs pa'i las kyi tshogs 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gdong gi sna rtser thun phyed phyed kyi dus su 'dzin nas ji srid sems rtse gcig par gyur pa de srid gnas par byas pas 'bad rtsol med par zhi ba la sogs pa'i las kyi tshogs 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: By that, the collection of activities such as pacification and so on will be accomplished without effort.

original: de ni gti mug gi rigs can gyi rnal 'byor pa'i phra mo'i thig le bsgom pa'i man ngag go //
analyzed: de ni gti mug gi rigs can gyi rnal 'byor pa'i phra mo'i thig le bsgom pa'i man ngag go //
translated: That is the intimate instruction for meditating on the subtle bindu of a yogin of the deluded type.

original: lus thams cad la gnas pa zhes pa ni rtsa rgyus thams cad kyi lus la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lus thams cad la gnas pa zhes pa ni rtsa rgyus thams cad kyi lus la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Residing in the entire body” means in the body of all the channels.

original: ye shes lnga'i ngo bo zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i ngo bos so //
analyzed: ye shes lnga'i ngo bo zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i ngo bos so //
translated: “The nature of the five intuitions” means the nature of Vairochana, etc.

original: 'od zer lnga po zhes pa ni srog la sogs pa'i rlung lnga ste /
analyzed: 'od zer lnga po zhes pa ni srog la sogs pa'i rlung lnga ste /
translated: “The five light rays” are the five winds, life, etc.

original: bzhi po ni phung po bzhi la gnas pa ste gsal ba'o //
analyzed: bzhi po ni phung po bzhi la gnas pa ste gsal ba'o //
translated: The four are “residing in the four aggregates,” i.e., are manifest.

original: lnga pa ni mi gsal ba'o //
analyzed: lnga pa ni mi gsal ba'o //
translated: The fifth is not manifest.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,🔽it is said:

original: rlung gi las kun rjes 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: rlung gi las kun rjes 'gro ba'o //
translated: “The function of the wind is to follow after all,

original: spyod pa kun la rab 'jug pa //
analyzed: spyod pa kun la rab 'jug pa //
translated: to enter into all activities,

original: rnam par snang mdzad ngo bo ste //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad ngo bo ste //
translated: to be the nature of Vairochana,

original: 'chi ba'i lus las 'pho bar 'gyur //🔽zhes bshad pas so //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i lus las 'pho bar 'gyur // zhes bshad pas so //
translated: and to transfer from the body at death.”

original: srog dang rtsol bar gyur nas zhes pa ni /
analyzed: srog dang rtsol bar gyur nas zhes pa ni /
translated: Having become life and exertion,

original: lnga'i bdag nyid kyi rlung de nyid srog dang rtsol ba nyid du gyur nas so //
analyzed: lnga'i bdag nyid kyi rlung de nyid srog dang rtsol ba nyid du gyur nas so //
translated: means that very wind of the nature of the five, having become life and exertion,

original: steng gi sna yi bu ga las //
analyzed: steng gi sna yi bu ga las //
translated: from the upper nostril

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: means

original: kun rdzob kyi sna khung g-yas pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas phye bar gyur pa las so //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi sna khung g-yas pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas phye bar gyur pa las so //
translated: by the division of the right nostril, etc. of the relative.

original: dkyil 'khor bzhi yi kha dog gis //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor bzhi yi kha dog gis //
translated: By the colors of the four mandalas,🔽in the first period of the day, the fire mandala arises; in the second, the air mandala; in the third, the earth mandala; and in the fourth, the water mandala. In the same way, one should understand the night.🔽One should understand the arising of the mandalas in the reverse order in the night.🔽One should understand the arising of the mandalas in the reverse order in the night.🔽One should understand the arising of the mandalas in the reverse order in the night.

original: zhes pa ni nyin mo'i thun dang po la me'i dkyil 'khor 'char ba dang / gnyis pa la rlung gi dkyil 'khor dang // gsum la sa'i dkyil 'khor dang bzhi pa la chu'i dkyil 'khor 'char ba de bzhin du mtshan mor rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni nyin mo'i thun dang po la me'i dkyil 'khor 'char ba dang / gnyis pa la rlung gi dkyil 'khor dang // gsum la sa'i dkyil 'khor dang bzhi pa la chu'i dkyil 'khor 'char ba de bzhin du mtshan mor rtogs par bya'o //
translated: One should understand the arising of the mandalas in the reverse order in the night.

original: go rims bzhin du nges par 'byung //🔽zhes pa ni g-yas pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du nges par 'byung // zhes pa ni g-yas pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: One should understand the arising of the mandalas in the reverse order in the night.

original: ji skad du zhes pa la sogs pa'i lung tshad ma nyid du bstan to //🔽sna rtse ni gdong gi sna rtser ro //
analyzed: ji skad du zhes pa la sogs pa'i lung tshad ma nyid du bstan to // sna rtse ni gdong gi sna rtser ro //
translated: One should understand the arising of the mandalas in the reverse order in the night.🔽One should understand the arising of the mandalas in the reverse order in the night.🔽One should understand the arising of the mandalas in the reverse order in the night.🔽One should understand the arising of the mandalas in the reverse order in the night.🔽One should understand the arising of the mandalas in the reverse order in the night.🔽One should understand the arising of the mandalas in the reverse order in the night.🔽One should understand the arising of the mandalas in the reverse order in the night.🔽One should understand the arising of the mandalas in the reverse order in the night.🔽One should understand the arising of the mandalas in the reverse order in the night.🔽One should understand the arising of the mandalas in the reverse order in the night.🔽One should understand the arising of the mandalas in the reverse order in the night.🔽One should understand the arising of the mandalas in the reverse order in the night.🔽One should understand the arising of the mandalas in the reverse order in the night.🔽One should understand the arising of the mandalas in the reverse order in the night.🔽One should understand the arising of the mandalas in the reverse order in the night.🔽One should understand the arising of the mandalas in the reverse order in the night.🔽One should understand the arising of the mandalas in the reverse order in the night.🔽One should understand the arising of the mandalas in the reverse order in the night.

original: yungs kar zhes pa ni yungs kar gyi 'bru'i tshad tsam gyi 'od zer gyi thig le'o //
analyzed: yungs kar zhes pa ni yungs kar gyi 'bru'i tshad tsam gyi 'od zer gyi thig le'o //
translated: One should understand the arising of the mandalas in the reverse order in the night.

original: srog dang rtsol ba'i brtag pa'o //
analyzed: srog dang rtsol ba'i brtag pa'o //
translated: One should understand the

original: zhes pa ni de nyid rlung nye bar bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de nyid rlung nye bar bsdus pa'o //
translated: This is the gathering of the vital winds into the reality drop.

original: thig le de nyid srog dang rtsol ba la sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: thig le de nyid srog dang rtsol ba la sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin te /
translated: The nature of the Buddha is in the life and exertion of that reality drop.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo 'od zer lnga yod de dkyil 'khor re re 'ang de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid yin pas so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo 'od zer lnga yod de dkyil 'khor re re 'ang de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid yin pas so //
translated: The nature of the Tathagata is the five lights, because each mandala is the nature of the five Tathagatas.

original: 'od zer de rnams ni steng gi sna las te gdong gi sna las nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'od zer de rnams ni steng gi sna las te gdong gi sna las nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Those lights definitely emerge from the upper nose, from the nose of the face.

original: sgo @247b las 'byung ba'i rim pa bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sgo @247b las 'byung ba'i rim pa bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain the emergence from the doors,

original: g-yon zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: g-yon zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “left” and so on.

original: rlung gi dkyil 'khor g-yon nas 'byung ba dang me'i dkyil 'khor g-yas las 'byung ba dang sa'i dkyil 'khor gnyi ga las 'byung ba dang / chu'i dkyil 'khor gnyi ga las dal bus rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: rlung gi dkyil 'khor g-yon nas 'byung ba dang me'i dkyil 'khor g-yas las 'byung ba dang sa'i dkyil 'khor gnyi ga las 'byung ba dang / chu'i dkyil 'khor gnyi ga las dal bus rgyu ba'o //
translated: The air mandala emerges from the left, the fire mandala emerges from the right, the earth mandala emerges from both, and the water mandala moves slowly from both.

original: de nyid nang gi dus yin bar bshad pa ni rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi nang gi dus yin no //
analyzed: de nyid nang gi dus yin bar bshad pa ni rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi nang gi dus yin no //
translated: This is explained as the inner time, the inner time of the yogis.

original: dus kyi rim pa 'dis rnal 'byor pas zhi ba la sogs pa'i las byed de /
analyzed: dus kyi rim pa 'dis rnal 'byor pas zhi ba la sogs pa'i las byed de /
translated: By this sequence of time, the yogi performs the actions of pacification and so forth.

original: rang ni 'od gsal ba ste mi shigs pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: rang ni 'od gsal ba ste mi shigs pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: One’s own is clear light, the nature of the indestructible.

original: de las byung ba'i sngags ni yi ge gsum mo //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i sngags ni yi ge gsum mo //
translated: The mantra that arises from that is the three syllables.

original: de'i gzhi ni dkyil 'khor bzhi'o //
analyzed: de'i gzhi ni dkyil 'khor bzhi'o //
translated: The basis of that is the four mandalas.

original: de rnams kyi sbyor ba ni rab tu sbyor ba ste 'od zer spro ba'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi sbyor ba ni rab tu sbyor ba ste 'od zer spro ba'i rim pa'o //
translated: The yoga of those is the application, the process of radiating light rays.

original: nyin mtshan ni nyin mo dang mtshan mor des gnas shing sna'i rtse mor 'od zer de 'dzin par bya'o //
analyzed: nyin mtshan ni nyin mo dang mtshan mor des gnas shing sna'i rtse mor 'od zer de 'dzin par bya'o //
translated: Day and night, by that, one should abide and hold the light ray at the tip of the nose.

original: thun phyed phyed ni chu'i tshod brgyad kyi bdag nyid kyi dus ni thun no //
analyzed: thun phyed phyed ni chu'i tshod brgyad kyi bdag nyid kyi dus ni thun no //
translated: Half periods are the time of eight finger lengths, which is a period.

original: de'i phyed ni chu tshod bzhi'o //
analyzed: de'i phyed ni chu tshod bzhi'o //
translated: Half of that is four finger lengths.

original: de yang phyed ni chu tshod gnyis so //
analyzed: de yang phyed ni chu tshod gnyis so //
translated: And half of that is two finger lengths.

original: des na thun re rer chu tshod gnyis gnyis kyi bar du 'od zer gyi thig le 'dzin pas 'od gsal ba rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na thun re rer chu tshod gnyis gnyis kyi bar du 'od zer gyi thig le 'dzin pas 'od gsal ba rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, by holding the drop of light rays for two finger lengths in each period, one will realize clear light.

original: rim ni zhes pa ni kha dog dmar po la sogs pa'i dbye ba dang / g-yas pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: rim ni zhes pa ni kha dog dmar po la sogs pa'i dbye ba dang / g-yas pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas so //
translated: The stages are the divisions of the colors, red and so on, and the divisions of the right and so on.

original: go rims ji bzhin du zhes pa ni me dang rlung dang sa dang chu'i dkyil 'khor shar ba'i rim pas so //
analyzed: go rims ji bzhin du zhes pa ni me dang rlung dang sa dang chu'i dkyil 'khor shar ba'i rim pas so //
translated: As for in due order, it is in the order of the arising of the maṇḍalas of fire, wind, earth, and water.

original: rdo rje'i tshig gi don zhes pa ni don zab pa dang ldan pa'i tshig gis brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje'i tshig gi don zhes pa ni don zab pa dang ldan pa'i tshig gis brjod par bya'o //
translated: As for the meaning of the vajra words, it should be expressed with words that have profound meaning.

original: rlung gi de kho na nyid ces pa ni yungs kar gyi 'bru'i tshad tsam gyi byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le'i de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: rlung gi de kho na nyid ces pa ni yungs kar gyi 'bru'i tshad tsam gyi byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le'i de kho na nyid do //
translated: As for the reality of the wind, it is the reality of the bindu of bodhicitta, which is the size of a mustard seed.

original: sngags kyi de kho na nyid ces pa ni yi ge gsum gyis bskyed pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i mi 'jigs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: sngags kyi de kho na nyid ces pa ni yi ge gsum gyis bskyed pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i mi 'jigs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: As for the reality of the mantra, it is the cause generated by the three syllables, which has the characteristic of fearlessness.

original: des las dkyil 'khor dang rlung dang yi ge gsum yang 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des las dkyil 'khor dang rlung dang yi ge gsum yang 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the maṇḍala of the body, the wind, and the three syllables arise from that.

original: ye shes kyi de kho na nyid bstan pa'i phyir zhe sdang gi rigs can gyi phra mo'i rnal 'byor bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: ye shes kyi de kho na nyid bstan pa'i phyir zhe sdang gi rigs can gyi phra mo'i rnal 'byor bstan par bya ste /
translated: In order to teach the reality of intuition, the subtle yoga of the type of person who is angry should be taught.

original: rnam par shes pa gsum ni sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten gyi rang bzhin kun gzhi la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gsum ni sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten gyi rang bzhin kun gzhi la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: The three consciousnesses are the nature of the world of sentient beings and the world of the container, characterized by the fundamental consciousness and so forth.

original: byang chub kyi bdag nyid can gyi sems zhes pa ni snang ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can no //🔽khams phra ba ste zhes pa ni aom dang a'a: nye bar bsdus nas thugs rdo rje yig 'bru'i thig @248a * //
analyzed: byang chub kyi bdag nyid can gyi sems zhes pa ni snang ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can no // khams phra ba ste zhes pa ni aom dang a'a: nye bar bsdus nas thugs rdo rje yig 'bru'i thig @248a * //
translated: The mind that has the nature of enlightenment is the nature of appearance and so forth.

original: le lhag mar gyur pa'i khams phra ba'o //
analyzed: le lhag mar gyur pa'i khams phra ba'o //
translated: The subtle constituent is the subtle constituent that remains as the bindu of the syllable of mind vajra, which is subsumed in the oṃ and āḥ.🔽That which is located in the heart is the support and the supported.

original: snying ga la gnas pa'i de la rten dang brten par gyur pa zhes pa ni 'gro ba de nyid rnam par shes par byed de bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: snying ga la gnas pa'i de la rten dang brten par gyur pa zhes pa ni 'gro ba de nyid rnam par shes par byed de bsam par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the world is made conscious by that.

original: de ni ye shes kyi de kho na nyid de yan lag lnga pa'o //
analyzed: de ni ye shes kyi de kho na nyid de yan lag lnga pa'o //
translated: That is the reality of intuition, which has five branches.

original: rlung dang rnam par shes pa zhes brtags pa'i zhes pa ni rlung ma lus pa'i 'khor lo dang rnam par shes pa gsum gyi rang bzhin gyi sngags kyi thig le de la'o //
analyzed: rlung dang rnam par shes pa zhes brtags pa'i zhes pa ni rlung ma lus pa'i 'khor lo dang rnam par shes pa gsum gyi rang bzhin gyi sngags kyi thig le de la'o //
translated: In the drop of mantra, which is the nature of the wheel of all the winds and the three consciousnesses.

original: ye shes kyi sku zhes pa ni cig car du 'byung ba 'ja' tshon bzhin no //
analyzed: ye shes kyi sku zhes pa ni cig car du 'byung ba 'ja' tshon bzhin no //
translated: The body of intuition is like a rainbow, arising all at once.

original: 'ja' tshon ltar zhes pa ni yod pa dang med pa gnyis dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: 'ja' tshon ltar zhes pa ni yod pa dang med pa gnyis dang bral ba'o //
translated: Like a rainbow, it is free from both existence and nonexistence.

original: dkar po la sogs pa zhes pa ni 'od zer gyi tshogs dang ldan pa'o ;
analyzed: dkar po la sogs pa zhes pa ni 'od zer gyi tshogs dang ldan pa'o ;
translated: White and so on, it is endowed with a multitude of light rays.🔽Since it is not the domain of conceptual yogis, it should not be taught to those who are yogis of the stage of generation.

original: / rtog pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir zhes pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams la bstan par mi bya ba 'od gsal ba las 'byung ba rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: / rtog pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir zhes pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams la bstan par mi bya ba 'od gsal ba las 'byung ba rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The body of Great Vajradhara, who arises from the clear light, should be cultivated.

original: des yongs su dag pa'i lha'i de kho na nyid bstan to //
analyzed: des yongs su dag pa'i lha'i de kho na nyid bstan to //
translated: This concludes the explanation of the reality of the pure deity.

original: theg pa chen po'i mdo sde zhes pa ni rje btsun rin chen te la las so //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i mdo sde zhes pa ni rje btsun rin chen te la las so //
translated: The words “Mahāyāna sūtras” are from the venerable Ratna.

original: dgongs pas bshad pa zhes pa ni 'gal ba'i tshig gi sbyor bas so //
analyzed: dgongs pas bshad pa zhes pa ni 'gal ba'i tshig gi sbyor bas so //
translated: “Interpreted by the intention” is by the application of contradictory words.

original: skra tsam zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni skra'i rtse mo dang 'dra ba shu kra dang sngags dang 'od zer gyi bdag nyid kyi thig le la ji srid gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma dang 'dra bar bzhugs pa de bzhin du rdul re re'i cha cha'i dbye
analyzed: skra tsam zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni skra'i rtse mo dang 'dra ba shu kra dang sngags dang 'od zer gyi bdag nyid kyi thig le la ji srid gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma dang 'dra bar bzhugs pa de bzhin du rdul re re'i cha cha'i dbye
translated: “As many as there are atoms” and so forth means that just as there are as many drops as there are grains of sand in the Ganges, so too, by the division of the parts of each atom, there are as many atoms as there are.

original: bas rdul ji srid yod pa de'i rtsis kyis de la yang byang chub sems dpa' de dang 'dra bar bzhugs so zhes bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: bas rdul ji srid yod pa de'i rtsis kyis de la yang byang chub sems dpa' de dang 'dra bar bzhugs so zhes bsam par bya'o //
translated: By that calculation, one should think that the bodhisattvas are present there in the same way.

original: des ni brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i bdag nyid can thig le yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: des ni brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i bdag nyid can thig le yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: That teaches that the bindu is the nature of the maṇḍala wheel, which is the nature of the animate and inanimate.

original: lha'i de kho na nyid ces bya ba ni nye bar bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: lha'i de kho na nyid ces bya ba ni nye bar bsdu ba'o //
translated: The “reality of the deity” is the summary.

original: nges pa'i don ni rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa'i yan lag tu 'gyur ba rlung gi de kho na nyid la sogs pa bstan pas so //
analyzed: nges pa'i don ni rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa'i yan lag tu 'gyur ba rlung gi de kho na nyid la sogs pa bstan pas so //
translated: The definitive meaning is the reality of the wind, etc., which is taught as a branch of the stage of vajra repetition.

original: da ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas gti mug gi rigs can la ltos nas phra mo'i rnal 'byor spros pas bstan par bya ste /🔽sngags dang rlung mnyam par sbyor ba las zhes pa ni 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis srog la sogs pa'i ngo bo snang bar 'gyur ba'i yi ge gsum dang 'jug pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rlung dang 'brel bas dkyil 'khor bzhi byung ba
analyzed: da ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas gti mug gi rigs can la ltos nas phra mo'i rnal 'byor spros pas bstan par bya ste / sngags dang rlung mnyam par sbyor ba las zhes pa ni 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis srog la sogs pa'i ngo bo snang bar 'gyur ba'i yi ge gsum dang 'jug pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rlung dang 'brel bas dkyil 'khor bzhi byung ba
translated: Now, beginning with “now,” the subtle yoga is taught for the sake of those of the deluded type, by way of elaboration.🔽From the union of mantra and wind means from the connection of the three syllables, which appear in the nature of life, etc., by way of the nature of exhalation, etc., and the wind, which has the character of exhalation, etc.

original: zhes bya ba ni g-yas @248b pa la sogs pa las rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni g-yas @248b pa la sogs pa las rgyu ba'o //
translated: The four mandalas arise means that they move from the right, etc.

original: de ltar gyur na yan lag ma nyams pa'i bzlas pa la zhes pa ni yan lag ma nyams pa'i lha la sogs pa'i dbyer med pa'i sbyor bas bzlas pa gang yin pa de'i rim pa ni go rims bstan pa'i phyir zhes pa ni gsal bar bya ba'i phyir
analyzed: de ltar gyur na yan lag ma nyams pa'i bzlas pa la zhes pa ni yan lag ma nyams pa'i lha la sogs pa'i dbyer med pa'i sbyor bas bzlas pa gang yin pa de'i rim pa ni go rims bstan pa'i phyir zhes pa ni gsal bar bya ba'i phyir
translated: Thus, “in the recitation with complete limbs” means that whatever recitation is done by the yoga of the inseparability of the deity and so forth with complete limbs, “the stages of that” are taught “in order” for the sake of “clarity.”

original: ro // mi shigs pa zhes pa ni spros pa thams cad med pa'i mtshan nyid 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: ro // mi shigs pa zhes pa ni spros pa thams cad med pa'i mtshan nyid 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: “ Indestructible” is clear light, which is the nature of the absence of all elaborations.

original: de las byung ba ni 'od gsal ba las me la sogs pa dkyil 'khor bzhi 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de las byung ba ni 'od gsal ba las me la sogs pa dkyil 'khor bzhi 'byung ba'o //
translated: “ Arisen from that” means that the four maṇḍalas of fire and so forth arise from clear light.

original: me'i dkyil 'khor kha dog dmar po'i ngo bo zhes pa ni nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor ni dmar po yin pas so //
analyzed: me'i dkyil 'khor kha dog dmar po'i ngo bo zhes pa ni nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor ni dmar po yin pas so //
translated: “ The essence of the red-colored fire maṇḍala” is the sun maṇḍala, because it is red.

original: g-yas las 'byung ba zhes pa ni ngo bo nyid kyis de'i de lam yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽rnam par snang mdzad do zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs yin pas so //
analyzed: g-yas las 'byung ba zhes pa ni ngo bo nyid kyis de'i de lam yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽rnam par snang mdzad do zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs yin pas so //
translated: “ Arisen from the right” means that it is the path of that by nature.🔽“ Vairocana” is the buddha family.

original: sku ni nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor 'od dpag tu med pa ste kha dog dmar po yin pas so //
analyzed: sku ni nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor 'od dpag tu med pa ste kha dog dmar po yin pas so //
translated: The body is the sun-disk, of immeasurable light, because it is red in color.

original: aom dang a'a: ste zhes pa ni de dag gis bskyed pa'i sa bon yin pas so //
analyzed: aom dang a'a: ste zhes pa ni de dag gis bskyed pa'i sa bon yin pas so //
translated: The syllable A and the syllable A are the seed-syllable of those two.

original: de nyid 'jug pa dang gnas pa zhes pa ni sngags dang rlung gi tha dad pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang de'i bdag nyid du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid 'jug pa dang gnas pa zhes pa ni sngags dang rlung gi tha dad pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang de'i bdag nyid du 'jug pa'o //
translated: That very thing is the entry and the abiding, because it is not different from the mantra and the wind, but rather it is their very nature.

original: yi ge h'um ldang ba'i bdag nyid can zhes pa ni thugs rdo rje'i sa bon yin pas dbang po la brten nas phyi rol yul la 'byung ba'i rang bzhin yongs su brtag pa ste bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: yi ge h'um ldang ba'i bdag nyid can zhes pa ni thugs rdo rje'i sa bon yin pas dbang po la brten nas phyi rol yul la 'byung ba'i rang bzhin yongs su brtag pa ste bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The syllable HUM is the nature of the arising, because it is the seed-syllable of the mind-vajra. It is the imagination, the meditation, of the nature of the external object, based on the sense-faculty.

original: 'di ni 'od dpag tu med pa'i bzlas pa'o zhes pa ni me'i dkyil 'khor la dbang byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni 'od dpag tu med pa'i bzlas pa'o zhes pa ni me'i dkyil 'khor la dbang byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is the recitation of Amitabha, because it controls the fire-mandala.

original: chu'i dkyil 'khor te zhes pa ni zla ba dang 'dra bas so //
analyzed: chu'i dkyil 'khor te zhes pa ni zla ba dang 'dra bas so //
translated: The water-mandala is like the moon.

original: spyan gyi yi ge ni yi ge aom mo //
analyzed: spyan gyi yi ge ni yi ge aom mo //
translated: The syllable of Locana is the syllable OM.

original: tshul ni kha dog dkar po'o //
analyzed: tshul ni kha dog dkar po'o //
translated: The method is the white color.

original: dkar zhing zhes pa ni de nyid do //
analyzed: dkar zhing zhes pa ni de nyid do //
translated: The white one is that itself.

original: de nas te zhes pa ni tshig phrad don du ma yin pas de nas kyi sgra ni bkra shis kyi don rjod par byed pa ste yi ge aom gyi rnam grangs so //
analyzed: de nas te zhes pa ni tshig phrad don du ma yin pas de nas kyi sgra ni bkra shis kyi don rjod par byed pa ste yi ge aom gyi rnam grangs so //
translated: Then is a conjunctive particle, which has many meanings. The word then expresses the meaning of auspiciousness, which is a synonym of the syllable om.

original: 'das ma thag pa'i don yang yin te snga ma 'das pa la ltos pas /
analyzed: 'das ma thag pa'i don yang yin te snga ma 'das pa la ltos pas /
translated: It also has the meaning of immediately past, since it depends on the past.

original: bkra shis dang ni dbang nyid brjod //
analyzed: bkra shis dang ni dbang nyid brjod //
translated: Auspiciousness and power are expressed.

original: des na sgra dang de'i phyir sgras //
analyzed: des na sgra dang de'i phyir sgras //
translated: Therefore, by the word and because of the word,

original: rim dang gtan tshigs don ston to //
analyzed: rim dang gtan tshigs don ston to //
translated: the order and the reason are shown.

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: yi ge aom ni bkra shis kyi don la rab tu grags so //
analyzed: yi ge aom ni bkra shis kyi don la rab tu grags so //
translated: The syllable om is well known to have the meaning of auspiciousness.

original: yongs su gyur pa'i rjes la zhes pa ni de nyid 'jug pa'i bdag nyid kyi bzlas pa'i 'og tu 'o //
analyzed: yongs su gyur pa'i rjes la zhes pa ni de nyid 'jug pa'i bdag nyid kyi bzlas pa'i 'og tu 'o //
translated: After the transformation is after the repetition that has the nature of entering that.

original: yi ge a'a: ni padma'i rigs kyi sa bon yin pas so //
analyzed: yi ge a'a: ni padma'i rigs kyi sa bon yin pas so //
translated: The syllable aḥ is the seed of the lotus family.

original: yi ge h'um ni rdo rje rigs kyi sa bon yin @249a * //
analyzed: yi ge h'um ni rdo rje rigs kyi sa bon yin @249a * //
translated: The syllable hūṃ is the seed of the vajra family.

original: pas so // rdo rje bzlas pa zhes pa ni thugs rdo rje'i bzlas pa'o //
analyzed: pas so // rdo rje bzlas pa zhes pa ni thugs rdo rje'i bzlas pa'o //
translated: Vajra repetition is the repetition of mind vajra.

original: kha dog ser po zhes pa ni rin chen 'byung ldan gyi dkyil 'khor te rgyas pa'i rang bzhin yin pas so //
analyzed: kha dog ser po zhes pa ni rin chen 'byung ldan gyi dkyil 'khor te rgyas pa'i rang bzhin yin pas so //
translated: The color yellow is the mandala of Ratnasaṃbhava, because it is the nature of increase.

original: yi ge gsum zhes pa ni sngags thams cad kyi skyed pa'i rgyu yin pas so //
analyzed: yi ge gsum zhes pa ni sngags thams cad kyi skyed pa'i rgyu yin pas so //
translated: The three syllables are the cause of the generation of all mantras.

original: rtse gcig tu bsgom zhing zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor gyi rnam pa dang kha dog dang sgo la sogs pa la mnyam par gzhag pas so //
analyzed: rtse gcig tu bsgom zhing zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor gyi rnam pa dang kha dog dang sgo la sogs pa la mnyam par gzhag pas so //
translated: Meditate one-pointedly means with samādhi on the form, color, doors, and so on, of the mandala.

original: rin po che'i bzlas pa zhes pa ni nye bar bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: rin po che'i bzlas pa zhes pa ni nye bar bsdus pa'o //
translated: The recitation of the jewel is the summary.

original: mi shigs pa ni 'od gsal ba las so //
analyzed: mi shigs pa ni 'od gsal ba las so //
translated: The indestructible is from clear light.

original: rlung gi dkyil 'khor te zhes pa ni gzhu'i dbyibs can no //
analyzed: rlung gi dkyil 'khor te zhes pa ni gzhu'i dbyibs can no //
translated: The wind mandala is the shape of a bow.

original: sangs rgyas kyi tshul te yi ge h'um zhes pa ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bdag po mi bskyod pa bskyed pa'i sa bon yin pas so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi tshul te yi ge h'um zhes pa ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bdag po mi bskyod pa bskyed pa'i sa bon yin pas so //
translated: The way of the buddhas, the syllable hūṃ, is the seed that generates Akṣobhya, the lord of all buddhas.

original: zhi ba thung du zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhi ba thung du zhes pa ni /
translated: The short a is peace.

original: de nyid kyi khyad par te ldang ba'i rang bzhin yin pas so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi khyad par te ldang ba'i rang bzhin yin pas so //
translated: That is its distinction, because it is the nature of arising.

original: 'jug pa dang gnas pa'i rjes la zhes pa ni yi ge aom dang aa'i gzhi 'jug pa dang gnas pa'i 'og tu zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'jug pa dang gnas pa'i rjes la zhes pa ni yi ge aom dang aa'i gzhi 'jug pa dang gnas pa'i 'og tu zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: After entering and abiding, means after the basis of the letters Om and Ah.

original: don yod bzlas pa zhes pa ni nye bar bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: don yod bzlas pa zhes pa ni nye bar bsdu ba'o //
translated: The word unfailing is a summary.

original: de ni gsung rdo rje la sogs pa rnam pa bzhi yan lag ma nyams pa'i bzlas pa bstan te sngags dang rlung dang rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni gsung rdo rje la sogs pa rnam pa bzhi yan lag ma nyams pa'i bzlas pa bstan te sngags dang rlung dang rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This shows the recitation of the four aspects such as Vajra Speech, etc., without loss of limbs, because of the inseparability of mantra, wind, consciousness, etc.

original: slong mo za zhing mi bzla ste //
analyzed: slong mo za zhing mi bzla ste //
translated: One should not recite while eating alms,

original: ma blangs pa la chags mi bya //
analyzed: ma blangs pa la chags mi bya //
translated: nor should one be attached to what is not accepted.

original: 'dod pa thams cad longs spyod pas //🔽yan lag ma nyams gsang sngags bzla //
analyzed: 'dod pa thams cad longs spyod pas // yan lag ma nyams gsang sngags bzla //
translated: By enjoying all desires,

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: one should recite the mantra without loss of limbs.

original: re re'i zhes pa la me'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa re re'i 'o //
analyzed: re re'i zhes pa la me'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa re re'i 'o //
translated: Each means each of the fire mandala, etc.

original: dkyil 'khor gsum po 'khor du gyur pas zhes pa ni chu la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor gsum po'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gsum po 'khor du gyur pas zhes pa ni chu la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor gsum po'o //
translated: The three mandalas that have become the retinue means the three mandalas of water, etc.

original: de'i nang du chud pa spro //
analyzed: de'i nang du chud pa spro //
translated: One should emanate the mantra syllables into the middle of those.

original: zhes pa ni de'i cha shas nyid kyis spro bar bya ste 'byung ba chen po'i gcig ni 'byung ba bzhi'i rang bzhin yin pas so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de'i cha shas nyid kyis spro bar bya ste 'byung ba chen po'i gcig ni 'byung ba bzhi'i rang bzhin yin pas so //
translated: This is to be expanded by its parts, because the one great element has the nature of the four elements.🔽 The explanatory tantra means the Guhyasamaja Tantra, the Tantra of the

original: bshad pa'i rgyud ces pa ni dgongs pa lung bstan pa'i gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud las so //
analyzed: bshad pa'i rgyud ces pa ni dgongs pa lung bstan pa'i gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud las so //
translated: Prediction of the Intention.

original: gos dkar can sogs bzlas bshad pa ;
analyzed: gos dkar can sogs bzlas bshad pa ;
translated: The recitation of Pandaravasini and so forth

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis po'i don ni le'u gsum pa nas bshad zin to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis po'i don ni le'u gsum pa nas bshad zin to //
translated: is explained in the two verses, the meaning of which has already been explained in the third chapter.

original: rnal 'byor pa gnyi ga zhes bya ba la sogs pas brtags pa dang rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams la phra mo'i rnal 'byor bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa gnyi ga zhes bya ba la sogs pas brtags pa dang rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams la phra mo'i rnal 'byor bstan par bya ste /
translated: The two yogas means that the subtle yoga is to be taught to those who are in the investigative and perfect yogas.

original: autpala mthing ka'i kha dog dang 'dra ba zhes @249b pa ni mi bskyod pa'i rigs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: autpala mthing ka'i kha dog dang 'dra ba zhes @249b pa ni mi bskyod pa'i rigs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The color of the blue lotus means that it is the family of Akshobhya.

original: rang gi rdo rje'i bu gar zhes pa ni gsang ba'i rdo rje'i rtse mo'i bu ga la'o //
analyzed: rang gi rdo rje'i bu gar zhes pa ni gsang ba'i rdo rje'i rtse mo'i bu ga la'o //
translated: The opening of one's vajra means the opening of the tip of the secret vajra.

original: mi bskyod pa'i rnal 'byor pa de nyid kyis sme sha can gyi phyag rgya'i padma'i nang du nas kyi 'bru'i tshad tsam gyi rdo rje phra mo bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa'i rnal 'byor pa de nyid kyis sme sha can gyi phyag rgya'i padma'i nang du nas kyi 'bru'i tshad tsam gyi rdo rje phra mo bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The yogin of Akṣobhya should meditate on a subtle vajra the size of a barley grain in the lotus of the low-caste consort.

original: tsa na ka zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis 'khor lo la sogs pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: tsa na ka zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis 'khor lo la sogs pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: By “the size of a mustard seed” and so on, it is taught that the yogins of Vairocana and so on should meditate on a wheel and so on.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir rigs kyi dbye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir rigs kyi dbye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In order to teach just that, he says “the division of the families” and so on.

original: des ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi dkyil 'khor rgyal mchog gi ting nge 'dzin gyi dang po phyag rgya legs par sbyong ba'i dus su de dag bsdom par bya'o //
analyzed: des ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi dkyil 'khor rgyal mchog gi ting nge 'dzin gyi dang po phyag rgya legs par sbyong ba'i dus su de dag bsdom par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the yogins of the creation stage, at the time of properly training in the mudrā of the first samādhi of the supreme royal maṇḍala, should bind those [vajras].

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis kyang rim pa lnga char yang rtag tu bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis kyang rim pa lnga char yang rtag tu bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The yogins of the completion stage should also always meditate on all five stages.

original: des kyang cir 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas phra mo'i rnal 'byor bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu bstan to //
analyzed: des kyang cir 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas phra mo'i rnal 'byor bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu bstan to //
translated: What is the result of cultivating the subtle yoga?

original: zhi ba la sogs pa zhes pa ni zhi ba dang rgyas pa dang / dbang dang dgug pa dang rnam par sdang ba dang gsod pa dang dgar ba dang rengs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhi ba la sogs pa zhes pa ni zhi ba dang rgyas pa dang / dbang dang dgug pa dang rnam par sdang ba dang gsod pa dang dgar ba dang rengs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Pacification, etc.  refers to pacification, enrichment, power, summoning, separating, killing, paralyzing, etc.

original: 'dod pa'i dbang phyug la sogs pa brgyad ces pa ni /🔽sku dbang phyug dang gsung dbang phyug / de bzhin thugs kyi dbang phyug dang // chos 'phrul yon tan dbang phyug dang // byed dang longs spyod yon tan brgyad //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i dbang phyug la sogs pa brgyad ces pa ni / sku dbang phyug dang gsung dbang phyug / de bzhin thugs kyi dbang phyug dang // chos 'phrul yon tan dbang phyug dang // byed dang longs spyod yon tan brgyad //
translated: The eight, such as the lordship of desire, etc. ,🔽 are explained as follows:🔽The lordship of body, the lordship of speech,🔽and likewise the lordship of mind,🔽the lordship of magical power of phenomena,

original: ces bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and the eight, action, enjoyment, and qualities.

original: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes zhes pa ni zung du 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes zhes pa ni zung du 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The nondual intuition is the characteristic of union.

original: rgyu ni bzhi'o //
analyzed: rgyu ni bzhi'o //
translated: The cause is fourfold.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa ni rim pa gnyis pa dang bzhi pa dag gis thob par bya ste 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa ni rim pa gnyis pa dang bzhi pa dag gis thob par bya ste 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: The ultimate truth is to be attained by the second and fourth stages, which are clear light.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad rnam par dag pas na zhes pa ni 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa rang bzhin brgya drug cu spong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad rnam par dag pas na zhes pa ni 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa rang bzhin brgya drug cu spong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Since all afflictions are purified means that the one hundred and sixty natural [afflictions] such as freedom from attachment are abandoned.

original: yid dga' ba'o zhes pa ni 'dod chags dang 'dod chags bral ba dang 'dod chags par ma spong ba'i phyir ro //🔽de ltar bu'i dngos grub thams cad kyi gzhir gyur pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: yid dga' ba'o zhes pa ni 'dod chags dang 'dod chags bral ba dang 'dod chags par ma spong ba'i phyir ro // de ltar bu'i dngos grub thams cad kyi gzhir gyur pa zhes pa ni /
translated: The mind is delighted means that one is free from attachment, free from freedom from attachment, and free from attachment.

original: dngos grub thams cad de las byung ba yin gyi gzhan las ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos grub thams cad de las byung ba yin gyi gzhan las ma yin no //
translated: Thus, it is the basis of all accomplishments means that all accomplishments arise from that, not from anything else.

original: rnal 'byor pa de'i mngon du gyur pa zhes pa ni rnal 'byor pa'i mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i spyod yul du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa de'i mngon du gyur pa zhes pa ni rnal 'byor pa'i mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i spyod yul du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The manifest of that yogin means that it becomes the domain of the valid knowledge of the yogin's direct perception. This is the meaning.

original: don dam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas de kho na nyid thob pa'i thabs bstan par bya ste//
analyzed: don dam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas de kho na nyid thob pa'i thabs bstan par bya ste//
translated: The ultimate, etc.

original: @250a * // phung po la sogs pa'o zhes pa ni de'i rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin yin pas so //
analyzed: @250a * // phung po la sogs pa'o zhes pa ni de'i rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin yin pas so //
translated: The aggregates, etc. means that they are the nature of its purity.

original: sprul pa'i sku'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku'i gnas skabs so //
translated: in the state of the Emanation Body.

original: zhes pa ni sngags kyi sku blang ba'i skabs kyis bzung ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sngags kyi sku blang ba'i skabs kyis bzung ba'o //
translated: This is the taking up of the Mantra Body.

original: ye shes gsum gyi sbyor bas gnas par zhes pa ni sngags dang phyag rgya dag gi rim pa gang yang rung bas snang ba la sogs pa ngo bos byas nas so //
analyzed: ye shes gsum gyi sbyor bas gnas par zhes pa ni sngags dang phyag rgya dag gi rim pa gang yang rung bas snang ba la sogs pa ngo bos byas nas so //
translated: The abiding by the union of the three intuitions is the making of the appearances, etc. by the process of the Mantra and the Seal, whichever is appropriate.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa der spro zhing 'jug pa'o zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba la de rnams 'jug par bya ste rim pa bzhi pas 'od gsal ba'i go 'phang la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa der spro zhing 'jug pa'o zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba la de rnams 'jug par bya ste rim pa bzhi pas 'od gsal ba'i go 'phang la 'jug pa'o //
translated: The entering into that ultimate truth is the entering into the Clear Light by those, and the entering into the state of the Clear Light by the fourth process.

original: ldang ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ldang ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the arising, he says:

original: zhes pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa la 'jug pas gzhan gyi don med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa la 'jug pas gzhan gyi don med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The because of the absence of the benefit of others means because of the entering into the ultimate truth.

original: sku gsum gyi bdag nyid can no zhes pa ni chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: sku gsum gyi bdag nyid can no zhes pa ni chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The having the nature of the three bodies is the nature of the Dharma Body, the Enjoyment Body, and the Emanation Body.

original: 'od gsal ba'o zhes pa ni chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa ste rim pa gnyis pa dang bzhi pas thob par bya ba'i de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba'o zhes pa ni chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa ste rim pa gnyis pa dang bzhi pas thob par bya ba'i de kho na nyid do //
translated: The clear light is the nature of all phenomena, the reality to be attained by the second and fourth stages.

original: rgyu gang yin pa zhes pa ni sa bcu pa la ye shes kyi dbang thob nas bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pas sku blangs te /
analyzed: rgyu gang yin pa zhes pa ni sa bcu pa la ye shes kyi dbang thob nas bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pas sku blangs te /
translated: The cause is that, having attained the consecration of gnosis on the tenth stage, one takes up a body by the stage of self-consecration,

original: mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pas rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin thob nas zung du 'jug pa'i rim pas sa bcu gcig pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya bas 'od gsal ba nyid zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pas rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin thob nas zung du 'jug pa'i rim pas sa bcu gcig pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya bas 'od gsal ba nyid zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: and having attained the vajra-like meditative stabilization by the stage of manifest enlightenment, one attains the eleventh stage by the stage of union. Thus, the clear light itself is the cause of the stage of union.

original: de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i bdag nyid du bskyed par bya'o zhes pa ni zhi ba dang skye ba la mi gnas pa dpal rdo rje 'chang gi phyag rgya chen po'i sku rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i bdag nyid du bskyed par bya'o zhes pa ni zhi ba dang skye ba la mi gnas pa dpal rdo rje 'chang gi phyag rgya chen po'i sku rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: One should generate the nature of Great Vajradhara means one should complete the great seal body of glorious Vajradhara, who does not abide in peace or birth.

original: 'di skad bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad bshad pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pas rdo rje dang padma la sogs pa'i phra mo'i rnal 'byor bsgoms pas 'bras bur gyur pa'i zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snod du gyur pa yin gyi de'i dus su thob pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pas rdo rje dang padma la sogs pa'i phra mo'i rnal 'byor bsgoms pas 'bras bur gyur pa'i zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snod du gyur pa yin gyi de'i dus su thob pa ma yin te /
translated: The yogi/nī of the stage of generation, by cultivating the subtle yoga of the vajra and lotus, etc., becomes a vessel for the samādhi of union, which is the result, but does not attain it at that time.

original: de'i dbang po dman pa nyid kyis de kho na nyid snang na yang mngon du mi 'gyur pa'i phyir ro ;🔽/ rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pas ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i bdag nyid dmigs nas phra mo'i rnal 'byor bsgom pa de ma thag tu sems rnam par dag pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis 'od gsal ba la 'jug nas de'i 'bras bur gyur pa zung du
analyzed: de'i dbang po dman pa nyid kyis de kho na nyid snang na yang mngon du mi 'gyur pa'i phyir ro ; / rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pas ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i bdag nyid dmigs nas phra mo'i rnal 'byor bsgom pa de ma thag tu sems rnam par dag pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis 'od gsal ba la 'jug nas de'i 'bras bur gyur pa zung du
translated: Because of his/her inferior faculties, even though reality appears, it does not manifest.

original: 'jug pa'i rim pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rim pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: The yogi/nī of the stage of completion, having visualized the identity of Great Vajradhara, immediately after cultivating the subtle yoga, enters into clear light by way of the sequence of the purification of the mind, etc., and attains the stage of union, which is the result of that.

original: dgongs @250b pas bshad pa zhes pa ni 'gal ba'i tshig gi sbyor bas zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa'i phyir rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rdzogs pa'i rim pa bstan pas so //
analyzed: dgongs @250b pas bshad pa zhes pa ni 'gal ba'i tshig gi sbyor bas zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa'i phyir rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rdzogs pa'i rim pa bstan pas so //
translated: The “explanation by intention” is the teaching of the perfection stage, which has the character of vajra repetition, etc., because of the attainment of the concentration of union by the application of the words of contradiction.

original: da ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la brten pas byang chub thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: da ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la brten pas byang chub thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: Now, beginning with “now”, it is taught that enlightenment is attained by means of the five objects of desire.

original: gang gi phyir brtul zhugs dang sbyangs pa'i yon tan la sogs pa dang lus ngal bas sangs rgyas nyid thob par mi 'gyur ro //🔽dka' thub bsdams pas ma rungs pa'i //
analyzed: gang gi phyir brtul zhugs dang sbyangs pa'i yon tan la sogs pa dang lus ngal bas sangs rgyas nyid thob par mi 'gyur ro // dka' thub bsdams pas ma rungs pa'i //
translated: Because buddhahood is not attained by means of austerities, ascetic practices, etc., and by means of physical fatigue.🔽As it is said in the Sri-Paramādya:🔽“By means of austerities,

original: sdug bsngal gyis ni lus skams 'gyur //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyis ni lus skams 'gyur //
translated: the body becomes emaciated by suffering.

original: sdug bsngal gyis ni sems g-yengs te //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyis ni sems g-yengs te //
translated: By means of suffering, the mind becomes distracted.

original: g-yengs pas dngos grub thob mi 'gyur //
analyzed: g-yengs pas dngos grub thob mi 'gyur //
translated: By means of distraction, one does not attain success.

original: zhes dpal mchog dang po las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes dpal mchog dang po las 'byung ngo //
translated: And:

original: gang phyir lus ni gdung ba yis //
analyzed: gang phyir lus ni gdung ba yis //
translated: “Because the body is emaciated,

original: 'ba' zhig gis ni chos med do //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig gis ni chos med do //
translated: there is no Dharma by means of austerity alone.”

original: des gzhan 'tshe ba bral min dang // gzhan dag rjes su gzung ba min //
analyzed: des gzhan 'tshe ba bral min dang // gzhan dag rjes su gzung ba min //
translated: It does not free others from harm, nor does it care for others.

original: sbyin pa tshul khrims bzod pas gsal //
analyzed: sbyin pa tshul khrims bzod pas gsal //
translated: Giving, morality, and patience are its illumination.

original: dam pa'i chos ni lam chen po //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos ni lam chen po //
translated: The true Dharma is the great path.

original: gang zhig bor nas lus ngal ba'i //🔽lam ngan nas ni 'gro 'gyur na //
analyzed: gang zhig bor nas lus ngal ba'i // lam ngan nas ni 'gro 'gyur na //
translated: Whoever abandons it and goes🔽along a bad path,

original: 'khor ba'i dgon pa ma rungs pa //🔽skye bo mtha' las shing drung can //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i dgon pa ma rungs pa // skye bo mtha' las shing drung can //
translated: will wander for a long time in the wilderness of cyclic existence,

original: nyon mongs sprul gyis lus bcings pa //🔽de ni yun ring 'khor bar 'gyur //
analyzed: nyon mongs sprul gyis lus bcings pa // de ni yun ring 'khor bar 'gyur //
translated: in the jungle of birth, with a body bound by the coils of afflictive emotions.

original: zhes 'byung ngo //🔽'dod pa'i yon tan lnga zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo // 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga zhes pa ni /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: gzugs la sogs pa yul lnga nye bar spyod pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa yul lnga nye bar spyod pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The five sense pleasures are characterized by the enjoyment of the five objects such as form.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa zhes pa ni so sor sdud pa dang bsam gtan gyi rim pas thob par bya ba rdo rje 'chang nyid ces bya ba 'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa zhes pa ni so sor sdud pa dang bsam gtan gyi rim pas thob par bya ba rdo rje 'chang nyid ces bya ba 'i tha tshig go //
translated: The completion stage is the state of Vajradhara, which is to be attained by the stages of withdrawal and meditative concentration.

original: phra mo'i rnal 'byor bshad pa'i 'og tu zhes pa ni rim pa gnyis kyis bsgom par bya ba'i phra mo'i rnal 'byor rnam pa gsum gyi 'og tu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽gnyis su med pa'i ye shes te //
analyzed: phra mo'i rnal 'byor bshad pa'i 'og tu zhes pa ni rim pa gnyis kyis bsgom par bya ba'i phra mo'i rnal 'byor rnam pa gsum gyi 'og tu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // gnyis su med pa'i ye shes te //
translated: After the explanation of the subtle yoga means after the three kinds of subtle yoga that are to be cultivated by the two stages.

original: zhes pa ni sems can thams cad kyis de nyid 'dod par bya bas so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sems can thams cad kyis de nyid 'dod par bya bas so //
translated: The nondual intuition means that it is to be desired by all sentient beings.

original: kun ni zhes bya ba rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: kun ni zhes bya ba rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: All means the three kinds.

original: spros pa dang bcas pa zhes pa ni chags pa'i rol ba la sogs pa'i rgya che bas nye bar mtshon pa'o //
analyzed: spros pa dang bcas pa zhes pa ni chags pa'i rol ba la sogs pa'i rgya che bas nye bar mtshon pa'o //
translated: The elaborate is characterized by the extensive play of passion, and so on.

original: spros pa med pa zhes pa ni ji ltar rnyed pa'i spyod pas nye bar mtshon pa'o //
analyzed: spros pa med pa zhes pa ni ji ltar rnyed pa'i spyod pas nye bar mtshon pa'o //
translated: The unelaborate is characterized by the conduct of whatever is found.

original: shin du spros pa med pa zhes pa ni bla na med pa'i mngon par byang chub pa'i 'bras bu can mngon par byang chub pa'i sbyor bas so //
analyzed: shin du spros pa med pa zhes pa ni bla na med pa'i mngon par byang chub pa'i 'bras bu can mngon par byang chub pa'i sbyor bas so //
translated: The very unelaborate is characterized by the application of manifest enlightenment, which has the result of unexcelled manifest enlightenment.

original: de rnams kyi mchog ni longs spyod pa dang grol ba'i spyod pa'o @251a * //
analyzed: de rnams kyi mchog ni longs spyod pa dang grol ba'i spyod pa'o @251a * //
translated: Among them, the best is the conduct of enjoyment and liberation.

original: zhes pa ni de la longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skus sems can thams cad la chos kyi bdud rtsi sbyin par byed pa'i longs spyod kyis tshim par byed pa dang / rang gi bdag nyid kyang de bzhin du tshim par byed pa ste longs spyod pa'i spyod pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de la longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skus sems can thams cad la chos kyi bdud rtsi sbyin par byed pa'i longs spyod kyis tshim par byed pa dang / rang gi bdag nyid kyang de bzhin du tshim par byed pa ste longs spyod pa'i spyod pa'o //
translated: This is the enjoyment activity of the enjoyment body, which satisfies all sentient beings by giving the nectar of Dharma and also satisfies itself in the same way.

original: grol ba'i spyod pa ni chos kyi sku'i mtshan nyid de rtog pa thams cad yongs su spong ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: grol ba'i spyod pa ni chos kyi sku'i mtshan nyid de rtog pa thams cad yongs su spong ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The activity of liberation is the characteristic of the Dharma body, which has the nature of completely abandoning all conceptual thoughts.

original: de rnams kyi dag pa ni rnam par dag pa'i gnas thob par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi dag pa ni rnam par dag pa'i gnas thob par byed pa'o //
translated: Their purity is the attainment of the state of purity.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang thob pas so zhes pa ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i go 'phang thob par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang thob pas so zhes pa ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i go 'phang thob par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The attainment of the stage of Great Vajradhara is the attainment of the stage of glorious Vajrasattva.

original: gsang ba'i dam pa zhes pa ni nyan thos pa la sogs pa la bstan par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gsang ba'i dam pa zhes pa ni nyan thos pa la sogs pa la bstan par mi bya'o //
translated: The supreme secret should not be taught to the Sravakas and so forth.

original: 'og nas bshad pa ste zhes pa ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'og nas bshad pa ste zhes pa ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: What is explained below is what will be explained.

original: gzugs la sogs pa zhes pa ni dus kyi tshad bstan par bya ste //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa zhes pa ni dus kyi tshad bstan par bya ste //
translated: Form and so forth indicates the measure of time.

original: gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg dang ldan pa zhes pa ni gzugs la sogs pa 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga nye bar spyod pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi yul rnams kyi zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽rdo rje ltar mi phyed pa'i rang bzhin gyi bdag nyid can du shes nas zhes pa ni bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pas /
