analyzed: rjes su myong zhing bsten pas so //
translated: By experiencing and relying on them,

original: zhes pa ni so sor sdud pa'i rim pas bzung nas bsam gtan gyi yan lag gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin du rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni so sor sdud pa'i rim pas bzung nas bsam gtan gyi yan lag gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin du rtogs pa'o //
translated: one should hold them by the stage of withdrawal and realize them as the nature of the transcendent lords by the branch of meditative concentration.

original: 'dod pa ni 'dun pa ste zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul rnams gzung pa'i 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa ni 'dun pa ste zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul rnams gzung pa'i 'dod pa'o //
translated: Desire is longing for the objects of the transcendent lords.

original: 'dod pa ni gzung ba'i rnam pa ste zhes pa la dman pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'dod pa ni gzung ba'i rnam pa ste zhes pa la dman pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Desire is the aspect of the object to be grasped, which has the characteristic of inferiority, etc.

original: mig la sogs pas zhes pa ni dbang po drug gis so //
analyzed: mig la sogs pas zhes pa ni dbang po drug gis so //
translated: By the eye, etc. refers to the six sense faculties.

original: gzugs la sogs pa zhes pa ni yul drug go //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa zhes pa ni yul drug go //
translated: By form, etc. refers to the six objects.

original: ngan pa dang 'bring dang mchog rnams gcig pa'i snang ba yul du byed pa'o zhes pa ni dbang po rnams kyi skad cig ma dang po la ngan pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa skye bar mi 'gyur te rtog pa las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngan pa dang 'bring dang mchog rnams gcig pa'i snang ba yul du byed pa'o zhes pa ni dbang po rnams kyi skad cig ma dang po la ngan pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa skye bar mi 'gyur te rtog pa las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The arising of the inferior, etc. conceptualization does not occur in the first moment of the sense faculties, because it is beyond conceptualization.

original: @257b mngon sum rtog pa las 'das pa //
analyzed: @257b mngon sum rtog pa las 'das pa //
translated: Direct perception is beyond conceptualization.

original: ma 'khrul pa zhes mngon par brjod //
analyzed: ma 'khrul pa zhes mngon par brjod //
translated: It is called non-erroneous.

original: don rtogs pa ni rtogs pa ste //
analyzed: don rtogs pa ni rtogs pa ste //
translated: The realization of the object is realization.

original: spyi las yang dag 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: spyi las yang dag 'byung ba'o //
translated: It arises from the universal.

original: zhes bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bshad do //
translated: Thus it is explained.

original: mig la sogs pa de rnams kyis yul rnams gzung ba'i dus su ngan pa la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa ni med do //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa de rnams kyis yul rnams gzung ba'i dus su ngan pa la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa ni med do //
translated: When those eyes, etc. grasp the objects, there is no conceptualization of inferiority, etc.

original: nges pa'i rtog pas ni de rnams la med pa dang ngan pa dang bar ma dang mchog nyid du gzung bar byed pa ste dngos po ni cha shas med pa'i ngo bo yin pas so //
analyzed: nges pa'i rtog pas ni de rnams la med pa dang ngan pa dang bar ma dang mchog nyid du gzung bar byed pa ste dngos po ni cha shas med pa'i ngo bo yin pas so //
translated: The conceptualization of determination causes one to apprehend them as nonexistent, inferior, middling, or supreme, because a thing has the nature of being partless.

original: 'dzin par byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de ni bden pa las gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dzin par byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de ni bden pa las gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The conceptualization of apprehension is other than the truth.

original: rnal 'byor pas kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa drug pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa drug pa'o //
translated: The yogi/nī, etc. refers to the six consciousnesses of the eye, etc.

original: gang dang gang 'dod pa 'byung ba de'i 'dod pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i yul rnams spyod par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gang dang gang 'dod pa 'byung ba de'i 'dod pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i yul rnams spyod par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: It teaches that one should enjoy the objects that are in accordance with one’s desire, whatever they may be.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: dbang po'i lam ni gang dang gang //
analyzed: dbang po'i lam ni gang dang gang //
translated: Whatever path of the senses

original: rang bzhin de dang de nyid 'gro //
analyzed: rang bzhin de dang de nyid 'gro //
translated: one goes by,

original: mnyam par ma bzhag sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag sbyor ba yis //
translated: one should practice with an unfixed mind

original: sangs rgyas thams cad rang bzhin lta //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad rang bzhin lta //
translated: and see the nature of all buddhas.

original: dbang po'i lam ni de dang des //
analyzed: dbang po'i lam ni de dang des //
translated: By that very path of the senses,

original: sgrub pa po ni yul phrad nas //
analyzed: sgrub pa po ni yul phrad nas //
translated: the practitioner, having encountered the object,

original: ma lus de bzhin gshegs pa la //
analyzed: ma lus de bzhin gshegs pa la //
translated: In order to satisfy the Sugatas,

original: tshim par bya phyir dbul bar bya //
analyzed: tshim par bya phyir dbul bar bya //
translated: one should offer everything.

original: zhes rdo rje phreng ba las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes rdo rje phreng ba las 'byung ngo //
translated: This is stated in the Vajra-Avali.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rten par byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis spros pa dang bcas pa'i spyod pa bstan par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rten par byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis spros pa dang bcas pa'i spyod pa bstan par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: Therefore, it is stated that the conduct with elaboration should be taught by the words beginning with “the basis,” etc.

original: ci zhig ce na zhes bya ba la sogs pas spyod pa'i 'bras bu bstan to //
analyzed: ci zhig ce na zhes bya ba la sogs pas spyod pa'i 'bras bu bstan to //
translated: What is that? The result of the conduct is taught by “whatever,” etc.

original: yul dang dbang po mnyam par sbyor ba zhes pa ni so sor sdud pa dang bsam gtan gyi yan lag gi yul 'dzin pa dang / de rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi sbyor bas so //
analyzed: yul dang dbang po mnyam par sbyor ba zhes pa ni so sor sdud pa dang bsam gtan gyi yan lag gi yul 'dzin pa dang / de rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi sbyor bas so //
translated: The union of object and sense faculty means the retention of the object by the branches of withdrawal and concentration, and by the application of the characteristics of their purification.

original: rdo rje 'chang nyid myur zhing zhes pa ni de'i 'og tu yan lag bzhi'i rnal 'byor bsgom par bya bas so //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang nyid myur zhing zhes pa ni de'i 'og tu yan lag bzhi'i rnal 'byor bsgom par bya bas so //
translated: “The state of Vajradhara is swift” means that after that, one should cultivate the yoga of the four branches.

original: 'dir dgongs pa 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dir dgongs pa 'di yin te /
translated: Here is the intended meaning.

original: re zhig dang po'i rnal 'byor pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i lha rnams kyi gang yang rung ba'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas gdong dang phyag rgya dang dbyibs la sogs pa shing gis byas la khang pa sum brtsegs la 'dug ste //
analyzed: re zhig dang po'i rnal 'byor pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i lha rnams kyi gang yang rung ba'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas gdong dang phyag rgya dang dbyibs la sogs pa shing gis byas la khang pa sum brtsegs la 'dug ste //
translated: First, the yogī endowed with the yoga of any deity, such as Vairocana, and so on, should make a face, mudra, shape, and so on, from wood and sit in a three-storied house.

original: 'og khang la bza' ba dang bca' ba la sogs pa bzhag cing /
analyzed: 'og khang la bza' ba dang bca' ba la sogs pa bzhag cing /
translated: In the lower story, he should place food, drink, and so on.

original: bar khang la gar dang rol mo la sogs pa la mkhas pa bzhag cing /🔽yang khang la stan 'jam po'i @258a * //
analyzed: bar khang la gar dang rol mo la sogs pa la mkhas pa bzhag cing / yang khang la stan 'jam po'i @258a * //
translated: In the middle story, he should place those skilled in dance, music, and so on.

original: steng du dbus kyi gtso bo'i nga rgyal dang ldan pas bzhugs la /
analyzed: steng du dbus kyi gtso bo'i nga rgyal dang ldan pas bzhugs la /
translated: In the upper story, he should sit on a soft cushion with the pride of the principal deity in the center.

original: phyogs bzhi po la gzugs bzang legs par brgyan pa dam tshig gi phyag rgya na so gzhon pa rigs kyi yum sangs rgyas spyan ma la sogs pa'i tshul dang ldan pa bzhi po bzhag cing /
analyzed: phyogs bzhi po la gzugs bzang legs par brgyan pa dam tshig gi phyag rgya na so gzhon pa rigs kyi yum sangs rgyas spyan ma la sogs pa'i tshul dang ldan pa bzhi po bzhag cing /
translated: In the four directions, he should place four young, beautiful, and well-adorned pledge mudras, who are the consorts of the family, such as Buddhalocanā, and so on.

original: de rnams kyi yang phyi rol gyi mtshams su gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa yul gyi lha mo bzhi'i tshul dang ldan pa'i phyag rgya rnams bkod la //
analyzed: de rnams kyi yang phyi rol gyi mtshams su gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa yul gyi lha mo bzhi'i tshul dang ldan pa'i phyag rgya rnams bkod la //
translated: Also, outside of them, one should arrange the seals endowed with the manner of the four goddesses of the objects, such as Rūpavajrā, and so on.

original: dam tshig gi phyag rgya ma gcig rang gis 'khyud la de dang lhan cig tu brang skyes dang mchan khung la sogs pa mtho zhing reg la /
analyzed: dam tshig gi phyag rgya ma gcig rang gis 'khyud la de dang lhan cig tu brang skyes dang mchan khung la sogs pa mtho zhing reg la /
translated: Embracing one’s own pledge seal, one should remain in union with her, touching the high places, such as the breasts and armpits, and so on.

original: mig yangs pa la sogs pa'i lta bas yid dga' bar gyur pa 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga nyams su myong zhing ji srid sems rtse gcig pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid bde ba chen po byung ba de srid kyi bar du gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: mig yangs pa la sogs pa'i lta bas yid dga' bar gyur pa 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga nyams su myong zhing ji srid sems rtse gcig pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid bde ba chen po byung ba de srid kyi bar du gnas par bya'o //
translated: With the gaze of wide-open eyes, and so on, one should experience the five sense objects that delight the mind, and one should remain for as long as the bliss characterized by one-pointed mind arises.

original: de ni spros pa dang bcas pa'i spyod pa ste /
analyzed: de ni spros pa dang bcas pa'i spyod pa ste /
translated: This is the conduct with elaboration.

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i spyod yul yin no //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i spyod yul yin no //
translated: It is the domain of the yoga of the creation stage.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas nye bar bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas nye bar bsdus pa'o //
translated: The summary is stated by “thus,” and so on.

original: spros pa med pa'i spyod pa'i dbang du mdzad nas zhes pa ni gnyis pa brtsam par bya ste /
analyzed: spros pa med pa'i spyod pa'i dbang du mdzad nas zhes pa ni gnyis pa brtsam par bya ste /
translated: The phrase from the perspective of the conduct that is free of elaborations is the second [topic] to be undertaken.

original: bdag nyid 'dod pa dang rjes su mthun pa zhes pa ni ji ltar rnyed pa'i spyod pas so //🔽'dod pa'i yon tan lngas bdag ste //🔽zhes pa ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya la gnas pas so //
analyzed: bdag nyid 'dod pa dang rjes su mthun pa zhes pa ni ji ltar rnyed pa'i spyod pas so // 'dod pa'i yon tan lngas bdag ste // zhes pa ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya la gnas pas so //
translated: The phrase in accordance with one's desires refers to the conduct of acquiring [consorts].

original: rang nyid dang ni bdag nyid do //
analyzed: rang nyid dang ni bdag nyid do //
translated: The phrase one should delight in oneself refers to the pledge seal.🔽The phrase one should delight in others refers to the yoginīs.🔽The phrase one should delight in oneself and in others refers to the pledge seal.🔽The phrase one should delight in oneself and in others refers to the pledge seal.🔽The phrase one should delight in oneself and in others refers to the pledge seal.

original: gzhan rnams la ni rnal 'byor ma dam tshig gi phyag rgya ste tshim par bya ba ni de dang lhan cig snyoms par 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan rnams la ni rnal 'byor ma dam tshig gi phyag rgya ste tshim par bya ba ni de dang lhan cig snyoms par 'jug par bya'o //
translated: The phrase one should delight in oneself and in others refers to the pledge seal.

original: sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis so zhes pa ni bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i bsgom pas so //
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis so zhes pa ni bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i bsgom pas so //
translated: The phrase one should delight in oneself and in others refers to the pledge seal.🔽The phrase one should delight in oneself and in others refers to the pledge seal.🔽The phrase one should delight in oneself and in others refers to the pledge seal.🔽The phrase one should delight in oneself and in others refers to the pledge seal.🔽The phrase one should delight in oneself and in others refers to the pledge seal.🔽The phrase one should delight in oneself and in others refers to the pledge seal.🔽The phrase one should delight in oneself and in others refers to the pledge seal.🔽The phrase one should delight in oneself and in others refers to the pledge seal.🔽The phrase one should delight in oneself and in others refers to the pledge seal.🔽The phrase one should delight in oneself and in others refers to the pledge seal.🔽The phrase one should delight in oneself and in others refers to the pledge seal.🔽The phrase one should delight in oneself and in others refers to the pledge seal.🔽The phrase one should delight in oneself and in others refers to the pledge seal.🔽The phrase one should delight in oneself and in others refers to the pledge seal.🔽The phrase one should delight in oneself and in others refers to the pledge seal.🔽The phrase one should delight in oneself and in others refers to the pledge seal.

original: gtsug lag khang la sogs pa'i sgrub pa'i dka' thub dang zhes pa ni de dag bsgrub pa'i don du 'bad pa chen po yin pas dka' thub yin no //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang la sogs pa'i sgrub pa'i dka' thub dang zhes pa ni de dag bsgrub pa'i don du 'bad pa chen po yin pas dka' thub yin no //
translated: The phrase one should delight in oneself and in others refers to the pledge seal.🔽The phrase one should

original: shing drung pa la sogs pa sbyangs pa'i yon tan bcu gnyis kyi sdom pa dang zhes pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: shing drung pa la sogs pa sbyangs pa'i yon tan bcu gnyis kyi sdom pa dang zhes pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The twelve ascetic vows such as dwelling at the foot of a tree are as follows.

original: bsod snyoms pa dang / chos gos gsum pa dang / phyag dar khrod pa dang / phying ba pa dang / shing drung pa dang / bla gab med pa dang / phyis mi len pa dang / gdan gcig pa dang / dur khrod pa dang /
analyzed: bsod snyoms pa dang / chos gos gsum pa dang / phyag dar khrod pa dang / phying ba pa dang / shing drung pa dang / bla gab med pa dang / phyis mi len pa dang / gdan gcig pa dang / dur khrod pa dang /
translated: The ascetic vows are: the vow of alms, the vow of three robes, the vow of a dust heap, the vow of a mat of rags, the vow of the foot of a tree, the vow of the open air, the vow of not accepting food after roaming for alms, the vow of one seat, the vow of a charnel ground, the vow of squatting, and the vow of a solitary place.

original: cog pu ba dang / dgon pa pa ste sbyangs pa'i yon tan bcu gnyis ni lus ngal ba dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cog pu ba dang / dgon pa pa ste sbyangs pa'i yon tan bcu gnyis ni lus ngal ba dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: These twelve ascetic vows are related to physical hardship.

original: de rnams kyi lus ngal ba yin gyis @258b de kho na nyid rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyi lus ngal ba yin gyis @258b de kho na nyid rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They are physical hardship, not the realization of suchness.

original: ri las mchong zhing mar 'jug pa la sogs pa mi zad pa ste zhes pa ni mu stegs pa rnams kyi lta ba 'di ltar yin te /
analyzed: ri las mchong zhing mar 'jug pa la sogs pa mi zad pa ste zhes pa ni mu stegs pa rnams kyi lta ba 'di ltar yin te /
translated: The non-exhaustion of jumping from a mountain, entering fire and so on is the view of the tīrthikas.

original: ri las mchong bas sa rnam par dag par 'gyur ba dang / chu las mchong bas chu rnam par dag par 'gyur ba dang // me las 'jug pas me rnam par dag par 'gyur ba dang / mi za bar shi bas rlung rnam par dag par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: ri las mchong bas sa rnam par dag par 'gyur ba dang / chu las mchong bas chu rnam par dag par 'gyur ba dang // me las 'jug pas me rnam par dag par 'gyur ba dang / mi za bar shi bas rlung rnam par dag par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: By jumping from a mountain, the earth element is purified; by jumping into water, the water element is purified; by entering fire, the fire element is purified; by starving to death, the wind element is purified;

original: 'pho ba shi bas nam mkha'i khams rnam par dag par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'pho ba shi bas nam mkha'i khams rnam par dag par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: by dying in an orgasm, the space element is purified.

original: de bzhin sdug bsngal grol bar byed pa'i don du rgan po gsod par byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta ba ngan pa gzhan yang rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin sdug bsngal grol bar byed pa'i don du rgan po gsod par byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta ba ngan pa gzhan yang rtogs par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should understand other false views, such as “one should kill the aged in order to liberate them from suffering.”

original: de rnams kyis gdungs bzhin pas ni zhes pa la lus dang yid la sdug bsngal dang yid kyi sdug bsngal sbyin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyis gdungs bzhin pas ni zhes pa la lus dang yid la sdug bsngal dang yid kyi sdug bsngal sbyin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “By them being tormented” means by giving rise to physical and mental suffering and mental pain.

original: byang chub rnyed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub rnyed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: “One will not attain Awakening”

original: zhes pa ni thabs ma yin pa'i phyir dang log pa'i lta ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ni thabs ma yin pa'i phyir dang log pa'i lta ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: means because it is not the method and because it is a false view.

original: 'o na zhes bya ba la sogs pas dka' thub bkag nas bde pa'i spyod pa la phan yon bstan bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'o na zhes bya ba la sogs pas dka' thub bkag nas bde pa'i spyod pa la phan yon bstan bar bya ste /
translated: Now, with Well then, and so on, he will explain the benefits of the practice of bliss, having refuted asceticism.

original: thams cad kyis 'dod cing don du gnyer bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir zhes pa ni sngar bshad pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyis 'dod cing don du gnyer bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir zhes pa ni sngar bshad pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: Because it is desired and sought by all refers to the previously explained form and so on.

original: de rnams la nye bar longs spyod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas de'i longs spyod kyi sgo nas gal te bdag nyid rdo rje 'chang chen po mnyes par byed na de'i tshe phyag rgya chen po'i 'bras bu mngon du byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnams la nye bar longs spyod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas de'i longs spyod kyi sgo nas gal te bdag nyid rdo rje 'chang chen po mnyes par byed na de'i tshe phyag rgya chen po'i 'bras bu mngon du byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one pleases the Great Vajradhara by means of the enjoyment of those, then at that time the result of the great seal will be actualized.

original: tshe 'di nyid la zhes pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor pa las ldog par bstan to //
analyzed: tshe 'di nyid la zhes pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor pa las ldog par bstan to //
translated: In this very life indicates the reversal from the perfection-vehicle yogi.

original: gang gi phyir de ni bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis byang chub thob par 'gyur ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ni bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis byang chub thob par 'gyur ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: Because he will attain enlightenment in three incalculable aeons, he thinks.

original: sgra ji bzhin pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin pa zhes pa ni /
translated: As for the literal meaning,

original: spyod pa ji lta ji ltar gsungs //
analyzed: spyod pa ji lta ji ltar gsungs //
translated: it is taught that the practice is just as it is taught.

original: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is the meaning of the explanation.

original: 'dir bsdus pa'i don 'di yin te re zhig dang po rnal 'byor pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i lha'i gzugs 'dzin pa phyag rgya yang de dang 'dra bar byas te bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa'i sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin mngon du
analyzed: 'dir bsdus pa'i don 'di yin te re zhig dang po rnal 'byor pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i lha'i gzugs 'dzin pa phyag rgya yang de dang 'dra bar byas te bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa'i sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin mngon du
translated: Here is the condensed meaning: First, the yogi/nī, holding the form of a deity such as Vairocana, makes the consort similar to that, and actualizes the illusion-like meditative stabilization of the stage of self-consecration.

original: byas la / ji ltar rnyed pa'i bza' ba tsam gyis chog shes pa /
analyzed: byas la / ji ltar rnyed pa'i bza' ba tsam gyis chog shes pa /
translated: With contentment with just whatever food is found,

original: lung bstan pa'i phyag rgya dang ldan pas yul nas yul du 'khor bas ji srid phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob pa de srid du gnas par @259a * //
analyzed: lung bstan pa'i phyag rgya dang ldan pas yul nas yul du 'khor bas ji srid phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob pa de srid du gnas par @259a * //
translated: endowed with the consort who is the prophecy, wandering from place to place, one should remain as long as one has not attained the power of the Great Seal.

original: bya'o ; / de ni spros pa med pa'i spyod pa'o //
analyzed: bya'o ; / de ni spros pa med pa'i spyod pa'o //
translated: That is the unelaborated conduct.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas shin du spros pa med pa'i spyod pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas shin du spros pa med pa'i spyod pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: The very unelaborated conduct is to be explained by “thus” and so forth.

original: lus gdung ba'i sgo nas zhes pa ni sngar bshad pa'i lus nges par bsdams pas so //
analyzed: lus gdung ba'i sgo nas zhes pa ni sngar bshad pa'i lus nges par bsdams pas so //
translated: “By way of tormenting the body” is by means of the body restraint explained above.

original: phyag rgya chen por 'gyur ba thob par bkag nas zhes pa ni /
analyzed: phyag rgya chen por 'gyur ba thob par bkag nas zhes pa ni /
translated: Having blocked the attainment of the state of Mahamudra, means

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang bkag nas so //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang bkag nas so //
translated: having blocked the state of Great Vajradhara.

original: sgrub pa po'i yid kyi gdung ba yang dgag par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa'i mtshan nyid dgag par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrub pa po'i yid kyi gdung ba yang dgag par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa'i mtshan nyid dgag par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to block the torment of the mind of the practitioner, means in order to block the characteristics of conceptual proliferation.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rtog pa ni nyon mongs pa yin no zhes 'byung bas so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rtog pa ni nyon mongs pa yin no zhes 'byung bas so //
translated: Since it is said, The conception of a Bodhisattva is an affliction,

original: brjod par mi bya'o zhes pa ni dman pa'i tshul du gang yang smra bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: brjod par mi bya'o zhes pa ni dman pa'i tshul du gang yang smra bar mi bya'o //
translated: one should not speak means that one should not speak in any inferior way.

original: slong mo za ba ni nye bar mtshon pa'i don yin te zhes pa ni 'dra ba'i sgras sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: slong mo za ba ni nye bar mtshon pa'i don yin te zhes pa ni 'dra ba'i sgras sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase eating alms is a metaphor means that it is connected by the word like.

original: de bas na slong du 'gro ba dang 'dra bar zhes pa ni bza' ba slong du 'gro ba yid gdung ba dang tshig dman pa zhes rab tu grags so //
analyzed: de bas na slong du 'gro ba dang 'dra bar zhes pa ni bza' ba slong du 'gro ba yid gdung ba dang tshig dman pa zhes rab tu grags so //
translated: Therefore, like going to beg for alms is well known as the torment of the mind and the inferior speech of one who goes to beg for food.

original: yongs su tshol ba zhes pa la sogs pas ni g-yo sgyu dang pha rol la bstod pa dang tshig sbyang ba la sogs pa dang ldan pas mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: yongs su tshol ba zhes pa la sogs pas ni g-yo sgyu dang pha rol la bstod pa dang tshig sbyang ba la sogs pa dang ldan pas mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: By searching and so on, he shows that it is not so if one is accompanied by deceit, flattery of others, and verbal embellishment, and so on.

original: nye bar mtshon pas na zhes pa ni 'dra ba'i rkyen mi mngon pas so //
analyzed: nye bar mtshon pas na zhes pa ni 'dra ba'i rkyen mi mngon pas so //
translated: By symbolized he means that the condition of similarity is not manifest.

original: zas la zhen par ma gyur pa zhes pa ni phyi'i bza' ba bkag pa'o //
analyzed: zas la zhen par ma gyur pa zhes pa ni phyi'i bza' ba bkag pa'o //
translated: By not being attached to food he means that he rejects external food.

original: ji tsam zhes bya ba la sogs pas bsam gtan gyi bza' ba dang ldan pas shin tu spros pa med pa'i spyod pas sbyang bar bya'o //
analyzed: ji tsam zhes bya ba la sogs pas bsam gtan gyi bza' ba dang ldan pas shin tu spros pa med pa'i spyod pas sbyang bar bya'o //
translated: By how much and so on, he shows that one should practice with very unelaborate conduct by means of the food of meditative concentration.

original: gal te yod na ji tsam gyis lus gnas par 'gyur ba zhes pa ni 'bad pa med par rnyed pas 'bras bu dang rtsa ba la sogs pa nags tshal gyi lha mos sbyin pas cho ga shes par bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te yod na ji tsam gyis lus gnas par 'gyur ba zhes pa ni 'bad pa med par rnyed pas 'bras bu dang rtsa ba la sogs pa nags tshal gyi lha mos sbyin pas cho ga shes par bya ba'o //
translated: If there is, then by how much will the body be sustained? He should know the rite by which the goddess of the forest gives fruits, roots, and so on, since they are obtained effortlessly.

original: rtag tu nags tshal slong du 'khor //🔽brtan par nges pa'i sgrub po la //
analyzed: rtag tu nags tshal slong du 'khor // brtan par nges pa'i sgrub po la //
translated: Always wandering in the forest,

original: lha mos brgyan pas bza' ba ni //
analyzed: lha mos brgyan pas bza' ba ni //
translated: the goddess adorns the firm practitioner,🔽and gives him food.

original: skrag cing 'jigs pas ster bar byed //
analyzed: skrag cing 'jigs pas ster bar byed //
translated: One gives out of fear and terror.

original: rmongs pa'i bdag nyid gyis bltas nas //
analyzed: rmongs pa'i bdag nyid gyis bltas nas //
translated: Having seen with an ignorant self,

original: rdo rje ltar na'ang 'jig par 'gyur //
analyzed: rdo rje ltar na'ang 'jig par 'gyur //
translated: one is destroyed, even if one is like a vajra.

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de lha'i sbyong pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas shin tu spros pa med pa'i spyod par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de lha'i sbyong pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas shin tu spros pa med pa'i spyod par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: There, by “divine practice” and so forth, he teaches that one should practice the extremely unelaborate conduct.

original: yi ge gsum ni sngags thams cad nye bar sdud pa'i rang bzhin dang gsang ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yi ge gsum ni sngags thams cad nye bar sdud pa'i rang bzhin dang gsang ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The three syllables are the essence of the collection of all mantras and are secret.

original: lha yi rnal 'byor mi phyed pa'i //
analyzed: lha yi rnal 'byor mi phyed pa'i //
translated: “The yoga of the deity is indivisible”

original: zhes pa ni sogs pa'i sgra mi mngon par byas nas /
analyzed: zhes pa ni sogs pa'i sgra mi mngon par byas nas /
translated: is a non-Buddhist term.

original: lha la @259b sogs pa'i rnal 'byor dang mi phyed pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lha la @259b sogs pa'i rnal 'byor dang mi phyed pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should meditate on the yoga of the deity and so forth as indivisible.

original: 'dod pa kun la longs spyod pa'i //
analyzed: 'dod pa kun la longs spyod pa'i //
translated: “The mantra practitioner who enjoys all desires”

original: sngags pas zhes pa ni gal te mi phyed pa'i bzlas pa rnal 'byor bas slob na de'i tshe 'dod pa thams cad nye bar spyod pas kyang 'gal bar mi 'gyur ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: sngags pas zhes pa ni gal te mi phyed pa'i bzlas pa rnal 'byor bas slob na de'i tshe 'dod pa thams cad nye bar spyod pas kyang 'gal bar mi 'gyur ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: means that if the mantra practitioner who is engaged in the yoga of the deity practices recitation indivisibly, then there is no contradiction even if he enjoys all desires. This is the intended meaning.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas phan yon bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas phan yon bstan par bya ste /
translated: Thus, etc.

original: rtse gcig par gyur pa zhes pa ni //
analyzed: rtse gcig par gyur pa zhes pa ni //
translated: One-pointedness is

original: rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa'i rim pa bzhi pos zhes bya ba ni rtse gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa'i rim pa bzhi pos zhes bya ba ni rtse gcig pa nyid do //
translated: the four stages beginning with vajra repetition.

original: de thob na zhes pa ni rim gyis thob nas so //
analyzed: de thob na zhes pa ni rim gyis thob nas so //
translated: When one attains that,🔽one attains the state of Great Vajradhara.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po nyid thob cing zhes pa ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pas thob par bya ba'i rdo rje 'chang gi go 'phang nyid do //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po nyid thob cing zhes pa ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pas thob par bya ba'i rdo rje 'chang gi go 'phang nyid do //
translated: One attains the state of Vajradhara, which is to be attained by the stage of union.🔽One finds the experience of reality,

original: yang dag par nyams su myong ba rnyed par 'gyur ba'i zhes pa ni bla mas nye bar bstan pa'i bsgom pa'i lam gyis thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang dag par nyams su myong ba rnyed par 'gyur ba'i zhes pa ni bla mas nye bar bstan pa'i bsgom pa'i lam gyis thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: by the path of meditation taught by the guru.🔽In other ways, etc.

original: gzhan du na zhes bya ba la sogs pas dka' thub dang bde ba'i spyod pa dag la skyon dang yon tan bstan to ;
analyzed: gzhan du na zhes bya ba la sogs pas dka' thub dang bde ba'i spyod pa dag la skyon dang yon tan bstan to ;
translated: The faults and virtues of the practices of austerity and bliss are taught.🔽Not abandoning the light

original: / yang ba ma spangs zhes pa ni rims la sogs pa ngal ba myong ba'i 'brel bas so //
analyzed: / yang ba ma spangs zhes pa ni rims la sogs pa ngal ba myong ba'i 'brel bas so //
translated: means that one is connected with the experience of fatigue such as fever, etc.

original: des ni tshe 'di nyid kyi tsha ba'i rnam par smin pa bstan to //
analyzed: des ni tshe 'di nyid kyi tsha ba'i rnam par smin pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the ripening of the heat in this very life.

original: 'chi ba'i dus byas shing 'di nas 'phos nas zhes pa ni tshe 'di nyid la 'chi bar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i dus byas shing 'di nas 'phos nas zhes pa ni tshe 'di nyid la 'chi bar 'gyur bas so //
translated: Having died and passed from here, means that one will die in this very life.

original: mnar med pa la sogs par nges par bsreg par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni grang ba dang dro ba'i dmyal ba chen po la tshig par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mnar med pa la sogs par nges par bsreg par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni grang ba dang dro ba'i dmyal ba chen po la tshig par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: One will certainly be burned in the Avīci and so on, means that one will be burned in the great cold and hot hells, that is the meaning.

original: drang ba'i don to zhes pa ni spyod pa tsam bstan pas so //
analyzed: drang ba'i don to zhes pa ni spyod pa tsam bstan pas so //
translated: The interpretable meaning is because only the conduct is taught.

original: lung gis bshad pa brjod par bya ste zhes pa ni rdo rje phreng ba'i rgyud las gsungs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lung gis bshad pa brjod par bya ste zhes pa ni rdo rje phreng ba'i rgyud las gsungs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The explanation by scripture should be stated, means that it is stated in the Vajra Garland Tantra.

original: tha dad yi ge slong mo yin //
analyzed: tha dad yi ge slong mo yin //
translated: The different letters are the beggar.

original: zhes bya bas ni sku gsung thugs kyi sa bon ni tha dad par brjod pa ni sa bon te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni sku gsung thugs kyi sa bon ni tha dad par brjod pa ni sa bon te /
translated: By this, the seed syllables of body, speech, and mind are said to be different, that is, the seed syllables.

original: yi ge rnams tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yi ge rnams tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the letters are different.

original: de lta bu'i yi ge ngag gi bzlas pa tsam gyis 'don pa gang yin pa de ni slong mo za ba'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i yi ge ngag gi bzlas pa tsam gyis 'don pa gang yin pa de ni slong mo za ba'o //
translated: Those who recite such syllables with the mere recitation of the voice are beggars.

original: lkog ma rkan dang lce yis ni //
analyzed: lkog ma rkan dang lce yis ni //
translated: With throat, palate, and tongue,

original: gang zhig don ni g-yo 'gyur ba //
analyzed: gang zhig don ni g-yo 'gyur ba //
translated: whatever is deceptive about the meaning,

original: de ni mi 'gyur ga la ste //
analyzed: de ni mi 'gyur ga la ste //
translated: how could that be unchanging?

original: 'gyur ba nyid du 'jug pa'o //🔽zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'gyur ba nyid du 'jug pa'o // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: It is just engaged in change.

original: de dag slong mo za ba mi 'dod ces pa ni de ltar mi 'gyur ba'i slong mo za ba mi 'dod pa gang yin pa /
analyzed: de dag slong mo za ba mi 'dod ces pa ni de ltar mi 'gyur ba'i slong mo za ba mi 'dod pa gang yin pa /
translated: Those who do not desire to be beggars in that way are those who do not desire to be beggars in that way.

original: 'on kyang dbyer med pas rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa'i rim pas gang zhig bzlas pa ste /🔽mi @260a * //
analyzed: 'on kyang dbyer med pas rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa'i rim pas gang zhig bzlas pa ste / mi @260a * //
translated: However, by the stage of vajra recitation and so forth, they are those who recite with indivisibility.

original: 'jig pa tsam la gnas pas rdo rje bzlas par byed pa de dag la dga' bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'jig pa tsam la gnas pas rdo rje bzlas par byed pa de dag la dga' bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Those who practice vajra recitation by merely abiding in the indestructibility of the voice do not delight in that.

original: ngag gi bzlas pa tsam la mchog tu gzhol bar mi 'gyur ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: ngag gi bzlas pa tsam la mchog tu gzhol bar mi 'gyur ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: It is the thought that they do not apply themselves to the mere recitation of the voice.

original: dbugs dbyung ba zhes pa ni yi ge h'um ldang ba'i bdag nyid bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: dbugs dbyung ba zhes pa ni yi ge h'um ldang ba'i bdag nyid bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Exhalation is the meditation on the nature of the arising of the syllable hūṃ.

original: rngub pa ni yi ge aom gyis 'jug par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rngub pa ni yi ge aom gyis 'jug par byed pa'o //
translated: Inhalation is the entry of the syllable Om.

original: sbyor ba bzhi zhes pa ni myur ba dang langs pa dang / rnam par bcings pa dang 'khyil ba ste //
analyzed: sbyor ba bzhi zhes pa ni myur ba dang langs pa dang / rnam par bcings pa dang 'khyil ba ste //
translated: The four yogas are the quick, the rising, the bound, and the coiled.

original: ma long la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor bzhi po las sna'i rtse mor thun phyed phyed kyi dus su 'dzin par byed pas shes rab ni yi ge a'a: ste dbyangs kyi sde tshan nye bar sdud par byed pas so //
analyzed: ma long la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor bzhi po las sna'i rtse mor thun phyed phyed kyi dus su 'dzin par byed pas shes rab ni yi ge a'a: ste dbyangs kyi sde tshan nye bar sdud par byed pas so //
translated: From among the four mandalas of the non-deficient, etc., wisdom is the syllable Ah, because it is the collection of vowels, which are held at the tip of the nose at the time of each half-period.

original: thabs ni yi ge h'um ste gsal bya ma lus pa'i tshogs mdor bsdus pas so //
analyzed: thabs ni yi ge h'um ste gsal bya ma lus pa'i tshogs mdor bsdus pas so //
translated: The method is the syllable Hum, because it is the collection of all consonants.

original: gzhan ni ma ning ste yi ge aom mo //
analyzed: gzhan ni ma ning ste yi ge aom mo //
translated: The other is the neuter, the syllable Om.

original: der gnas nas zhes pa 'jug pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo yi ge gsum mi dmigs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: der gnas nas zhes pa 'jug pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo yi ge gsum mi dmigs par byed pa'o //
translated: Dwelling there means making the three syllables, which are the nature of inhalation, etc.,

original: sngags kyi yan lag ma nyams bzlas //
analyzed: sngags kyi yan lag ma nyams bzlas //
translated: Recite the mantra without losing the branches.

original: zhes pa ni lha la sogs pa'i sbyor ba dang ma nyams pa'i yi ge gsum bzla bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni lha la sogs pa'i sbyor ba dang ma nyams pa'i yi ge gsum bzla bar bya'o //
translated: This means that one should recite the three syllables, which are the yoga of the deity, etc., without losing them.

original: rnal 'byor dbang po zhes bya ba la sogs pas nyin mo dang mtshan mo stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig dang drug brgya rnal 'byor pas bzlas par bya zhes bzlas pa'i grangs bstan te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor dbang po zhes bya ba la sogs pas nyin mo dang mtshan mo stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig dang drug brgya rnal 'byor pas bzlas par bya zhes bzlas pa'i grangs bstan te /
translated: The yogi should recite twenty-one thousand and six hundred times during the day and night, indicates the number of recitations.

original: rlung rgyu ba ni de tsam gyi rtsis yin pas so //🔽zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rlung rgyu ba ni de tsam gyi rtsis yin pas so // zhes bstan to //
translated: The measure of the recitation is the number of movements of the vital wind.

original: nges pa'i don to zhes pa ni rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa bstan pas so //
analyzed: nges pa'i don to zhes pa ni rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa bstan pas so //
translated: The definitive meaning is taught by the stage of vajra repetition.

original: 'dir ni bsdus pa'i don 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni bsdus pa'i don 'di yin te /
translated: Here is the condensed meaning:

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa ye shes kyi phyag rgya dang snyoms par zhugs pa bsgoms pas gang yang rung ba'i nags tshal las 'byung ba'i bza' bca'i chog shes pa'am bsam gtan gyi bza' bca' dang ldan pa bdag dang bdag gi med pa 'gro ba thams cad
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa ye shes kyi phyag rgya dang snyoms par zhugs pa bsgoms pas gang yang rung ba'i nags tshal las 'byung ba'i bza' bca'i chog shes pa'am bsam gtan gyi bza' bca' dang ldan pa bdag dang bdag gi med pa 'gro ba thams cad
translated: The yogi of the stage of completion, who has entered into union with the wisdom seal, should meditate, satisfied with whatever food and drink comes from the forest, or with the food and drink of concentration, without self and self-possession, seeing all beings

original: sgyu ma dang mtshungs par mthong ba smyon pa'i brtul zhugs 'dzin pa /
analyzed: sgyu ma dang mtshungs par mthong ba smyon pa'i brtul zhugs 'dzin pa /
translated: as like illusions, adopting the conduct of a madman.

original: 'jig rten pas bzhad gang du byas pa gcer bu'am tshem po gyon pas ri dags dgon pa la sogs pa la bla na med pa'i phyag rgya chen po'i sku dpal rdo rje 'chang gi go 'phang de ji srid thob pa de srid du gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pas bzhad gang du byas pa gcer bu'am tshem po gyon pas ri dags dgon pa la sogs pa la bla na med pa'i phyag rgya chen po'i sku dpal rdo rje 'chang gi go 'phang de ji srid thob pa de srid du gnas par bya'o //
translated: One should remain in the state of the Great Seal, the body of the glorious Vajradhara, until one attains the state of the Great Seal, which is the object of ridicule of the worldly people, who are naked or dressed in rags, in the wilderness, and so on.

original: gcer bu'am ni gcer bu min //
analyzed: gcer bu'am ni gcer bu min //
translated: Naked or not naked,

original: gang dang gang du ji lta bzhin //
analyzed: gang dang gang du ji lta bzhin //
translated: in whatever place, in whatever way,

original: rang lhag lha yi rnal 'byor gyis //
analyzed: rang lhag lha yi rnal 'byor gyis //
translated: with the yoga of one's own deity,

original: de nyid gcig pu bsam par bya //
analyzed: de nyid gcig pu bsam par bya //
translated: one should contemplate that reality alone.

original: smyon pa'i brtul zhugs la brten te //
analyzed: smyon pa'i brtul zhugs la brten te //
translated: Relying on the conduct of a madman,

original: @260b phun sum tshogs kun 'grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: @260b phun sum tshogs kun 'grub par 'gyur //
translated: one will accomplish all perfections.

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: des na rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal byor pa shin du spros pa med pa'i spyod pa bstan to //
analyzed: des na rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal byor pa shin du spros pa med pa'i spyod pa bstan to //
translated: Therefore, the conduct of the yogin of the completion stage is taught to be extremely unelaborate.

original: 'das pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas spyod pa gsum gyi sgo nas ye shes can gyi dngos grub thob po zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'das pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas spyod pa gsum gyi sgo nas ye shes can gyi dngos grub thob po zhes bstan to //
translated: By transcendent and so forth, it is taught that one attains the power of the one who has wisdom through the three conducts.

original: ye shes can zhes pa ni sngar grub pa mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes can zhes pa ni sngar grub pa mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The “possessor of pristine awareness” is the previously accomplished one, Akṣobhya, and so forth.

original: spyod pa 'di nyid kyis zhes pa ni rnam pa gsum gyi spyod pas so //
analyzed: spyod pa 'di nyid kyis zhes pa ni rnam pa gsum gyi spyod pas so //
translated: “By this very conduct” refers to the conduct of the three kinds.

original: nyid kyi sgra ni nges par gzung pa'i don to //
analyzed: nyid kyi sgra ni nges par gzung pa'i don to //
translated: The word “very” has the meaning of restriction.

original: thabs gzhan gyis ma yin no //
analyzed: thabs gzhan gyis ma yin no //
translated: It is not by any other means.

original: rin chen lta bu'i gang zag ces pa ni dbang po rno ba'o //
analyzed: rin chen lta bu'i gang zag ces pa ni dbang po rno ba'o //
translated: The “person who is like a jewel” is one of sharp faculties.

original: padma dkar po lta bu'i gang zag la sogs pa'o zhes pa ni dbang po dman pa'o //🔽bya ba'i rgyud ni sgron ma 'byung ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: padma dkar po lta bu'i gang zag la sogs pa'o zhes pa ni dbang po dman pa'o // bya ba'i rgyud ni sgron ma 'byung ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The “person who is like a white lotus” and so forth is one of inferior faculties.🔽The action tantra is the Lamp that Brings Emancipation and so forth.

original: spyod pa'i rgyud ni rnam par snang mdzad mngon par byang chub pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: spyod pa'i rgyud ni rnam par snang mdzad mngon par byang chub pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The conduct tantra is the Manifest Enlightenment of Vairocana and so forth.

original: gnyis ka'i rgyud ni dpal mchog dang po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka'i rgyud ni dpal mchog dang po la sogs pa'o //
translated: The tantra of both is the Supreme Original Primordial and so forth.

original: de las bshad pa'i spyod pa ni khyad par gyi spyod pa ste dam tshig rnams so //
analyzed: de las bshad pa'i spyod pa ni khyad par gyi spyod pa ste dam tshig rnams so //
translated: The conduct explained in that is the special conduct, the commitments.

original: de dag gi mchog ni rnal 'byor gyi spyod pa ste zhes pa ni dpal 'dus pa las gsungs pa rnam pa gsum gyi spyod pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi mchog ni rnal 'byor gyi spyod pa ste zhes pa ni dpal 'dus pa las gsungs pa rnam pa gsum gyi spyod pa'o //
translated: The best of those is the practice of yoga.🔽The practice of the three kinds mentioned in the Shri-Guhyasamaja is the practice of the three kinds of conduct.

original: de rnams spyod pa'i ngang tshul can gang yin pa de ni de bzhin du zhes pa ni sngar bshad pa dang 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rim pas des bsnyen pa'i rang bzhin gang la yod pa de ni rin po che lta bu la sogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams spyod pa'i ngang tshul can gang yin pa de ni de bzhin du zhes pa ni sngar bshad pa dang 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rim pas des bsnyen pa'i rang bzhin gang la yod pa de ni rin po che lta bu la sogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He who has the nature of practicing those is just so.

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa zhes pa ni rtog pa dang bcas pas so //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa zhes pa ni rtog pa dang bcas pas so //
translated: The relative truth is with conceptualization.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa zhes pa ni mi 'jigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa zhes pa ni mi 'jigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The ultimate truth is without fear.

original: de bas na bar gyi tshig mi mngon pa ni las 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na bar gyi tshig mi mngon pa ni las 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the middle term is dropped.

original: de dag zung du 'jug pa'i bdag nyid can zhes pa ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings kyi brdar byas pa de nyid rdo rje 'chang chen po nyid ces bstan to //
analyzed: de dag zung du 'jug pa'i bdag nyid can zhes pa ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings kyi brdar byas pa de nyid rdo rje 'chang chen po nyid ces bstan to //
translated: The nature of their union is the sign of the realm of non-abiding nirvana.

original: dbang phyug thams cad kyi gzhir gyur pas na zhes pa ni phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyi gzhir gyur pas so //
analyzed: dbang phyug thams cad kyi gzhir gyur pas na zhes pa ni phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyi gzhir gyur pas so //
translated: The phrase because it is the basis of all powers means that it is the basis of all perfections.

original: phul du byung ba ni dam pa'o //
analyzed: phul du byung ba ni dam pa'o //
translated: The word excellent means supreme.

original: mngon sum du byas pa zhes pa ni rang rig par byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon sum du byas pa zhes pa ni rang rig par byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: The phrase is made manifest means is made known to oneself.

original: rtse gcig par mi 'gyur pa'i phyir zhes pa ni dal ba dang bcas pas sems g-yeng bar byed pas so //
analyzed: rtse gcig par mi 'gyur pa'i phyir zhes pa ni dal ba dang bcas pas sems g-yeng bar byed pas so //
translated: The phrase because it is not one-pointed means that it is distracted by being slow.

original: yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i slar yang dka' thub dgag pa bstan to //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i slar yang dka' thub dgag pa bstan to //
translated: The word again and so on indicates the prohibition of asceticism.

original: dgongs pa ma yin pa @261a * //🔽bshad pa'o zhes pa ni spyod pa gsum gyi rgyus thob pa shin du gsal ba'i de kho na nyid bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgongs pa ma yin pa @261a * // bshad pa'o zhes pa ni spyod pa gsum gyi rgyus thob pa shin du gsal ba'i de kho na nyid bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word indirectly means not directly.🔽The word taught means taught in order to make known the reality that is very clear by means of the attainment of the three practices.

original: de rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas spros pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa'i spyod pa gsum rgyas par bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas spros pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa'i spyod pa gsum rgyas par bstan par bya ste /
translated: The phrase by those and so on explains in detail the three practices of elaboration and so on.

original: yul thob pa rnams la zhen pa yin la zhes pa ni yul la mngon par zhen pa can no //
analyzed: yul thob pa rnams la zhen pa yin la zhes pa ni yul la mngon par zhen pa can no //
translated: Those who are attached to the objects that are attained are those who are attached to objects.

original: de yang gnyis su med pa'i ye shes 'dod cing zhes pa ni yan lag drug gi rnal 'byor gyi rim pas spros pa med pa'i go 'phang 'dod pa ste spyod pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang gnyis su med pa'i ye shes 'dod cing zhes pa ni yan lag drug gi rnal 'byor gyi rim pas spros pa med pa'i go 'phang 'dod pa ste spyod pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And they also desire the nondual intuition means that they desire the state of freedom from conceptual elaboration by means of the process of the yoga of the six-branched yoga, because that is the result of the practice.

original: spyod lam thams cad du zhes pa ni ldang ba dang 'dug pa dang nyal ba dang 'chag pa zhes bya ba la brten pas so //
analyzed: spyod lam thams cad du zhes pa ni ldang ba dang 'dug pa dang nyal ba dang 'chag pa zhes bya ba la brten pas so //
translated: In all the postures means that they are based on the postures of standing, sitting, lying down, and walking.

original: sems can thams cad kyi 'dod cing zhes pa ni 'gro ba rigs drug po la gnas par 'dod pa ste 'dod pa'i khams de'i rang bzhin yin pas so //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi 'dod cing zhes pa ni 'gro ba rigs drug po la gnas par 'dod pa ste 'dod pa'i khams de'i rang bzhin yin pas so //
translated: They desire all sentient beings means that they desire to be in the six life-forms of transmigrators, because that is the nature of the desire realm.

original: sangs rgyas nyid rab tu ster pa'i yon tan dang ldan pas na zhes pa ni so sor sdud pa dang bsam gtan gyi yan lag gis de rnams sangs rgyas nyid ster bas so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid rab tu ster pa'i yon tan dang ldan pas na zhes pa ni so sor sdud pa dang bsam gtan gyi yan lag gis de rnams sangs rgyas nyid ster bas so //
translated: Because it possesses the quality of bestowing buddhahood means that by means of the branches of withdrawal and meditative concentration, they bestow buddhahood.

original: thabs la mkhas pas bsten pa'i skyon rnams kyang yon tan nyid du 'gyur bar mthong ste /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pas bsten pa'i skyon rnams kyang yon tan nyid du 'gyur bar mthong ste /
translated: The faults of reliance through skill in means are seen as qualities themselves.

original: sngags kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i dug zos pa la bdud rtsi nyid du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: sngags kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i dug zos pa la bdud rtsi nyid du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Like poison that is consumed through the blessing of mantra, it becomes nectar itself.

original: de nas las 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: de nas las 'dzin pa ste /
translated: Then, the retention of karma.

original: yon tan gnyis rdzas gcig gi yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan gnyis rdzas gcig gi yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the two qualities are the object of a single substance.

original: lnga po de dag ni zhes pa la sogs pa la chos kyi dbyings yongs su spangs nas so zhes tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: lnga po de dag ni zhes pa la sogs pa la chos kyi dbyings yongs su spangs nas so zhes tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: As for “those five,” and so on, the phrase “having abandoned the dharmadhātu” is left out.

original: mig la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: As for “the eyes, and so on,” and so on,

original: rdo rje skye mched rnams dang ni //
analyzed: rdo rje skye mched rnams dang ni //
translated: the vajra sense bases

original: byang chub sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor mchog / ces bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor mchog / ces bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and the supreme maṇḍala of bodhisattvas.

original: byang chub ni sa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin de spyan la sogs pa zhes pa ni snyoms par zhugs pa'i sbyor bas byang chub thob par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub ni sa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin de spyan la sogs pa zhes pa ni snyoms par zhugs pa'i sbyor bas byang chub thob par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Enlightenment is the nature of earth, and so on. The eyes, and so on, are the means of attaining enlightenment through the practice of union.

original: sa yi khams ni spyan mar bshad //
analyzed: sa yi khams ni spyan mar bshad //
translated: The earth element is explained as Buddhalocana.

original: chu khams m'a ma k'i yin te //
analyzed: chu khams m'a ma k'i yin te //
translated: The water element is Māmakī.

original: me ni gos dkar mo zhes bya //
analyzed: me ni gos dkar mo zhes bya //
translated: Fire is called Pāṇḍaravāsinī.

original: rlung ni dam tshig sgrol mar bshad //🔽cas 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rlung ni dam tshig sgrol mar bshad // cas 'byung ngo //
translated: Wind is said to be Samayatārā.

original: 'od gsal ba las nyon mongs pa nges par bsreg pa'i lha mo dang snyoms par zhugs pa las 'byung ba'i bde bas chags pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rnams spangs pa'o //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba las nyon mongs pa nges par bsreg pa'i lha mo dang snyoms par zhugs pa las 'byung ba'i bde bas chags pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rnams spangs pa'o //
translated: From the clear light, through the bliss that arises from union with the goddess who definitely burns the afflictions, the natures of attachment and so on are abandoned.

original: rnam par snang mdzad la @261b sogs pa zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'o //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad la @261b sogs pa zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'o //
translated: Vairocana and so on are the five tathāgatas.

original: gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa ngo bo nyid du zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i ming gi tha snyad du byas pas so //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa ngo bo nyid du zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i ming gi tha snyad du byas pas so //
translated: The aggregates of form and so on are the natures of Vairocana and so on, because they are given the conventional names of Vairocana and so on.

original: mdor bsdus pas ni phung po lnga //
analyzed: mdor bsdus pas ni phung po lnga //
translated: In brief, the five aggregates

original: sangs rgyas lngar ni rab tu bshad //🔽ces 'byung ngo //🔽dgyes par gyur la tshem par bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas lngar ni rab tu bshad // ces 'byung ngo // dgyes par gyur la tshem par bya'o //
translated: are explained as the five buddhas.

original: zhes pa ni yan lag dang po gnyis pas so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni yan lag dang po gnyis pas so //
translated: The two first limbs are from the second.

original: rnam pa gsum po zhes bya ba la sogs pas so sor sdud pa'i yan lag spros par bstan te /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum po zhes bya ba la sogs pas so sor sdud pa'i yan lag spros par bstan te /
translated: The three aspects and so forth teach the elaboration of the branch of withdrawal.🔽 The three inferior, middling, and superior are the bad, middling, and good.

original: dman pa dang bar ma dang mchog gsum ni ngan pa dang 'bring dang dam pa'o //
analyzed: dman pa dang bar ma dang mchog gsum ni ngan pa dang 'bring dang dam pa'o //
translated: The three aspects are the good, the middling, and the bad.🔽 The three aspects are the good, the middling, and the bad.🔽 The three aspects are the good, the middling, and the bad.🔽 The three aspects are the good, the middling, and the bad.

original: mchog gsum du rnam par shes shing zhes pa ni dam pa lhag par mos pas ngan pa dang 'bring dag mchog la bsdus pas so //🔽de bzhin du kun dang sbyor ro //🔽rang gi rigs kyi lha rnams zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rigs can te /
analyzed: mchog gsum du rnam par shes shing zhes pa ni dam pa lhag par mos pas ngan pa dang 'bring dag mchog la bsdus pas so // de bzhin du kun dang sbyor ro // rang gi rigs kyi lha rnams zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rigs can te /
translated: The three aspects are the good, the middling, and the bad.🔽 The three aspects are the good, the middling, and the bad.

original: phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams la'o //🔽gzugs sna tshogs pas zhes pa ni mig yangs pa la sogs pa'i spros pas so //
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams la'o // gzugs sna tshogs pas zhes pa ni mig yangs pa la sogs pa'i spros pas so //
translated: The three aspects are the good, the middling, and the bad.🔽 The three aspects are the good, the middling, and the bad.🔽 The three aspects are the good, the middling, and the bad.🔽 The three aspects are the good, the middling, and the bad.

original: spros pa dang bcas pa'i spyod pa la gnas pa'i sngags pas zhes pa ni sngar bshad pa'i rim pa dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: spros pa dang bcas pa'i spyod pa la gnas pa'i sngags pas zhes pa ni sngar bshad pa'i rim pa dang ldan pas so //
translated: The three aspects are the good, the middling, and the bad.🔽 The three aspects are the good, the middling, and the bad.🔽 The three aspects are the good, the middling, and the bad.🔽 The three aspects are the good, the middling, and the bad.🔽 The three aspects are the good, the middling, and the bad.🔽 The three aspects are the good, the middling, and the bad.🔽 The three aspects are the good, the middling, and the bad.🔽 The three aspects are the good, the middling, and the bad.🔽 The three aspects are the good, the middling, and the bad.🔽 The three aspects are the good, the middling, and the bad.🔽 The three aspects are the good, the middling, and the bad.🔽 The three aspects are the good, the middling, and the bad.🔽 The three aspects are the good, the middling, and the bad.🔽 The three aspects are the good, the mid

original: lha'i 'khor lo mchod par bya zhing zhes pa ni lus kyi 'khor lo'i nang du gnas pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor pa'i 'khor lo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lha'i 'khor lo mchod par bya zhing zhes pa ni lus kyi 'khor lo'i nang du gnas pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor pa'i 'khor lo zhes bya'o //
translated: The wheel of the gods is to be worshipped. The wheel of the body is the wheel of the mandala of Vairocana, etc.

original: de nyid lha'i mos pa nyid gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
analyzed: de nyid lha'i mos pa nyid gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
translated: The same is the devotion to the gods. The three aspects of form, etc. are taught by the words, etc.

original: gang gsungs pa ni rnam pa gsum du gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gsungs pa ni rnam pa gsum du gsungs pa'o //
translated: That which is said is said to be threefold.

original: de dang gzhan ma yin pa zhes pa ni logs su dmigs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de dang gzhan ma yin pa zhes pa ni logs su dmigs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Not other than that is not imagined separately.

original: thams cad kyi bdag nyid can zhes pa ni brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: thams cad kyi bdag nyid can zhes pa ni brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The nature of all is the nature of the animate and inanimate.

original: me long lta bu'i ye shes kyis nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa dag pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pas na bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: me long lta bu'i ye shes kyis nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa dag pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pas na bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: The Blessed One is so called because he possesses the nature of the mirror-like intuition, which is characterized by the purification of the addictive and objective obscurations.

original: rnam par snang mdzad do zhes pa ni khyad par du snang ba ste rags pa nyid du snang ba'i phyi rol gyi don gyi tshogs dag par byed pa bzhi pa'i ngo bo yin pas so //🔽shes par ni so sor sdud pas dmigs nas so //🔽rang gi rigs zhes pa ni rin chen 'byung ldan gyi rigs kyi rnam par dag pas gnas pa phung po dang khams @262a * //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad do zhes pa ni khyad par du snang ba ste rags pa nyid du snang ba'i phyi rol gyi don gyi tshogs dag par byed pa bzhi pa'i ngo bo yin pas so // shes par ni so sor sdud pas dmigs nas so // rang gi rigs zhes pa ni rin chen 'byung ldan gyi rigs kyi rnam par dag pas gnas pa phung po dang khams @262a * //
translated: Vairocana is the special appearance, the essence of the fourth purification of the collection of external objects that appear as gross.

original: dang skye mched rnams la'o //
analyzed: dang skye mched rnams la'o //
translated: Having observed with the withdrawal of consciousness, one's own family is the aggregates, elements, and sense bases that abide in the purification of the family of Ratnasaṃbhava.

original: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes so sor tha dad pa'i rnam par rtog pa bcom pas na bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes so sor tha dad pa'i rnam par rtog pa bcom pas na bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: The equality wisdom is the Bhagavān because it conquers the conception of individual separateness.

original: rnam pa bco brgyad kyis tshor ba'i phung po sbyor bas na rin chen ltar dkon pa gang la yod pa de ni rin chen 'byung ldan no //🔽yang na bsam pa thams cad rdzogs par byed pas na rin chen 'byung ldan te /
analyzed: rnam pa bco brgyad kyis tshor ba'i phung po sbyor bas na rin chen ltar dkon pa gang la yod pa de ni rin chen 'byung ldan no // yang na bsam pa thams cad rdzogs par byed pas na rin chen 'byung ldan te /
translated: Ratnasaṃbhava is he in whom there is the jewel that is rare, since the aggregate of feeling is purified by the eighteen aspects.

original: rgyas pa'i rang bzhin yin pas so //
analyzed: rgyas pa'i rang bzhin yin pas so //
translated: Alternatively, Ratnasaṃbhava is he who fulfills all wishes, because he is the nature of increase.

original: 'od dpag tu med pa'i rigs can zhes pa ni 'od dpag tu med pa'i rigs kyi rnam par dag pas gnas pa phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams la'o //
analyzed: 'od dpag tu med pa'i rigs can zhes pa ni 'od dpag tu med pa'i rigs kyi rnam par dag pas gnas pa phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams la'o //
translated: The one who has the family of Amitābha is so called because of the purity of the family of Amitābha in the aggregates, elements, and sense-fields.

original: 'od dpag tu med pa zhes pa ni yan lag bcu gnyis pa'i gsung rab rnam par dag pa 'dzin pa dang / ngag sbyangs pa'i ngo bo yin pas so //
analyzed: 'od dpag tu med pa zhes pa ni yan lag bcu gnyis pa'i gsung rab rnam par dag pa 'dzin pa dang / ngag sbyangs pa'i ngo bo yin pas so //
translated: Amitābha is so called because he holds the purity of the scriptures with the twelve branches, and because he is the essence of the purification of speech.

original: yang na so sor rtog pa'i ye shes mtha' yas pa'i ye shes rang bzhin gyi 'od gang la yod pa de ni 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: yang na so sor rtog pa'i ye shes mtha' yas pa'i ye shes rang bzhin gyi 'od gang la yod pa de ni 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: Or, the one who has the light of infinite knowledge of discernment is Amitābha.

original: yang na byang chub sems kyi rang bzhin gyi 'od dang ldan pas na 'od dpag tu med pa ste /
analyzed: yang na byang chub sems kyi rang bzhin gyi 'od dang ldan pas na 'od dpag tu med pa ste /
translated: Or, the one who has the light of the nature of the mind of enlightenment is Amitābha.

original: dbang gi ngo bo yin pas so //
analyzed: dbang gi ngo bo yin pas so //
translated: He is so called because he is the essence of the empowerment.

original: las kyi rigs can zhes pa ni don yod grub pa'i rnam par dag pas gnas pa phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams la'o //
analyzed: las kyi rigs can zhes pa ni don yod grub pa'i rnam par dag pas gnas pa phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams la'o //
translated: The one who has the family of Amoghasiddhi is so called because of the purity of the aggregates, elements, and sense-fields in Amoghasiddhi.

original: 'grub pa'i phrin las mdzad pas na bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: 'grub pa'i phrin las mdzad pas na bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: The Bhagavān is so called because he performs the activity of accomplishment.

original: bya ba nan tan grub pa'i ye shes kyis 'gro ba thams cad rjes su gzung bar mdzad pas na don yod grub pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba nan tan grub pa'i ye shes kyis 'gro ba thams cad rjes su gzung bar mdzad pas na don yod grub pa'o //
translated: Amoghasiddhi is so called because he benefits all beings with the gnosis of successful action.

original: yang na dgug pa'i ngo bo yin pas so //
analyzed: yang na dgug pa'i ngo bo yin pas so //
translated: Or else, he is so called because he has the nature of summoning.

original: bdag gi rigs te rdo rje rigs can rnams la zhes pa ni thugs kyi rdo rje 'chang ni rigs thams cad kyi nang na mchog yin pas so //
analyzed: bdag gi rigs te rdo rje rigs can rnams la zhes pa ni thugs kyi rdo rje 'chang ni rigs thams cad kyi nang na mchog yin pas so //
translated: Those of my family, those who belong to the vajra family, refers to the family of the mind-vajra holder, which is the best of all families.

original: mi bskyod pa zhes pa ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes mngon du mdzad pas na bdud bzhis mi phyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa zhes pa ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes mngon du mdzad pas na bdud bzhis mi phyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Akshobhya is so called because he has realized the gnosis of the expanse of reality and is therefore indivisible by the four devils.

original: yang na mngon spyod kyi las la nus pa ma nyams pas na mi bskyod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na mngon spyod kyi las la nus pa ma nyams pas na mi bskyod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Or else, he is called Akshobhya because his activity of wrath is unimpaired.

original: bshad ma thag pa'i don zhes pa ni yul lnga nye bar spyod pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i don zhes pa ni yul lnga nye bar spyod pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The meaning just explained is the characteristic of enjoying the five objects.

original: bsdus nas ston pa ni mdor bstan nas bshad pa'o //
analyzed: bsdus nas ston pa ni mdor bstan nas bshad pa'o //
translated: The concise teaching is the explanation after the brief teaching.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rang bzhin yin te de la phyi rol du snang ba'i gzugs ni rags pa nyid du snang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rang bzhin yin te de la phyi rol du snang ba'i gzugs ni rags pa nyid du snang ngo //
translated: Thus, etc. means that form, etc. are the nature of the five Tathagatas, Vairochana, etc. There, form, appearing externally, appears as gross.

original: de las gzhan sgra la sogs pa ni phra ba nyid du snang ngo //
analyzed: de las gzhan sgra la sogs pa ni phra ba nyid du snang ngo //
translated: Sound, etc., other than that, appear as subtle.

original: de bzhin du me long lta bu la sogs pa'i ye shes rnams kyang @262b rags pa dang phra ba nyid dang gong nas gong gi rim pas snang bar 'gyur bas gzugs la sogs pa rnam par snang mdzad kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du me long lta bu la sogs pa'i ye shes rnams kyang @262b rags pa dang phra ba nyid dang gong nas gong gi rim pas snang bar 'gyur bas gzugs la sogs pa rnam par snang mdzad kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Similarly, the mirror-like, etc. intuitions appear as gross and subtle, in order from above downward, because form, etc. are the nature of Vairochana, etc.

original: de rnams la zhes pa ni rgyu de las gzugs la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: de rnams la zhes pa ni rgyu de las gzugs la sogs pa la'o //
translated: In them, etc. means in form, etc. from that cause.

original: nyin dang mtshan zhes pa ni des rnal 'byor pa la don med pa'i skad cig ma yang bkag ste yun rings dang bar chad med pa dang dad pas bsten nas bstan par 'gyur ro zhes 'byung bas so //
analyzed: nyin dang mtshan zhes pa ni des rnal 'byor pa la don med pa'i skad cig ma yang bkag ste yun rings dang bar chad med pa dang dad pas bsten nas bstan par 'gyur ro zhes 'byung bas so //
translated: Day and night means that it is also a negation of a moment that is meaningless for the yogi/nī, because it is said that [the guru] teaches after a long time, without interruption, and with devotion.

original: yid la byed pa ni lhag par mos pa de bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa ni lhag par mos pa de bskyed par bya'o //
translated: Attention is that special attention that arises from the branches of withdrawal and meditative concentration.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas phan yon bstan te /
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas phan yon bstan te /
translated: This and so forth indicate the benefits.

original: sems bskyed pa zhes pa ni so sor sdud pa dang bsam gtan dag gi yan lag dag las 'byung ba'i yid la byed pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa zhes pa ni so sor sdud pa dang bsam gtan dag gi yan lag dag las 'byung ba'i yid la byed pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: The arising of the mind is a special attention that arises from the branches of withdrawal and meditative concentration.

original: sba bar gyur pa zhes pa ni zhal gyi man ngag gi rgyud la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: sba bar gyur pa zhes pa ni zhal gyi man ngag gi rgyud la gnas pa'o //
translated: Concealed means that it is found in the oral lineage.

original: sangs rgyas kyi 'bras bu thob par byed pas ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pas thob par bya ba dpal rdo rje 'chang gi go 'phang thob par byed pas so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi 'bras bu thob par byed pas ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pas thob par bya ba dpal rdo rje 'chang gi go 'phang thob par byed pas so //
translated: It causes the attainment of the result of buddhahood because it causes the attainment of the state of glorious Vajradhara, which is to be attained by means of the stage of union.

original: de nyid snying po btus pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid snying po btus pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That is called the essence extracted.

original: thabs kyi rang bzhin du zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rigs kyi ngo bos so //
analyzed: thabs kyi rang bzhin du zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rigs kyi ngo bos so //
translated: “In the nature of means” means by the nature of the five Tathagata families, Vairochana, etc.

original: spyan ma la sogs pa shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid du zhes pa ni stong pa bzhi'i rang bzhin gyi rigs kyi yum bzhi'i ngo bos so //
analyzed: spyan ma la sogs pa shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid du zhes pa ni stong pa bzhi'i rang bzhin gyi rigs kyi yum bzhi'i ngo bos so //
translated: “In the nature of wisdom” means by the nature of the four mothers of the families, Lochana, etc., which are the nature of the four emptinesses.

original: yongs su gyur pa zhes pa ni des byin gyis brlab pa nyid do //
analyzed: yongs su gyur pa zhes pa ni des byin gyis brlab pa nyid do //
translated: “Transformation” means consecration by them.

original: 'dir ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes ni gcig ste dbyer med pa gcad du med pa mi 'jigs pa nyid bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes ni gcig ste dbyer med pa gcad du med pa mi 'jigs pa nyid bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: Here, the gnosis of the Dharmadhatu is one, indivisible, undifferentiated, fearless, the Blessed One Vajrasattva.

original: des ni gzhan rnams yongs su gzung ba'i phyir rnam pa gnyis su snang ste /
analyzed: des ni gzhan rnams yongs su gzung ba'i phyir rnam pa gnyis su snang ste /
translated: It appears as two, in order to embrace the others.

original: de la rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs kyis thabs kyi ngo bo ste pho'i rtags ltar snang ngo //
analyzed: de la rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs kyis thabs kyi ngo bo ste pho'i rtags ltar snang ngo //
translated: Therein, by the form of the Tathagatas, Vairochana, etc., it appears as means, as the male gender.

original: spyan ma la sogs pa rigs kyi yum bzhi'i gzugs kyis shes rab kyi ngo bo ste /
analyzed: spyan ma la sogs pa rigs kyi yum bzhi'i gzugs kyis shes rab kyi ngo bo ste /
translated: The nature of wisdom is the four mothers of the families, Lochana and so on,

original: mo'i rtags ltar snang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mo'i rtags ltar snang bar 'gyur te /
translated: appearing as the female gender.

original: snying rje chen po dang stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir dang / chos kyi dbyings ni cha gnyis kas thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snying rje chen po dang stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir dang / chos kyi dbyings ni cha gnyis kas thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they are the nature of great compassion and emptiness, and the realm of reality is attained by both aspects.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: chos kyi dbyings la dbyer med phyir //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la dbyer med phyir //
translated: Since there is no division in the realm of reality,

original: rigs kyi dbye ba mi 'thad de //🔽brten pa'i chos kyis dbye ba yis //
analyzed: rigs kyi dbye ba mi 'thad de // brten pa'i chos kyis dbye ba yis //
translated: the division of families is not tenable.🔽But the division of the families

original: de yi dbye ba rab tu bshad //🔽ces 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de yi dbye ba rab tu bshad // ces 'byung ngo //
translated: is explained by the division of the phenomena they support.

original: rgyud phyi ma las kyang //
analyzed: rgyud phyi ma las kyang //
translated: And the Later Tantra says:

original: gang zhig shes rab dngos med de //
analyzed: gang zhig shes rab dngos med de //
translated: Wisdom is the absence of entity

original: thabs ni dngos po'i mtshan nyid do //🔽thabs dang shes @263a * //
analyzed: thabs ni dngos po'i mtshan nyid do // thabs dang shes @263a * //
translated: and method is the characteristic of entity.

original: rab snyoms 'jug pa //🔽rnal 'byor zhes ni mngon par brjod //
analyzed: rab snyoms 'jug pa // rnal 'byor zhes ni mngon par brjod //
translated: The union of method and wisdom

original: ces 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ces 'byung ngo //
translated: is called yoga.

original: phyogs gzhan ston par byed pa'i tshig phrang ces pa ni shes rab kyi phyogs ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs gzhan ston par byed pa'i tshig phrang ces pa ni shes rab kyi phyogs ston par byed pa'o //
translated: The line “The other side is the path of wisdom” means that wisdom is the path.

original: shes rab ni rigs kyi yum rnams las gang yang rung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab ni rigs kyi yum rnams las gang yang rung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Wisdom is any of the mothers of the families.

original: gzugs rdo rje la sogs par rigs kyi dbye bas zhes pa ni de'i sprul pa'i rang bzhin yin pas so //
analyzed: gzugs rdo rje la sogs par rigs kyi dbye bas zhes pa ni de'i sprul pa'i rang bzhin yin pas so //
translated: The division of the families is from Rupavajra and so forth, because they are the nature of his emanations.

original: rigs kyi dbye bas zhes pa ni yul rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo yin pas so //
analyzed: rigs kyi dbye bas zhes pa ni yul rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo yin pas so //
translated: The division of the families is from the nature of the pure objects.

original: gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa rigs lnga las byung ba zhes pa ni mchod pa'i lha mo dang byang chub sems dpa' dang / khro bo'i mtha'i bar du dbang po la sogs pa rnam par dag par byed pa de rnams kyis so //
analyzed: gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa rigs lnga las byung ba zhes pa ni mchod pa'i lha mo dang byang chub sems dpa' dang / khro bo'i mtha'i bar du dbang po la sogs pa rnam par dag par byed pa de rnams kyis so //
translated: The arising from the five families of Rupavajra and so forth is from those who purify the sense faculties, up to the goddesses of offering, the bodhisattvas, and the wrathful ones.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen por dmigs par byed de zhes pa ni ji ltar mos pas gzugs la sogs pa spyod cing yan lag drug gi rnal 'byor yongs su rdzogs nas dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i go 'phang thob par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa sbyor ba thams
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen por dmigs par byed de zhes pa ni ji ltar mos pas gzugs la sogs pa spyod cing yan lag drug gi rnal 'byor yongs su rdzogs nas dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i go 'phang thob par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa sbyor ba thams
translated: One visualizes as Great Vajradhara, because one should practice with form and so forth, according to one's devotion, and having completed the yoga of the six branches, one should attain the state of glorious Vajrasattva.

original: cad la ni sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: cad la ni sngar bshad zin to //
translated: All of the applications have been explained previously.

original: spyi'i don to zhes pa ni mdo sde pa la sogs pa'i 'gyod pa zlog par byed pa dang / bskyed pa'i rim pa bstan pas so //
analyzed: spyi'i don to zhes pa ni mdo sde pa la sogs pa'i 'gyod pa zlog par byed pa dang / bskyed pa'i rim pa bstan pas so //
translated: The general meaning is that it is the dispeller of the remorse of the Sautrantikas, etc., and it is the teaching of the stage of generation.

original: spros pa dang bcas pa'i spyod pa'o zhes pa ni chags pa la sogs pa'i rol pa rgya che ba'i don dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: spros pa dang bcas pa'i spyod pa'o zhes pa ni chags pa la sogs pa'i rol pa rgya che ba'i don dang ldan pas so //
