translated: The conduct with elaboration is the one that has the meaning of the extensive play of passion, etc.

original: yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i dbye bas rnam pa gsum zhes pa ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang btang snyoms kyi dbye bas gsum mo //
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i dbye bas rnam pa gsum zhes pa ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang btang snyoms kyi dbye bas gsum mo //
translated: The three kinds are the pleasant, unpleasant, and neutral, which are the three kinds of feelings, pleasure, pain, and indifference.

original: snang ba ni phyi rol du gzugs su snang bas na snang ba gsum ste rnam par shes pa gsum mo //
analyzed: snang ba ni phyi rol du gzugs su snang bas na snang ba gsum ste rnam par shes pa gsum mo //
translated: The three appearances are the three consciousnesses, because they appear externally as forms.

original: de las byung ba ni zhes pa ni sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de las byung ba ni zhes pa ni sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The three feelings arise from those.🔽The three feelings arise from those three appearances.

original: chags pa dang chags pa dang bral ba dang btang snyoms kyi rang bzhin rnams kyi zhes pa ni nyin mo dang mtshan mor brgya drug cu'i rang bzhin gyis so //
analyzed: chags pa dang chags pa dang bral ba dang btang snyoms kyi rang bzhin rnams kyi zhes pa ni nyin mo dang mtshan mor brgya drug cu'i rang bzhin gyis so //
translated: The nature of attachment, detachment, and equanimity, means that by the nature of one hundred and sixty [moments] during the day and night.

original: yul zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rang bzhin de rnams kyis phyi rol gyi ngo bor snang ba gzugs la sogs pa gang yin pa rnams mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pas nyams su myong zhing /
analyzed: yul zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rang bzhin de rnams kyis phyi rol gyi ngo bor snang ba gzugs la sogs pa gang yin pa rnams mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pas nyams su myong zhing /
translated: By the word object, etc., it is taught that the nature of those [moments] is the appearance as external entities, such as form, etc., which are experienced by the eye consciousness, etc.

original: rnam par shes pa gsum las byung ba'i chags pa dang bral ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi ngo bo yul de dag yin no zhes mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pas nyams su myong zhing mchod par bya zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gsum las byung ba'i chags pa dang bral ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi ngo bo yul de dag yin no zhes mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pas nyams su myong zhing mchod par bya zhes bstan to //
translated: Those objects are the nature of attachment, detachment, and equanimity, which arise from the three consciousnesses.

original: mchod pa dang len pa nye bar mtshon pa'i zhes pa ni bya ba'i stobs kyis @263b byed pa po dang las ni mchod par bya ba dang mchod par byed pa dag mchog tu 'dzin no //
analyzed: mchod pa dang len pa nye bar mtshon pa'i zhes pa ni bya ba'i stobs kyis @263b byed pa po dang las ni mchod par bya ba dang mchod par byed pa dag mchog tu 'dzin no //
translated: The word 'offering' is a metaphor for the act of offering. By the power of the verb, the agent and object are conceived as the one to be offered to and the one who offers.

original: rnal 'byor pas bdag nyid la zhes pa ni /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas bdag nyid la zhes pa ni /
translated: The yogi should worship himself.

original: bdag nyid sangs rgyas kun nyid do //
analyzed: bdag nyid sangs rgyas kun nyid do //
translated: He is the nature of all Buddhas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' kun rang bzhin //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' kun rang bzhin //
translated: the nature of all Bodhisattvas.

original: de phyir 'bad pa thams cad kyis //
analyzed: de phyir 'bad pa thams cad kyis //
translated: Therefore, with all effort,

original: rang gi bdag nyid mchod par bya //🔽zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid mchod par bya // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: he should worship his own nature.

original: brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i bdag nyid ces pa ni sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten gnyi ga'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i bdag nyid ces pa ni sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten gnyi ga'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of the animate and inanimate is the nature of both the sentient and inanimate worlds.

original: rigs thams cad kyi bdag nyid can zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i sku'i rigs kyi bdag nyid ces bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: rigs thams cad kyi bdag nyid can zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i sku'i rigs kyi bdag nyid ces bya ba'i don te /
translated: The nature of all families means the nature of the family of the body of Vairochana and so forth,

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po ni rigs thams cad kyi bskyed pa'i rgyu yin pas so //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po ni rigs thams cad kyi bskyed pa'i rgyu yin pas so //
translated: because Great Vajradhara is the cause of the generation of all families.

original: mgon po sangs rgyas kun bdag nyid //🔽ces 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mgon po sangs rgyas kun bdag nyid // ces 'byung ngo //
translated: The Lord is the nature of all Buddhas.

original: gang du thim par gyur pa zhes pa ni skad kyi byings nye bar bsdus pa yin na yang don du ma yin pas bskyed pa'i don du 'jug go //
analyzed: gang du thim par gyur pa zhes pa ni skad kyi byings nye bar bsdus pa yin na yang don du ma yin pas bskyed pa'i don du 'jug go //
translated: The meaning of “dissolves into” is the verbal root “sam” which is included in the collection of roots, but since it does not have many meanings, it is used in the sense of generation.

original: des na rnam par snang mdzad kyi gzhi ni rnam par snang mdzad bskyed par mdzad pa zhes ston to //
analyzed: des na rnam par snang mdzad kyi gzhi ni rnam par snang mdzad bskyed par mdzad pa zhes ston to //
translated: Therefore, the basis of Vairocana is the one who generates Vairocana.

original: tshogs gnyis dang ldan pa zhes pa ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs gtso bor gyur par rim pa gnyis ston par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: tshogs gnyis dang ldan pa zhes pa ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs gtso bor gyur par rim pa gnyis ston par mdzad pa'o //
translated: Endowed with the two accumulations refers to the two stages, which are primarily the accumulations of merit and knowledge.

original: de nyid rnal 'byor pa zhes pa'o zhes pa ni 'od gsal bas ye shes gsum spangs nas rdo rje 'chang ba nyid du thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro//
analyzed: de nyid rnal 'byor pa zhes pa'o zhes pa ni 'od gsal bas ye shes gsum spangs nas rdo rje 'chang ba nyid du thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro//
translated: That itself is the yogi/ni, because by means of clear light, one attains the state of Vajradhara, having abandoned the three exalted wisdoms.

original: shes rab dang thabs nye bar thob pa rnams la 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang nyon mongs pa can gyi rnam par shes pa dang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang de las byung ba'i rang bzhin rnams la dbul bar bya ba ni de'i ngo bo nyid
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs nye bar thob pa rnams la 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang nyon mongs pa can gyi rnam par shes pa dang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang de las byung ba'i rang bzhin rnams la dbul bar bya ba ni de'i ngo bo nyid
translated: The consciousnesses of engagement, the afflicted consciousness, and the consciousness of the ground, which arise from that, are to be offered to those who have attained wisdom and method.

original: du bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: du bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: They should be gathered into the nature of those.

original: rin chen 'byung gnas gtso zhes pa ni brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i bdag nyid can gyi 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: rin chen 'byung gnas gtso zhes pa ni brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i bdag nyid can gyi 'gro ba'o //
translated: The source of jewels is the chief, which is the migrating beings who are the nature of the animate and inanimate.

original: 'di las rin po che rnams 'byung bas na zhes pa ni de dag gang las byung ba de ni rin chen 'byung gnas gtso bo ste /
analyzed: 'di las rin po che rnams 'byung bas na zhes pa ni de dag gang las byung ba de ni rin chen 'byung gnas gtso bo ste /
translated: Since jewels are produced from it, it is the chief source of jewels.

original: 'od gsal ba'i bdag nyid rdo rje 'chang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba'i bdag nyid rdo rje 'chang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the term is “Vajradhara, whose nature is clear light.”

original: de nyid kyi phyir sna tshogs kyi bdag nyid rdo rje 'chang chen po zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sna tshogs kyi bdag nyid rdo rje 'chang chen po zhes bstan to //
translated: For that very reason, it is taught to be “the nature of the Great Vajradhara.”

original: des ni thams cad 'di khyab ste //
analyzed: des ni thams cad 'di khyab ste //
translated: It pervades everything,

original: til mar gyis ni til sogs bzhin //
analyzed: til mar gyis ni til sogs bzhin //
translated: like sesame seeds with oil.

original: zhes rdo rje sa 'og las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes rdo rje sa 'og las 'byung ngo //
translated: This is from the Vajra Underground Tantra.

original: rnam par shes pa gsum gyi bdag nyid can zhes pa la de rnams nye bar bsdu bar byed pa 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid kyi bdag nyid can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gsum gyi bdag nyid can zhes pa la de rnams nye bar bsdu bar byed pa 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid kyi bdag nyid can zhes bya'o //
translated: The meaning of “whose nature is the three consciousnesses” is “whose nature is the reality of clear light, which is the subsuming of those three.”

original: rnal 'byor can de nyid do zhes pa ni dbyer med pa nyid du @264a * //
analyzed: rnal 'byor can de nyid do zhes pa ni dbyer med pa nyid du @264a * //
translated: “That very reality of the yogi” teaches that they are inseparable.

original: bstan to // snang ba la sogs pa dbul bar bya'o zhes pa ni /
analyzed: bstan to // snang ba la sogs pa dbul bar bya'o zhes pa ni /
translated: “The offerings of appearance and so forth” are

original: snang ba dang snang ba mched pa dang snang ba nye bar thob pa ni zla ba dang nyi ma dang mtshams kyi snang ba rnams de'i bdag nyid du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: snang ba dang snang ba mched pa dang snang ba nye bar thob pa ni zla ba dang nyi ma dang mtshams kyi snang ba rnams de'i bdag nyid du shes par bya'o //
translated: The light, the light-increase, and the light-attainment should be known as the nature of the appearances of the moon, sun, and the horizon.

original: 'dod chags rnam par dag par byed pas na 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags rnam par dag par byed pas na 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: It is Amitābha, because it purifies passion.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po zhes pa ni de las byung ba dang der bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po zhes pa ni de las byung ba dang der bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Mahāvajradhara is so called because it arises from that and is included in that.

original: de bskyed pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis 'chang bar mdzad pas na zhes pa ni spro ba dang bsdu ba'i rang bzhin de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de bskyed pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis 'chang bar mdzad pas na zhes pa ni spro ba dang bsdu ba'i rang bzhin de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: It is held by him, because he has the nature of generating that. That is to say, he is so called because he has the nature of emitting and gathering.

original: bdag nyid la dbul bar bya'o zhes pa ni bdag nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rigs kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid la dbul bar bya'o zhes pa ni bdag nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rigs kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It should be offered to oneself, because oneself is the nature of the family of all tathāgatas.

original: bdag nyid sangs rgyas thams cad nyid //
analyzed: bdag nyid sangs rgyas thams cad nyid //
translated: One is all buddhas.

original: ces 'byung bas so //🔽kun du kun nas thams cad ni //
analyzed: ces 'byung bas so // kun du kun nas thams cad ni //
translated: This is stated.🔽Everywhere, in every way,

original: kun ngo rnam pa kun bdag nyid //
analyzed: kun ngo rnam pa kun bdag nyid //
translated: in every respect, in every manner,

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi rang bzhin grub //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi rang bzhin grub //
translated: The nature of all buddhas is accomplished.

original: rang gi bdag nyid des mthong ngo //🔽zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid des mthong ngo // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: One sees it by oneself.

original: mi bskyod par snang ba zhes pa ni rnal 'byor pa de'i rnam pas snang ba'o //
analyzed: mi bskyod par snang ba zhes pa ni rnal 'byor pa de'i rnam pas snang ba'o //
translated: The appearance of Akshobhya is the appearance of that yogin.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po de nyid do zhes pa ni dbyer med pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po de nyid do zhes pa ni dbyer med pa bstan pa'o //
translated: That is Great Vajradhara himself is the teaching of non-differentiation.

original: bshad ma thag pa'i don gnyis gsal bar ston pa yin te zhes pa ni spros par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i don gnyis gsal bar ston pa yin te zhes pa ni spros par bshad pa'o //
translated: It is the clear teaching of the two topics just explained is the elaboration.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i skad cig ma med par zhes pa ni /🔽gang zhig 'das pa de med pa //🔽ma 'ongs pa ni ma byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i skad cig ma med par zhes pa ni / gang zhig 'das pa de med pa // ma 'ongs pa ni ma byung ba'o //
translated: Without past and future moments is

original: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is explained:🔽What is past does not exist.🔽The future has not yet come.🔽The present moment is

original: da ltar gyi skad cig mas zhes pa ni de ltar byung ba skad cig ma dang yud tsam dang thang cig la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: da ltar gyi skad cig mas zhes pa ni de ltar byung ba skad cig ma dang yud tsam dang thang cig la sogs pa'o //
translated: the arising of that, such as a moment, a second, a minute, and so on.🔽A moment, a second, a minute,

original: skad cig thang cig yud tsam dang // mig btsums thal mo sbyar ba ste //
analyzed: skad cig thang cig yud tsam dang // mig btsums thal mo sbyar ba ste //
translated: blinking, and clapping the hands,

original: skad cig se gol gtogs pa tsam //
analyzed: skad cig se gol gtogs pa tsam //
translated: a moment is the time of a finger snap.

original: thang cig yungs kar bskor ba tsam //
analyzed: thang cig yungs kar bskor ba tsam //
translated: The time of a moment is the time it takes to blink the eye.

original: yud tsam dbugs rngub 'byung ba ste //🔽mig btsums mig ni 'dzums pa'i bar //🔽lag gnyis thal mo sbyar ba ste //
analyzed: yud tsam dbugs rngub 'byung ba ste // mig btsums mig ni 'dzums pa'i bar // lag gnyis thal mo sbyar ba ste //
translated: The time of a second is the time it takes to breathe in and out.🔽The time of a minute is the time it takes to blink the eye twice.

original: skad cig ma sogs mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: skad cig ma sogs mtshan nyid do //
translated: The time of a hand is the time it takes to clap the hands together.🔽The time of an instant is the time it takes to snap the fingers.

original: de rnams gang yang rung ba la skad cig ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams gang yang rung ba la skad cig ma zhes bya'o //
translated: Any one of these is called a moment.

original: rnam par shes pa gsum la sbyor bar bya'o zhes pa ni snang ba la sogs pa ye shes gsum yongs su spangs nas 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gsum la sbyor bar bya'o zhes pa ni snang ba la sogs pa ye shes gsum yongs su spangs nas 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin du bya'o //
translated: One should apply the three consciousnesses means that one should abandon the three wisdoms of appearance and so on and make them the nature of clear light.

original: gzugs la sogs pa sems nyid du shes par bya'o zhes pa ni gzugs la sogs pa phyi rol gyi yul lnga gang yin pa de rnams ni rang gi snang ba med pas kun gzhi la sogs pa rnam par shes pa gsum gyi ngo bo nyid do //🔽de rnams kyi rang @264b bzhin yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa sems nyid du shes par bya'o zhes pa ni gzugs la sogs pa phyi rol gyi yul lnga gang yin pa de rnams ni rang gi snang ba med pas kun gzhi la sogs pa rnam par shes pa gsum gyi ngo bo nyid do // de rnams kyi rang @264b bzhin yod pa ma yin te /
translated: One should know that form and so on is mind means that whatever the five external objects of form and so on are, they are the nature of the three consciousnesses, such as the foundation consciousness, because they do not exist as one’s own appearance.

original: gcig dang du ma dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig dang du ma dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Their nature does not exist because they are free from one and many.

original: bdag dang chos rnams nyer brtags pa //
analyzed: bdag dang chos rnams nyer brtags pa //
translated: The self and phenomena are thoroughly examined.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs gang zhig 'jug //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs gang zhig 'jug //
translated: What is engaged in various aspects?

original: rnam par shes pa yongs gyur te //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yongs gyur te //
translated: Consciousness is transformed.

original: 'gyur ba de yang rnam gsum yin //🔽rnam par smin dang yid dang ni //
analyzed: 'gyur ba de yang rnam gsum yin // rnam par smin dang yid dang ni //
translated: That transformation is threefold.🔽Maturation, mental,

original: yul ni rnam par rig pa'o //
analyzed: yul ni rnam par rig pa'o //
translated: and the perception of objects.

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,

original: gcig ni rnam pa gnyis snang ba //
analyzed: gcig ni rnam pa gnyis snang ba //
translated: one appears as two.

original: sems ni rnam par 'khrul pa can //
analyzed: sems ni rnam par 'khrul pa can //
translated: The mind is mistaken.

original: gzung ba 'dzin pa'i dbye ba yis //
analyzed: gzung ba 'dzin pa'i dbye ba yis //
translated: By the division of apprehended and apprehender,

original: ji ltar shin tu mkhas pa yin //
analyzed: ji ltar shin tu mkhas pa yin //
translated: how is it very skilled?

original: dbyer med pa yang tha dad pas //
analyzed: dbyer med pa yang tha dad pas //
translated: Also, the indivisible is differentiated.🔽The external name and external object,

original: phyir 'gro ming dang phyi rol dang // yul gyi rnam pa dri ma can //
analyzed: phyir 'gro ming dang phyi rol dang // yul gyi rnam pa dri ma can //
translated: the aspect of the object is defiled.

original: sems ni rnam pa du mar snang //
analyzed: sems ni rnam pa du mar snang //
translated: The mind appears in many aspects.

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: dgongs so zhes pa ni dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: dgongs so zhes pa ni dgongs pa'o //
translated: Intentionally means with intention.

original: 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pas phan yon bstan pa bya ste /
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pas phan yon bstan pa bya ste /
translated: The benefits are taught by this and so on.

original: bshad ma thag pa nyid yongs su shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam par shes pa gsum gyi bdag nyid kyi gzugs la sogs pa'i yul gyi tshogs zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa nyid yongs su shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam par shes pa gsum gyi bdag nyid kyi gzugs la sogs pa'i yul gyi tshogs zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “the collection of objects such as form, etc., which is the nature of the three consciousnesses” is that which was just explained as “thoroughly known,” etc.

original: rin po che lta bu'i gang zag rnams la sbyin par bya ba yin gyi zhes pa ni dbang po rno ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rin po che lta bu'i gang zag rnams la sbyin par bya ba yin gyi zhes pa ni dbang po rno ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “It should be given to those who are like jewels” means that it should be given to those who are of sharp faculties.

original: tsandan lta bu la sogs pa rnams la bstan par bya ba ma yin pas na zhes pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pa tsam de rnams kyi yul yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: tsandan lta bu la sogs pa rnams la bstan par bya ba ma yin pas na zhes pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pa tsam de rnams kyi yul yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: “It should not be taught to those who are like sandalwood, etc.,” means that the stage of generation is the domain of those.

original: yang dag pa zhes pa ni ji lta ba bzhin du'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa zhes pa ni ji lta ba bzhin du'o //
translated: “Correctly” means “as it is.”

original: blangs nas bsags shing zhes pa ni bshad pa'i rgyud la sogs pa las btus te rdzogs pa'i rim pa nyid kyis bsag par bya ba zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: blangs nas bsags shing zhes pa ni bshad pa'i rgyud la sogs pa las btus te rdzogs pa'i rim pa nyid kyis bsag par bya ba zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Having taken it up, it should be collected” means that it should be collected by the stage of completion, having been extracted from the explanatory tantras, etc.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says:

original: dus gsum du bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams te zhes pa ni snying por gyur pa'i chos kyi dbyings rtogs par gyur bas so //
analyzed: dus gsum du bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams te zhes pa ni snying por gyur pa'i chos kyi dbyings rtogs par gyur bas so //
translated: The Tathagatas dwelling in the three times are the ones who have realized the essence, the realm of phenomena.

original: yang na yang dag pa'i ye shes gang la yod pa de la 'di skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: yang na yang dag pa'i ye shes gang la yod pa de la 'di skad ces bya'o //
translated: Or else, he who has right wisdom is so-called.

original: bshad ma thag pa'i tshul lo zhes pa ni sems rnam par dben pa'i rim pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i tshul lo zhes pa ni sems rnam par dben pa'i rim pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The method just explained is the characteristic of the stage of mind isolation.

original: sngags pas te yan lag ma nyams par bzlas pas zhes pa ni rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa'i mthar thob nas sems la dmigs pa bsgom par 'dod pas so //
analyzed: sngags pas te yan lag ma nyams par bzlas pas zhes pa ni rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa'i mthar thob nas sems la dmigs pa bsgom par 'dod pas so //
translated: The mantra practitioner, who has recited without loss of limbs, who has attained the stage of vajra repetition, and who wishes to cultivate the meditation of mind observation,

original: rdo rje bzlas nas rnal 'byor pas //
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas nas rnal 'byor pas //
translated: the yogi/nī, having attained the stage of vajra repetition,

original: sems la dmigs pa thob par 'gyur //🔽zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sems la dmigs pa thob par 'gyur // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: will attain the observation of mind.

original: rnam pa gsum ni sngar bshad zin pas so //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum ni sngar bshad zin pas so //
translated: The three aspects have been explained previously.

original: ye shes gsum du shes par bya'o zhes pa ni dag par 'gyur na de nyid lha'i rnam pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes gsum du shes par bya'o zhes pa ni dag par 'gyur na de nyid lha'i rnam pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: The three wisdoms should be known means that when they are purified, they become the very aspect of the deity.

original: @265a * // rang bzhin gyi dbye ba nyid ni de'i sems las byung ba'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: @265a * // rang bzhin gyi dbye ba nyid ni de'i sems las byung ba'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The division of their natures is the form of their mental events.

original: rigs te zhes pa ni nyon mongs pa'i bag chags dang ldan pa'i sems kyi chos rnams so //
analyzed: rigs te zhes pa ni nyon mongs pa'i bag chags dang ldan pa'i sems kyi chos rnams so //
translated: The “families” are the phenomena of the mind endowed with the habitual tendencies of the afflictions.

original: chags pa zhes pa ni thabs kyi rang bzhin bzhi bcu ste nyon mongs pa can gyi yid las byung ba'o //
analyzed: chags pa zhes pa ni thabs kyi rang bzhin bzhi bcu ste nyon mongs pa can gyi yid las byung ba'o //
translated: “ Attachment” is the forty phenomena of the nature of method, which arise from the afflicted mind.

original: chags pa dang bral ba ni shes rab kyi rang bzhin sum cu rtsa gsum ste 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa las 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: chags pa dang bral ba ni shes rab kyi rang bzhin sum cu rtsa gsum ste 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa las 'byung ba'o //
translated: “ Freedom from attachment” is the thirty-three phenomena of the nature of wisdom, which arise from the consciousness of the ground of all.

original: chags pa bar ma ni shes rab dang thabs snyoms par zhugs pa las byung ba rang bzhin bdun te kun gzhi las 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: chags pa bar ma ni shes rab dang thabs snyoms par zhugs pa las byung ba rang bzhin bdun te kun gzhi las 'byung ba'o //
translated: “ Intermediate attachment” is the seven phenomena that arise from the union of wisdom and method, which arise from the all-base.

original: rang bzhin zhes pa ni sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: rang bzhin zhes pa ni sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //
translated: “ Nature” refers to the mental events.

original: de rnams kyi dbye ba ni khyad par rnams kyi tshul la zhes pa ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa la sogs pa'i dbye ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de rnams kyi dbye ba ni khyad par rnams kyi tshul la zhes pa ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa la sogs pa'i dbye ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The division of those is the mode of the distinctions, which is the characteristic of the division of virtue, nonvirtue, indeterminate, and so on.

original: de ni 'di skad ces bya ba la sogs pa phyi rol gyi rnam pa nyid du gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams snang ba gang yin par dman pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas nye bar mtshon pa de dag rnam par shes pa gsum gyi rgyu can rang bzhin
analyzed: de ni 'di skad ces bya ba la sogs pa phyi rol gyi rnam pa nyid du gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams snang ba gang yin par dman pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas nye bar mtshon pa de dag rnam par shes pa gsum gyi rgyu can rang bzhin
translated: That is this and so on. The appearance of external forms and so on, which are illustrated by the division of inferior and so on, are ascertained to be the nature of the one hundred and sixty natures of the three consciousnesses.

original: brgya drug cu'i ngo bo yin no zhes nges par byas la de rnams kyi 'od gsal ba nyid rang bzhin yin no zhes sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas de dag sbyangs la 'od gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid du shes par bya'o ;
analyzed: brgya drug cu'i ngo bo yin no zhes nges par byas la de rnams kyi 'od gsal ba nyid rang bzhin yin no zhes sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas de dag sbyangs la 'od gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid du shes par bya'o ;
translated: Their clear light is the nature. Having refined them by means of the stage of mantra and mudra, they should be understood to be the nature of clear light.

original: / sbas pa zhes pa ni ye shes gsum rnam par spyod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don bstan pas so //
analyzed: / sbas pa zhes pa ni ye shes gsum rnam par spyod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don bstan pas so //
translated: The hidden is taught by the meaning of the characteristic of the three exalted wisdoms.

original: 'di ni spros pa med pa'i spyod pa'o zhes pa la sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa sgom par byed pa'i rnal 'byor pas ji ltar rnyed pa'i spyod pa'i don bstan pas so //
analyzed: 'di ni spros pa med pa'i spyod pa'o zhes pa la sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa sgom par byed pa'i rnal 'byor pas ji ltar rnyed pa'i spyod pa'i don bstan pas so //
translated: The meaning of the conduct is taught by the yogi who meditates on the stage of the pure mind, as it is found.

original: mchog la sogs pa zhes pa la sogs pa ni yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba dang gnyis ka'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: mchog la sogs pa zhes pa la sogs pa ni yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba dang gnyis ka'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The supreme, etc., are the pleasant, unpleasant, and neutral.

original: snang ba gsum gyi ngo bo nyid du yongs su shes pa'o zhes pa ni sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas rnam par sbyangs nas 'od gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid du bya'o //
analyzed: snang ba gsum gyi ngo bo nyid du yongs su shes pa'o zhes pa ni sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas rnam par sbyangs nas 'od gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid du bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of the nature of the three appearances is the clear light nature, having been purified by the stage of mantra and seal.

original: rang bzhin shes pa'o zhes pa ni chags pa dang chags pa dang bral ba dang chags pa bar ma'i bsgom pa'i sgo nas chags pa la sogs pa de rnams kyi 'od gsal mngon du byed pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin shes pa'o zhes pa ni chags pa dang chags pa dang bral ba dang chags pa bar ma'i bsgom pa'i sgo nas chags pa la sogs pa de rnams kyi 'od gsal mngon du byed pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the nature is the clear light of those, passion, etc., by the door of the meditation of passion, separation from passion, and neutral passion.

original: 'od gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid du yongs su bstim pa ste zhes pa ni bde ba chen po'i ngo bo dang ro gcig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid du yongs su bstim pa ste zhes pa ni bde ba chen po'i ngo bo dang ro gcig par bya'o //
translated: One should dissolve into the essence of clear light, that is, one should make it of the same taste as the essence of great bliss.

original: 'di nyid ni bla na med pa'i mchod pa ste zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba la 'jug pa'i @265b mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'di nyid ni bla na med pa'i mchod pa ste zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba la 'jug pa'i @265b mtshan nyid do //
translated: This itself is the unexcelled worship, that is, the definition of entry into clear light.

original: de nyid kyi phyir le'u bcu bdun pa las /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir le'u bcu bdun pa las /
translated: For this very reason, in the seventeenth chapter,

original: rdo rje gsum mchog phyag mi bya //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum mchog phyag mi bya //
translated: it is said that one should not make obeisance to the three vajras,

original: zhes bya bas 'od gsal ba la 'jug pa'i dgongs pas phyi rol gyi phyag dang mchod pa la sogs pa bcom ldan 'das kyis dgag par gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya bas 'od gsal ba la 'jug pa'i dgongs pas phyi rol gyi phyag dang mchod pa la sogs pa bcom ldan 'das kyis dgag par gsungs so //
translated: with the intention of entering clear light, the Blessed One has prohibited external obeisance, worship, and so forth.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,🔽it is said that

original: sangs rgyas thams cad mnyes byed la //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad mnyes byed la //
translated: one should worship the one who pleases all the Buddhas,

original: de ni mchod pa chen por 'dod //
analyzed: de ni mchod pa chen por 'dod //
translated: and that is considered the great worship.🔽That itself is Great Vajradhara,

original: ces 'byung ngo //🔽de nyid rdo rje 'chang chen po ste zhes pa ni /
analyzed: ces 'byung ngo // de nyid rdo rje 'chang chen po ste zhes pa ni /
translated: it is said that

original: 'di ni rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor zhes //
analyzed: 'di ni rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor zhes //
translated: this is the perfect yoga,

original: rdo rje 'chang chen de nyid de //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen de nyid de //
translated: that itself is Great Vajradhara,

original: rnam pa thams cad mchog ldan pa //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mchog ldan pa //
translated: endowed with all supreme aspects.

original: de las kun mkhyen 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de las kun mkhyen 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: From that, the Omniscient One arises.

original: zhes bshad pas so //
analyzed: zhes bshad pas so //
translated: Thus it is explained.

original: de'i bskyed pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni rim pa bzhi pa la zung du 'jug pa'i rim pas rdo rje 'chang chen po 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i bskyed pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni rim pa bzhi pa la zung du 'jug pa'i rim pas rdo rje 'chang chen po 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the cause of its generation, in the fourth stage, the Great Vajradhara arises by means of the stage of union.🔽Thus, etc.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas sgra la sogs pa rnams kyang 'od gsal ba las nges par sbyar bar bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas sgra la sogs pa rnams kyang 'od gsal ba las nges par sbyar bar bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: The sounds, etc. are also to be applied to clear light.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i rgyud las zhes pa ni dgongs pa lung bstan pa las so //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i rgyud las zhes pa ni dgongs pa lung bstan pa las so //
translated: From the tantra as explained, etc.

original: nang ni rang gi rgyud la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: nang ni rang gi rgyud la gnas pa'o //
translated: The inner is located in one's own continuum.

original: phyi rol ni gzhan gyi rgyud la gnas pa dang / snod kyi 'jig rten la gnas pa ni gnyi ga zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyi rol ni gzhan gyi rgyud la gnas pa dang / snod kyi 'jig rten la gnas pa ni gnyi ga zhes bya'o //
translated: The outer is located in another's continuum and in the world receptacle. Both are called the outer.

original: de lta bu'i rnam pa gsum gyi gzugs la sogs pa mi dmigs pa ste gcig dang du ma dang bral ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam pa gsum gyi gzugs la sogs pa mi dmigs pa ste gcig dang du ma dang bral ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: The non-apprehension of forms, etc. of such a threefold type is because of being free from one and many.

original: / de bas na 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin du bya ba gang yin pa de ni lha rnams la dbul ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: / de bas na 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin du bya ba gang yin pa de ni lha rnams la dbul ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, that which is to be done as the nature of clear light is called the offering to the gods.

original: shin tu spros pa med pa'i spyod pa ste zhes pa ni ye shes kyi phyag rgya dang snyoms par 'jug pa la mngon par byang chub kyi sbyor bas spyod pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu spros pa med pa'i spyod pa ste zhes pa ni ye shes kyi phyag rgya dang snyoms par 'jug pa la mngon par byang chub kyi sbyor bas spyod pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The conduct of the extremely unelaborate mode is taught by the line the conduct of the unelaborate mode, which refers to the practice of the stage of generation by means of the union with the wisdom consort.

original: mthar thug pa'o zhes ni 'od gsal ba la 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don ston pas so //
analyzed: mthar thug pa'o zhes ni 'od gsal ba la 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don ston pas so //
translated: The ultimate is taught by the line the ultimate, which refers to the meaning of the characteristic of entering clear light.🔽 Now, the line the essence of all tantras and so forth teaches the essence of the two stages by means of the six recollections. The first stage is taught by the recollection of the buddhas, and the second stage is taught by the remaining five recollections. The first stage is taught by the recollection of the buddhas, and the second stage is taught by the remaining five recollections.🔽 The line the essence of all tantras and so forth teaches the essence of the two stages by means of the six recollections. The first stage is taught by the recollection of the buddhas, and the second stage is taught by the remaining five recollections. The first stage is taught by the recollection of the buddhas, and the second stage is taught by the remaining five recollections.

original: da ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas rjes su dran pa drug gi sgo nas rgyur thams cad kyi snying por gyur pa rim pa gnyis las gcig ni rigs brgya'i dbye ba'i bar dang / gnyis pa ni rim pa lnga pa'i mtshan nyid so sor bstan par bya ste gcig gi rjes su dran pa gcig gis bskyed pa'i rim pa lngas ni rim pa lnga bstan to //
analyzed: da ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas rjes su dran pa drug gi sgo nas rgyur thams cad kyi snying por gyur pa rim pa gnyis las gcig ni rigs brgya'i dbye ba'i bar dang / gnyis pa ni rim pa lnga pa'i mtshan nyid so sor bstan par bya ste gcig gi rjes su dran pa gcig gis bskyed pa'i rim pa lngas ni rim pa lnga bstan to //
translated: The line the essence of all tantras and so forth teaches the essence of the two stages by means of the six recollections. The first stage is taught by the recollection of the buddhas, and the second stage is taught by the remaining five recollections. The first stage is taught by the recollection of the buddhas, and the second stage is taught by the remaining five recollections.🔽 The line the essence of all tantras and so forth teaches the essence of the two stages by means of the six recollections. The first stage is taught by the recollection of the buddhas, and the second stage is taught by the remaining five recollections. The first stage is taught by the recollection of the buddhas, and the second stage is taught by the remaining five recollections.🔽 The line the essence of all tantras and so forth teaches the essence of the two stages by means of the six recollections. The first stage is taught by the recollection of the buddhas, and the second stage is taught by the remaining five recollections. The first stage is taught by the recollection of the buddhas, and the second stage is taught by the remaining five recollections.

original: rigs brgya'i dbye bas zhes pa ni sngar rgyas par bshad pas so //
analyzed: rigs brgya'i dbye bas zhes pa ni sngar rgyas par bshad pas so //
translated: The division into one hundred families is as explained above in detail.

original: lus rnam par dben pas byed pa zhes pa ni lus kyi cha cha'i dbye bas rigs lnga'i de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du rtogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: lus rnam par dben pas byed pa zhes pa ni lus kyi cha cha'i dbye bas rigs lnga'i de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du rtogs par byed pa'o //
translated: The performance by means of the isolation of the body means that one realizes the five Tathagatas by means of the division of the parts of the body.

original: @266a * // de nyid kyi phyir sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du rjes su dran pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: @266a * // de nyid kyi phyir sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du rjes su dran pa zhes bya'o //
translated: For that very reason, the recollection of the Buddha is called the recollection of the aggregates, elements, and sense-fields as the Tathagatas.

original: de bzhin du rdo rje bzlas pa mthar thug pa zhes pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po la sogs pa rnam pa bcu gcig gi rdo rje bzlas pa yongs su rdzogs nas so //
analyzed: de bzhin du rdo rje bzlas pa mthar thug pa zhes pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po la sogs pa rnam pa bcu gcig gi rdo rje bzlas pa yongs su rdzogs nas so //
translated: Similarly, after the completion of the vajra recitation means after the completion of the vajra recitation of the eleven aspects such as Great Vajradhara.

original: ngag rnam par 'byed pa ni nyon mongs pa'i ngag sbyang bas so //
analyzed: ngag rnam par 'byed pa ni nyon mongs pa'i ngag sbyang bas so //
translated: The differentiation of speech means the purification of the afflicted speech.

original: chos rjes su dran pa zhes pa ni a'a li dang k'a li'i rang bzhin gyi yi ge dang tshig dang ngag dang chen po la sogs pa'i dbye ba dang ldan pa'i ngag gi spros pa ni chos rnams so //
analyzed: chos rjes su dran pa zhes pa ni a'a li dang k'a li'i rang bzhin gyi yi ge dang tshig dang ngag dang chen po la sogs pa'i dbye ba dang ldan pa'i ngag gi spros pa ni chos rnams so //
translated: The mindfulness of Dharma is the proliferation of speech endowed with the divisions of letters, words, speech, and the great, which have the nature of the vowels and consonants.

original: rjes su dran pa ni de rnams kyi rang bzhin yongs su shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rjes su dran pa ni de rnams kyi rang bzhin yongs su shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: The mindfulness is the thorough knowledge of their nature.

original: rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa 'dis //
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa 'dis //
translated: By this stage of vajra repetition,

original: gsung gi rdo rje sgrub byed pa //
analyzed: gsung gi rdo rje sgrub byed pa //
translated: one accomplishes the vajra of speech.

original: ye shes gsum gyi dbye ba yis //🔽sems tsam la ni nges par sbyor //
analyzed: ye shes gsum gyi dbye ba yis // sems tsam la ni nges par sbyor //
translated: By the division of the three intuitions,

original: zhes 'byung bas so //
analyzed: zhes 'byung bas so //
translated: one is definitely joined to mind only.

original: rang bzhin snang ba'i rim gyis zhes pa ni //
analyzed: rang bzhin snang ba'i rim gyis zhes pa ni //
translated: By the stage of the appearance of the nature,

original: sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas nye bar bsdus pa'i rnam par shes pa gsum dang // de'i rang bzhin gyi chos bsgom pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas nye bar bsdus pa'i rnam par shes pa gsum dang // de'i rang bzhin gyi chos bsgom pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: by the stage of mantra and seal, one is joined to the three consciousnesses and their nature, by the cultivation of Dharma.

original: sems la rnam par rtog pa ni //
analyzed: sems la rnam par rtog pa ni //
translated: The conceptualization of mind

original: zhes pa la rnam par shes pa gsum po 'od gsal ba'i go 'phang la 'jug par byed pas so //
analyzed: zhes pa la rnam par shes pa gsum po 'od gsal ba'i go 'phang la 'jug par byed pas so //
translated: is the entry of the three consciousnesses into the state of clear light.

original: rdo rje rjes su dran pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje rjes su dran pa'o //
translated: is the recollection of the vajra.

original: zhes pa ni rdo rje ltar mi phyed pa gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi 'od gsal ba las rjes su dran pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rdo rje ltar mi phyed pa gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi 'od gsal ba las rjes su dran pa'o //
translated: This means that the recollection is from the clearlight natured nondual intuition which is like a vajra, indivisible.

original: snang ba la sogs pa ye shes gsum thob nas phyi nas 'od gsal ba mngon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snang ba la sogs pa ye shes gsum thob nas phyi nas 'od gsal ba mngon du 'gyur ro //
translated: After attaining the three intuitions, such as the appearance, etc., the clearlight manifests later.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid do zhes pa la rdul phra rab du ma tshogs pa'i bdag nyid yin pas so //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid do zhes pa la rdul phra rab du ma tshogs pa'i bdag nyid yin pas so //
translated: The body, speech, and mind are so called because they are the nature of a collection of many atoms.

original: ye shes gsum gyi ngo bo so sor yongs su shes pa'o zhes pa ni ye shes gsum gyi bdag nyid can ni lus la sogs pa yin no zhes lhag par mos pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes gsum gyi ngo bo so sor yongs su shes pa'o zhes pa ni ye shes gsum gyi bdag nyid can ni lus la sogs pa yin no zhes lhag par mos pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The individual thorough knowledge of the nature of the three intuitions is the conviction that the body, etc., are the nature of the three intuitions.

original: sbyor ba ni phyis gcig tu byas pa ste zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba rtogs pas ro gcig tu 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni phyis gcig tu byas pa ste zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba rtogs pas ro gcig tu 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The union is the later making into one, which means that by realizing the clearlight, they become of one taste.

original: ngo bo nyid med rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The perfection of realitylessness.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas snang ba nye bar thob pa la sogs pa'i rim pa las 'byung ba ye shes kyi sku ste bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas snang ba nye bar thob pa la sogs pa'i rim pa las 'byung ba ye shes kyi sku ste bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The body of intuition that arises from the sequence of the attainment of light, etc., is the nature of the stage of self-consecration.

original: khro bo ni thabs kyi ye shes so zhes pa ni ma rig pa'i 'og tu 'byung ba zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: khro bo ni thabs kyi ye shes so zhes pa ni ma rig pa'i 'og tu 'byung ba zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: Wrath is the intuition of the means, which should be said to arise after ignorance.

original: des na snang ba nye bar thob pa dang snang ba @266b mched pa dang snang ba ste /
analyzed: des na snang ba nye bar thob pa dang snang ba @266b mched pa dang snang ba ste /
translated: Therefore, the attainment of light, the culmination of light, and the light🔽are meditated as one taste, like the light of night, day, and the moon.

original: mtshan mo dang nyin mo dang zla ba'i snang ba dang 'dra bas ro gcig tu bsgom pa ni khro bo rjes su dran pa ste /🔽sgyu ma'i sku yi rgyur gyur pa //
analyzed: mtshan mo dang nyin mo dang zla ba'i snang ba dang 'dra bas ro gcig tu bsgom pa ni khro bo rjes su dran pa ste / sgyu ma'i sku yi rgyur gyur pa //
translated: This is the recollection of wrath,

original: zhes bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bstan to //
translated: which is taught as the cause of the illusory body.

original: rang gi zla ba'i gzugs brnyan 'dra //
analyzed: rang gi zla ba'i gzugs brnyan 'dra //
translated: Like one's own reflection in a moon,

original: bdag nyid kyis ni sems nyid mthong //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis ni sems nyid mthong //
translated: one sees the mind itself.

original: gal te zla ba la dmigs nas //
analyzed: gal te zla ba la dmigs nas //
translated: If one visualizes the moon,🔽one should imagine the vajra sign,

original: rdo rje mtshan ni rab tu brtag / de ni thabs te ston byed pa //
analyzed: rdo rje mtshan ni rab tu brtag / de ni thabs te ston byed pa //
translated: which is the means of instruction.

original: rdor sogs bskyed pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i //
analyzed: rdor sogs bskyed pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i //
translated: The yoga of generating the vajra, etc.

original: zla ba rdo rje sogs sbyor bas //
analyzed: zla ba rdo rje sogs sbyor bas //
translated: is the union of the moon, vajra, etc.

original: sems dang sems byung yang dag sbyar //
analyzed: sems dang sems byung yang dag sbyar //
translated: The mind and mental factors are rightly united.

original: shes rab thabs dang kun sbyor bas //
analyzed: shes rab thabs dang kun sbyor bas //
translated: The union of wisdom and means

original: lha yi sku ni 'byung bar 'gyur //🔽zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: lha yi sku ni 'byung bar 'gyur // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: gives rise to the body of the deity.

original: lha ni phyag rgya chen po'i tshul lo zhes pa ni ma lus lus pa med pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku rnams kyis byin gyis rlob pa ye shes kyi sku zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lha ni phyag rgya chen po'i tshul lo zhes pa ni ma lus lus pa med pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku rnams kyis byin gyis rlob pa ye shes kyi sku zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The deity is the method of the Great Seal, which means the intuitive wisdom body, the consecration by the bodies of all the Tathāgatas, without exception.

original: de'i rjes su dran pa ni de mthong ba ste sgyu ma la sogs pa dang 'dra bar yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes su dran pa ni de mthong ba ste sgyu ma la sogs pa dang 'dra bar yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: The recollection of that is the seeing of it, the thorough knowledge of it as like an illusion, etc.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says:🔽The thorough knowledge by way of the moon in water, etc.

original: chu zla la sogs pa'i rnam pas yongs su shes pa'o zhes pa ni chu zla la sogs pa sgyu ma'i dpe bcu gnyis kyis nye bar mtshon pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chu zla la sogs pa'i rnam pas yongs su shes pa'o zhes pa ni chu zla la sogs pa sgyu ma'i dpe bcu gnyis kyis nye bar mtshon pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: means the thorough knowledge by way of the twelve examples of illusion, such as the moon in water, etc.

original: des ni bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: des ni bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: This explains the stage of self-consecration.

original: don dam pa'i bden pas gcig tu byas pa'o zhes pa ni phyi dang nang gi mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa'am ril por 'dzin pa dang rjes su gzhig pa'i ting nge 'dzin gnyis kyis rim pas 'od gsal ba nyid du 'gyur ba man ngag bzhi pas mngon
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pas gcig tu byas pa'o zhes pa ni phyi dang nang gi mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa'am ril por 'dzin pa dang rjes su gzhig pa'i ting nge 'dzin gnyis kyis rim pas 'od gsal ba nyid du 'gyur ba man ngag bzhi pas mngon
translated: The phrase made one with the ultimate truth refers to the stage of manifest enlightenment, either external or internal, or to the stage of clear light, which is attained by the two meditative stabilizations of totality and disintegration, as taught in the fourth esoteric instruction.

original: du bya ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: du bya ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase made manifest means that it is made manifest.

original: nges ni mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: nges ni mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: The phrase the stage of manifest enlightenment explains the stage of manifest enlightenment.

original: de bas na rjes su sbyor bas zhes pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa dang gcig tu byas pa ste /
analyzed: de bas na rjes su sbyor bas zhes pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa dang gcig tu byas pa ste /
translated: The phrase by the subsequent yoga means that it is made one with the ultimate truth.

original: ye shes kyi sku dang 'od gsal ba ro gcig tu gyur pa'i mtshan nyid kyi mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa las so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ye shes kyi sku dang 'od gsal ba ro gcig tu gyur pa'i mtshan nyid kyi mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa las so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase from the stage of manifest enlightenment means that it is of the nature of the pristine awareness body and clear light, which have become of one taste.

original: bsgom pa ni bden pa gnyis kyi rnam pas dmigs nas zhes pa ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin te /
analyzed: bsgom pa ni bden pa gnyis kyi rnam pas dmigs nas zhes pa ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin te /
translated: The phrase cultivated by observing the two truths is merely an illustration.

original: rnam pa dang bcas pa dang rnam pa med pa dang thabs dang shes rab la sogs pa dbyer med pas kyang bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam pa dang bcas pa dang rnam pa med pa dang thabs dang shes rab la sogs pa dbyer med pas kyang bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: One should meditate on the union of the two, the aspect and the non-aspect, the method and the wisdom, and so on.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:🔽The conceptualization of the aspect and the thing,

original: rnam bcas dngos po rtog pa dang // rnam pa med pa'i rtog pa ste //
analyzed: rnam bcas dngos po rtog pa dang // rnam pa med pa'i rtog pa ste //
translated: and the conceptualization of the non-aspect,

original: gcig tu byas nas gang du spyod //🔽de ni zung du 'jug par bshad //
analyzed: gcig tu byas nas gang du spyod // de ni zung du 'jug par bshad //
translated: having made them one, wherever one practices,

original: @267a * // ces 'byung ngo //
analyzed: @267a * // ces 'byung ngo //
translated: that is said to be the union.

original: chos thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa'i mtshan nyid ni byang chub po //
analyzed: chos thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa'i mtshan nyid ni byang chub po //
translated: The characteristic of the complete knowledge of all dharmas as they are is enlightenment.

original: de nyid bde ba chen po'i mtshan nyid gcig pa zhes pa ni chos kyi sku ro gcig pa'i ngo bo rtag tu bde ba'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de nyid bde ba chen po'i mtshan nyid gcig pa zhes pa ni chos kyi sku ro gcig pa'i ngo bo rtag tu bde ba'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That itself is the characteristic of great bliss, the single essence, the nature of constant bliss, the essence of the single taste of the dharmakāya.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: de nyid zag pa med pa'i dbyings //
analyzed: de nyid zag pa med pa'i dbyings //
translated: That itself is the untainted realm,🔽inconceivable, virtuous, permanent,

original: bsam gyis mi khyab dge ba rtag / bde ba rnam par grol ba'i sku //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab dge ba rtag / bde ba rnam par grol ba'i sku //
translated: the bliss of the liberated body,

original: thub pa chen po'i chos zhes bya //🔽zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: thub pa chen po'i chos zhes bya //🔽zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: the dharma of the great sage.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po thob par 'gyur ba'o zhes pa ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i phyag rgya chen po'i sku'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po thob par 'gyur ba'o zhes pa ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i phyag rgya chen po'i sku'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: One attains the state of Great Vajradhara means the state of the Great Seal of glorious Vajrasattva.

original: des ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: des ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus he has taught the stage of union.

original: don 'di nyid ces pa ni rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don 'di nyid ces pa ni rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This very meaning means the nature of the perfection stage, such as vajra repetition and so forth.

original: bshad pa'i rgyud las zhes pa ni rdo rje phreng ba las so //🔽nyams dga' sangs rgyas kun gyis bsten //
analyzed: bshad pa'i rgyud las zhes pa ni rdo rje phreng ba las so // nyams dga' sangs rgyas kun gyis bsten //
translated: In the explanatory tantra means in the Vajra Garland.

original: zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin sku rnam par dben pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin sku rnam par dben pa'o //
translated: Delightful, relied upon by all the Buddhas, means the nature of all the Tathagatas, the body of emptiness.

original: bha ga ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: bha ga ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The bhaga is endowed with the accumulations of merit and wisdom.

original: zhi ba gcig pu'i ming zhes pa ni 'gro ba dang 'ong ba rnam par grol ba'i rang bzhin gyi rdo rje bzlas pa'i mthar thug pa ma ning gi bzlas pa'o //
analyzed: zhi ba gcig pu'i ming zhes pa ni 'gro ba dang 'ong ba rnam par grol ba'i rang bzhin gyi rdo rje bzlas pa'i mthar thug pa ma ning gi bzlas pa'o //
translated: The name of the single peace means the neuter repetition, the final stage of vajra repetition, the nature of which is liberation from coming and going.

original: rang gi sku la sogs pa'i de kho na nyid de snang ba la sogs pa'i ye shes rnams so //
analyzed: rang gi sku la sogs pa'i de kho na nyid de snang ba la sogs pa'i ye shes rnams so //
translated: The reality of one's body, etc. is the pristine cognitions of appearance, etc.

original: de nyid gnyis med ces pa ni stong pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de nyid gnyis med ces pa ni stong pa gsum mo //
translated: The non-dual is the three voidnesses.

original: de 'byung ba ni gang las skyes pa ste de ni rang gi ngo bo nyid gnyis med 'byung ste 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: de 'byung ba ni gang las skyes pa ste de ni rang gi ngo bo nyid gnyis med 'byung ste 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: The arising is the birth from which the reality of one's own nature, non-dual, arises, which is clearlight.

original: rdo rje ni sngar bshad pa'i lus la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje ni sngar bshad pa'i lus la sogs pa'o //
translated: The vajra is the body, etc. as previously explained.

original: de nyid du sbyor bzhes pa ni 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid bzhi pa de la sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas mi snang bar bya'o //🔽sangs rgyas rjes dran sbyor ba ste //
analyzed: de nyid du sbyor bzhes pa ni 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid bzhi pa de la sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas mi snang bar bya'o // sangs rgyas rjes dran sbyor ba ste //
translated: The union is the fourth reality, clearlight transparency, which is to be made invisible by the process of mantra and seal.

original: zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ro gcig par byed pa 'od gsal ba rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi de kho na nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ro gcig par byed pa 'od gsal ba rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi de kho na nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The application is the recollection of the Buddha, which is the reality characterized by the realization of clearlight transparency, which is the oneness of all Ones-Gone-Thus.

original: de nyid bha gar ni 'od gsal ba la'o //
analyzed: de nyid bha gar ni 'od gsal ba la'o //
translated: The bhaga is clearlight transparency.

original: ling ga ni thim pa nyid yin par grags pa ni bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ling ga ni thim pa nyid yin par grags pa ni bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The entering is the fame of dissolution.

original: des ni sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa bstan to //
analyzed: des ni sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa bstan to //
translated: This teaches the stage of the mind's purification.

original: bzhugs pa zhes pa sgyu ma la sogs pa'i rnam pas so //
analyzed: bzhugs pa zhes pa sgyu ma la sogs pa'i rnam pas so //
translated: The abiding is by way of the illusion and so forth.

original: gnyis med sbyor ba ste zhes pa ni sbyor ba ni tha mi dad do //
analyzed: gnyis med sbyor ba ste zhes pa ni sbyor ba ni tha mi dad do //
translated: The nondual union is the union that is not different.

original: sangs rgyas gzugs su bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas gzugs su bsgom pa'o //
translated: The cultivation of the Buddha-body

original: zhes pa ni @267b de ltar gyur pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sku sgyu ma'i rnam pa'i lha'i sku'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni @267b de ltar gyur pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sku sgyu ma'i rnam pa'i lha'i sku'o //
translated: is the divine body of the illusion-like aspect of the Buddha-body that has come about in that way.

original: sgom pa'i zhes pa ni snang ba nye bar thob pa la sogs pa'i rim pa'am cig car du spro bar bya'o //
analyzed: sgom pa'i zhes pa ni snang ba nye bar thob pa la sogs pa'i rim pa'am cig car du spro bar bya'o //
translated: The cultivation is the emanation by way of the stage of the attainment of the appearance and so forth, or all at once.

original: des ni bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: des ni bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: This teaches the stage of the self-consecration.

original: de las ni de la dmigs nas mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa'i mtshan nyid kyi man ngag gang yin ba de las ni man ngag bzhi pa mngon du byed pa'i mtshan nyid 'od gsal ba las so //
analyzed: de las ni de la dmigs nas mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa'i mtshan nyid kyi man ngag gang yin ba de las ni man ngag bzhi pa mngon du byed pa'i mtshan nyid 'od gsal ba las so //
translated: From that, the fourth consecration, which is the characteristic of the clearlight transparency, is manifested from the instruction that has the characteristic of the stage of manifest enlightenment, which is focused on that.

original: blo ldan gyis zhes pa ni rnal 'byor pa las so //
analyzed: blo ldan gyis zhes pa ni rnal 'byor pa las so //
translated: The wise is the yogi.

original: spro ba ni zhi ba dang skye ba la mi gnas pa rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: spro ba ni zhi ba dang skye ba la mi gnas pa rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku bskyed par bya'o //
translated: The emanation is the creation of the body of Great Vajradhara, who does not abide in peace or birth.🔽At that time,

original: de'i tshe // ba spu'i bu ga'i rtse mor gnas //
analyzed: de'i tshe // ba spu'i bu ga'i rtse mor gnas //
translated: he abides at the tip of the pores.

original: zhes pa ni ba spu'i bu ga la sogs pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni ba spu'i bu ga la sogs pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: This means that he abides in the pores, etc.

original: mnyam pa med pa khyad par du //
analyzed: mnyam pa med pa khyad par du //
translated: He is unequaled,

original: zhes pa ni brjod du mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni brjod du mi nus pa'o //
translated: this means that he is inexpressible.

original: sangs rgyas sprin rnams der spro'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sprin rnams der spro'o //
translated: The clouds of Buddhas emanate there.🔽This means that the Tathagatas should be emanated for the sake of benefiting others.

original: zhes pa ni gzhan gyi don bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa rnams spro bar bya'o zhes pa 'dis zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gzhan gyi don bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa rnams spro bar bya'o zhes pa 'dis zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the teaching of the stage of union.

original: dgongs pas bshad pa'o zhes pa ni 'gal ba'i tshig gi sgo nas rim pa lnga'i de kho na nyid kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgongs pas bshad pa'o zhes pa ni 'gal ba'i tshig gi sgo nas rim pa lnga'i de kho na nyid kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The explanation by the intention is for the sake of teaching the characteristic of the reality of the five stages by means of contradictory words.🔽Thus, etc.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngar bshad pa'i don bsdu ba'i phyir bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngar bshad pa'i don bsdu ba'i phyir bshad par bya ste /
translated: The explanation is for the sake of summarizing the meaning that was previously explained.

original: yongs su dag pa'i lha yi sku //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa'i lha yi sku //
translated: The body of the pure deity

original: zhes pa ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pas thob par bya ba'i rdo rje 'chang chen po'i phyag rgya'i sku bskyed nas so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pas thob par bya ba'i rdo rje 'chang chen po'i phyag rgya'i sku bskyed nas so //
translated: This is the creation of the body of the Great Vajradhara, the seal, which is to be attained by the stage of union.

original: rnal 'byor pa thams cad kyi thun mong gi zhes pa ni bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa dag gis thun mong pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa thams cad kyi thun mong gi zhes pa ni bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa dag gis thun mong pa'o //
translated: The common of all yogis is the common of the creation and perfection stages.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i rim pa zhes pa ni dbang po gnyis yang dag par sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi rim pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i rim pa zhes pa ni dbang po gnyis yang dag par sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi rim pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The stage of union is the stage which has the characteristic of the union of the two organs.

original: de la bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa la dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog gi ting nge 'dzin rtsom na phyag rgya legs par spyod pa'i dus su snyoms par 'jug pa'i rim pa bstan pa dang / rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa la rim pa lnga char la yang snyoms par 'jug pa'i rim pa bstan to //
analyzed: de la bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa la dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog gi ting nge 'dzin rtsom na phyag rgya legs par spyod pa'i dus su snyoms par 'jug pa'i rim pa bstan pa dang / rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa la rim pa lnga char la yang snyoms par 'jug pa'i rim pa bstan to //
translated: Now, for the yogi of the creation stage, when he composes the samadhi of the mandala of the Supreme Victor, the stage of union is taught at the time of the practice of the seal, and for the yogi of the perfection stage, the stage of union is taught in all five stages.

original: na tshod gzhon pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i zhes pa ni gzhon pa nyid dang mdzes pa nyid dang dam tshig dang sdom pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: na tshod gzhon pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i zhes pa ni gzhon pa nyid dang mdzes pa nyid dang dam tshig dang sdom pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: Endowed with youth and so on means endowed with youth, beauty, and commitments, vows, and so on.

original: bud med ni dam tshig dang ye shes kyi phyag rgya las gang yang rung ba'o //🔽rnyed @268a * //
analyzed: bud med ni dam tshig dang ye shes kyi phyag rgya las gang yang rung ba'o // rnyed @268a * //
translated: A woman is any suitable consort, whether a pledge seal or a pristine awareness seal.

original: cing zhes pa ni rnyed pa dang bsgom par byas nas so //
analyzed: cing zhes pa ni rnyed pa dang bsgom par byas nas so //
translated: Having found her, having found and cultivated her,🔽her form as found is a karmamudra,

original: der ji ltar rnyed pa'i gzugs dang zhes pa ni thams cad ma tshogs na las kyi phyag rgya ste /🔽byol song sa la 'ang rab tu brtag / ces 'byung bas so //
analyzed: der ji ltar rnyed pa'i gzugs dang zhes pa ni thams cad ma tshogs na las kyi phyag rgya ste / byol song sa la 'ang rab tu brtag / ces 'byung bas so //
translated: if all the other qualities are not complete.

original: yan lag ma nyams pa gzugs dang ldan zhing zhes pa ni rigs dang rjes su mthun pa autpala sngon po'i kha dog dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yan lag ma nyams pa gzugs dang ldan zhing zhes pa ni rigs dang rjes su mthun pa autpala sngon po'i kha dog dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Her limbs unimpaired and endowed with form means that she is suitable for the family, the color of a blue lotus.

original: rab tu dben zhing yid dang mthun pa zhes pa ni spros pa dang bcas pa dang spros pa med pa'i rnal 'byor pa dag gis lha khang sum brtsegs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu dben zhing yid dang mthun pa zhes pa ni spros pa dang bcas pa dang spros pa med pa'i rnal 'byor pa dag gis lha khang sum brtsegs la sogs pa'o //
translated: A very secluded and pleasing place is a temple with three stories, etc., of yogis with elaboration and without elaboration.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul gyi mtshan nyid kyi mchod pa brtsam par bya'o zhes pa ni dpal sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam par sbyor ba mkha' 'gro dra ba'i bde mchog gi rim pa'i rgyud las gsungs pas chags pa'i rol pa la sogs pa'i rgya che ba'i mtshan
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul gyi mtshan nyid kyi mchod pa brtsam par bya'o zhes pa ni dpal sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam par sbyor ba mkha' 'gro dra ba'i bde mchog gi rim pa'i rgyud las gsungs pas chags pa'i rol pa la sogs pa'i rgya che ba'i mtshan
translated: One should begin the worship characterized by objects such as form, etc., which is said in the Tantra of the glorious Cakrasaṃvara who is Equal to All Buddhas, the Ḍākinī Jālasamvara Tantra, with the characteristics of extensive objects such as the play of passion, etc.

original: nyid kyi yul gyi mchod pa bya'o //
analyzed: nyid kyi yul gyi mchod pa bya'o //
translated: One should perform the worship characterized by objects such as form, etc.

original: gang gis she na zhes bya ba la sogs pas brtson pa'i dus su bya ba bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: gang gis she na zhes bya ba la sogs pas brtson pa'i dus su bya ba bshad par bya ste /
translated: By whom? and so on explains the practice at the time of striving.

original: yul du byin gyis brlabs pa na //
analyzed: yul du byin gyis brlabs pa na //
translated: The consecration of the objects

original: zhes pa ni yul rnams len pa'am dmigs pa'am de las gzung ba'i gtso bo'i sgo nas 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni yul rnams len pa'am dmigs pa'am de las gzung ba'i gtso bo'i sgo nas 'byung ba'o //
translated: is the arising from the objects, either by taking them, or by observing them, or by the principal one being grasped from them.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa rang bzhin gsum zhes pa ni chags pa bral ba dang chags pa dang chags pa bar ma la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa rang bzhin gsum zhes pa ni chags pa bral ba dang chags pa dang chags pa bar ma la sogs pa ste /
translated: Attachment and so on are the three natures, that is, the absence of attachment, attachment, and the middle state between attachment and absence of attachment.

original: shes rab dang thabs dang nye bar thob pa gsum zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs dang nye bar thob pa gsum zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the same as the three: wisdom, means, and near attainment.

original: yid du 'ong ba'i yul rnams zhes pa ni rnam pa gsum gyi yul rnams gcig tu bya ste yid du 'ong ba'i yul zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba'i yul rnams zhes pa ni rnam pa gsum gyi yul rnams gcig tu bya ste yid du 'ong ba'i yul zhes bya'o //
translated: The objects that are pleasing are the objects of the three types, taken together as one, and called pleasing objects.

original: yul gsum po dag gis zhes pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i yul rnams zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yul gsum po dag gis zhes pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i yul rnams zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The three objects are the objects that serve as the causes of attachment and so on.

original: ngag gi bdag nyid mchod par bya'o zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyi 'brel pa dang ldan pa'i yul rnams nye bar spyod pa la brten nas rang gi rgyud tshim par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ngag gi bdag nyid mchod par bya'o zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyi 'brel pa dang ldan pa'i yul rnams nye bar spyod pa la brten nas rang gi rgyud tshim par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: One should worship with speech means that one should satisfy one’s continuum in dependence on the enjoyment of the objects that are related to the Tathāgata families of Vairocana and so on.

original: de ltar rdo rje 'chang chen po ni dbus kyi gtso bo ste dpal rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: de ltar rdo rje 'chang chen po ni dbus kyi gtso bo ste dpal rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: Thus, Great Vajradhara is the central principal, glorious Vajrasattva.

original: reg bya rdo rje ni dbus kyi gtso bo ste khyad par du ma gzung bas so //
analyzed: reg bya rdo rje ni dbus kyi gtso bo ste khyad par du ma gzung bas so //
translated: The Vajra of Touch is the central principal, because he is not held to be distinct.

original: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa zhes pa ni rigs kyi dbye bas gnas pa zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa zhes pa ni rigs kyi dbye bas gnas pa zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: Vairochana and so forth means that he abides as a division of families, that is the meaning of the words.

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i yin pas na zhes pa ni @268b rnam par snang mdzad kyi rigs las 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i yin pas na zhes pa ni @268b rnam par snang mdzad kyi rigs las 'byung ba'o //
translated: Since this is the Tathagata's, it is the origin of the Vairochana family.🔽Among those other mudras of that family, the queen is the principal one, since she is related to Vairochana, the Tathagata family.

original: rigs de'i phyag rgya gzhan rnams kyis ni zhes pa la rnam par snang mdzad de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyi 'brel pa dang ldan pa'i phyag rgya gang yin pa de rnams kyi nang na gtso bo ni btsun mo yin pas so //
analyzed: rigs de'i phyag rgya gzhan rnams kyis ni zhes pa la rnam par snang mdzad de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyi 'brel pa dang ldan pa'i phyag rgya gang yin pa de rnams kyi nang na gtso bo ni btsun mo yin pas so //
translated: Among those other mudras of that family, the queen is the principal one, since she is related to Vairochana, the Tathagata family.

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa la sogs pa spong ba'i phyogs su me long lta bu'i ye shes dang po gtso bo yin pas so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa la sogs pa spong ba'i phyogs su me long lta bu'i ye shes dang po gtso bo yin pas so //
translated: The mirror-like wisdom is the principal one among the aspects that abandon the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience and so forth.

original: btsun mo chen mo ste sngar bshad pa zhes pa ni snga ma bzhin du mtshan nyid dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: btsun mo chen mo ste sngar bshad pa zhes pa ni snga ma bzhin du mtshan nyid dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The great queen, as previously explained, is endowed with the characteristics as previously explained.

original: ma bshad pa rnams kyang bsdus pa'i don to zhes pa ni rin chen 'byung ldan la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs gzung bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma bshad pa rnams kyang bsdus pa'i don to zhes pa ni rin chen 'byung ldan la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs gzung bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The unexpressed ones are also included, because of the need to take up the Tathāgata family of Ratnasaṃbhava, etc.🔽That very one should be meditated on as Māmakī by the jewel yogin, because of the power of the family, it is intended.

original: de nyid rin po che'i rnal 'byor pas m'a ma k'i ra bsgom par bya'o zhes pa ni rigs kyi dbang gis bsgom par bya'o zhes dgongs pa'o zhes sbyor ro zhes pa ni bya ba'i tshig med kyang rtogs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de nyid rin po che'i rnal 'byor pas m'a ma k'i ra bsgom par bya'o zhes pa ni rigs kyi dbang gis bsgom par bya'o zhes dgongs pa'o zhes sbyor ro zhes pa ni bya ba'i tshig med kyang rtogs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word “should” is to be supplied, even though it is not expressed.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsung rdo rje la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis kyang de nyid gos dkar mo dang sgrol ma'i gzugs su bsgom par bya zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsung rdo rje la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis kyang de nyid gos dkar mo dang sgrol ma'i gzugs su bsgom par bya zhes bstan to //
translated: Thus, etc. shows that the Vajra Speech yogins, etc. should also meditate on that very one in the form of Pāṇḍaravāsinī and Tārā.

original: skyes pa dang bud med kyi dbang po zhes pa ni rdo rje dang padma gnyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skyes pa dang bud med kyi dbang po zhes pa ni rdo rje dang padma gnyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The male and female faculties are the meaning of “vajra and lotus.”

original: phan tshun rjes su chags pas sngon du 'gro bas zhes bya ba'i rim pa yin te /
analyzed: phan tshun rjes su chags pas sngon du 'gro bas zhes bya ba'i rim pa yin te /
translated: The process is that of prior engagement in mutual passion.

original: re zhig dang por rnal 'byor pas ji ltar bshad pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyag rgya blangs la /🔽de'i yan lag dang nying lag la de bzhin gshegs pa lnga la sogs pa'i sa bon dgong cing mig dang lcags kyu dang ba dan dang sdigs mdzub gnyis la sogs pa'i lag pa'i phyag rgya de'i padma'i nang du bcug la byang chub sems 'dzag pa 'dod pa'i gdugs
analyzed: re zhig dang por rnal 'byor pas ji ltar bshad pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyag rgya blangs la / de'i yan lag dang nying lag la de bzhin gshegs pa lnga la sogs pa'i sa bon dgong cing mig dang lcags kyu dang ba dan dang sdigs mdzub gnyis la sogs pa'i lag pa'i phyag rgya de'i padma'i nang du bcug la byang chub sems 'dzag pa 'dod pa'i gdugs
translated: First, the yogi takes a consort who has the characteristics explained above.🔽He visualizes the seeds of the five tathagatas and so forth in her limbs and minor limbs. He inserts his vajra into her lotus and, with the mudras of the eye, hook, banner, two threatening mudras, and so forth, he stimulates her until he experiences the heat of the channels of the desire-to-emit bodhicitta and so forth.

original: la sogs pa'i rtsa rnams dro ba'i reg pa rnyed pa'i bar du bskul nas rang gi rdo rje'i rtse mo nas 'od zer gyi tshogs spro zhing /
analyzed: la sogs pa'i rtsa rnams dro ba'i reg pa rnyed pa'i bar du bskul nas rang gi rdo rje'i rtse mo nas 'od zer gyi tshogs spro zhing /
translated: He emanates a mass of light rays from the tip of his vajra.

original: lha mo'i padma'i sngar zhugs pa des de'i lus po'i nang gsal bar byas nas padma las kyang 'od zer gyi tshogs spros te /
analyzed: lha mo'i padma'i sngar zhugs pa des de'i lus po'i nang gsal bar byas nas padma las kyang 'od zer gyi tshogs spros te /
translated: A mass of light rays emanates from the lotus.

original: rdo rje'i lam nas thabs kyi lus des gsal zhing 'dod pas 'byung na rang nyid kyis thabs kyi rke la 'khyud pa'i 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i phyag rgya 'gyur na /
analyzed: rdo rje'i lam nas thabs kyi lus des gsal zhing 'dod pas 'byung na rang nyid kyis thabs kyi rke la 'khyud pa'i 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i phyag rgya 'gyur na /
translated: If the body of the hero, the method, is illuminated by the passion of the hero, the mudra who has the desire to embrace the hero with her body should transform into the following.🔽Om, all tathagatas, I am the vajra of passion.

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta aa nu r'a ga na badzra sva bh'a wa a'a tm'a ko&amp ;🔽h'um // zhes brjod nas rdo rje @269a * //
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta aa nu r'a ga na badzra sva bh'a wa a'a tm'a ko&amp ; h'um // zhes brjod nas rdo rje @269a * //
translated: Hum.🔽At the time of uniting the vajra and lotus, the yogin should meditate on the following.🔽Om, all tathagatas, I am the vajra of offering.

original: dang padma sbyor ba'i dus su aom sarba ta th'a ga ta p'u dza badzra sva bh'a wa a'atma ko& ham /
analyzed: dang padma sbyor ba'i dus su aom sarba ta th'a ga ta p'u dza badzra sva bh'a wa a'atma ko& ham /
translated: Hum.

original: zhes bya ba brjod pas bsgom pa gang yin pa de ni phan tshun rjes su chags par rnal 'byor pas bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba brjod pas bsgom pa gang yin pa de ni phan tshun rjes su chags par rnal 'byor pas bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the yogin should meditate on the mutual passion.

original: 'khyud pa la sogs pa'i las rjes su bsten pa ste zhes pa ni 'khyud pa dang 'o dang 'jib pa dang so dang sen mo gdab pa la sogs pa rang gi bya ba rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'khyud pa la sogs pa'i las rjes su bsten pa ste zhes pa ni 'khyud pa dang 'o dang 'jib pa dang so dang sen mo gdab pa la sogs pa rang gi bya ba rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase one should attend to the acts of embracing, etc. means that one should complete one's own acts of embracing, kissing, sucking, biting with the teeth and with the fingernails, and so on.
