original: rdo rje 'chang chen po zhes pa ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi ngo bo gcig pas so //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po zhes pa ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi ngo bo gcig pas so //
translated: Great Vajradhara means that he is the essence of all the Buddhas.

original: mchog tu dga' ba'i mtshan nyid gcig pa ste zhes pa ni bde ba chen po zhes bya'o //🔽'dir zhes bya ba la sogs pas rim pa gnyis sgom pa po'i nang na bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams la nges par gzung bar bya ste sngags pa rjes su gzhol ba rnams kyi zhes pa ni sngags la mngon par zhen pa bskyed pa'i rim pa'i
analyzed: mchog tu dga' ba'i mtshan nyid gcig pa ste zhes pa ni bde ba chen po zhes bya'o // 'dir zhes bya ba la sogs pas rim pa gnyis sgom pa po'i nang na bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams la nges par gzung bar bya ste sngags pa rjes su gzhol ba rnams kyi zhes pa ni sngags la mngon par zhen pa bskyed pa'i rim pa'i
translated: The phrase having the same nature as supreme joy means that he is called great bliss.

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: The phrase here, etc. refers to those who cultivate the two stages, and it is to be taken as referring to the yogis of the creation stage. The phrase those who are devoted to mantra means those who are devoted to mantra, i.e., the yogis of the creation stage.

original: cho ga ni sngags dgod pa'i mtshan nyid can zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: cho ga ni sngags dgod pa'i mtshan nyid can zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase the rite means the rite that has the characteristic of mantra placement.

original: yi ge h'um yongs su gyur pa las ni thugs rdo rje'i sa bon las 'byung ba rtse lnga pa'i rdo rje bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: yi ge h'um yongs su gyur pa las ni thugs rdo rje'i sa bon las 'byung ba rtse lnga pa'i rdo rje bsgom par bya'o //
translated: From the transformation of the syllable hūṃ, which is the seed of Mind-vajra, one should meditate on the five-pronged vajra.

original: aom gyis nor bu'i cha byin gyis brlab par bsam pa dang zhes pa ni sra ba yin pas rnam par snang mdzad kyi sa bon gyis byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: aom gyis nor bu'i cha byin gyis brlab par bsam pa dang zhes pa ni sra ba yin pas rnam par snang mdzad kyi sa bon gyis byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: One should think that the syllable oṃ consecrates the jewel-part, because it is hard, one should consecrate it with the seed of Vairocana.

original: aa las phyag rgya'i padma mngon par 'dus byas pa zhes pa gsung rdo rje 'chang gi sa bon shes rab kyi rang bzhin gyis dam tshig gi phyag rgya'i chos 'byung sa bon de nyid las bskyed cing de nyid dgod par bya ste /
analyzed: aa las phyag rgya'i padma mngon par 'dus byas pa zhes pa gsung rdo rje 'chang gi sa bon shes rab kyi rang bzhin gyis dam tshig gi phyag rgya'i chos 'byung sa bon de nyid las bskyed cing de nyid dgod par bya ste /
translated: From the syllable a, one should imagine the lotus of the seal, which is the seed of Speech-Vajradhara, generated from the seed of the reality-seal, which is the nature of wisdom, and one should place it there.

original: de shes rab kyi yan lag yin pas shes rab kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de shes rab kyi yan lag yin pas shes rab kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the branch of wisdom, it is the nature of wisdom.

original: rin chen 'byung ldan gyi nga rgyal dang ldan pas ni /
analyzed: rin chen 'byung ldan gyi nga rgyal dang ldan pas ni /
translated: Endowed with the pride of Ratnasaṃbhava,

original: nam mkha'i khams kyi rang bzhin gyi rgya che ba'i sems kyis so //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams kyi rang bzhin gyi rgya che ba'i sems kyis so //
translated: with the mind of vastness, which is the nature of the realm of space.

original: yi ge h'um gi rlung dang dga' ba nyid kyis rdo rje dang padma snyoms par zhugs pa las 'byung ba'i yi ge h'um gi dbugs bsgoms pas mnyes nas te /
analyzed: yi ge h'um gi rlung dang dga' ba nyid kyis rdo rje dang padma snyoms par zhugs pa las 'byung ba'i yi ge h'um gi dbugs bsgoms pas mnyes nas te /
translated: By the wind and joy of the syllable hūṃ, one should meditate on the breath of the syllable hūṃ, which arises from the union of the vajra and lotus, and please one’s consort.

original: rang gi phyag rgya mnyes nas mchog gi bsnyen pa la sogs pas snang ba la sogs pa'i ye shes 'byung ba dang yang dag par sbyar nas so //
analyzed: rang gi phyag rgya mnyes nas mchog gi bsnyen pa la sogs pas snang ba la sogs pa'i ye shes 'byung ba dang yang dag par sbyar nas so //
translated: Having pleased one’s consort, one should apply the arising of the pristine awareness of appearance and so forth, through the supreme approximation and so forth.

original: yi ge phat kyi sgras byang chub kyi sems dbab par bya'o zhes pa ni lhan cig skyes pa zhes bya ba bde ba chen po nyams su @269b myong zhing de nas dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor bskyed par bya ba'i phyir rdo rje'i lam nas padma'i nang du rang🔽gi ragta spro bar bya'o //
analyzed: yi ge phat kyi sgras byang chub kyi sems dbab par bya'o zhes pa ni lhan cig skyes pa zhes bya ba bde ba chen po nyams su @269b myong zhing de nas dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor bskyed par bya ba'i phyir rdo rje'i lam nas padma'i nang du rang gi ragta spro bar bya'o //
translated: One should cause the descent of the bodhicitta by the sound of the syllable phaṭ. This is the experience of the coemergent, called “great bliss.” Then, in order to generate the pledge wheel, one should emanate one’s own seed syllable from the vajra path into the lotus.🔽This is the meaning of the vajra words.

original: rdo rje'i tshig gi don 'di yin no zhes pa ni zab pa'i don dang ldan pa'i tshig don zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje'i tshig gi don 'di yin no zhes pa ni zab pa'i don dang ldan pa'i tshig don zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “the meaning of the words endowed with profound meaning.”

original: 'di dag thams cad sku gsum gyi rtog pa zhes pa ni snang ba la sogs pa ye shes gsum gyi rdzogs pa'i rim pa dang dam tshig dang ye shes dang ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid de bskyed pa'i rim pas so //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad sku gsum gyi rtog pa zhes pa ni snang ba la sogs pa ye shes gsum gyi rdzogs pa'i rim pa dang dam tshig dang ye shes dang ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid de bskyed pa'i rim pas so //
translated: All these are called “concepts of the three bodies” because they are the perfection stage of the three intuitions, such as the vision, and so on, and they are the nature of the three beings, the pledge being, intuition being, and concentration being, by the stage of generation.

original: rnam par rtog pa tsam nyid yin gyi zhes pa ni brtags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa tsam nyid yin gyi zhes pa ni brtags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “ They are mere concepts” means that they are imagined.

original: de kho na nyid ma yin no zhes pa ni thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid du bsgom pa yang yin pa de ni don dam pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de kho na nyid ma yin no zhes pa ni thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid du bsgom pa yang yin pa de ni don dam pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “ They are not reality” means that the meditation on the nature of means and insight is not the ultimate, that is the meaning.

original: de kho na nyid ni spros pa du mas bsgrub bya ma yin te 'ba' zhig tu rang snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid ni spros pa du mas bsgrub bya ma yin te 'ba' zhig tu rang snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Reality is not an object to be established by many conceptual elaborations, because it is a mere self-manifestation.

original: phyag rgya la sogs pa'i rgyu'i tshogs pa de kho na nyid gsal bar byed pa yin gyi byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phyag rgya la sogs pa'i rgyu'i tshogs pa de kho na nyid gsal bar byed pa yin gyi byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The collection of causes such as the seal is a clarifier of reality, but it is not a maker.

original: de kho na nyid ni rang snang ba khams gsum la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: de kho na nyid ni rang snang ba khams gsum la gnas pa ste /
translated: Reality is a self-manifestation, abiding in the three realms.

original: glo bur gyi dri ma'i bag chags mang bas mi snang ngo zhes phal cher du sngar bshad pas 'dir ma bstan to //
analyzed: glo bur gyi dri ma'i bag chags mang bas mi snang ngo zhes phal cher du sngar bshad pas 'dir ma bstan to //
translated: Since there are many latent tendencies of adventitious defilements, it does not appear. Since this has been explained before, it is not taught here.

original: snyoms par zhugs pa'i dus su zhes bya ba la sogs pas snyoms par zhugs pa'i bsgom pa'i rim pa'i khyad par bstan par bya ste /🔽dkar po la sog pa'i 'od zer lnga zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rang bzhin yin pa 'am /
analyzed: snyoms par zhugs pa'i dus su zhes bya ba la sogs pas snyoms par zhugs pa'i bsgom pa'i rim pa'i khyad par bstan par bya ste / dkar po la sog pa'i 'od zer lnga zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rang bzhin yin pa 'am /
translated: The phrase at the time of entering into union and so forth teaches the distinctive stages of cultivation of entering into union.

original: rdo rje dang padma dag gis 'dod pa'i gdugs la sogs pa'i rtsa lnga dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rdo rje dang padma dag gis 'dod pa'i gdugs la sogs pa'i rtsa lnga dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The five light rays of white and so forth are the nature of the five tathagatas, or endowed with the five channels of desire such as the parasol of the vajra and lotus.

original: zla 'od ces bya ba la sogs pas zhes pa ni kha dog dkar po 'od spro ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zla 'od ces bya ba la sogs pas zhes pa ni kha dog dkar po 'od spro ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The phrase moon light and so forth means white color emitting light rays.

original: zla 'od ces bya ba la sogs pas me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi ngo bos phyi rol du yang rnam pa sna tshogs kyi 'od zer gyi tshogs spro ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zla 'od ces bya ba la sogs pas me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi ngo bos phyi rol du yang rnam pa sna tshogs kyi 'od zer gyi tshogs spro ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase moon light and so forth means emitting an assembly of light rays of various aspects externally with the nature of mirror-like wisdom.

original: yid 'phrog pa'i bud med ces pa ni phyag rgya'i mtshan nyid nu ma rgyas pa dang padma can dang byang chub kyi sems 'dzag pa dang bde ba'i sgra mkhas pa la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i sems 'phrog pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yid 'phrog pa'i bud med ces pa ni phyag rgya'i mtshan nyid nu ma rgyas pa dang padma can dang byang chub kyi sems 'dzag pa dang bde ba'i sgra mkhas pa la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i sems 'phrog pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “a woman who captivates the mind” is that the seal has the characteristics of full breasts, a lotus, the emission of bodhicitta, and the sound of bliss, and she is skilled in captivating the mind of a yogin.

original: bsam pa 'di ni nye bar mtshon pa zhes pa ste gsung dang thugs dang rin chen dang don yod grub pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis rang gi rjes su 'brangs nas /🔽dmar po dang sngon po dang ser po @270a * //
analyzed: bsam pa 'di ni nye bar mtshon pa zhes pa ste gsung dang thugs dang rin chen dang don yod grub pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis rang gi rjes su 'brangs nas / dmar po dang sngon po dang ser po @270a * //
translated: “ This thought is an example” means that yogins of Vairocana, Amitābha, Ratnasaṃbhava, and Amoghasiddhi, following their own,🔽should meditate on a seal endowed with the colors red, blue, yellow,

original: po dang kha dog ljang gu dang ldan pa sngar bshad pa'i yon tan gyi tshogs kyis brgyan pa'i phyag rgya bsgom par bya zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: po dang kha dog ljang gu dang ldan pa sngar bshad pa'i yon tan gyi tshogs kyis brgyan pa'i phyag rgya bsgom par bya zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: and green, and adorned with the previously explained collection of qualities.

original: dgongs pa ma yin pas bshad pa'o zhes pa ni shin tu gsal ba'i de kho na nyid bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgongs pa ma yin pas bshad pa'o zhes pa ni shin tu gsal ba'i de kho na nyid bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “ Non-intentional” means that it is taught for the sake of revealing the very clear reality.

original: sngar gsungs pa'i rjes su dran pa drug ces pa ni rim pa gnyis rjod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sngar gsungs pa'i rjes su dran pa drug ces pa ni rim pa gnyis rjod par byed pa'o //
translated: The six recollections mentioned above are described in the two stages.

original: nges par ston par bzhed nas zhes pa ni phyogs gcig tu chad par bzhed pas so //
analyzed: nges par ston par bzhed nas zhes pa ni phyogs gcig tu chad par bzhed pas so //
translated: With the intention of teaching means with the intention of teaching in a single direction.

original: gzhan du na mdor bstan pa dang rgyas par bshad pa mthun par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na mdor bstan pa dang rgyas par bshad pa mthun par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the brief explanation and the extensive explanation would not agree.

original: gang gi phyir lus rnam par dben pa nas brtsams te rjes su dran pa drug mdor bstan par byas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir lus rnam par dben pa nas brtsams te rjes su dran pa drug mdor bstan par byas so //
translated: Because the six recollections beginning with the body is empty are explained in the brief explanation.

original: 'di ni bskyed pa'i rim pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i sku bsgoms nas rim pa gnyis kyis 'od gsal la zhugs nas bdag la byin gyis brlabs pas de rnams rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bskyed pa'i rim pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i sku bsgoms nas rim pa gnyis kyis 'od gsal la zhugs nas bdag la byin gyis brlabs pas de rnams rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku bsgom par bya'o //
translated: This is the stage of generation, having meditated on the bodies of the five Tathagatas beginning with Vairocana, and having entered into clear light by the two stages, one should meditate on the body of Great Vajradhara by means of the self-consecration.

original: de ltar na phyogs gcig gi sgo nas mdor bstan pa dang rgyas par bshad pa rnams dang 'brel lo //
analyzed: de ltar na phyogs gcig gi sgo nas mdor bstan pa dang rgyas par bshad pa rnams dang 'brel lo //
translated: Thus, the brief explanation and the extensive explanation are connected by way of a single direction.

original: la la ni ma lus pas 'brel te zhes zer te gang gi phyir bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i sku bsgoms la /
analyzed: la la ni ma lus pas 'brel te zhes zer te gang gi phyir bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i sku bsgoms la /
translated: Some say that the entire [stage] is related, because one meditates on the form of Vairochana, etc.🔽of the creation stage, and by the first stage one makes the speech isolated, by the second one enters into clear light, by the third one meditates on those as Vairochana, etc.

original: rim pa dang pos ngag rnam par dben par byas te gnyis pas 'od gsal ba la 'jug cing gsum pas de rnams rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa bsgoms te bzhi pas 'od gsal bar byas nas lnga pas rdo rje 'chang gi phyag rgya chen po'i sku bsam
analyzed: rim pa dang pos ngag rnam par dben par byas te gnyis pas 'od gsal ba la 'jug cing gsum pas de rnams rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa bsgoms te bzhi pas 'od gsal bar byas nas lnga pas rdo rje 'chang gi phyag rgya chen po'i sku bsam
translated: , and by the fourth one makes them clear light, and by the fifth one should imagine the body of the great seal of Vajradhara.

original: par bya'o // de bas na mdor bstan pa dang rgyas par bshad pa rnams mthun pa yin no zhes gnas so //
analyzed: par bya'o // de bas na mdor bstan pa dang rgyas par bshad pa rnams mthun pa yin no zhes gnas so //
translated: Therefore, the brief presentation and the extensive explanation are consistent, so it is correct.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir gnas ston par mdzad pa yin te zhes smos te /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir gnas ston par mdzad pa yin te zhes smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says, “he teaches the stages.

original: rgyas par bshad pa'i rim pas brtson par bshad do //
analyzed: rgyas par bshad pa'i rim pas brtson par bshad do //
translated: ” He explains the stages of the extensive explanation with effort.

original: ston pa po rang nyid kyis zhes pa ni 'dri ba dang lan 'debs par rang nyid kyis mdzad pa ste pha rol gyi rtog pa la dgongs nas zhes tshig lhag ma'o //
analyzed: ston pa po rang nyid kyis zhes pa ni 'dri ba dang lan 'debs par rang nyid kyis mdzad pa ste pha rol gyi rtog pa la dgongs nas zhes tshig lhag ma'o //
translated: The phrase by the teacher himself means that the teacher himself asks and answers, and the phrase with regard to the thought of others is a supplement.

original: de nyid yang nas yang bslab par bya ba yin par shes pa shin tu gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid yang nas yang bslab par bya ba yin par shes pa shin tu gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is very clear that it should be known that that very [emptiness] is to be trained in again and again.

original: sgom pa ni sems rtse gcig pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: sgom pa ni sems rtse gcig pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par ro //
translated: Meditation is the distinctive samādhi of one-pointed mind.

original: bha ga ni don dam pa'i bden pa zhes pa ni chags pa dang bral ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin @270b bcom pas so //
analyzed: bha ga ni don dam pa'i bden pa zhes pa ni chags pa dang bral ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin @270b bcom pas so //
translated: The bhaga is the ultimate truth means that it is destroyed by the nature of being free from attachment and so on.

original: de thim pas na zhes pa ni de las 'byung ba 'am de la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de thim pas na zhes pa ni de las 'byung ba 'am de la 'jug pa'o //
translated: Dissolving into that means arising from that or entering into that.

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o zhes pa ni sgyu ma lta bu'i sku'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o zhes pa ni sgyu ma lta bu'i sku'o //
translated: The relative truth means the illusory body.

original: 'od gsal ba la rab tu zhugs nas zhes pa ni phyag rgya dang ting nge 'dzin gyi rim pas stong par byas nas so //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba la rab tu zhugs nas zhes pa ni phyag rgya dang ting nge 'dzin gyi rim pas stong par byas nas so //
translated: Having entered into luminosity means having emptied [the illusory body] by means of the stage of the mudra and samādhi.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku zhes bya ba la sogs pas zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku zhes bya ba la sogs pas zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa bstan par bya ste /
translated: The term buddha body and so forth teaches the stage of union.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa las ldang bar bya'o zhes pa ni mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa las phyag rgya chen po'i sku blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa las ldang bar bya'o zhes pa ni mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa las phyag rgya chen po'i sku blang bar bya'o //
translated: The phrase one should arise from the ultimate truth means that one should take up the body of the great seal from the stage of manifest enlightenment.

original: ba spu'i bu ga zhes bya ba la sogs pas rim pa lnga pa la gnas pas gzhan gyi don bstan to //
analyzed: ba spu'i bu ga zhes bya ba la sogs pas rim pa lnga pa la gnas pas gzhan gyi don bstan to //
translated: The phrase from the pores of the body and so forth teaches the benefit of others by one who abides in the fifth stage.

original: de la gang las byung ba de ni ba spu'i bu ga ste ba spu'i rtsa ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la gang las byung ba de ni ba spu'i bu ga ste ba spu'i rtsa ba zhes bya'o //
translated: There, the pores of the body are the roots of the hairs.

original: de rnams kyi mtha' ni rtse mo'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi mtha' ni rtse mo'o //
translated: The ends of those are the tips.

original: ba spu'i gnyi ga'i bar zhes pa ni ba spu'i bar la bya'o //
analyzed: ba spu'i gnyi ga'i bar zhes pa ni ba spu'i bar la bya'o //
translated: The phrase between the pores of the body means between the pores of the body.

original: des na don 'di yin te dang po bskyed pa'i rim pas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i sku bsgoms la rdzogs pa'i rim pas mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings kyi rang bzhin de kho na nyid thob nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad spro
analyzed: des na don 'di yin te dang po bskyed pa'i rim pas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i sku bsgoms la rdzogs pa'i rim pas mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings kyi rang bzhin de kho na nyid thob nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad spro
translated: Therefore, the meaning of this is as follows: First, one should cultivate the body of Vairocana and so forth by means of the creation stage, and then, by means of the completion stage, one should attain reality, the nature of the sphere of non-abiding nirvana, and then emanate all the Tathagatas, preceded by the emanation of the five Gnoses.

original: ba sngon du 'gro bar gzhan gyi don bya'o zhes tshig gi don to //
analyzed: ba sngon du 'gro bar gzhan gyi don bya'o zhes tshig gi don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the words.

original: mkhas pa ni rang bzhin shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rim pa gnyis thob nas rdo rje 'chang gi gzugs kyi rang bzhin shes pas spro bar bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: mkhas pa ni rang bzhin shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rim pa gnyis thob nas rdo rje 'chang gi gzugs kyi rang bzhin shes pas spro bar bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: The wise one, having attained the two stages called knowing the nature and so forth, should emanate by knowing the nature of the form of Vajradhara.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas spro ba'i khyad par bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas spro ba'i khyad par bshad par bya ste /
translated: Thus, and so forth explain the special emanation.

original: gti mug la spyod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas gti mug gi rigs can rnams sangs rgyas spro zhing gti mug gi dri ma de las bzlog ste /
analyzed: gti mug la spyod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas gti mug gi rigs can rnams sangs rgyas spro zhing gti mug gi dri ma de las bzlog ste /
translated: Those who engage in delusion and so forth explain that those of the deluded type emanate as Buddhas, and that delusion is to be averted from that stain.

original: rnam par snang mdzad du gyur pas 'od zer gyi sbyor bas de rnams rang gi rdo rje'i sku la 'jug par bya'o zhes gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa sgrub par bstan to //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad du gyur pas 'od zer gyi sbyor bas de rnams rang gi rdo rje'i sku la 'jug par bya'o zhes gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa sgrub par bstan to //
translated: Having become Vairocana, one should cause them to enter one’s vajra body by the yoga of light rays. Thus he shows the accomplishment of the perfection of the aims of others.

original: de bzhin du gsung rdo rje la sogs pa la yang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gsung rdo rje la sogs pa la yang shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand this also in the case of Vajra Speech and so forth.🔽Because of the nature of fearlessness.

original: mi 'jigs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni /
translated: It is said:

original: brtan pa snying po khong stong med //
analyzed: brtan pa snying po khong stong med //
translated: Firm, essential, without hollowness,

original: gcad med dbyer med mtshan nyid de //
analyzed: gcad med dbyer med mtshan nyid de //
translated: inseparable, without marks,

original: sred pa med cing 'jig med pa //
analyzed: sred pa med cing 'jig med pa //
translated: without craving, without destruction,

original: stong pa nyid ni rdo rjer bshad //🔽ces 'byung bas so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni rdo rjer bshad // ces 'byung bas so //
translated: emptiness is explained as vajra.

original: de la sngar bshad pa'i rim pas zhes pa ni 'dod chags kyi spyod pa dang ldan pa sems can gyi khams sbyang ba'i rim pas spro zhing bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la sngar bshad pa'i rim pas zhes pa ni 'dod chags kyi spyod pa dang ldan pa sems can gyi khams sbyang ba'i rim pas spro zhing bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: Therein, “by the previously explained process” means that one should expand and withdraw by the process of purifying the realm of sentient beings, which is endowed with the practice of passion.

original: rdo rje @271a * //
analyzed: rdo rje @271a * //
translated: Vajra🔽means Great Vajradhara.

original: sems dpa' ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'o zhes pa ni /
analyzed: sems dpa' ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'o zhes pa ni /
translated: It is said:

original: lnga spong ba dang lnga rig pa //
analyzed: lnga spong ba dang lnga rig pa //
translated: Abandoning the five, knowing the five,

original: rdo rje zhes byar bshad pa yin //
analyzed: rdo rje zhes byar bshad pa yin //
translated: is explained as “vajra.”

original: de la sems dpa' ni rang bzhin gang la yod pa de la rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la sems dpa' ni rang bzhin gang la yod pa de la rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
translated: Here, one who has the nature of a hero is called “Vajrasattva.”

original: sku ni sa'o zhes pa ni tshig phrad kyi don du ma yin pas so //
analyzed: sku ni sa'o zhes pa ni tshig phrad kyi don du ma yin pas so //
translated: “ Body” is “sa,” because it is not the meaning of a compound.

original: la ste 'dzin cing bdag gir mdzad pas na zhes pa ni re ba thams cad yongs su rdzogs pas so //
analyzed: la ste 'dzin cing bdag gir mdzad pas na zhes pa ni re ba thams cad yongs su rdzogs pas so //
translated: “ Holding” and “making one’s own” is “va,” because all hopes are fulfilled.

original: rin chen 'byung ldan ni nam mkha'i mdzod kyi nye bar mtshon pas so //
analyzed: rin chen 'byung ldan ni nam mkha'i mdzod kyi nye bar mtshon pas so //
translated: Ratnasaṃbhava is illustrated by the sky treasury.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rang bzhin yin pas na rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rang bzhin yin pas na rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
translated: Because he is the nature of all buddhas, he is Mahāvajradhara.

original: dam tshig gis khro bar mdzad pas na /
analyzed: dam tshig gis khro bar mdzad pas na /
translated: Because he is wrathful by means of his commitments,🔽he is Vajra Wrathful.

original: zhes pa ni dam tshig nyams pa la khros pa'i stobs kyis nges par bsdams pa'am sbyang bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni dam tshig nyams pa la khros pa'i stobs kyis nges par bsdams pa'am sbyang bar byed pa'o //
translated: Because he is wrathful by means of his commitments, he is definitely restrained or purified by the power of being angry with those who violate their commitments.

original: dam tshig gsos pa la bcom ldan 'das don yod grub pa dbang byed pa yin no zhes bla ma'i rgyud yin no //
analyzed: dam tshig gsos pa la bcom ldan 'das don yod grub pa dbang byed pa yin no zhes bla ma'i rgyud yin no //
translated: In the restoration of the commitments, the Bhagavān Amoghasiddhi is the lord.

original: zhe sdang las byung ba'i phyir khro bo ni mi bskyod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang las byung ba'i phyir khro bo ni mi bskyod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it arises from hatred, wrath is called “Akṣhobhya.”

original: de ni sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa la sogs pa lnga pos rim pa gnyis sngar mdor bstan pas ni rgyas par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa la sogs pa lnga pos rim pa gnyis sngar mdor bstan pas ni rgyas par bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is the extensive explanation of the five recollections of the Buddha, etc., which were previously taught in brief in the second stage.

original: dam tshig gi rjes su dran pas las kyi rgyal ba mchog gi yan lag gcig tshim par bya ba'i cho ga bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: dam tshig gi rjes su dran pas las kyi rgyal ba mchog gi yan lag gcig tshim par bya ba'i cho ga bstan par bya ste /
translated: The rite of satisfying one branch of the supreme victor of action with the recollection of the pledge should be taught.

original: dam tshig thams cad sprul par mdzad pas na dam tshig ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
analyzed: dam tshig thams cad sprul par mdzad pas na dam tshig ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
translated: The pledge is the Great Vajradhara, since he emanates all pledges.

original: ye shes kyi sku'i rang bzhin gyi zhes pa ni ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin gyi lha'i sku zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ye shes kyi sku'i rang bzhin gyi zhes pa ni ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin gyi lha'i sku zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “the nature of the body of intuition” is the body of the deity which is the nature of the five intuitions.

original: bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pas thob par bya ba'i ye shes kyi sku 'dir 'chad par 'dod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pas thob par bya ba'i ye shes kyi sku 'dir 'chad par 'dod pa ma yin te /
translated: The body of intuition which is to be attained by the process of self-consecration is not being explained here,

original: de rdzogs pa'i rim pa yin pas bdud rtsis tshim pa'i cho ga mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rdzogs pa'i rim pa yin pas bdud rtsis tshim pa'i cho ga mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the stage of completion, and because it is not reasonable to have a rite of satisfaction with nectar.

original: dgos na yang rdzogs pa'i rim pa nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dgos na yang rdzogs pa'i rim pa nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: If necessary, the completion stage will be impaired.🔽After that, he is remembered, i.e.

original: de'i phyi nas rjes su dran zhing zhes pa ni ting nge 'dzin gnyis kyis rdzogs pa rdo rje 'chang ni sku phyi ma'i dus su'o //
analyzed: de'i phyi nas rjes su dran zhing zhes pa ni ting nge 'dzin gnyis kyis rdzogs pa rdo rje 'chang ni sku phyi ma'i dus su'o //
translated: Vajradhara, who is perfected by the two samadhis, at the time of the later body.

original: sprul pa'i sku'o zhes pa ni spyan ma la sogs pa lha mo bzhis bskul ba dang / mi bskyod pa la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa lngas bstod pa las 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku'o zhes pa ni spyan ma la sogs pa lha mo bzhis bskul ba dang / mi bskyod pa la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa lngas bstod pa las 'byung ba'o //
translated: The emanation body is said to arise from the urging of the four goddesses such as Lochana and the praise of the five Tathagatas such as Akshobhya.

original: de rgyas par bya ba'i phyir zhes pa ni de tshim pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rgyas par bya ba'i phyir zhes pa ni de tshim pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to expand that, i.e. in order to satisfy that.

original: lce rdo rje ni rdo rje lta bu'i lce bsgoms nas so //
analyzed: lce rdo rje ni rdo rje lta bu'i lce bsgoms nas so //
translated: Having meditated on the vajra tongue, i.e. the tongue like a vajra.

original: rkan gyi padma zhes pa ni rkan gyi phyogs so //
analyzed: rkan gyi padma zhes pa ni rkan gyi phyogs so //
translated: The lotus of the palate is the region of the palate.

original: rdo rje padma la sogs pas dpe bstan to //
analyzed: rdo rje padma la sogs pas dpe bstan to //
translated: The example is taught by the vajra lotus, etc.

original: klad rgyas na @271b gnas pa'i bdud rtsi zhes pa ni tshangs pa'i bu ga'i nang na gnas pa'i byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: klad rgyas na @271b gnas pa'i bdud rtsi zhes pa ni tshangs pa'i bu ga'i nang na gnas pa'i byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: The nectar that resides in the brain is the bodhicitta that resides in the aperture of Brahma.

original: thigs pa'i bskul ba dbab pa'i cha rnams kyis zhes pa ni aom gyis yi ge 'bar bas bzhus pa dang dbyangs bcu drug gi bdag nyid kyi zla ba'i dkyil 'khor zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thigs pa'i bskul ba dbab pa'i cha rnams kyis zhes pa ni aom gyis yi ge 'bar bas bzhus pa dang dbyangs bcu drug gi bdag nyid kyi zla ba'i dkyil 'khor zhes bya'o //
translated: The parts of the descent of the urging of the drops are the burning by the blazing syllable OṀ and the moon-disk which is the nature of the sixteen vowels.

original: gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa zhes pa ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched kyi bdag nyid kyi lus so //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa zhes pa ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched kyi bdag nyid kyi lus so //
translated: The aggregates of form, etc. are the body which is the nature of the aggregates, elements, and media.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams zhes pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams zhes pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin te /
translated: The mind and mental factors are the nature of mind and mental factors.

original: rnam par shes pa lus bde bar gyur na sems la yang yid bde ba bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa lus bde bar gyur na sems la yang yid bde ba bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when the consciousness becomes blissful in the body, it also produces mental pleasure in the mind.

original: tshim par bya zhes pa ni tshim pa nyid mchod pa zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: tshim par bya zhes pa ni tshim pa nyid mchod pa zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: The word “satisfy” means that satisfaction itself is worship.

original: bdud rtsi dbab pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas bdud rtsi myang ba'i cho ga la phan yon bstan to //
analyzed: bdud rtsi dbab pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas bdud rtsi myang ba'i cho ga la phan yon bstan to //
translated: The benefits of the rite of tasting the elixir are taught by the words “descent of the elixir,” etc.

original: tshig gi don 'di yin te /
analyzed: tshig gi don 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of the words is as follows.

original: phra mo'i rnal 'byor dang bzlas pa dang 'od du zhu ba dang lha mos bskul bas ldang ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pas bstod pa'i 'og tu sems dub par 'gyur na mtho gang tsam bor nas rang gi spyi bor cha bcu drug yongs su gyur pa las gdugs dkar po lta bu rgyas pa bdud rtsi lnga'i rang bzhin gyi zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dkar po bsams la
analyzed: phra mo'i rnal 'byor dang bzlas pa dang 'od du zhu ba dang lha mos bskul bas ldang ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pas bstod pa'i 'og tu sems dub par 'gyur na mtho gang tsam bor nas rang gi spyi bor cha bcu drug yongs su gyur pa las gdugs dkar po lta bu rgyas pa bdud rtsi lnga'i rang bzhin gyi zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dkar po bsams la
translated: If one becomes tired after praising the Tathagata, one should descend one handspan and imagine a white parasol, the size of one's head, completely transformed into a white moon mandala, the nature of the five nectars.

original: / de'i dkyil du thur du kha bltas pa yi ge aom 'bar ba dgod de /
analyzed: / de'i dkyil du thur du kha bltas pa yi ge aom 'bar ba dgod de /
translated: In the center of that, one should place an inverted syllable oṃ, blazing.

original: lce'i rdo rje rkan gyi phyogs su yang dag par sbyar zhing yi ge aom de'i 'bar bas de bzhus par 'gyur ba tshangs pa'i sgo nas 'dzag pa lces myang bar bsams la kun du spyod pa'i rim pas lus po thams cad tshim par 'gyur ba bsgom par bya'o
analyzed: lce'i rdo rje rkan gyi phyogs su yang dag par sbyar zhing yi ge aom de'i 'bar bas de bzhus par 'gyur ba tshangs pa'i sgo nas 'dzag pa lces myang bar bsams la kun du spyod pa'i rim pas lus po thams cad tshim par 'gyur ba bsgom par bya'o
translated: The vajra tongue should be joined to the palate, and the blazing of that syllable oṃ should melt it, dripping through the brahma aperture. One should imagine that the tongue tastes it and meditate that the entire body becomes satisfied through the process of conduct.

original: // de'i phan yon ni /
analyzed: // de'i phan yon ni /
translated: The benefits of that are as follows.

original: rga ba ma yin gnyer ba min //
analyzed: rga ba ma yin gnyer ba min //
translated: It is not old age, it is not decay,

original: de bzhin dus med 'chi ba med //
analyzed: de bzhin dus med 'chi ba med //
translated: Likewise, there is no death, no fear.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' bzhin du de'i tshe dang nad med gzhon par 'gyur zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' bzhin du de'i tshe dang nad med gzhon par 'gyur zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: At that time, one becomes youthful, with the life and health of Vajrasattva.

original: de ni las kyi rgyal ba mchog gi ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: de ni las kyi rgyal ba mchog gi ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: This is the samadhi of the Supreme King of Actions.

original: dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog gi ting nge 'dzin gyi dang po'i yan lag bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog gi ting nge 'dzin gyi dang po'i yan lag bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, the first branch of the samadhi of the Supreme King of Mandalas will be explained.

original: mchog sgrub pa la gnas pa zhes pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: mchog sgrub pa la gnas pa zhes pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: Abiding in the practice of supreme attainment means abiding in meditative union.

original: phyi'i bud med dang yang dag par sbyor bas zhes pa ni legs par sbyangs pa shin tu slob pa dam tshig gi phyag rgya dang 'brel pas so //🔽bdud rtsi 'byin pa'i dgos pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir zhes pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa las 'byung @272a * //
analyzed: phyi'i bud med dang yang dag par sbyor bas zhes pa ni legs par sbyangs pa shin tu slob pa dam tshig gi phyag rgya dang 'brel pas so // bdud rtsi 'byin pa'i dgos pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir zhes pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa las 'byung @272a * //
translated: By engaging in union with an external woman means by engaging in proper training, in the practice of the pledge seal, which is the excellent training.

original: ba'i byang chub kyi sems spro bar bya'o //
analyzed: ba'i byang chub kyi sems spro bar bya'o //
translated: In order to demonstrate the purpose of emitting nectar, means that the bodhicitta arising from meditative union should be emitted.

original: phyung ba'i dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba ni badzra dhri ka ces bya ba la sogs pa'i phyung ba'i sngags kyi ngo bo byang chub sems kyi thig le rnams kyis sprul pa'i dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyung ba'i dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba ni badzra dhri ka ces bya ba la sogs pa'i phyung ba'i sngags kyi ngo bo byang chub sems kyi thig le rnams kyis sprul pa'i dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “mandala emanated” is that the mandalas emanated are the essence of the mantras “vajra-dhṛk” and so forth, the drops of bodhicitta.

original: rang gi bya ba la dbang byed pas na dbang po'o zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor pa spro ba'i phyir bdag po yin pas so //
analyzed: rang gi bya ba la dbang byed pas na dbang po'o zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor pa spro ba'i phyir bdag po yin pas so //
translated: “ Sense organ” means that they control their own actions, because they are the lords of the emanation of the mandala.

original: skyes pa dang bud med kyi bdag po dag ste zhes pa ni sngar bshad pa'i rim pas sngags kyi yi ge ma lus pa dgod pa gsang ba'i rdo rje dang padma'o //
analyzed: skyes pa dang bud med kyi bdag po dag ste zhes pa ni sngar bshad pa'i rim pas sngags kyi yi ge ma lus pa dgod pa gsang ba'i rdo rje dang padma'o //
translated: “ Male and female lords” are the secret vajra and lotus, on which all the mantra syllables are arranged in the sequence explained above.

original: 'khyud pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba la byang ba'o zhes pa ni dpal rdo rje gdan bzhi'i rgyud las gsungs pa'i sgong thog la sogs pa'i bya ba la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: 'khyud pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba la byang ba'o zhes pa ni dpal rdo rje gdan bzhi'i rgyud las gsungs pa'i sgong thog la sogs pa'i bya ba la mkhas pa'o //
translated: “ Skilled in the practice of embracing and so forth” means skilled in the activities of the egg and so forth, as taught in the glorious Catuspīṭha Tantra.

original: rang gi sa bon zhes pa ni byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: rang gi sa bon zhes pa ni byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: “ Their own seed” is bodhicitta.

original: rtsa sbubs stong bdun cu rtsa gnyis bskul nas zhes pa ni /
analyzed: rtsa sbubs stong bdun cu rtsa gnyis bskul nas zhes pa ni /
translated: Having aroused the seventy-two thousand channels,

original: rdo rje dang padma snyoms par 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid kyi sbyor bas so //
analyzed: rdo rje dang padma snyoms par 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid kyi sbyor bas so //
translated: means by the yoga characterized by the union of the vajra and lotus.

original: snying gar phyin pa zhes pa ni rtsa thams cad kyi gtso bor gyur pa snying ga ni 'dod pa'i gdugs te rtsa dbu ma'o //
analyzed: snying gar phyin pa zhes pa ni rtsa thams cad kyi gtso bor gyur pa snying ga ni 'dod pa'i gdugs te rtsa dbu ma'o //
translated: Having reached the heart means that the heart, which is the principal of all channels, is the parasol of desire, the central channel.

original: de las thob pa'i byang chub sems zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de las thob pa'i byang chub sems zhes bya'o //
translated: The bodhicitta obtained from that is called the “bodhicitta of the desire realm.”

original: rdo rje'i lam nas phab pa'o zhes pa ni snang ba la sogs pa'i ye shes gsum myong zhing rtags lnga mtshon pa sngon du 'gro ba'i 'od gsal ba la 'jug ste /
analyzed: rdo rje'i lam nas phab pa'o zhes pa ni snang ba la sogs pa'i ye shes gsum myong zhing rtags lnga mtshon pa sngon du 'gro ba'i 'od gsal ba la 'jug ste /
translated: Having descended through the vajra path means that one enters into clear light, preceded by the experience of the three exalted wisdoms of appearance and so forth and the indication of the five signs.

original: badzra dhri ka ces bya ba la sogs pa phyung ba'i sngags kyi bdag nyid phat kyi sgra ste spro bar bya'o //
analyzed: badzra dhri ka ces bya ba la sogs pa phyung ba'i sngags kyi bdag nyid phat kyi sgra ste spro bar bya'o //
translated: The mantra of the nature of the emission, “vajra-dhṛk” and so forth, is the sound of “phaṭ” and should be emitted.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas byang chub kyi sems spro ba'i 'bras bu bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas byang chub kyi sems spro ba'i 'bras bu bstan par bya ste /
translated: The result of the emission of bodhicitta is taught by “then” and so forth.

original: bu dang tsha bo la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor zhes pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po las 'byung ba'i phyir bu ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'o //
analyzed: bu dang tsha bo la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor zhes pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po las 'byung ba'i phyir bu ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'o //
translated: The mandala of sons, grandsons, and so on is called a mandala because it arises from Great Vajradhara. The sons are the five Tathagatas.

original: de'i sprul pa yin pa dang de'i bya ba byed pas tsha bo ni sa'i snying po la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //
analyzed: de'i sprul pa yin pa dang de'i bya ba byed pas tsha bo ni sa'i snying po la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //
translated: The grandsons are the Bodhisattvas, Kshitigarbha and so on, because they are his emanations and because they perform his functions.

original: de rnams kyi dkyil 'khor ni rang rang gi phyung ba'i sngags las 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi dkyil 'khor ni rang rang gi phyung ba'i sngags las 'byung ba'o //
translated: Their mandala arises from the mantras that are their respective seed syllables.

original: de ltar gyur pa'i dkyil 'khor ni brgyan pa zhes bya ba la chos 'byung ba'i nang dang dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor dang sgrub pa'i dkyil 'khor la yang rgyan du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa'i dkyil 'khor ni brgyan pa zhes bya ba la chos 'byung ba'i nang dang dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor dang sgrub pa'i dkyil 'khor la yang rgyan du gyur pa'o //
translated: The mandala that has come about in this way is called an ornament, because it is an ornament of the Dharma-source, the mandala of commitment, and the mandala of evocation.

original: sangs rgyas nyid rab tu ster bas na sangs rgyas kyi bur gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid rab tu ster bas na sangs rgyas kyi bur gyur pa'o //
translated: It is a son of the Buddha because it bestows Buddhahood.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas nye bar bsdus pa bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas nye bar bsdus pa bstan to //
translated: Thus, and so on, indicates the summary.

original: dgongs pas bshad pa zhes pa ni 'gal ba'i @272b sgra'i sgo nas dkyil 'khor gyi de kho na nyid bstan pas so //
analyzed: dgongs pas bshad pa zhes pa ni 'gal ba'i @272b sgra'i sgo nas dkyil 'khor gyi de kho na nyid bstan pas so //
translated: The “explanation by the intention” is the teaching of the reality of the mandala by means of contradictory words.

original: dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: This is the samadhi called “Victorious Mandala.”

original: rnal 'byor ni thugs rje chen po bsgom pa sngon du 'gro ba khyad par gyi gnas bzung ba dang bgegs bskrad pa dang / stong pa nyid bsgom pa dang / ye shes kyi sa gzhi bsgom pa dang / gzhal yas khang pa bskyed pa dang /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ni thugs rje chen po bsgom pa sngon du 'gro ba khyad par gyi gnas bzung ba dang bgegs bskrad pa dang / stong pa nyid bsgom pa dang / ye shes kyi sa gzhi bsgom pa dang / gzhal yas khang pa bskyed pa dang /
translated: The yoga is the meditation on great compassion, the taking of the special place, the expulsion of the obstructors, the meditation on emptiness, the meditation on the ground of gnosis, the generation of the celestial mansion,

original: lhag par mos pa'i dkyil 'khor bsgom pa dang / don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor bsgom pa dang / gdan la sogs pa'i dbye ba dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi sngags kyis byin gyis brlab pa dang / zla ba'i dkyil 'khor bsgom pa dang ; / de la sa bon dgod pa dang //
analyzed: lhag par mos pa'i dkyil 'khor bsgom pa dang / don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor bsgom pa dang / gdan la sogs pa'i dbye ba dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi sngags kyis byin gyis brlab pa dang / zla ba'i dkyil 'khor bsgom pa dang ; / de la sa bon dgod pa dang //
translated: the meditation on the mandala of resolute imagination, the meditation on the ultimate mandala, the divisions of the seat, etc., the consecration with the mantra of the dharmadhatu, the meditation on the moon mandala, the placement of the seed syllable there,

original: de yongs su gyur pa las phyag mtshan dang / de yongs su gyur nas rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i sku rdzogs pa de rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa las phyag mtshan dang / de yongs su gyur nas rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i sku rdzogs pa de rnal 'byor ro //
translated: That is the yoga.

original: ye shes sems dpa' dang ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' gnyis bsgom pa ni rjes su rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: ye shes sems dpa' dang ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' gnyis bsgom pa ni rjes su rnal 'byor ro //
translated: The meditation on both the gnosis being and the concentration being is the subsequent yoga.

original: phung po dang khams dang skye mched dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dang lha mo dang byang chub sems dpa'i sa bon gyi byin gyis brlabs pa ni shin tu rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang skye mched dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dang lha mo dang byang chub sems dpa'i sa bon gyi byin gyis brlabs pa ni shin tu rnal 'byor ro //
translated: The consecration of the seed syllables of the aggregates, elements, sense bases, tathāgatas, goddesses, and bodhisattvas is the extremely une yoga.

original: de rdzogs nas gang zhig bya ba yin pa de zhes pa ni sku la sogs pa byin gyis brlabs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rnal 'byor chen po'o ;
analyzed: de rdzogs nas gang zhig bya ba yin pa de zhes pa ni sku la sogs pa byin gyis brlabs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rnal 'byor chen po'o ;
translated: The great yoga is that which is to be done after that is complete, which has the characteristic of the consecration of the body, and so on.

original: / de bstan pa'i phyir zhes pa ni gsal bar bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / de bstan pa'i phyir zhes pa ni gsal bar bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to teach that, in order to explain it clearly,

original: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa zhes pa ni gzhung gi 'di skad bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa zhes pa ni gzhung gi 'di skad bshad par bya ste /
translated: Vairocana, and so on, this text should be explained as follows.

original: mgo bo dang lkog ma dang snying ga'i phyogs su zla ba dang padma dang rdo rje yi ge gsum las 'byung ba bsgoms nas /
analyzed: mgo bo dang lkog ma dang snying ga'i phyogs su zla ba dang padma dang rdo rje yi ge gsum las 'byung ba bsgoms nas /
translated: Having meditated on the three syllables arising from the moon, lotus, and vajra at the head, throat, and heart,

original: de'i steng du dkar po dang dmar po dang sngon po'i yi ge aom la sogs pa gsum po de nyid bkod la /🔽de rnams las byung ba'i 'od zer gyi tshogs las spyan ma dang na bza' dkar mo dang m'a ma k'i'i tshogs spros la des 'og min dang bde ba can dang mngon par dga' ba'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing na bzhugs pa /
analyzed: de'i steng du dkar po dang dmar po dang sngon po'i yi ge aom la sogs pa gsum po de nyid bkod la / de rnams las byung ba'i 'od zer gyi tshogs las spyan ma dang na bza' dkar mo dang m'a ma k'i'i tshogs spros la des 'og min dang bde ba can dang mngon par dga' ba'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing na bzhugs pa /
translated: one should arrange the three syllables om, āḥ, and hūṃ, which are white, red, and blue, respectively, on top of those.🔽From the mass of light rays that arise from those, one should emanate the hosts of Locanā, Māmakī, and Pāṇḍaravāsinī.🔽With sweet words and the experience of play, they supplicate and arouse passion for the buddhas residing in Akaniṣṭha, Sukhāvatī, and Abhirati, Vairocana, Amitābha, and Akṣobhya, respectively.

original: rnam par snang mdzad dang 'od dpag tu med pa dang mi bskyod pa rnams tshig snyan pa dang rol pa'i nyams kyis gsol ba 'debs shing rjes su chags par byas la phyag gi zhags pas 'khyud cing 'gugs te mdun du gzhal yas khang pa'i shar phyogs kyi sgor🔽sna @273a * //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad dang 'od dpag tu med pa dang mi bskyod pa rnams tshig snyan pa dang rol pa'i nyams kyis gsol ba 'debs shing rjes su chags par byas la phyag gi zhags pas 'khyud cing 'gugs te mdun du gzhal yas khang pa'i shar phyogs kyi sgor🔽sna @273a * //
translated: Having been embraced by the noose of their hands, they are drawn forth and arrive in the eastern door of the celestial mansion in front.

original: tshogs padma dang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyis steng du bzhugs nas /
analyzed: tshogs padma dang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyis steng du bzhugs nas /
translated: Having sat on the lotus and moon seat,🔽one should please them with the five offerings and enter with Locanā and so forth.🔽Having gone for refuge to the Three Jewels,

original: mchod pa lngas mchod cing mnyes pa byas nas spyan ma la sogs pa de dang lhan cig tu 'jug par bya ste /
analyzed: mchod pa lngas mchod cing mnyes pa byas nas spyan ma la sogs pa de dang lhan cig tu 'jug par bya ste /
translated: one should recite the following mantra, which is the essence of the three vajras:

original: dpal ldan rdo rje gsung gi lam //
analyzed: dpal ldan rdo rje gsung gi lam //
translated: Oṃ vajra-uddhara, vajra-vidāraṇa, vajra-bhedana, vajra-praharaṇa, hūṃ phaṭ.🔽Then, one should recite the following mantra, which is the essence of the five buddhas:🔽Oṃ sarva-tathāgata-kāya-vāk-citta-vajra-svabhāva-ātmako ’haṃ.🔽Then, one should recite the following mantra, which is the essence of the three vajras:🔽Oṃ sarva-tathāgata-kāya-vāk-citta-vajra-svabhāva-ātmako ’haṃ.🔽Then, one should recite the following mantra, which is the essence of the five buddhas:🔽Oṃ sarva-tathāgata-kāya-vāk-citta-pāramitā-prāptaye vajra-svabhāva-ātmako ’haṃ.🔽Then, one should recite the following mantra, which is the essence of the three vajras:🔽Oṃ sarva-tathāgata-kāya-vāk-citta-vajra-svabhāva-ātmako ’haṃ.

original: zhes bya ba'i gsol ba gdab pa sngon du 'gro bas aom sarba ta th'a ga ta k'a ya w'a ka tsi tta badzra sva bh'a wa a'atma ko& ham /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i gsol ba gdab pa sngon du 'gro bas aom sarba ta th'a ga ta k'a ya w'a ka tsi tta badzra sva bh'a wa a'atma ko& ham /
translated: Then, one should recite the following mantra, which is the essence of the five buddhas:🔽Oṃ sarva-tathāgata-kāya-vāk-citta-pāramitā-prāptaye vajra-svabhāva-ātmako ’haṃ.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngags kyi tshig rnams kyis brtan par byas la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngags kyi tshig rnams kyis brtan par byas la /
translated: Then, one should recite the following mantra, which is the essence of the three vajras:🔽Oṃ sarva-tathāgata-kāya-vāk-citta-vajra-svabhāva-ātmako ’haṃ.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'di rnams kyis nga rgyal bya'o //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'di rnams kyis nga rgyal bya'o //
translated: Then, one should recite the following mantra, which is the essence of the five buddhas:

original: rnam par snang mdzad de zhes pa ni lus rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin yin pas so //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad de zhes pa ni lus rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin yin pas so //
translated: Oṃ sarva-tathāgata-kāya-vāk-citta-pāramitā-prāptaye vajra-svabhāva-ātmako ’haṃ.🔽Then

original: dus gsum zhes pa la sogs pas longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku'i rang bzhin gyis rnam par snang mdzad kyi dkyil 'khor du zhugs pas de'i rang bzhin gyi nga rgyal bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: dus gsum zhes pa la sogs pas longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku'i rang bzhin gyis rnam par snang mdzad kyi dkyil 'khor du zhugs pas de'i rang bzhin gyi nga rgyal bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: The phrase in the three times and so on indicates that one should assume the pride of being of the nature of Vairocana, having entered the mandala of Vairocana by means of the nature of the enjoyment body and emanation body.

original: sprul pa'i sku gang zhig yod pa zhes pa ni sems can gyi don mdzad pa'i phyir dang 'byung ba'i sku ni sprul pa'i sku zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku gang zhig yod pa zhes pa ni sems can gyi don mdzad pa'i phyir dang 'byung ba'i sku ni sprul pa'i sku zhes bya'o //
translated: The phrase the emanation body that exists means that the body that appears for the sake of sentient beings is called the emanation body.

original: gzhan du na rtag tu dga' ba nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa me long lta bu la sogs pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la sku dang 'brel ba ci dgos so //
analyzed: gzhan du na rtag tu dga' ba nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa me long lta bu la sogs pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la sku dang 'brel ba ci dgos so //
translated: Otherwise, what need would the Tathagatas, who are of the nature of mirror-like and other wisdoms, which are always like space and joy, have for a body?

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: dmar dang ljang gu dur kha ste //
analyzed: dmar dang ljang gu dur kha ste //
translated: Red, green, and blue-black,

original: khyed la sku mdog yod pa min //
analyzed: khyed la sku mdog yod pa min //
translated: You have no bodily color.

original: dkar nag ser po ma yin pa'i //
analyzed: dkar nag ser po ma yin pa'i //
translated: Not white, not black, not yellow,

original: kha dog las 'das khyod la 'dud //🔽chen po ma yin thung ba min //
analyzed: kha dog las 'das khyod la 'dud // chen po ma yin thung ba min //
translated: I bow to you, beyond color.🔽Not great, not short,

original: ring po ma yin zlum po min //
analyzed: ring po ma yin zlum po min //
translated: Not long, not round,

original: tshad med kyi ni tshul thob pa'i //
analyzed: tshad med kyi ni tshul thob pa'i //
translated: You have attained the way of the immeasurables.

original: tshad med khyod la phyag 'tshal bstod //🔽ces 'byung ngo //
analyzed: tshad med khyod la phyag 'tshal bstod // ces 'byung ngo //
translated: Homage and praise to you, Immeasurable!

original: bdag gi slob mar gyur pa yang //
analyzed: bdag gi slob mar gyur pa yang //
translated: And also my disciples

original: zhes pa ni slob mar 'dod pa'i yang ngo //
analyzed: zhes pa ni slob mar 'dod pa'i yang ngo //
translated: This is also for those who wish to be disciples.

original: lus ni lta bu'i ngo bor gyur cig pa ste zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi rang bzhin skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum bcu rtsa gnyis kyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: lus ni lta bu'i ngo bor gyur cig pa ste zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi rang bzhin skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum bcu rtsa gnyis kyis brgyan pa /
translated: May my body become like the essence of Vairocana, adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great being,🔽endowed with the eighty minor marks.

original: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu dang ldan par gyur cig / gsol ba ni gsol pa 'debs par bya'o //
analyzed: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu dang ldan par gyur cig / gsol ba ni gsol pa 'debs par bya'o //
translated: The request is to make the request.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pas na zhes pa ni gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis kyi rang bzhin yin pas na 'od dpag tu med pa'o zhes grags so //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pas na zhes pa ni gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis kyi rang bzhin yin pas na 'od dpag tu med pa'o zhes grags so //
translated: Because it has become the essence of that, it is known as Amitābha, because it has the nature of the twelve branches of scripture.

original: byang chub kyi sems kyi ngo bo yin pas na rdo rje'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyi ngo bo yin pas na rdo rje'o //
translated: It is a vajra because it is the essence of bodhicitta.

original: gsung rab thams cad kyi chos kyi rang bzhin yin pas na chos so //
analyzed: gsung rab thams cad kyi chos kyi rang bzhin yin pas na chos so //
translated: It is the Dharma because it is the nature of all the teachings.

original: rdo rje yang yin la chos kyang yin pas na rdo rje chos te ngag gi dbang phyug @273b ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rdo rje yang yin la chos kyang yin pas na rdo rje chos te ngag gi dbang phyug @273b ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since he is both a vajra and a dharma, he is a vajra dharma, which means “lord of speech.”

original: nges pa ni ming gi rnam grangs thams cad kyi sgo nas bshad pa ni gsung ba ste nges par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa ni ming gi rnam grangs thams cad kyi sgo nas bshad pa ni gsung ba ste nges par bshad pa'o //
translated: He is the one who explains through all the synonyms, the one who explains with certainty.

original: yang dag pa zhes pa ni phyin ci ma log pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa zhes pa ni phyin ci ma log pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Correct means that which is not distorted.

original: nye bar mtshon pa tsam ste zhes pa ni nges pa'i tshig 'ba' zhig tu ma yin no //
analyzed: nye bar mtshon pa tsam ste zhes pa ni nges pa'i tshig 'ba' zhig tu ma yin no //
translated: It is merely an illustration means that it is not just a synonym.

original: des zhes bya la sogs pa ni de la chos so so yang dag par rig pa ni gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis kyi chos ma lus pa kha ton du mnga' ba'o //
analyzed: des zhes bya la sogs pa ni de la chos so so yang dag par rig pa ni gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis kyi chos ma lus pa kha ton du mnga' ba'o //
translated: With regard to that, the correct understanding of the dharma is the mastery of the entire dharma of the twelve branches of excellent speech through recitation.

original: don so so yang dag par rig pa ni de'i brjod par bya ba'i don dran pa'o //
analyzed: don so so yang dag par rig pa ni de'i brjod par bya ba'i don dran pa'o //
translated: The correct understanding of the meaning is the recollection of the meaning that is expressed by those.

original: spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa zhes pa ni sngar ma byung ba'i gzhal bya rtsom par byed pa ste /
analyzed: spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa zhes pa ni sngar ma byung ba'i gzhal bya rtsom par byed pa ste /
translated: The correct understanding of confidence is the composition of a subject that has not previously occurred.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it has been said:

original: sar zhing sar pa'i gzhal bya ni //
analyzed: sar zhing sar pa'i gzhal bya ni //
translated: The object of knowledge of the earth and the earth-possessor

original: rtsom pa'i shes rab spobs par bshad //🔽ces 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rtsom pa'i shes rab spobs par bshad // ces 'byung ngo //
translated: is said to be the eloquence of the wisdom of composition.

original: chos 'dzin pa dang 'dra bar gyur cig pa'o zhes pa ni yan lag drug cu dang ldan pa padma'i 'dab ma dang mtshungs pa mnga' ba g-yas su 'khyil pa'i dung dang 'dra ba'i lkog ma'i phyogs su gnas pa gsung rnams su gyur cig ces gsol ba 'debs pa'o
analyzed: chos 'dzin pa dang 'dra bar gyur cig pa'o zhes pa ni yan lag drug cu dang ldan pa padma'i 'dab ma dang mtshungs pa mnga' ba g-yas su 'khyil pa'i dung dang 'dra ba'i lkog ma'i phyogs su gnas pa gsung rnams su gyur cig ces gsol ba 'debs pa'o
translated: The phrase may I be like the one who holds the Dharma means that one prays, May I have a voice that is endowed with sixty aspects, like the petals of a lotus, and that is situated in the throat region, like a right-spiraling conch.🔽The phrase the mind of Akshobhya means that the mind is the nature of the gnosis of the Dharma realm.

original: // mi bskyod pa'o zhes pa ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin sems yin pas so /🔽glo bur gyi dri ma so sor snang ba dang ldan pas 'khor bar 'khor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: // mi bskyod pa'o zhes pa ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin sems yin pas so / glo bur gyi dri ma so sor snang ba dang ldan pas 'khor bar 'khor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It is said, The mind, which is the nature of the gnosis of the Dharma realm, is the cause of the world and the world beyond.

original: sems 'di'i rang bzhin 'od gsal te /🔽glo bur pa rnams dri ma yin //
analyzed: sems 'di'i rang bzhin 'od gsal te / glo bur pa rnams dri ma yin //
translated: The mind, which is the nature of the gnosis of the Dharma realm, is the cause of the world and the world beyond.🔽The mind, which is the nature of the gnosis of the Dharma realm, is the cause of the world and the world beyond.🔽The mind, which is the nature of the gnosis of the Dharma realm, is the cause of the world and the world beyond.🔽The mind, which is the nature of the gnosis of the Dharma realm, is the cause of the world and the world beyond.🔽The mind, which is the nature of the gnosis of the Dharma realm, is the cause of the world and the world beyond.🔽The mind, which is the nature of the gnosis of the Dharma realm, is the cause of the world and the world beyond.🔽The mind, which is the nature of the gnosis of the Dharma realm, is the cause of the world and the world beyond.🔽The mind, which is the nature of the gnosis of the Dharma realm, is the cause of the world and the world beyond.🔽The mind, which is the nature of the gnosis of the Dharma realm, is the cause of the world and the world beyond.🔽The mind, which is the nature of the gnosis of the Dharma realm, is the cause of the world and the world beyond.

original: chu khams gser dang nam mkha' yi //
analyzed: chu khams gser dang nam mkha' yi //
translated: The mind, which is the nature of the gnosis of the Dharma realm, is the cause of the world and the world beyond.

original: dag pa bzhin du dag par 'dod //🔽ces 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dag pa bzhin du dag par 'dod //🔽ces 'byung ngo //
translated: The mind, which is the nature of the gnosis of the Dharma realm, is the cause of

original: gsang ba ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes so zhes pa ni chos kyi dbyings gyi ye shes so //
analyzed: gsang ba ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes so zhes pa ni chos kyi dbyings gyi ye shes so //
translated: Secret is nondual intuition.

original: de gsung zhing ston par mdzad pa ste zhes pa ni de ston par mdzad pas na gu hya ka ni gsang ba ste bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de gsung zhing ston par mdzad pa ste zhes pa ni de ston par mdzad pas na gu hya ka ni gsang ba ste bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'o //
translated: He teaches and reveals that, is Guhyaka, the Lord, Bhagavat Vairocana, etc.

original: de kho na nyid bstan pa rnams kyi gtso bor gyur pa zhes pa ni de rnams kyi bdag po yin pas thugs rdo rje'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid bstan pa rnams kyi gtso bor gyur pa zhes pa ni de rnams kyi bdag po yin pas thugs rdo rje'o //
translated: He is the chief of those who teach reality, is Cittavajra, because he is their lord.

original: blo ni reg bya rdo rje'i zhes pa ni shes rab kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blo ni reg bya rdo rje'i zhes pa ni shes rab kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Mind is Sparshavajrā, because she is the nature of wisdom.

original: kun nas bzang bas na zhes pa la thog ma dang bar ma dang tha mar bzang ba ni de dag gang las 'byung ba de ni kun du bzang po ste dpal thugs kyi rdo rje 'chang ba'o //
analyzed: kun nas bzang bas na zhes pa la thog ma dang bar ma dang tha mar bzang ba ni de dag gang las 'byung ba de ni kun du bzang po ste dpal thugs kyi rdo rje 'chang ba'o //
translated: He is Samantabhadra, because he is good in the beginning, middle, and end, and he is the glorious Vajradhara of mind from whom they all arise.

original: de lta bu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa dang bral bzla ba'i @274a * //
analyzed: de lta bu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa dang bral bzla ba'i @274a * //
translated: Thus, etc.

original: dkyil 'khor rdzogs pa dang 'dra bar bdag la yang sems gyur cig ces gsol ba 'debs pas nga rgyal bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor rdzogs pa dang 'dra bar bdag la yang sems gyur cig ces gsol ba 'debs pas nga rgyal bya'o //
translated: One should have the pride May my mind become just like the perfect maṇḍala.

original: sgra ji bzhin pa'o zhes pa ni dang po sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi phyogs gcig rnal 'byor chen po'i mtshan nyid 'chang bar 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin pa'o zhes pa ni dang po sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi phyogs gcig rnal 'byor chen po'i mtshan nyid 'chang bar 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: As it is, means that one should hold the characteristic of the great yoga, which is one part of the first yoga, the samādhi of engagement.

original: de ni sogs pa'i sgras shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni sogs pa'i sgras shes par bya'o //
translated: That is to be understood by the word etc.

original: da ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams la sku la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa bstan nas rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams la yang bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams la sku la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa bstan nas rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams la yang bstan par bya ste /
translated: Now, beginning with And now, the consecration of body, etc. is taught for the yogis of the stage of generation, and also for the yogis of the stage of completion.

original: sgrub pa'i mchog la gnas pa'i zhes pa ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i mchog la gnas pa'i zhes pa ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa'o //
translated: The phrase who abide in the supreme attainment refers to the yogis of the stage of completion.

original: rang bzhin yongs su shes pa tsam gyis zhes pa ni khams gsum la gnas pa'i sems can gyi khams kyi lus la sogs pa dang / bdag gi yang lus la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad ngo bo nyid du mnyam pa yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin yongs su shes pa tsam gyis zhes pa ni khams gsum la gnas pa'i sems can gyi khams kyi lus la sogs pa dang / bdag gi yang lus la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad ngo bo nyid du mnyam pa yin te /
translated: By merely knowing the nature means that the bodies, etc. of the beings of the three realms, and also my own body, etc. are all the same in terms of their essence.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin yin pas so //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin yin pas so //
translated: Because they are the nature of the dharmadhatu.

original: sgo nga las skyes pa dang zhes pa ni /
analyzed: sgo nga las skyes pa dang zhes pa ni /
translated: Those born from eggs are

original: 'dab chags bya la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dab chags bya la sogs pa'o //
translated: birds, etc.

original: mngal nas skyes pa dang zhes pa ni mi dang phyugs dang ri dags la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mngal nas skyes pa dang zhes pa ni mi dang phyugs dang ri dags la sogs pa'o //
translated: Those born from wombs are humans, cattle, deer, etc.

original: drod gsher las skyes pa dang zhes pa ni sbrang bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: drod gsher las skyes pa dang zhes pa ni sbrang bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: Those born from heat and moisture are insects, etc.

original: brdzus te skyes pa dang zhes pa ni dmyal ba dang yi dags dang lha dang lha ma yin rnams so //
analyzed: brdzus te skyes pa dang zhes pa ni dmyal ba dang yi dags dang lha dang lha ma yin rnams so //
translated: Those born supernaturally are hell beings, hungry ghosts, gods, and demigods.

original: bshad ma thag pa rnams kyi'o zhes pa ni rnam pa bzhi'i sems can rnams kyi skye gnas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa rnams kyi'o zhes pa ni rnam pa bzhi'i sems can rnams kyi skye gnas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Those just mentioned means that they are called the birth processes of beings of the four types.

original: 'di ni lus so zhes pa ni rkang pa'i dkyil nas brtsams te mgo bo'i bar du bshang gci la sogs pa'i rdzas rnams kyis gang ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni lus so zhes pa ni rkang pa'i dkyil nas brtsams te mgo bo'i bar du bshang gci la sogs pa'i rdzas rnams kyis gang ba'o //
translated: This is the body is from the center of the feet up to the head, filled with substances such as feces, urine, and so on.

original: 'di ni dag go zhes pa ni rnam pa bzhi'i gnas ngan len pa la sogs pa'i rtog pa bzhi dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dag go zhes pa ni rnam pa bzhi'i gnas ngan len pa la sogs pa'i rtog pa bzhi dang bcas pa'o //
translated: This is the pure is the four aspects, such as the abode of the four conceptualizations of impurity, and so on.

original: 'di ni sems so zhes pa ni rnam par shes pa brgyad kyi mtshan nyid rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i sems las byung ba'i chos dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sems so zhes pa ni rnam par shes pa brgyad kyi mtshan nyid rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i sems las byung ba'i chos dang ldan pa'o //
translated: This is the mind is the various aspects of the mind endowed with mental factors, the characteristics of the eight consciousnesses.

original: brtags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas de ltar gyur pa lus la so sor snang ba'i sems ni khams gsum pa dang / bdag gis gang yin pa de ni 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: brtags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas de ltar gyur pa lus la so sor snang ba'i sems ni khams gsum pa dang / bdag gis gang yin pa de ni 'dra ba yin no //
translated: As such, the mind that appears individually to the body is the three realms, and that which is mine is similar.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na zhes pas gtan tshigs bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na zhes pas gtan tshigs bshad par bya ste /
translated: Why? explains the reason.

original: de kho na nyid rig pa zhes pa ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa @274b rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid rig pa zhes pa ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa @274b rnams kyi'o //
translated: The knowledge of reality is of the yogins abiding in the stage of completion.

original: gang gi phyir sems de nam mkha' dang 'dra ba'i zhes pa ni nam mkha'i dkyil dang mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems de nam mkha' dang 'dra ba'i zhes pa ni nam mkha'i dkyil dang mtshungs pa'o //
translated: means it is like the center of space.🔽It is mixed,

original: 'dres par gyur pas zhes pa ni sems nyams pas so //
analyzed: 'dres par gyur pas zhes pa ni sems nyams pas so //
translated: means it is defiled by the mind.

original: ji skad du /🔽dngos po kun ni dngos po gcig rang bzhin //
analyzed: ji skad du / dngos po kun ni dngos po gcig rang bzhin //
translated: As it is said:🔽All things have the nature of one thing.

original: dngos po gcig ni dngos po kun ngo bo //
analyzed: dngos po gcig ni dngos po kun ngo bo //
translated: One thing has the nature of all things.

original: gang gis dngos gcig de nyid du mthong na //
analyzed: gang gis dngos gcig de nyid du mthong na //
translated: Whoever sees the reality of one thing

original: dngos po kun gyi de nyid nges mthong 'gyur //🔽zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dngos po kun gyi de nyid nges mthong 'gyur // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Will certainly see the reality of all things.🔽This shows the mastery of omnipresence,

original: 'dis ni thams cad du song ba'i dbang phyug tu bstan pas zhes pa ni thams cad du song ba ni khams gsum gyi yul can no //
analyzed: 'dis ni thams cad du song ba'i dbang phyug tu bstan pas zhes pa ni thams cad du song ba ni khams gsum gyi yul can no //
translated: means the mastery of omnipresence is the object of the three realms.🔽Mastery is the mastery of mind.

original: dbang phyug ni sems kyi dbang phyug gang yin pa de bstan pas so //
analyzed: dbang phyug ni sems kyi dbang phyug gang yin pa de bstan pas so //
translated: It shows the mental consecration,

original: thugs byin gyis brlab par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni sems kyi mnyam pa nyid shes pas so //
analyzed: thugs byin gyis brlab par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni sems kyi mnyam pa nyid shes pas so //
translated: means by knowing the sameness of mind.

original: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dang 'dra ba'i //
analyzed: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dang 'dra ba'i //
translated: The mind, which is like a moon mandala,

original: sems ni rang nyid kyis mthong 'gyur //
analyzed: sems ni rang nyid kyis mthong 'gyur //
translated: Is seen by itself.

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de ni thugs byin gyis brlab pa'o //
analyzed: de ni thugs byin gyis brlab pa'o //
translated: This is the consecration of the mind.

original: tshig thams cad don zhes pa ni sngags kyi sgras tshig gi don ston pas so //
analyzed: tshig thams cad don zhes pa ni sngags kyi sgras tshig gi don ston pas so //
translated: All words are the meaning, because the sound of the mantra indicates the meaning of the words.🔽The collection of those aggregates is the great elements, because they are the cause of the elements.🔽The collection of the great elements is the collection of the great elements, because they are the cause of the elements.🔽The collection of the great elements is the collection of the great elements, because they are the cause of the elements.

original: phung po de dag gi tshogs so zhes pa ni 'byung ba chen po las rgyur gyur pa'i sgra zin pa la sogs pa'i dbye ba'am /🔽yi ge dang tshig dang ngag dang ngag chen po la sogs pa'i dbye ba'am /
analyzed: phung po de dag gi tshogs so zhes pa ni 'byung ba chen po las rgyur gyur pa'i sgra zin pa la sogs pa'i dbye ba'am / yi ge dang tshig dang ngag dang ngag chen po la sogs pa'i dbye ba'am /
translated: The collection of the great elements is the collection of the great elements, because they are the cause of the elements.

original: chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong gi dbye bas so //🔽sku dang zhes bya ba ni brjod par bya ba'i thugs gang yin pa zhes pa la lus nyid du snang ba'i sems so //
analyzed: chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong gi dbye bas so // sku dang zhes bya ba ni brjod par bya ba'i thugs gang yin pa zhes pa la lus nyid du snang ba'i sems so //
translated: The collection of the great elements is the collection of the great elements, because they are the cause of the elements.🔽The collection of the great elements is the collection of the great elements, because they are the cause of the elements.

original: sku'i ngo bo nyid du yongs su gyur pa de ni zhes pa sems nyid lus kyi rnam pa nyid du snang ba'i phyir ro //🔽lus ni logs su yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sku'i ngo bo nyid du yongs su gyur pa de ni zhes pa sems nyid lus kyi rnam pa nyid du snang ba'i phyir ro // lus ni logs su yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The collection of the great elements is the collection of the great elements, because they are the cause of the elements.🔽The collection of the great elements is the collection of the great elements, because they are the cause of the elements.🔽The collection of the great elements is the collection of the great elements, because they are the cause of the elements.🔽The collection of the great elements is the collection of the great elements, because they are the cause of the elements.🔽The collection of the great elements is the collection of the great elements, because they are the cause of the elements.🔽The collection of the great elements is the collection of the great elements, because they are the cause of the elements.🔽The collection of the great elements is the collection of the great elements, because they are the cause of the elements.🔽The collection of the great elements is the collection of the great elements, because they are the cause of the elements.🔽The collection of the great elements is the collection of the great elements, because they are the cause of the elements.🔽The collection of the great elements is the collection of the great elements, because they are the cause of the elements.🔽The collection of the great elements is the collection of the great elements, because they are the cause of the elements.🔽The collection of the great elements is the collection of the great elements, because they are the cause of the elements.🔽The collection of the great elements is the collection of the great elements, because they are the cause of the elements.

original: gzhan gyi snang ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi snang ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The collection of the great elements is the collection of the great elements, because they are the cause of the elements.🔽The

original: rang snang ba gang yin pa de ni don dam par yod pa ste /
analyzed: rang snang ba gang yin pa de ni don dam par yod pa ste /
translated: That which is self-appearing is ultimately existent,

original: rang gi rnam par shes pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi rnam par shes pa yin no //
translated: being one's own consciousness.🔽Form, etc. are the appearances of others.

original: gzugs la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi snang ba yin no zhes rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi snang ba yin no zhes rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: This is a natural inference.

original: sems can thams cad kyi sngags kyi gzugs dang / sku dang gsung dang thugs gang yin pa la zhes pa ni ngag dang / lus kyang gang zhes bya ba'i don to//
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sngags kyi gzugs dang / sku dang gsung dang thugs gang yin pa la zhes pa ni ngag dang / lus kyang gang zhes bya ba'i don to//
translated: The phrase whatever is the mantra-form, body, speech, and mind of all sentient beings means whatever is speech and body.

original: yan lag ces pa ni ngag dang lus dang ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yan lag ces pa ni ngag dang lus dang ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word limb means speech and body.

original: ngag yin la zhes pa ni smra ba'i don dang ldan pas so //
