analyzed: ngag yin la zhes pa ni smra ba'i don dang ldan pas so //
translated: The phrase is speech means is endowed with the meaning of utterance.

original: mi phyed pas na rdo rje'o zhes pa ni so so skye bo rnams kyis dgag par bya ba ma yin pa'o //🔽lus ngag yin pa ni lus kyi sgra ni tshogs kyi rnam grags so //
analyzed: mi phyed pas na rdo rje'o zhes pa ni so so skye bo rnams kyis dgag par bya ba ma yin pa'o // lus ngag yin pa ni lus kyi sgra ni tshogs kyi rnam grags so //
translated: The word vajra means indivisible, that is, not to be refuted by ordinary beings.
The word body means collection of sounds, and speech means utterance.

original: nyid bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: nyid bstan par bya ste /
translated: That is to be explained.

original: sgo nga las skyes pa la sogs pa'i sgra'i tshogs gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: sgo nga las skyes pa la sogs pa'i sgra'i tshogs gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The collection of sounds such as born from an egg, etc.,

original: de rnams kyi rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i skad rnams so //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i skad rnams so //
translated: These are the various languages.

original: des ni sems can thams cad kyi ngag gi tshogs bstan to //
analyzed: des ni sems can thams cad kyi ngag gi tshogs bstan to //
translated: This teaches the collection of speech of all sentient beings.

original: kun du rtogs pas na zhes pa ni bsgom zhing tha snyad du bya'o //
analyzed: kun du rtogs pas na zhes pa ni bsgom zhing tha snyad du bya'o //
translated: Since it is conceptualized, it is cultivated and conventionally designated.

original: tshig gi sku rnam par bsgom pa ni ngag gi sgo nas lus tha snyad du bya'o //
analyzed: tshig gi sku rnam par bsgom pa ni ngag gi sgo nas lus tha snyad du bya'o //
translated: The cultivation of the body of words is the body conventionally designated by speech.

original: tshig tu brjod cing sku zhes btags pa ni ngag gis brjod pa lus zhes brdar bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: tshig tu brjod cing sku zhes btags pa ni ngag gis brjod pa lus zhes brdar bstan par bya ste /
translated: The designation of the body by verbal expression is indicated by the conventional term body.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i tshig 'byung ba dang / tshig las sgra 'byung ba'i phyir sgra rnams kyi las zhes tha snyad du byas te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i tshig 'byung ba dang / tshig las sgra 'byung ba'i phyir sgra rnams kyi las zhes tha snyad du byas te /
translated: Since conceptualized words arise and sounds arise from words, the conventional term the action of sounds is used.

original: sgra rnams kyis ni brda ston pa //
analyzed: sgra rnams kyis ni brda ston pa //
translated: Sounds indicate conventional symbols.

original: de ni tha snyad bya phyir bshad //
analyzed: de ni tha snyad bya phyir bshad //
translated: That is explained for the sake of conventional designation.

original: ces 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ces 'byung ngo //
translated: This is stated.

original: de dang 'dra ba'i sku zhes pa ni ngag gi brjod pa tha snyad du byas pa'o //
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba'i sku zhes pa ni ngag gi brjod pa tha snyad du byas pa'o //
translated: The body that is similar to that is the conventional designation of verbal expression.

original: sems can thams cad kyi sngags kyi gzugs dang zhes pa ni tshig gi tshogs so //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sngags kyi gzugs dang zhes pa ni tshig gi tshogs so //
translated: The form of the mantra of all sentient beings is the collection of words.

original: de rnams nyid ki sgo nga la sogs pa sngar bshad pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de rnams nyid ki sgo nga la sogs pa sngar bshad pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: Those very ones are the eggs, etc. as previously explained.

original: rdo rje chen po'i sku zhes pa ni lus nyid do //
analyzed: rdo rje chen po'i sku zhes pa ni lus nyid do //
translated: The body of the great vajra is the body itself.

original: bdag gi lus zhes bya ba la sogs pas khams gsum la gnas pa'i lus dang ngag dang bdag gi yang de dag mnyam pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bdag gi lus zhes bya ba la sogs pas khams gsum la gnas pa'i lus dang ngag dang bdag gi yang de dag mnyam pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The body, etc. of the three realms, are the same as those of the self, means that the body, speech, and self of the three realms are the same.

original: dus gsum ni 'das pa la sogs pa'i dus gsum la'o ;
analyzed: dus gsum ni 'das pa la sogs pa'i dus gsum la'o ;
translated: The three times are the three times of the past, etc.

original: / de ni dus mnyam pa yang rab tu bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: / de ni dus mnyam pa yang rab tu bstan pa yin no //
translated: That is also taught to be the same as the time.

original: 'o na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa ni 'jig pa dang ma phyin pa'i phyir ji ltar mnyam pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa ni 'jig pa dang ma phyin pa'i phyir ji ltar mnyam pa yin zhe na /
translated: Well, if the past and future are destroyed and not yet come, how are they the same?

original: da ltar byung zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni da ltar byung ba'i dus ni dus kun la 'dra ba yin pas de la log par rtog pa ni med do //
analyzed: da ltar byung zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni da ltar byung ba'i dus ni dus kun la 'dra ba yin pas de la log par rtog pa ni med do //
translated: The present time, etc. means that the present time is the same as all times, so there is no misconception about it.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa gang yin pa de dag de'i cha tsam gyis brten te dus gsum brtag par bya'o zhes skyon med do //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa gang yin pa de dag de'i cha tsam gyis brten te dus gsum brtag par bya'o zhes skyon med do //
translated: The past and future are to be considered as the three times by way of just that part of it.

original: yang rgyun rtag pa nyid kyis da ltar byung ba'i dus ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i tshul du thob pas dus gsum la gnas pa'i sems can thams cad kyi ngag dag dang lus mnyam pa nyid kyi lhag par mos pa rnal 'byor pas bya'o zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: yang rgyun rtag pa nyid kyis da ltar byung ba'i dus ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i tshul du thob pas dus gsum la gnas pa'i sems can thams cad kyi ngag dag dang lus mnyam pa nyid kyi lhag par mos pa rnal 'byor pas bya'o zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: Moreover, by the continuity being permanent, the present time is obtained in the manner of the past and future, and so the yogi/nī should imagine the equality of the speech and bodies of all sentient beings abiding in the three times.

original: sngags 'dzin pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sngags 'dzin pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: The mantra holder is Great Vajradhara,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad spro ba dang bsdu ba mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad spro ba dang bsdu ba mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he emanates and reabsorbs all the Tathāgatas.

original: des ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis rdo rje @275b 'chang chen po'i lhag par mos pas khyams gsum gyi yul can gyi lus la sogs pa dang / rang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la sogs pa yang mnyam pa nyid du rtogs par bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: des ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis rdo rje @275b 'chang chen po'i lhag par mos pas khyams gsum gyi yul can gyi lus la sogs pa dang / rang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la sogs pa yang mnyam pa nyid du rtogs par bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This teaches that yogins of the stage of completion, by the imagination of Great Vajradhara, should realize the equality of the objects of the three abodes, such as body, etc., and their own bodies, etc.

original: bdag ni sangs rgyas kun nyid de //
analyzed: bdag ni sangs rgyas kun nyid de //
translated: I am all the Buddhas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad nyid //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad nyid //
translated: I am all the Bodhisattvas,

original: de phyir 'bad pa thams cad kyis //
analyzed: de phyir 'bad pa thams cad kyis //
translated: Therefore, with all effort,

original: rang gi bdag nyid rtag tu mchod //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid rtag tu mchod //
translated: I should always worship myself.

original: ces 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ces 'byung ngo //
translated: This is stated.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: And similarly,

original: nam mkha'i dbyings ni thams cad la //
analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings ni thams cad la //
translated: In all the realm of space,

original: dpal ldan rdo rje sems dpa' bzhugs //
analyzed: dpal ldan rdo rje sems dpa' bzhugs //
translated: Glorious Vajrasattva abides.

original: zhes dpal bde mchog las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes dpal bde mchog las 'byung ngo //
translated: This is stated in the Shri-Paramadya.

original: dgongs pas bshad pa zhes pa ni sngags dang sku la sogs pa'i 'gal ba'i tshig gi sgo nas rdzogs pa'i rim pa bstan pas so //
analyzed: dgongs pas bshad pa zhes pa ni sngags dang sku la sogs pa'i 'gal ba'i tshig gi sgo nas rdzogs pa'i rim pa bstan pas so //
translated: The intentional explanation is by the stage of completion, through the door of words that are contradictory to the mantra, body, etc.

original: rnal 'byor pa thams cad kyi thun mong gi zhes pa ni rim pa gnyis sgom par byed pa'i rnal 'byor pa dag gis lhag par rtogs pas na mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa thams cad kyi thun mong gi zhes pa ni rim pa gnyis sgom par byed pa'i rnal 'byor pa dag gis lhag par rtogs pas na mnyam pa'o //
translated: The phrase “common to all yogis” means that it is equal because it is realized by all yogis who cultivate the two stages.

original: don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi rim gyis zhes pa ni ngo bo med pa'i mtshan nyid de dkyil 'khor ma lus pa nye bar bsdus pas so //
analyzed: don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi rim gyis zhes pa ni ngo bo med pa'i mtshan nyid de dkyil 'khor ma lus pa nye bar bsdus pas so //
translated: The phrase “by the process of the ultimate maṇḍala” means that it is characterized by the absence of an essence, because it is the complete withdrawal of all maṇḍalas.

original: de la bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog gi mthar las kyi rgyal mchog gi phyogs gcig dkyil 'khor ma lus pa nye bar sdud pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don ston pa dang / rdzogs pa'i rim pa yang sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pas 'od gsal bar bya zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de la bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog gi mthar las kyi rgyal mchog gi phyogs gcig dkyil 'khor ma lus pa nye bar sdud pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don ston pa dang / rdzogs pa'i rim pa yang sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pas 'od gsal bar bya zhes pa'i don to //
translated: There, the yogis of the generation stage, at the end of the supreme victor maṇḍala, demonstrate the meaning of the one part of the supreme victor of action, which is characterized by the complete withdrawal of all maṇḍalas, and the completion stage is the process of purifying the mind, which is the meaning of “to be made clear.”

original: mi 'da' ba'i don ni 'od gsal ba ste thams cad kyis de nyid 'dod pas so //
analyzed: mi 'da' ba'i don ni 'od gsal ba ste thams cad kyis de nyid 'dod pas so //
translated: The meaning of “not transgressing” is clear light, because all desire that.

original: sems ni rab tu 'jug pa'i phyir //
analyzed: sems ni rab tu 'jug pa'i phyir //
translated: Because the mind is engaged,

original: dpyod la 'jug par mi bya ste //
analyzed: dpyod la 'jug par mi bya ste //
translated: one should not engage in analysis.

original: 'khor ba 'joms par bya ba'i phyir //🔽ma lus pa yi blo mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba 'joms par bya ba'i phyir // ma lus pa yi blo mnyam pa'o //
translated: In order to destroy cyclic existence,

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: the mind is equal with regard to all.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku bkyed pa'i rjes thogs la zhes pa ni dang por sbyor ba dang / dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog gi ting nge 'dzin dag gi sems can gyi khams lus pa spyod bar byed pa'i rnal 'byor pas so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku bkyed pa'i rjes thogs la zhes pa ni dang por sbyor ba dang / dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog gi ting nge 'dzin dag gi sems can gyi khams lus pa spyod bar byed pa'i rnal 'byor pas so //
translated: After the expansion of the Buddha’s body, the yogi/nī who has practiced the remainder of the realm of sentient beings with the first union and the samādhi of the supreme victor maṇḍala,

original: don dam pa'i bden pa rtogs pa ste zhes pa ni phra mo'i rnal 'byor dang bzlas pa'i 'og tu zhu ba'i de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa rtogs pa ste zhes pa ni phra mo'i rnal 'byor dang bzlas pa'i 'og tu zhu ba'i de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: realizes ultimate truth, in order to teach the reality of the melting that comes after the subtle yoga and repetition.🔽“The pledge is the emission of the seminal essence” and so on.

original: dam tshig las ni khu ba phyung ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas legs par sbyangs pa'i phyag rgya dang snyoms par zhugs pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad 'jug pa @276a * //
analyzed: dam tshig las ni khu ba phyung ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas legs par sbyangs pa'i phyag rgya dang snyoms par zhugs pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad 'jug pa @276a * //
translated: The yogi/nī who has trained well, through union with the consort, all tathāgatas enter the bhaga of the consort.

original: sngon du 'gro bar reg bya rdo rje ma'i chos 'byung ba'i nang du badzra dhi ka ces bya ba la sogs pa phyung ba'i sngags kyis dkyil 'khor pa ma lus pa spro bas dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor bskyed la /
analyzed: sngon du 'gro bar reg bya rdo rje ma'i chos 'byung ba'i nang du badzra dhi ka ces bya ba la sogs pa phyung ba'i sngags kyis dkyil 'khor pa ma lus pa spro bas dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor bskyed la /
translated: Having previously generated the commitment wheel by emanating the entire wheel by the mantra “vajra-dhi-ka” and so on, which is the mantra for emerging from the source of phenomena of the tactile-vajra goddess,

original: de las kyang phyi rol du spros te phyogs bcu la gnas pa'i sems can gyi khams rab tu sbyor ba sngon du 'gro bar sgrub pa'i dkyil 'khor dgod pa dang / dbang bskur ba dang / rgyas gdab pa byas la phra mo'i rnal 'byor dang bzlas pa byas te /
analyzed: de las kyang phyi rol du spros te phyogs bcu la gnas pa'i sems can gyi khams rab tu sbyor ba sngon du 'gro bar sgrub pa'i dkyil 'khor dgod pa dang / dbang bskur ba dang / rgyas gdab pa byas la phra mo'i rnal 'byor dang bzlas pa byas te /
translated: and having also emanated externally, having previously applied the realm of sentient beings abiding in the ten directions, having arranged the accomplishment wheel, having conferred initiation, and having sealed, one should perform the subtle yoga and repetition.

original: bya ba byas nas dkyil 'khor la 'jug pa sngon du 'gro bar dbu ma nas byung ro mnyam par gyur pa 'od du zhu ba nyid bstan to //
analyzed: bya ba byas nas dkyil 'khor la 'jug pa sngon du 'gro bar dbu ma nas byung ro mnyam par gyur pa 'od du zhu ba nyid bstan to //
translated: Having performed the action, having previously entered the wheel, the melting of the light of the equal taste arisen from the central channel is taught.

original: shes rab dang thabs su sbyor bas so zhes pa ni thugs rdo rje dang reg bya rdo rje ma la snyoms par zhugs pas so //
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs su sbyor bas so zhes pa ni thugs rdo rje dang reg bya rdo rje ma la snyoms par zhugs pas so //
translated: “By the union of wisdom and means” means by entering into union with the mind-vajra and the tactile-vajra goddess.

original: de nas mer mer po la sogs pa'i rim gyis zhes pa ni snang ba la sogs pa nyams su myong ba sngon du 'gro bar dbu ma nas 'byung ba'i byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le 'dzag pa dang sra bar gyur pa dang bsdu bar gyur pa'i rim
analyzed: de nas mer mer po la sogs pa'i rim gyis zhes pa ni snang ba la sogs pa nyams su myong ba sngon du 'gro bar dbu ma nas 'byung ba'i byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le 'dzag pa dang sra bar gyur pa dang bsdu bar gyur pa'i rim
translated: Then, “in the stages of the kalala, etc.” means that, preceded by the experience of appearance, etc., the bindu of bodhicitta that arises from the central nāḍī increases in stages through the process of dripping, hardening, and gathering.

original: pas so ; / mngon par 'phel lo zhes pa ni sngags la sogs pa'i gzugs kyis 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pas so ; / mngon par 'phel lo zhes pa ni sngags la sogs pa'i gzugs kyis 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “It increases” means that it increases in the form of mantra, and so on.

original: de nyid sa bon dang myu gu dang 'dra ba zhes pa ni badzra dhi ka la sogs pa phyung ba'i sngags kyi gzugs ni sa bon no //
analyzed: de nyid sa bon dang myu gu dang 'dra ba zhes pa ni badzra dhi ka la sogs pa phyung ba'i sngags kyi gzugs ni sa bon no //
translated: “That is like a seed and a sprout” means that the form of the mantra that is extracted, such as vajra ḍhīḥ, is the seed.

original: de yongs su gyur pa las dkyil 'khor pa rnams 'byung ba ni myu gu'o //
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa las dkyil 'khor pa rnams 'byung ba ni myu gu'o //
translated: The arising of the maṇḍala deities from the complete transformation of that is the sprout.

original: gzhon nu ni thig le phyung ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gzhon nu ni thig le phyung ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: “Youth” is the characteristic of the bindu being extracted.

original: bar ma ni phyung ba'i sngags yongs su gyur pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: bar ma ni phyung ba'i sngags yongs su gyur pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: “Intermediate” is the characteristic of the complete transformation of the extracted mantra.

original: gnas skabs zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor ba rnams kyi gzugs grub pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gnas skabs zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor ba rnams kyi gzugs grub pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The “occasion” is the characteristic of the creation of the forms of the maṇḍala deities such as Vairocana.

original: yang na gzhon nu ni dam tshig sems dpa' bskyed pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: yang na gzhon nu ni dam tshig sems dpa' bskyed pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Alternatively, the “youth” is the characteristic of the creation of the pledge beings;

original: bar ma ni ye shes sems dpa' dgod pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: bar ma ni ye shes sems dpa' dgod pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: the “middle” is the characteristic of the placement of the wisdom beings;

original: skabs ni ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' dgod pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: skabs ni ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' dgod pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: and the “occasion” is the characteristic of the placement of the concentration beings.

original: de nas chos 'byung gi nang du sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid dkyil 'khor pa bskyed pa ni gzhon nu dang bar ma'i gnas skabs thob pa zhes bya'o ;
analyzed: de nas chos 'byung gi nang du sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid dkyil 'khor pa bskyed pa ni gzhon nu dang bar ma'i gnas skabs thob pa zhes bya'o ;
translated: Then, the creation of the maṇḍala deities, which are the nature of the three beings, within the phenomena source is called “attaining the occasion of youth and middle age.”

original: / de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: / de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, it is said:
